Once there, we had a 5 minutes training as it was our first time quad biking. Zacariah, our guide, was a very nice guy. We actually had a private tour, only me and my husband, as the rest of the group would be late, and that was very nice of Youssef that we didn't need to wait. The ride is worth every penny and we would highly recommend it! But look for Youssef, as there are other people offering this kind of experience, but for sure they won't be as nice. At the end, he even made us a surprise. Thanks, Youssef! We hope to see you again for a whole day experience! Cristina and Martin.

Great morning on the plains of Marrakech. We booked a half day quad biking trip during our stay in Marrakech and we were highly delighted with the service, quality of bikes, the guide and the professional way in which everything was organised. We usually go quad biking wherever we are on vacation, and this was one of the best. We covered a huge area and didn't hang around, yet felt completely safe. We also met some lovely people from Colchester which made the experience even more pleasurable. Highly recommended.

We had an absolute blast!. I came across quad evasion on tripadvisor. I booked prior to our trip. Youssef is very professional and responded right away.I would absolutely recommend this quadride to everyone who is interested in some great adventure and fun. I do have to add that it might be a bit tricky for firsttimers at first. But as the tour advanced you get the hang of it and it will be worth every penny!

Great value for money. I would highly recommend Youssef and his quad bike excursions. I recently visited with my family and we all had a great time. Our group comprised people of mixed abilities and Youssef and his colleagues were on hand whenever needed to assist a wandering quad back to the right track! The scenery was spectacular and the people at the village were very hospitable. Youssef collected my group from our Riad and was on hand to answer any questions we had. The booking process was very easy and I received prompt responses to my emails. This excursion was one of the highlights of our trip and I would not hesitate to recommend Marrakech Quad Evasion.

Very fun. We went on a half-day ride this afternoon, and it was very enjoyable. We were picked up from our riad by Youssef and driven to the starting point. Riding the quad bikes was really fun, neither of us had done it before but the group spent some time at the starting point getting used to them. The equipment was well-maintained and we felt safe. Our guide, Youssef, then took us out on the drive. He was very experienced, and took us through a few different types of terrain which was fun. Although we had a great time, we didn't give it 5 stars as we felt that the village stopping point was a bit dull, although recognise that it is probably good to have a restroom stop. Also, there possibly could have been some more in depth information given out before we headed out or whilst we stopped to tell us a bit more about the areas we were seeing.Overall, we recommend it highly and would definitely do it again! There are some really great views and it was nice to get out of the medina.

Camel-Riding and Quad Biking.. We initially went camel riding which was a lovely experience and you even got to have some mint tea. We were picked up from our hotel and brought back after the trip. As we had such a lovely time we decided to book quad-biking with the hotel. The tour guide Youssef was great and made the experience that much more memorisable. Well worth a try if your in Marrakech! Thank you Youssef!

Awesome ! Do it it's so worth it! See the real side of life in Morocco. Thinking in our holiday of what to do and came across this, from emailing youssef, he was great at responding, sorting out times to collect us and sorting lunch with a fabulous veggie option!!We felt so well looked after by youssef and the team zacque, Yassen and the camel ! It was my first time quad biking and we book a full day, our guide was great helping me build confidence and getting me out of some hairy moments, and yet did some fast speeds, and dunes for my fella. A great mixture.We enjoyed a welcoming lunch with more than enough to eat, and ended the day on a camel ride- truly amazing day seeing all the sights . You must have a go its great value , and a fab way to see the real side

Amazing. We had an amazing day! We took half a day quad riding. Everything was organized to the detail. Youssef answered quickly by mail and all arrangements (time of pick up, price, time of drop off) were clearly stated. We got the feeling we got more than we paid for. On the way back, we stopped to pick up another couple who went camel riding, Youssef gave us a free ride on the camels for a couple of minutes to make the wait fun. I normally don't write reviews on trip advisor but Marrakech quad evasion is such a well organised organisation with such a good host ( Youssef)!

Simply epic!. Youssef thank you for an amazing morning. Brought my Dad to Marrakesh for a surprise birthday treat so didn't pre book. Saw people advertising quads in the market so came on trip advisor to ensure we got a good one. This was highly recommended and I completely agree. Emailed the day before wanting to come, fast response and happy to accept payment in Dirhams, UK pounds or euros (handy since our last morning and were out of local currency).Picked up on time and we were really lucky that we got a guide just for our group, 3 people. Always felt safe and in control and the bikes looked well kept. A number of opportunities to get photos and our guide was excellent, taking photos of all of us. Me and my husband had shared a bike and for the last bit back to base our guide said I could drive his bike with him on the back which was a really nice touch. If I could give the team 10 stars I would. The price was also cheaper than the touts in the market and no haggling needed so don't waste your time. Book directly here and you won't be disappointed.Thanks again for making my dads Birthday super memorable!

A great activity in Marrakesch . We found this activity through trip advisor and booked by email within 30 minutes! Youssef was very friendly, the whole activity was very well organised and we were very well looked after as a group of 7. The quads are well maintained and good fun to drive, we would recommend this to anyone.

A Marrakech MUST DO activity!!!. On our final day in Marrakech my boyfriend kindly took me for a camel trek and it's was great but following the camels we were lucky enough to meet Youssef and arranged to go out on the Quad bikes with him and it was incredible! If your up for experiencing the views of Marrakech in the coolest and quickest way whilst getting a buzz thanks to the quality of the quads provided this is for you! I'd recommend Quads in Marrakech but you must do it through Youssef as he was the most welcoming guy we ment throughout our entire stay. The experience you have is worth every penny and when we return we will certainly return for a catch up and to learn some kickass tricks whilst looking out over the sites of such a beautiful country! Thanks to Youssef and his team, you guys turkey made our final day the most memorable!Kim and Tom x

Quad bikes vs camels. Quads Win.. We spent a week in Marrakech and did quad biking and rode camels. Whilst both were good fun the quad biking through the desert was amazing. Youssef was cool and showed us loads of tricks to help us tear it up in the desert. We would definitely recommend it to anyone.

One for the memory bank. I was in Marrakech over for a long weekend from 28th February to 4th March. During our stay, we went did the Marrakech Quad Evasion and had an amazing time with our tour guide Youssef. We were going around for about 2 hours and which was for me. Not too short or too long. Please note however that you will need to be prepared to get dirty. I would recommend this to everyone

What an awesome ride.... 9 of us ladies visited Marrakesh and booked a quad bike and camel ride day out and boy was it the longest most enjoyable not to mention adventure. Yusuf was our tour guide and he made sure we were well looked after. We thorougly enjoyed ourselves and got to spend 2 hours quad biking up to the mountains in the desert. This is one experience I will never forget. Thanks Yusuf. Highly recommended.

Amazing Day out. What an experience, we were a group 9 women and had some adrenaline junkies amongst us. Youssef showed us an amazing day out and was so friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble.All safety equipment was supplied (helmet and goggles). They were clean and didn't smell nasty like the normal bike/gokart rental helmet!!! We were advised of what to wear when we booked. Basically, closed shoes are the main requirement, we were in shorts, T-shirts and converse. Everything is thoroughly covered in dust now but as its so dry nothing is damaged!The excursion is said to last 2 hours but as we were a little slow to get started its took us a bit longer to complete the route, but Yousseff didn't rush us at all, didn't cut bits of the route out and most of all allowed us time to enjoy the views that the journey offered.At the end of the quads we rounded off by do a camel hike watching the sunset- TRULY AMAZING!!!! I would definitely recommend this as something to do while you're here.

Awesome!. Hey Yousouf,Just wanted to say a MASSIVE thanks to you, had an amazing experience! You come highly recommended as you spent a lot of time on/off quad bike and even managed to find time for us on our last night! Thanks for the restaurant and shisha recommendation, all came up trumps! Lastly from the bottom of my heart, thanks for the medication and aftercare following my accident! You ROCK!!!See you next time… insha’Allah!!
An experience I'll never forget. I started with a fear of getting on the quod but I'm glad I faced my fear and enjoyed the ride with my group. The views that we saw along the ride one word "amazing".

You have to go with these guys!. Had a blast riding the quads through the Marrakech desert. Beautiful scenery, exciting ride, only problem I wish I had one more day on my trip to go again. Youssef, our guide, was one of the friendlist guys we met in Morocco. Always a smile on his face, always excited. He picked us from the riad in his 4X4 and took us to the location.We were trained, provided with all the safety equipment, and off we went. The guides were great, always keeping an eye on the riders making sure everything is ok. It was my first time doing this, and I had a blast and felt super safe.All in all, you can't go wrong with these guys. Take a break from the souqs and try a quad out.

The best quad biking experience I've ever had!. I am so happy I booked with Marrakech quad evasion. The experience from pickup to drop off was very memorable. The tour was very well organised and so much fun. The price was fantastic and Youssef was an added bonus to the tour. He was friendly and made the experience so much more enjoyable. Highly recommended!!

Fantastic Experience. Wonderful experience for first timers and those adrenaline junkies. Well organized tour and friendly tour guide added to the day. From the moment of pick-up to drop-off it was an entertainment. That's four hours well spent in Marrakech! Thank you for a memorable experience Youssef :)

A great way to spend the day!. I booked my trip on a last minute the day before I went via their website. They called me that evening, and confirmed me for the next day's afternoon half-day trip. One of the managers picked me up Yusuf, and another couple. Even though our group was small, and the rest of our group was running late, Yusuf sent us off with our guide. The trip was REALLY cool, and you get to see Berber villages, amazing desert landscape, and even an oasis area. We had a nice stop at one of the villages for afternoon tea. Everyone was very friendly, and our guide was enthusiastic and thoughtful. I really enjoyed it. Highly recommended!

Really worth doing - highly recommended. We had a lovely day out quad biking with Yusuf. Went for a full 2 hours through beautiful scenery with the atlas mountains as the back drop. Stop for tea at a Berber village and lots of fun but manageable quad biking. Yusuf (the owner) was an amazing guide and very helpful. There are lots of dodgy trips that you can be talked in to in Marrakech but this is a good genuine one! Highly recommend you go with one with good reviews and not just a random one from the square as other tourists told us they turned up and got much shorter trips in rubbish locations.
AMAZING day out.. group of 5 girls, best day out in Marrakesh, had so much fun, you must do quad biking with this company. Very safe and organised. Yusuf the tour guide is lovely as well. Thank you.

Quad biking on my birthday. This was brilliant. It had rained a couple of days before so puddles everywhere which made it more fun. Going through them as fast as you could and getting covered in mud and soaked by water. Took a while to get used to the quad but once out in the desert - no problem just great fun. Would recommend quad-biking to anyone. Brilliant fun

It was a great day out!. This company was great! I read a lot of good reviews about it before coming to morocco so me and my friends made sure we booked a day on the quad bikes with them a week before. The guide, youssef, was very friendly gentleman who made us feel very welcome and showed us how to drive the quad bikes! We then went around in the desert area in a group for a couple of hours and we had the chance to take some breathtaking pictures halfway through and we were also offered some Moroccan tea. I would definitely recommend it because it was a great day out with good service and friendly staff!

Would definitely recommend this! !. Had a really good time in this quad biking trip. The quads were modern and easy to get the hang of using. the staff were very helpful and gave us a chance to get used to using the quads. We also got to see some amazing sights and got to stop off for photos and to have tea. We were picked up on time by yusseuf who was very freindly and went out of his way to make us feel welcome. He also dropped is off at a resturaunt rather than the hotel so we didn't have to talk which was really helpful. The trip was also very reasonably priced after looking at a few companies this was the cheapest and best value for money. I would recommend this to everyone as it was a really enjoyable day out with great staff :)

Brillant, highly recommended. Booked a last minute holiday to Marrakech, wasn't sure what to do or expect. Thought about quad biking something which I have never experienced before. Ended up contacting Marrakech Quad Evasion and it was amazing! The team was really helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend to any visitor to use their services.

awesome trip! definately recommend. On our second day in Marrakech we booked a half day on the Quad through Marrakech Quad Evasion. We were provided transport to and from with our booking which turned up promptly on time. Our quad biking was in Palm Grove and the scenery is absolutely magnificent. The team at Marrakech Quad Evasion were very friendly, helpful and assisted us until we felt comfortable on the Quads. It is definitely an experience and a half through the breathtaking view. The Quad's were also good quality Quads!Would definitely book again with this company! The tour guides are a friendly bunch!

Introduction to the Berber culture and the High Atlas. In September a group of 13 of us shared an unforgettable experience in the High Atlas. We were ably and knowledgeably led by our guide Omar and from him learned much about the Berber culture as well as being guided ever higher as the week passed until on the final day of our trek we walked upToubkal under a full moon and experienced the sun rise over Africa. A truly moving experience! The detailed organisation of the trip by Mohammed of Active Treks Morocco was excellent.I cannot recommend too highly the care and attention we received in particular from Omar, and also from Mohammed who prepared our meals, and from the muleteers whose friendliness and efficiency gave me a wonderful first impression of Morocco.I will be back and will use Active Treks Morocco again.

Trekking in Azzadene & Imenane Valleys. Once again Mohamed and his team organised an excellent week’s trekking through traditional High Atlas villages, this time in the secluded Azzadene and Imenane valleys (near Imlil). The trekking was along easy tracks amid splendid scenery; there are enticing paths over high passes for those fitter than myself. There was time to explore the villages in the afternoon; the rocky thoroughfares sometimes needing a bit of agility to negotiate. It was interesting to see the walnut harvest being gathered in and other aspects of village life. Accommodation was in basic gîtes (there is no other); there were showers in some and plenty of space, as there were few other trekkers around. The guiding and food were excellent thanks to Omar (guide) and Mohamed (cook and muleteer). Omar spoke good English and knew the area well. Transfer between the two valleys was by car.As usual, it was a most enjoyable and well organised week and I look forward to further trekking with this company. Thanks again to Mohamed, Omar and Mohamed.CarolMLondon

Fantastic trip and EXCELLENT service...... Just back from a 6-day trek with Mohammed and his guides and muleteers. Extremely well organised from pickup at the airport to everything in-between before drop off at the end. Nothing was too much trouble and our guide Omar was knowledgeable, fun and encouraging when we flagged. The weather definitely helped - wall to wall sunshine the whole time. Magical ascent of Toubkal under a full moon and at the top for the sunrise. Cannot recommend this company enough. Omar spoke excellent English, as did Mohammed and we felt fully taken care of, and not that it was 'just a job' for them. I'll definitely be back and will be recommending Mohammed as the organiser and Omar as the guide to EVERYONE!

Great trek in the Atlas mountains. I really enjoyed the visit to Morocco. It is my 4th visit and each time it is as good.Very well organised trip, lovely guide and team. Got to walk through farming valleys and experience a little of the local culture.I was delighted with accomodation,our guide Omar and staff , pace of walks, attention to detail.I also enjoyed our very brief stay in Marakesh, again the people in our Riyad were most accomodating.Had a great massage session , highly recommend after a week of treking.

Life changing trip. My trip with Mohamed to the Berber Villages in the Atlas Mountains was honestly a highlight of my life so far. The hikes themselves were accessible for people of all abilities and the places we stopped at were gorgeous. Mohamed was knowledgeable and friendly and helped us navigate through the hikes and to communicate with the local villagers for connections that I will never forget. All accommodations were perfect; they were comfortable and helped us feel like we were part of the community for the time we were there. I couldn't recommend booking a trip with Active Treks Morocco enough!

Guided Trek through the Atlas Mountains. Thank you Mohammed and your wonderful guides for a spectacular week! What a thrill it was to load up a mule and hit the trail for seven days. It is a privilidge to enter the gentle world of the Atlas Mountains and experience the life of the Berber people with their flocks of goats, to overnight in little stone villages that cling to cliff faces over beautiful river valleys. Omar guided through spectacular canyons and over ridges with stunning views. He had an excellent knowledge of habitat - plants, birds and was so generous to share stories of his life growing up in these rugged Atlas Mountains. Mohammed, our muleteer, created beautiful fresh meals and the Berber ballads he sang - echoed across the mountains. What a wonderful, challenging and heart opening week. Unforgettable. Thank you Atlas Treks.

Spectacular Hike to Berber Villages, Atlas Mountains. My trip with Mohamed was life changing! We picnicked and ate local food, got amazing hiking in daily, met tons of locals, and came away with incredible stories! A must do trip in Morocco!

High Atlas . I did a week-long High Atlas Mountains trip with Mohamed, ascending Toubkal in May 2014, prior to his set up of his current company. The trip was excellent. Well organised and Mohamed showed himself to be a very competent and knowledgeable guide. The scenery was amazing and the trip was very well organised.

Amazing road trip through the Atlas mountains. Recently I booked the "4 days Atlas and Desert Experience" with Mohamed´s team. With Hassan´s safe driving and Omar´s broad knowledge about all the places and panoramic views we visited, it was easy to feel comfortable and enjoy the road trip! Their great sense of humor was also very appreciated :) If you are in Morocco, I highly recommend booking a trip with this company!

Perfect day trip out of Marrakech. My friend and I were in Marrakech for a week and we wanted to head out of the city and into the mountains... everything was perfect, including the quick and helpful replies to my emails, comfortable transfer to and from the city and the hike itself with Mohamed. We started in Imlil where we met Mohamed and had some delicious mint tea, specific to the area. Then we head off into the hills, learning lots on the way and having a hearty lunch at the top.Really recommend this if you enjoy walking, exploring and learning about other cultures... it's also a great escape from the intense Marrakech heat in July!Looking forward to booking a longer trip with Mohamed next time we're in Marrakech.

Brilliant High Atlas day trek. This day trek in the High Atlas Mountains was absolutely brilliant.We were picked up by our lovely driver, taken through the Ourika Valley and even stopped to go through a Berber market which we had mentioned we would like to do. Our driver took us through, explaining the culture and traditions and we even tried some cactus fruit which was delicious. We then met Mohamed and our guide Abdul in Imlil. Drank some mint tea and set out on a 3/4 hour walk. Abdul was great, explaining things about life in Imlil, the culture and he set a pace we were able to keep up with. He took us up to a great spot which had a view of the entire valley and of Mount Toubkal. We went through small villages, drank tea by a waterfall and finished with a 3 course lunch in a riad which had the most stunning views of the mountains. The food was delicious and the whole day was worth every penny. Our only regret was that we were doing a day trip rather than a longer adventure. We will definitely be back - hopefully to climb Mount Toubkal!

MOUNT TOUBKAL TRIP. An excellent well organised trip from Mohamed and his team. All very courteous and friendly and it was great to see some of the local culture on the trek in preparation for the final climb up Mount Toubkal.

Ourika Valley Day Trip. If you are visiting Marrakech, make time to visit the surrounding area, which was a highlight of our holiday!We had a wonderful day with Mohamed exploring the Ourika Valley. He was courteous, patient, and personable. We felt safe with him as our guide, and he also made sure to challenge us with a 5 hour hike to see the 7 waterfalls! You may be tired at the end but you will also be exhilarated!Already looking forward to visiting again. A gorgeous country!

Imlil Valley trek. We did a trek on Sunday in the Imlil Valley for about three hours - would have been a longer one but temperatures very high. It was amazing, with fantastic scenery, and a great introduction to the mountains and what to expect. This taster has definitely made me want to do something longer. Highly recommend this company for value and efficiency - always responded immediately to emails. Price included pick-up from our hotel in Marrakech by Hassan, the services of Mohamed during the trek and the tastiest chicken tagine on our return. In fact, the lunch we had afterwards was the best during our stay in Marrakech.

Mount Toubkal. I had the pleasure of trekking up Mt.Toubkal with Mohamed and his team of guides. They were friendly, patient, helpful and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. The trek itself was full of great views. Challenging, but well worth the effort to reach the top. The guides provided a safe yet entertaining environment to enjoy the experience to the max.

An incredible 2 days in the mountains.. I only wish it had been longer!. My Dad joined Mohamed and his team on a multi day trek with a group of friends and absolutely loved it! So much so that he insisted my siblings and I go with him for a second trip and I'm so glad he did.The hustle and bustle of Marrakesh centre may not for everyone, but the jaw-dropping Atlas mountain range, scattered with quaint Berber villages must be!Mohamed is very friendly and has a great sense of humor, from the first moment of meeting him it felt as though we were trekking with a friend, rather than a tour guide.I would go back for the food alone, never mind the unbelievable surroundings and fantastic hosts! I honestly couldn't recommend Active Treks more.Thanks for an unforgettable experience, I would love to return and have a few extra days too :)

An absolutely amazing trek with Mohamed and his guides. I was invited to participate in this trek organised by dear friends. As I did not know much about the region beforehand, I was very happy just to dive into the experience. This trek was a fantastic way to explore the Atlas mountains and to find out lots about the Berber culture. Mohamed and his guides were the best people we could possibly have wished for. They were all very professional and spoke very good English. They are all from the area so they were able to give us a lot of interesting background information. Thank you so much Mohamed and your team – I would love to book another trek with you again one dayAnita

Toubkal. I spent 5 days with Mohamed trekking the Atlas Mountains during Ramadan. Tough bunch of guys to keep going without food and water all day and still manage to keep a smile on their faces and chat all day along the way. Great trip and I highly reccomend them. Fantastic value for money. Joe

King of the Hills. Just returned from my 4th mountaineering adventure with Mohamed at the helm. Mohamed has a very peaceful nature which is infectious and translates into a positive aura that surrounds every trip. The success of such adventures is underpinned by the ability of the leader to meet our needs such as safety, food, social and psychological well being. Mohamed is a master at meeting all of these needs ensuring success on your adventure. Mohamed tailors each trip to the objectives of each individual. Aside from meeting all of ones needs you get the feeling you're around a great person and that is everything. I'm going back as every day out there is pure magic.

Adventures in the Altas. I have just returned from a wonderful week trekking in the Atlas mountains all organised by Mohamed. A party of four started the adventure in Mararkech before being transferred to the mountains to start a 6 day trek. The whole trip was very well organised from start to finish and a great taste of Berber life. I would highly recommend.

Wonderful trek in the High Atlas. An outstanding 6 day trek in the High Atlas, and some time in Marrakech was excellently organised for our group of four, while still retaining a high degree of flexibility based on what we wanted as we went along. Mohamed arranged the trip for us, provided us with an excellent guide, and a chef to cook all our meals which were very tasty. We stayed in guest-houses and refuges along the route and had a wonderful time discovering the mountain passes, fertile valleys and remote Berber villages of the High Atlas. Highly recommended.

Magical Morocco. Pure magic, back from my second visit to Morocco,outstanding. Once again all the details were left in the capable hands of our guide Mohamed Machou. He did not dissapoint, going above and beyond to make thiis trek into the remote High Atlas Mountains memorable. From the hussle and bussle of Marrekesh to the sparsley inhabited MGoun range, even the unpridictable weather did not slow us down.... Mohamed is a MUST if you plan on trekking in remote untouched Morocco. Will most definitely use him again if/when I go back.

Simply the best ..... With 5 Dutch friends we embarked on a 6 day hike through the Atlas mountain valleys and high passes, including the Toubkal summit on one of the last days. Everything was perfectly organized - from the pick-up at our Riad in Marrakesh to the drop-off 6 days later. The Active Trek support team with guide, cook, assistant and two mules took very good care of us as well as all the hosts in the places where we stayed overnight. All in all a perfect hiking experience; simply the best!
A very charming experience!. We did a wonderful trekking on the Atlante, beautiful landscapes and very experienced, kind and sunny guide. Very raccomended!

The perfect trek!. Mohamed from Active Trek and his group are just incredible! We went to Morocco at the end of March for my husband's birthday and were travelling to the Atlas Mountains with a group of more than twenty friends. I can't find enough words to express my gratitude for the absolutely outstanding job these guys did-the organization was detailed, extremely reliable and just perfect. We were amazed by the kindness and professionalism of Mohamed and his team, enjoyed some lovely and freshly prepared picnics in the middle of nowhere, enjoyed ourselves immensely in the riad we did spend the night at and brought only unforgettable memories back home with us! Mohamed offers his services at very reasonable prices but provides a "only to praise" experience. Thank you Mohamed! Hope to be back one day soon! Elke

Great 6-day Toubkal trek. Mohamed from Active treks organized for us, a group of 5 friends, a fantastic 6 day trek throught the Atlas mountains incl the climb of the Toubkal summit. We had a great experience thanks to the Active trek team. All was very well organized including overnight stays and all meals. We experience great nature and local hostitality, thanks for that!!
Toubkal, winter ascent. Completed this ascent with Mohamed as the Chief Guide, couldn't rate him highly enough, great organisational skills and extremely safety aware.
Mt. Toubkal winter ascent. Absolutely awesome: Mohamed is very professional and knowledgeable, and has a great sense of humour! Had a great time and will certainly come back!

Full Day Trek in the Atlas Mountains. Fantastic day. Everything was as described when booked. Changed trek that was boo ked due to weather and guide discussed options with us to meet our needs. Guide was excellent, informative and helpful. Also thanks to Abul for a superb lumch and to Jacqueline the mule, who my daughter rode. On return journey driver stopped at the Argzn Cooperative at our request. Excellent day, service was fantastic and scenery breathtaking. Would recommend and hope yo use afain in the future.

Well Organized, Excellent Guide on a 4 Day Berber Village, Gorges & Sahara Excursion. A friend and I did a three night four day tour arranged by Mohammed of Active Treks. We were picked up in Marrakech and ended the trip in Fez. Everything was organized very well, from being picked up at our Riad in Marrakech to our meals and accommodation in each destination, everything was on time. Mohammed was very accommodating by fulfilling our request to change our itinerary on very short notice after we had some issue with an international flight connection. We saw the high Atlas, historical Kasbah's, the Gorges, spent the night in the Sahara and saw everything in between, along with every type of climate -- a wonderful experience. All of this with our fantastic guide - Faysel. I cannot say enough about Faysel, he was knowledgeable, had excellent English language skills and seemingly boundless energy. He went above and beyond in every regard to explain the sites and answer our questions about Moroccan culture. He made the extra effort to take photos for us and even ran ahead in the Sahara to capture great shots of us. I would definitely seek him out on my next trip.

Great two day atlas trek with kids and mules. We had a lovely 2-day trek in the Atlas mountains around Imlil. Perfectly organized - we got picked up at our Riad and transfered to our second hotel after the trek, the crew was very friendly and especially for our three kids, who were very enthousiastic about the trip, the mules and the guides. Be aware that it can get very cold in the mountains (we underdressed a little). The overnight accomodation was rather primitive, but the setting (a berber village beautifully located in the mountains, with lots of kids around who were more than happy to play with our childrenthat our children could play with all afternoon) made up for that. Recommended!

Very professional & well organized. Mohamed organized a trek for a group of about 20 of us, all of whom were in Morocco to celebrate our friend's birthday. Four intrepid trekkers joined Mohamed for four days of intense trekking first, and then the rest joined the group for two more days (6-7 hours of hiking/day). Mohamed and his team led the treks each day, prepared and served delicious lunches and dinners, and organized local accommodations for the group to spend the night(s). The accommodations were very rustic/authentic (read: no heat and primitive bathroom facilities) but perfect for our needs. He and his band of merry men even sang and played local musical instruments for our entertainment in the evening. His organization is extremely professional, he and his team are fit, detail-oriented, and tireless. I highly recommend Active Treks Morocco.

Stars, sun, sand and snow. I traveled to Morocco on a school trip around 8 years ago now! It was a wonderful few weeks and having Mohammed as our guide through the atlas mountains and to the summit of Toubkal made it absolutely unforgettable! This is the way to see the beautiful mountains and surrounding area. Mohammed is friendly, organised and thoughtful, making sure everyone has a chance to complete the trek safely and comfortably. We enjoyed great food, laughs, sleeping under the stars and meeting locals. A definite must-do if in the area, and if you are not in the area, then make it your next trip!Thanks Mo

Perfect trek from knowledgable people. The day out at the Atlas mountains on a perfect day was made even more perfect by Mohammed and his team of people. Mohammed was very professional from the time I contacted him via E-mail. I was picked up from my Riad on-time and was given all relevant information or asked for any required changes by Mohammed and the wonderful guide Hussain. Mohammed and his team of people are local Berbers, so they know all about Atlas!. Hussain, again a Berber gave me wonderful insights into the lives of the Berbers in the Imlil and Imnane valleys, where I did a circuit hike. So it was much more than just a simple hiking experience, which made this hike rather personally enriching, needless to say the landscape, views, mountain passes and those little smiling children in the villages all added to the magic of this place. Overall, a fantastic experience, thanks to Mohammed!. I would recommend these guys to anyone interested in getting to know real people with a passion for the mountains!. well done!

Best recommendations!. Everything thoughtful organized, nothing forgotten! Our guide Abdul (exeptionnal fit) really knew the area. Once he understood our physical condition he gave us relevant advices and reliable estimations. Always good mood, always ahead of next event. I can really recommend!

4 Day Trek through Berber country over passes, around Toubkal and then up to the submit and back down to the valley.. Just a wonderful 4 person trek with our guide. Challenging, remote, varied and spectacular event. Mohammed did a great job planning and supporting this trek. We followed this 4 day adventure with a more modest day and a half trek with a larger group. Great job by the whole Berber team. Highly recommended.

Great and grand 6 day trek around Toubkal massive in March. First time in the Atlas and it surpassed my expectations - by far.Much due to Mohamed who designed the route with us and layed out a great and grand circle around Toubkal (including the top) with all the details in place including our wonderful guide Abdul Rahim and his crew of good hearted mountain berbers. Do not hesitate to go with this company - they are your top choice!I´ll be back - with skies in February next time!

An unforgettable birthday trek. In March 2016 I organised a trek for 25 friends; the challenge was that we were 2 groups, a smaller one that wanted to do a longer and harder trek and a bigger one that wanted to join only for the last 2 days and do an easier trek. Mohamed understood the spirit and put together a fantastic program, challenging (8-10 hours walking a day, crampons and ice picks at times, etc) but always 100% safe for the first group and interesting and well crafted for the second group. I have trekked a lot in the high Himalayas and the Andes - always "self made" treks - but I have never experienced such a perfect organisation, such kind and helpful porters and muleteers and especially I never had such a amazingly professional, experienced and at the same time caring, friendly and gentle guide as Abdul Rahim: a real " Berber Chief"!! THANK YOU ALL FOR AN UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE!!

Amazing Trip. This was my third time trekking with Mohammed & his amazing peers which speaks volumes as I never go to the same place twice! A very well organised trip & able to make changes to the itinerary as required. The food was plentiful & amazing. Felt very well looked after and comfortable the whole time. Thanks guys, see you again later this year :-) x

Imi n’Talla & Ait Zitoun Atlas villages. Due to snow blocking high passes in the Atlas mountains (mid-February), a planned week’s trekking in the Amsouzarte Valley and Lac d’Ifni area had to be hastily re-arranged. Mohamed and his team soon came up with another itinerary, based in Imi n’Talla and Ait Zitoun villages, on the northern edge of the Atlas. The bad weather was avoided and the days were pleasantly Spring-like, although the nights were very cold. The accommodation was in gîtes that were basic and unheated, but plenty of warm blankets were provided. Guide Driss spoke good English and knew the area well. The walks were mostly on easy paths and were of a good length. Driss understands the needs of photographers, and was very patient when it came to standing around waiting. He also has some interest in geology, and a wealth of general knowledge about the area.I have booked with this company several times previously and highly recommend them. As usual, the transport was reliable, the food good and the guide excellent. Accommodation in Marrakech, at each end of the trip, was in a hotel and a riad, and was also excellent.Thanks to Mohamed and Driss. I look forward to booking another trip later this year.Carol M, London

Trekking in the High Atlas Mountains. What an amazing experience, Mohamed and his team were fantastic. I felt really well looked after and had an amazing experience. From the moment I arrived in Marakesh to the moment I left our group were well catered for including our airport transfers in Morocco.This was a multi day point to point trek. Always made our destination in plenty of time, a challenging trek but thoroughly enjoyed every minute. We even had time to play in the snow, making snow angels, snow men and having a snow ball fight!I would highly recommend, so much so I will be back!

Fabulous trek in the Atlas Mountains. Amazing trek in the Atlas Mountains with Active treks Morocco. Everything was organised perfectly and Mohammed and his team are fabulous guides and I would highly recommend them to anyone - I can't imagine you will find better. This was my second trip to Morocco and I will definitely be back.

4 amazing days in the Atlas and desert. Excellent organisation and fantastic people!From the beginning, our guide proposed to adjust stops to our like, adding his personal touch to the trip.Cheering up with a personal memory, giving us privacy qt lunch or in the car when he felt we needed.And although the distances might be long to some, time flew by.We will certainly use their services for our next Moroccan stop.

4 day Sahara-Atlas tour: amazing!. My partner and I did the 4 day Sahara-Atlas trip with [name of company]. We had Rachid as guide and Jamal as driver, and boy did we enjoy our time together. Everything was perfectly organized in the way that we had told Mohamed we preferred (not too much luxury, 4x4), so a big thank you to Mohamed for that! What we enjoyed the most was our stay in Les cinq lunes, where the owner of the place surprised us with some wonderful music at the fireplace, the stuff we learnt about Moroccon culture (thanks Rachid!), the stars in the Sahara (amazing) and the lunch we had together with Rachid and Jamal the last day (the best of the full tour, thnx to the company and the local cuisine-that tasted delicious). This trip was an amazing experience and I'd strongly recommend you to book with Active treks Morocco. Or if you want to be more active, book a Toubkal climb with them, I'm pretty sure we'll be back for that one day.

Excellent trip and organisation. In October 2014 I was part of a small recce party that worked with Mohammed organising a Scout expedition to climb Toubkal the following October, from the get go Mo was excellent, nothing was too much trouble and I think being the premiert guide in that area he knew all the best deals for cost saving while not skimping on safety and had the best people working for him. The expedition party of 20 older scouts arrived in Morocco in October 15 at the airport in Marrakech where minibuses were waiting to take us up to Mohammed's own guest house which I have to say was very nice. The following morning it was off on an acclimatisation hike to a near by tizzi where we stopped for lunch, back at the guest house we settled down to preparing our kit had a nice evening meal then it was an early night. Next morning it was off to the refuge Mouflons which in our humble opinion is the better of the two up there. This is a six hour day but as you are not carrying kit ( its on mules ) this wasn't a chore. Mohammed and hios guides were attentive at all times. Long story short we had two nights at the refuge and a successful summit, we then spent an evening in a guest house down in the valley before taking minibuses back to Marakech where we stayed in the Hotel Gomassine which was very nice and had a swimming pool which was welcolme. During our time in Marrakech Mohammed had organised two evening meals for us - one in a rooftop restraunt overlooking the main square and another also at the main square but with a belly dancer, Also organised for us was a quad bike safari and a camel ride both of which were really enjoyed. All together a brilliant trip, well organised and a credit to Mohammed. If you are thinking of running a similar trip or one on a smaller scale Mohammed Maachou is the go to guy, highly recommended.

Great 5 day hike. We booked a 5day hike including climbing Mt Toubkal through their website -very prompt reply and easy to organise. The guide and cook were fantastic -really great people with a good sense of humour, they really looked after us very well. Food was fantastic, could never finish it all. Beautiful landscape and great to see the villages. Amazing view from the top! Would definitely recommend and use again.

Excellent Moroccan Travels. I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Morocco and it was made all the better by the excellent Mohamed and his team. We were very well looked after, from the morning breakfasts to the post trek tea through to the hearty suppers and the camp was run with smiles and laughter. It is incredible how such amazing food is produced whilst camping, and from the most basic of equipment and it was certainly not in short supply. Mohamed's knowledge and love of the area shines forth and I would heartily recommend both him as a guide and this company to everyone, and indeed, have done so.

Mount Toubkal and Imlil. We did the mount Toubkal and stayed a few days with Mohamed in Imlil. It was awesome, from the food to the treks. Just perfect. They take really good care of you, speak very good english and show you a good time. Very knowledgeable and safe.I would recommend anyone to go with Mohammed.

Excellent family day hike . These guys really are great. Super easy to work with, professional, responsive, reliable and good company. We did a day hike in the Atlas starting from Imlil. It was a lovely walk with very kind and engaging guides and 2 Burros, one for our youngest daughter to ride and one for our lunch! On the way down we stopped for tea in the village in the home of one of the guides and then a really nice picnic lunch they prepared for us. We also had the chance to check out the local argan oil coop but low pressure. For all 5 of us it was one of our favorite days of our Marrakech trip. Book here!

Mt Toubkal winter Nov 2011. Mo and the team are excellent hosts and guides. Mo's professionalism and experience going to the summit meant we felt safe even in adverse weather conditions. I would fully recommend going again in the future with Mo.

Awesome Hike!. My husband and I did a two-day Toubkal summit hike last week, and had a great time. It was very easy to coordinate with this company. We were picked up from our hotel in Marrakech and transported to Imlil where we met our guide. Imlil is a cute mountain town though, and it might have been fun to stay there for a night! Day 1 of hiking was wonderful - our guide was a man of few words, but we felt safe nonetheless. We spent the night at the refuge which was better than usual hike accommodations. The dining room was heated, and dinner was wonderful! There were even decent bathrooms in the refuge. The sleeping arrangements were tough (10 of us in a room, and it was pretty cold), but nothing out of the ordinary for overnight hikes. We began Day 2 using our cell phones for light (as we started before the sun rose) which I felt was probably not the safest plan, but we were only hiking like that for about 30-45 minutes until there was enough natural light to put our phones away. I would probably recommend bringing a head lamp. The summit was beyond beautiful. Totally worth it. We had a plentiful lunch on the way down and then an easy transfer back to Marrakech at the end of Day 2. A very smoothly organized trip, and an awesome hike. The three hours up to the summit were challenging, but if you like challenging hikes without too much overnight camping, this is a great choice!

Fantastic trip!. My partner and I did a 3 day trek up Toubkal and then a 4 day trip into the Sahara desert. We had a truly amazing time. Mohammed and the team from Active Treks were excellent. They organised the whole trip for us and everything was extremely well organised. The guides were very knowledgeable, the accommodation was great and the food was delicious.If you go to Morocco please use this company! They are superb!

Great family day out. Second visit to Marrakech, we took the kids this time and decided to discover a bit of the Atlas. Very well organised, superb lunch, very friendly and professional guides. The trek was adapted for the family as we took 2 young kids but would love to do more next time. Till next time .....

great experience. With a group of 5 friends we took a tour of 6 days in the high Atlas, including mount Toubkal . For only € 250 per person, we were accompanied by a guide, a cook, a mule driver and 2 mules!! The guide, Driss, was extremely nice and very pleasant company. The food was great and the hiking trips were amazing. Overall, you get a lot in return for your money!!

Too short a trip but worth every minute. If you are looking for a trip from Marrakech, or any where else for that matter, into the mountains and you want to know how it is from the people who live and breathe the mountains look no further than Active Treks.Walking around Marrakech there are 100's places where you can book a trip, your Riad will probably be able to organise one too, but these guys are the real deal. Mohamad Maachou and his guys will look after you Berber style. We were picked up and dropped off by 2 great drivers, you need a good driver in Marrakech as the driving is insane!! We only went for a short 2.5 hour walk in the foothills of the Toubkal but it was an insight into their lives that will remain. Ibrahim was our guide and he was lovely, we had a mule for the children in case they didn't want to walk, which we let them use on the way down, the mule guy was great as well. Lunch in their Riad, on the roof terrace, was awesome. We will be back next year and we will definitely be booking with Active Treks. Thank you Mohamad for looking after us so well.

Exploring with friends . My friends and I really enjoyed our time with Mohamed. The hotel has the most amazing views and the food, walks were tailored to our needs. Mohamed was an excellent host - organised and reliable. We'd couldn't have asked for more!

Magical Moroccan Adventure - 8 Day expedition to Mt Toubkal and Marakech. Mohammed and his team could not do enough for our party. They were very attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and professional throughout our stay. The guides even fed us on the decent from the summit of Toubkal. Nothing was too much for them at all. I would very highly recommend using Mohammed for your visit to Morrocco.

Toubkal Expedition & Marrakech Excursion. Active Treks did a stellar job of making us feel secure and cared for throughout our expedition, which included the ascent of Mt Toubkal in the Atlas range, camel and quad bike riding and a few days soaking in the vibrant culture of Marrakech.Mohammed and his team of experienced guides know their trade very well, were attentive, professional and, just as importantly, approachable - happy to chat, and answer any questions we had about Moroccan customs and traditions.If you want to experience Morocco, Active Treks is the way to do it!

Mt Toubkal Expedition and visit to Marrakech. Mohammed and his team could not do enough for our party. They were very attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and professional throughout our stay. The facilities Mohammed selected were perfect for our needs; clean, comfy beds and plenty of Morrocan culture. I would highly recommend using Mohammed for your visit to Morrocco.

Mt Toubkal expedition, quad biking & camels.. Highly recommended!Mohamed is a fantastic guide with so much knowledge and experience. It was very well organised from start to finish. We were a big group of 20 with varying levels of experience/fitness, the guides put you at ease and you had every confidence in their ability. Would I do it again? Yes. Would I do it with the same company? Without a doubt! Fantastic experience finished off with quad biking and camel riding.

8 Day Expedition. Mohammed and his team were incredible from the start and made sure everything ran smoothly for my group of 20 people. From summiting Mt. Toubkal to quad biking and going to some wonderful local resturants they couldn't have done a better job at keeping us safe. I would highly recommend this man for anyone interested in visiting morocco and I will certainly be back using this man again.

Mt. Toubkal, Quad Biking and Camel Ride. Although we were a team of 20, Mo's organisation was flawless and made it appear very easy. He has a great team ranging from guides to chefs and is clearly a well known and respected man. We made the summit on schedule and not only that, you always felt the guides were confident and in control - friendly personalities and great sense of humour. We also had quad biking organised towards the end of the week which was a fantastic experience. You feel like you've had plenty of time on the bikes (2 hour round trip split up with a mint tea break in a hut) and hitting full speed on the flatter sections is very fun! Last word, all transportation was well organised and always on time which really makes a difference mentally. Highly recommend!

20 person trip from Greater Manchester West Scouts.. Fantastic 8 day trip organised for us including summiting Mt toubkal and quad bikes and camels plus traditional meals.Everything ran smoothly and nothing was too much trouble. I'd highly recommend Mohamed and this company, Infact we're going to come out in three years for another expedition.

3 Day Toubkal Trek. Really well organised. Ibraham our guide was very experienced, knew the mountains really well. On the trek itself we were looked after really well. Great good and refreshments. Make sure you remember your own toilet paper for the refuge though.

Superb organisation and great fun. I did the 2 day toubkhal trek - tough but would highly recommend!- Superb organisation including transfers, food and accommodation.- Really fun and interesting guide willing and happy to talk about local culture and geography in english and french.- Even willing to organise a tour during the festival of Eid when many Muslims in Morocco celebrate at home with their families.

Atlas mountains trek. I had Mohamed as our guide for a trek through the High Atlas and up Mt Toubkal back in 2010 (through Exodus at the time) and it's great to see he's now running his own company. He was a very attentive guide, very knowledgeable and clearly passionate about the mountains and countryside he lead us through (a keen eye for photography too). From a practical perspective the routes were well explained and manageable for a mixed ability group. His attention to health and safety of the trekkers was excellent and undertook a nice calm evac of one of the trekkers that took a tumble, nice to see the training in action.All in all very good at what he does and great sense of humour to go with it, I'd definitely recommend his services.

Superb Winter trek in the High Atlas . I recently too part in a trek with Active Treks Morocco through the foothills of the Atlas to the summit of Toubkal.This was the second time I have ascended this mountain and both times I was safely taken to the summit with Mohamed.He is a great guide and is company is very professional and versatile to the trekkers needs.I will definitely do another trek with Active Treks Morocco but a different mountain next time.

Guided winter ascent of Mount Toubkal. Mohamed guided us on a winter ascent of Mount (Jebel) Toubkal in the Moroccan High Atlas. He is an excellent guide and a great companion. He is very friendly and knowledgeable and did his utmost to ensure that we got the best out of our trek. I certainly recommend his services.

Amazing guide!. Mohamed is a fantastic guide, extremely knowledgeable and very friendly. My experience climbing Mt Toubkal is one I won't forget and just wouldn't have been as good without Mohamed! Will definitely be going back!

Everything you need in a guide. I have trekked with Mohamed in the past and hope to again. His knowledge of his amazing country is unmatched. Thoughtful, friendly and good-humoured, he ensures everyone with him gets the most out of every experience.

A fantastic guide in a wonderful country. My partner and I trekked in the Atlas with Mohamed a few years ago now but the trip and his most excellent service remain so very vivid.To say no task was too big for him is an understatement. Especially as we discovered our sleeping bags had been left at the airport in the UK. Mohamed went out of his way to ensure we had adequate bedding at all our stops.His guiding was exemplary and knowledge of the mountains flora and fauna really added to the experience. Always calm and eager to help our experience of Morocco under his friendly guidance was one to be savoured.The best way to sum him up is just to say he's a classy guy.

He could be the best. I have used Mohamed on 3 occasions as my guide for climbing in the High Atlas mountains and plan on a fourth trip in February. Mohamed has impeccable organizational skills which contribute to seamless transitions from trekking to camping etc.. Mohamed is a passionate guide with incredible interpersonal skills his kindness and compassion for people translates into emotional support for those he's guiding, which goes a long way in terms of meeting ones objectives. Mohamed epitomizes high character in high places, he is the best guide I've ever had in any place.

Mount Toubkal winter climb. I work for a travel company and have travelled all around the world but my experience with the Mount Toubkal winter climb has yet to be matched. It was an amazing week from start to finish and have come away with some lifelong memories of such a beautiful country and its people. This trip I took apprehensively solo with a group lead by Mohamed and his friendliness, knowledge, support and advice meant I loved every minute of it. Would recommend and use him for future adventures.

Fantastic Weekend Away - Definitely Want To Go Back!. Had an absolutely amazing couple of days exploring the Atlas Mountains with my family. Our guide was Mohamed who provided exceptional hospitality, we all really enjoyed our time with him. The Berber village we stayed in was wonderful, really humble and comfortable accommodation. All meals were provided for us on our tour, each one delicious and freshly cooked just for us. It was particularly special sitting for a break under the trees with a river flowing by us, while we relaxed on blankets and cushions provided for us and enjoyed the wonderful food being served. Everyone we met along the way were incredibly friendly and welcoming, it was a wonderful environment to be around and I would definitely love to go back for a repeat experience.

Mohamed Maachou is hands-down the BEST!!!. We visited Morocco in September 2010 with Semester at Sea (SAS). My husband and I were SAS staff trip leaders for a group of over 60 undergraduate college students and lifelong learners. Mohamed was the lead guide for our group on a 4-day hike into the Atlas Mountains. Here's a quote from the blog post we wrote about our trip back in 2010: Mohamed is "a walking, talking, joking encyclopedia of knowledge about history, culture, religion, the Moroccan monarchy, flora, fauna, geography, you name it. He seemed to be able to speak on nearly any subject we brought up. He was born and raised in a rural Chleh village on the other side of the mountains from our hiking expedition." Someone who clearly loves his country and loves his job, Mohamed was instrumental not only in guiding us through the Atlas Mountains to visit several beautiful Chleh villages and many kind Chleh people, he really taught us about Morocco and the Moroccan way of life. He went above and beyond to ensure that all of our group members had an amazing time--all the logistics (planes, trains, bus rides, mule trains, etc. were taken care of). Ours was a trip not for tourists, but for travelers--some visiting a predominantly Muslim country for the first time. We were there to experience Morocco, spend time with Moroccans, and to learn about the country's geography, culture and history. Mohamed found us wild fresh pomegranates while we were hiking and passed them out to everyone. We ate delicious Moroccan meals under shade trees and in gites and enjoyed dinner, drum circles, and dancing with Moroccan families who live in the mountains. We slept in the fresh air at the "Hotel of a Thousand Stars" as Mohamed called it. You really can see the entire Milky Way out there. It was magical, it was beautiful, it was the experience of a lifetime. Our students were so positively affected by this trip that almost all of them rated it THE highlight of their entire 4-month SAS experience--and we did as well. Whether you are looking for luxury or looking to rough it, if you are going to Morocco and you want to visit the Atlas Mountains or another area of the country, do yourself a favor and skip the touristy stuff. Instead, be a traveler with Mohamed! He will make sure that you experience the beautiful, magical country of Morocco and its people in ways you never could any other way.

Excellent hike, fantastic guide, great food—for a beyond reasonable price. We highly recommend using this company for your trek through the Atlas Mountains. Mo (the owner) was a good organizer, with continuous communication by email, phone, and Viber. Our hiking guide himself, Mohamed, was delightful—his English was good, and we always felt like we were in good hands. We did the 3-day hike in the Atlas Mountains (not the climb up Mt. Toubkal, although we were still at a pretty high altitude the whole time). There is an experience unlike any other. The insanely beautiful views, the tiny villages you hike directly through, the mule (which carries all your baggage, sleeping bags, and food)—there isn't much like it. Chef Hasan cooked TONS of good food for us—at least three or four courses for every meal, and not insubstantial ones: delicious salads, tagines, soups, fresh fruit, tons of mint tea. We felt embarrassed at how much was provided, and we were definitely never less than stuffed.Bring good, broken-in hiking boots: You'll be hiking 4+ hours the first day, 6+ hours the second day, and 6+ hours the third day. The hikes are not for beginners—there are some steep, slippery climbs and descents, not to mention a few stream crossings on rocks that require good balance. Keep in mind that you'll stay in refuges in the (very) rural towns; refuges are guesthouses with a few rooms and very basic amenities. They're definitely not luxurious; in one of the two we stayed in, there were only squat toilet (but a nice hot shower). These are not luxury hotels, but they are clean, and they are a unique experience.Do this hike—it was definitely one of the most memorable experiences we had in all of Morocco!

Sidi-Kaouki, Imouzzèr and Imlil. Recently I’ve returned from my seventh trip booked through Active Treks Morocco. This time to Sidi-Kaouki (via Essaouira) on the Atlantic coast, for a lovely valley walk to the shrine of Sidi-M’barak, and then over dunes and headlands and along long stretches of beautiful deserted beaches. It’s a windy place, with a strong north wind that builds up in the late afternoon, and is popular with surfers. Then down the coast towards Agadir, with stops at attractive spots along the coast, and inland to Imouzzèr-des-Ida-Outanane for short walks and a visit to the Cascades. Continuing towards Amizmiz we made a diversion down the Assif el Mall valley to see interesting villages and to have tea with locals. Next, an overnight stay near the village of Aguergour where there was sky diving (to watch!). Then over the Kik Plateau, covered in poppies and with views of snow-covered Jebel Toubkal and the Atlas range, to Imlil for a few days of local walks. The trip was full of interest and variety, but maybe a bit more walking and less time on the road would have been welcome. Food and accommodation were very good throughout, the transport and drivers were reliable and the guides were excellent - professional, knowledgeable about the area and good company. As usual I was well looked after; I have always felt secure on these trips, which I much appreciate, particularly as I travel solo. Very many thanks to guides Mustapha and Mohamed, and also to Mohamed at Active Treks Morocco for organising the trip. I am looking forward to my next trip to which will be a trek in the Amsouzarte Valley and to Lac d’Ifni later in the year. Carol M, London

Trip to the High Atlas. After a wonderful trip with 10 of my friends to climb Jebel Toubkal organised by Mohamed, I had promised my wife Marilyn that we would visit Marrakech and the High Atlas Mountains. I contacted Mohamed by Email and he agreed to organise our visit to the mountains. At 0830hrs promptly our driver Laarsen picked us at our Riad in the Medina in Marrakesh. It didn’t take long in Laarsens Toyota 4 wheel drive to escape the busy city streets and be on our way across the plains towards the High Atlas Mountains. We had great views of the snow covered peaks and could clearly see Jebel Toubkal. We stopped briefly at the Women’s Cooperative in Tahnaout to see a demonstration of the process for producing Argen Oil. Then on through Asni to Imlil at just after 10 o’clock. Waiting to meet us was our young guide Abdeslam and after a quick comfort stop we were heading out of town and towards the Mountains. We were soon to see our first but not last Mule head up the mountain and then we were shown a greater spotted woodpecker and on the next tree Levaillants green woodpecker only found in the high mountains of northwest Africa. The weather was perfect, sunny and not too warm, we walked steadily onwards and upwards stopping to see more birds and take in the incredible views of the snow covered High Atlas and of the almond and peach blossom. Abdeslam pointed out the various Walnut, Apple, Cherry, Poplar and other types of tree. We were told April and May are the best time for the Alpine flowers which appear in profusion. We crossed the river and climbed through the village to our high point at about 2000 metres about level with the snow line.We then walked to Mohamed’s house we had a wonderful lunch on the roof terrace watching fly catchers and blackbird’s in the trees around us. Moroccan Salad and Lentils followed by meat tagine with fresh local apples to follow. As we finished our meal Mohamed returned from the Mountain refuge with a Canadian couple who ascended the peak the day before. It was great to catch up again and we had a wonderful time talking about the mountains.Too soon it was time bid goodbye to walk back town and meet Laarsen and thank Abdeslam (Abdul) for his wonderful company. On the way back to our Riad we saw Stalks and Kites and stopped briefly in Asni for pictures of the Camels.Marilyn was really pleased with our wonderful day a true taste of mountain life and of wonderful mountain people. Thanks Again Mohamed

Amazing Adventures in the High Atlas Mountains.
