The trek was well organised starting from our pick up at Marrakech airport, through to getting to the summit of North Africa's highest mountain. I was very impressed with the crew that accompanies the trekkers such as the tent boys, mules & muleteers,cooks and most impressively the mountain guides led by Mohamed. All of our wild campsites were excellent, we stayed at a Gite and this was also very well catered. The trekking was pretty tough, but we had prepared for this and so that walking, climbing and scree scrambling was superb and this made way for the excellent views from the top of Jebel Toubkal. This was truly an adventure of a lifetime and one that i will never forget from the friendliness of the group, the views, the mountains, the High Atlas and the bustling city of Marrakech. Thanks to Mohamed and his team for arranging such a great adventure and a time that I will never forget. All the Best

Superb, a great experience. I went on a trek guided by Mohamed in early September, and it was a fantastic experience, with stunning views and great walking. As a guide, Mohamed is assured, calm and speaks excellent English, while also having a very well-rounded knowledge of anything you could care to ask him about the locality and its wildlife. In terms of the activities you'll be undertaking, you need to be relatively fit for this kind of thing, but if you're up for the challenge, I can't recommend this enough.

An adventure with a fantastic guide. Having recently undertaken a trek in the High Atlas Mountains that included climbing peaks over 4000metres and Passes of 3500metres, camping and staying in gites, I would recommend undertaking this adventure with Mohamed. He is an experienced and knowledgeable guide who can be relied on to keep you safe whilst having an amazing time. He is always ready to share his broad knowledge of the flora and fauna and has a great sense of humour. His spoken English is excellent.

3-day trek around Toubkal - Flawless organisation. I went on a bespoke 3-day trek organised by Mohamed and it was faultless in every way.He was responsive to my many emails and flexible to make any changes I wanted for the trip - number of people, days, travel arrangements, overnight locations. Nothing was too much trouble and all handled with the minimum of fuss.When I said I wanted a challenging 3-day trek on specific dates, Mohamed organised transport, a guide, chef, mule (to carry the food) and accommodation. All I had to do was show up in Marrakech and everything else was laid out for me. My guide, Hossain, was friendly and eager to adapt to any changes I wanted. He laid out a basic plan for the 3 days but adjusted the itinerary on the fly if we reached our destination early and I wanted to do more. He made all the arrangements for meeting the chef and mule for lunch / dinner each day and changed accommodation bookings when I opted for a change in plans. During the trek, he was very considerate of my needs and was the perfect guide - professional, friendly and very knowledgable of the area (given that he was local!). Because I wanted a challenging 3 days, he was happy to get up before 5am to start our treks and carried the food himself when our lunch spot was inaccessible to the mule. He kept a perfect pace for me and I learned a lot about technique for quick, efficient hiking both up and down mountains ('surfing' down the mountain was the highlight of my trip - thank you Hossain - just amazing!).At home, I stick to a Paleo diet, but wasn't expecting these needs to be met on the trip. But after a casual conversation about food on the first day, Hossain must have informed our chef (also called Mohamed) and every meal from that point was Paleo. He even made vegetable soup from scratch as a starter for my evening meals. Another example of customer service surpassing expectations. When we finished on the last day, Hossain phoned ahead to ensure a taxi was waiting for me at our finishing point to take me to the airport. However, as I had a few hours before my flight, I enquired about a massage for my aching body. Nothing was too much trouble. I was taken to central Marrakech where Mohamed met me and took me to a local Hammam Massage facility where they gave me a discount for being one of Mohamed's clients. Mohamed took care of my backpack and arranged the taxi to take me from the Massage place to the airport.Again, flawless organisation from start to finish, so efficient and professional, meeting every requirement with no fuss.Mohamed, Hossain, thank you. If I was able to give you a rating of more than 5 stars, I would. I have recommended you to everyone I know who thinking about doing such a trip. I would not think of speaking to anyone else if I organise a Sahara trip or return to Marrakech in the future.

Wonderful experience. If you are looking for an experienced, inspiring and knowledgeable guide and you are not afraid to sweat a little, enjoy wonderful views and experience the outdoors, Mohamed is your guide.I just did a two week hiking trip with Mohamed in the High Atlas mountains and had an absolute great time!

Very competent,reliable and good company. Mohamed Maachu led our school trip to Toubkal in July 2012. He was incredibly competent, polite, reliable and all 23 students and staff felt we were in safe hands. I returned in July 2014 with my own family and was fortunate that Mohamed was able to guide us. He is completely reliable, arriving early to meet us, arranging both mules and our food. One of the best things about Mohamed, apart from feeling in safe hands, is that he is willing to answer all our questions. My children have learnt about the Atlas mountains, but also gained a little insight into Moroccan culture. We stayed in Morocco a week,and we all fell in love with it. Looking back, those couple of days trekking with Mohamed made our trip. I can recommend that this guide will not only take care of you, but he will make you want to return to his beautiful country.

Toubkal Region Trek. Mohameg has excellent English to complement his extensive knowledge of the mountains and flora and fauna. I was Leader of a World Challenge Adventure Trek. Mohamed was an excellent Guide and Host. He was very flexible and completely considerate of the groups requirements. His decision making on the hill was Perfect and he was able to change agenda and logistics instantly. A great experience facilitated by a very experienced Guide. Thankyou Mohamed
MountTubkal. Mohammed was an excellent guide and was very flexible. The sights and food I would rate as 10/10! Highly recommended

Sahara Camel Trek. Mohamed Maachu arranged our trip to Merzouga for a Sahara camel trek, spending the night at the desert in a tent. We visited Ait Ben Haddou,Todra Gorges, Dades valley, etc. It was an excellent and wonderful trip with our driver Abdo and our guide Aziz. We highly recommend it.

Christmas with Mohamed. We trekked into the Atlas mountains with Mohamed at Christmas 2013. The trip was fantastic thanks to Mohamed. We had a very interesting, lively and diverse group and Mohamed was extremely adaptable and accommodating. He has a great sense of humour - much needed with our group and is a lovely interesting person and an excellent mountain guide. I really enjoyed the tea he made for us in the shepherd's hut up in the Atlas mountains!

Brilliant. Travelling with Mohammed was a pleasure. Took each walk as fast or as slow as the group needed. Very good English! Full of knowledge and many interesting stories. Your health and we'll being really is his top priority, becoming ill on trekk myself, he did not make me feel like a burden, and carried my belongings for me. Highly recommend!!! Thank you Mohammed

Exceptional. Highly skilled, very high degree of care.. My wife met Mohammed as a teacher on a school expedition. She insisted we return as a family and Mohammed would be our first choice for a guide. How right she was. Mohammed is very open to any itinerary at any level. Best bit was the lunches cooked for us at refuges and getting a ride on the mules. Highly capable with a very high level of care but above all a really nice man.

Active Treks Morocco - highly recommended. I have climbed and trekked in the High Atlas, Central Atlas and Sahara desert with Mohamed/ Active Treks Morocco on numerous occasions - I cannot recommend him highly enough. I have found Mohamed to be a friendly, good humoured, knowledgeable and highly capable mountain guide who has consitently 'gone the extra mile' to make sure that our trips have run smoothly. He has always provided good quality vehicles, excellent food and friendly staff and I have always found his rates to be reasonable.If you are looking for adventure, look no further than Active Treks Morocco.

Sahara Desert Trip. We had originally booked a trek to Mount Toubkal and two of our party developed health problems and we needed to switch to an alternative, less physical activity. Mohamed was understanding and said it was fine, to switch last minute.We had a driver and a guide, and both were called Abdellah. The driver was sensible and carefull at all times. He drove us around 1000 kilometres in three days and his driving was flawless.The other Abdellah was very chatty, and spoke a few languages. He was a good organiser and quickly found an extra room when he wanted a room of his own.The desert was wonderful. We saw the sunrise and sunset and slept in a tent at the edge of the dunes.We arrived a little late, though at 8pm and then waited nearly three hours for our food.Riding the camels was an experience, which was calming, It was so quiet.Thank you Mohamed

Eye opening. Wow what can I say one of the best trips I've ever been on, well looked after by a great guide and Amazing cook, for where we were we ate like kings :) the views were breath taking, would do more next time :)

Mount Toubkal trek. I've just returned from a trek to Mount Toubkal , Morocco. Was fantastic. We were well looked after by Mohamed and his team, accommodation and food were both good and well organised. Plus a helping hand was given when my legs decided they had had enough on the descent !
I would recommend a trip with them :-)

The perfect trip!. Mohamed arranged our trip to Ourika Valley and Ait Ben Haddou. We had lots of questions regarding the trips prior to the trip but he was always quick to reply. The trips were amazing and we were never rushed through anything - we were able to take our time en route to take pictures of the landscape and we could choose where we wanted / didn't want to visit - so were never pressurised to purchase anything! The guide was always prompt, friendly and accommodating, doing everything to ensure we were having the best time possible. Lunch on both days were great, again - we were not rushed through and could take our time. The only down side? That we didn't know we were going to drive through the amazing Atlas Mountains!! I would happily recommend Mohamed to all anyone who is thinking of visiting Morocco!

Atlas Mountains February 2014. Went on a seven day trip this year. Had an excellent time going through Berber Villages and making the trek through the mountains. The daily climbs had fantastic views and the overnight stays were unique, but enjoyable. Mohammad, our guide, I cannot say enough good thing about him. Very knowledgeable and friendly guy. He met the climbers where they were at physically and did not go beyond anyone's limitations. With that said, I never felt slowed down or irriated in any way. In short, I recommend the winter climb. It was challenging, not technical. After spending a copious amount of time with Mohammad and his team, I am considering coming back and checking out the Sahara Desert. Great experience.

Amazing Trek!. The mount Toubkal trek was absolutely fantastic. Our guide Mohamed was great - really friendly, very knowledgable and his English was perfect. Mohamed was also very flexible and happy to change arrangements for the group. The actual trek itself was a great challenge and a brilliant route up and down and well guided to the ability of the group. Would recommend this to anyone - just don't let the adventure company book your flights...changing in Casablanca was an experience I could have happily done with out.

Amazing!!. The trip was absolutely amazing. The only downside to the trip was we had a change in our hotel and it wasn't the best. Despite this, the Mohammed our guide was excellent. The gite was clean and the staff were friendly. I have recommended this trip to my friends

Mount Toubkal. I have just returned from Morocco after completed a trek in the Atlas mountains, culminating in a summit climb of Mount Toubkal. It was an amazing experience made even better by our mountain guide Mohamed Maachou. His knowledge and professionalism made you feel reassured throughout the trek, and he was also keen to join in with the banter along the way.

Mount Toubkal Climb. I've recently returned from the Mount Toubkal Climb with Mohamed as the guide. The trek was absolutely superb and obviously reaching the summit of Toubkal was one particular highlight. I do feel compelled to reserve special praise for Mohamed: his English is faultless, his knowledge of the mountain regions appears to be boundless, he successfully managed to look after a group of varying abilities, his enthusiasm infectious, and by the end of the week I would happily call Mohamed a very good friend. He also looked after us in Marrakech too. I cannot praise him highly enough and couldn't think of anyone better to look after you in both the Atlas Mountains as well as in Marrakech.

Mt. Toubkal Climb. The Mt. Toubkal climb is a 5 day trek that is described in the Exodus UK brochure as challenging - and that seems a fair description: you need to be a reasonably fit Brit to be able to attempt it (however it was increasingly apparent that it is no problem for the average Berber). Our trip was lead by Mohamed Maachou, of Active Treks Morocco. Mohamed proved to be very knowledgeable (of the mountain, its flora and fauna, and the history of the surrounding area), responsive to the requirements of the group, and the friendly team provided by his organisation consistently provided us with all the support (and food) we required. His sense of humour and good English also ensured that our group were always at ease.

A great day in the mountains. We only wanted a gentle trek in the mountains so did the Imlil-Ait day trek. A very relaxed way to enjoy the scenery. The trip was well organised - picked up from the hotel, discussed what we wanted to do over mint tea in Imlil and then set off. Our guide, Mohammad, was an absolute delight, even treating us to tea and biscuits in his own home. Excellent English and very personable. All in all a lovely day out.

The mountains were amazing - the tour less so. Firstly, I highly recommend everyone capable to do this tour. We did the full ascent and it was a bucket list kind of experience. The scenery is spectacular. The hike is a challenge but not technical. What disappointed me was that we had a guide who spoke poor english, had only done the mountain five times and who, poor kid, nearly froze during our ascent. Also, the food was only OK and got me a little sick. I recommend you ask about the qualifications of your actual guide befMy recommendation

Winter Toubkal trip. I went on the Adventure Company trek lead by Mohamed Maachou at the end of March 2014. I found the trip to be really good. The whole thing was very well organised by him and the food and cook in the mountains was varied and enjoyable. The weather was excellent with the snow well frozen in the morning and great views from North Africa's highest mountain. Mohamed has plenty of experience and knowledge of the area and his english is excellent.

Ait Bouguemez Valley and Bin El Ouidane. At the end of last month (March) I returned from a 5-day visit to the Ait Bouguemez Valley, followed by a 2-day visit to Bin El Ouidane, arranged by Mohamed Maachou of Active Treks Morocco, which was very well organised and enjoyable. The Valley is within the M’Goun National Park and encompasses around 30 traditional Atlas Mountain villages with lush green fields and orchards set against a backdrop of snow-topped mountains. My visit was just a bit too early for the fruit trees to be in bloom, which I’m sure must look stunning. There is easy walking through fields and along hillsides, and more challenging routes over passes for those fitter than myself. Hamid, my guide, knew the area very well as he is a local. There is an ancient granary on the top of a steep conical hill with a panoramic view. The interior of the granary is open to tourists and has a custodian (also ancient; he claimed to be 110). We visited another site of interest at the village of Ibakliwine, where dinosaur tracks can be seen preserved in the rock strata. The area is quite remote, and we came across few other tourists although there are several gîtes. I stayed at the Ecolodge which was comfortable, with en-suite showers, and good food. It was cold at night, but there was a wood fire in the saloon and some heating in the rooms. At Bin El Ouidane there is a large lake and hydro-electric dam. Approaching from Azilal there are superb views over the lake, and the dam is at the head of a superb rocky gorge. Photography is prohibited around the dam and adjacent areas. There is fishing available in the lake for those interested. I stayed in a guest house with an attractive garden and a good view of the river and gorge. There didn’t appear to be much walking in the near vicinity, apart from a track along the top of the gorge that gave good views. The Ouzoud Falls were visited en route back to Marrakesh and are worth seeing. It appears that it is very busy here later in the season. This was the sixth trip that I have booked through Mohamed and once again the guide, walking, transport, accommodation and food were all excellent, and the itinerary was varied and interesting. I am now planning my next trip, which will be a trek along part of the Atlantic coast, later this year. Many thanks, once again, to Mohamed and to Hamid. Carol M, London

jbel tubcal,winter. we had a fantastic trip to tubcal with some very mixed wintery weather which added to the whole experience.mohamed and hussaine guided us to the top and back safely in pretty atrocious weather.the whole trip was very well organised and i would certainly recomend it to anyone looking for some adventure.well done mohamed and your team.

Terrific Toubkal Trek!. Our trek started out in auspicious conditions: we set off in high spirits under speedwell-blue skies in glorious sunshine, confident in our abilities to meet all the challenges of this exciting adventure. As we climbed towards the snow line, admiring vistas of delicate cherry and apple blossom around the village if Aroumd to the North, and the snow-capped peaks to the South, our group began to gel, so that when we arrived at the Neltner refuge, we already felt in the company of good friends. This proved to be of vital importance as, overnight, the weather changed: the wind accelerated to gale-force and 30cms of snow fell, ensuring that, far from making the Toubkal ascent the following morning, we were hut-bound the entire day. However, we already had every confidence in the wisdom and excellent leadership of our guides, Mohamed and Hussein, who were both towers of strength when we did make the ascent the following day in clear but challenging conditions. Hussein set a perfect pace, kicking steps into the deep powder snow, while Mohamed was vigilant in his care and attention; his leadership was faultless and we trusted him implicitly. Both on the mountains and back in Marrakech, his attention to detail was immaculate and nothing was too much trouble; he gave a very professional yet personal service, delivered with good humour and patience. His impressive command of English and knowledge of the terrain and its flora and fauna, together with his calm, good-humoured and easy demeanour made him the perfect travelling companion and guide. Thanks, Mohamed, for making the trip so hugely enjoyable and such a success. Thanks must also go to Hussein the Cook, for his fabulous food!

A great trek day. We trekked from imlil, only over 1 day, which was a very enjoyable day. Ibrahim was very knowledgeable, set a good pace and answered our frequent questions about the surroundings and culture. The food at lunch was also great! A great day out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

Fantastic Trekking Holiday!. If you like point to point walking, wild camping and adventure, then trekking the peaks and valleys of the Atlas Mountains in Morocco is an absolute must. Mohamed Maachou was our guide and he speaks excellent English, also he was able to understand the different accents, as our group was a mix of Italian, English, Scottish and Australian. He is very knowledgeable and throughout the trek gave us updates on wildlife, plants and the culture of Morocco. The trekking on this holiday can be tough, but the scenery and walks are breathtaking, the pinnacle was reaching Mount Toubkal. The Berbers are very friendly people and throughout my holiday I always felt safe and in good hands. I was fortunate that the group was small and we all got on reasonably well. Mohammed is very friendly and had the ability to fit in with the group, but still maintain a watchful eye over everyone on the trek and above all else he has a good sense of humour. I would definitely recommend this holiday to anyone that enjoys a challenge!

Mount Toubkal winter climb Jan 2014. I have just returned from the Mount Toubkal Winter climb led by Mohamed Maachou. From start to finish Mohamed was enthusiastic, helpful, great fun, informative and above all has an amazing ability to judge the group individually and as a whole in terms of their capabilities. This led to a fantastic week filled with amazing scenery, great walking and a huge amount of fun.Thank you Mohamed!

Mount Toubkal in Winter. 2014 has got of to a great start for me with an ascent of Mount Toubkal on New Years Day in perfect weather conditions. Mohamed did a wonderful job of putting the trip together and is justifiably very proud and knowledgable of his homeland. The scenery was absolutely stunning and the food prepared by our cooks was amazing given all the equipment they had to prepare the meal with. I would recommend this trip and Active Treks to anyone wishing to visit Marrakesh and the High Atlas

Excellent Marrakech and High Atlas Trekking Holiday. I went on the Exodus Toubkal Winter Climb in December 2013 / January 2014. Our guide was Mr Mohammed Maachou and what a great guide and great person he is. From the reception at the airport, making sure the hotel arrangements were just right, arranging or suggesting social functions in and around Marrakech - this guy has it all covered.On the slopes of Toubkal and its sister peaks he really took care of us, at all times ensuring our safety but making sure we stretched ourselves physically (which is what we came to do) and came away with that rewarding feeling of achievement afterwards.I really recommend the high Atlas to any would be serious trekker, just a short flight away from any European major city and there's an abundance of 4000+ peaks out there to be explored.You'll need a good guide - readers of this review will already know who I recommend.

High Atlas villages and Essaouira. Another successful trip booked through Mohamed Maachou. This time to the villages of Tighza, Imi n'Tala and Tassa Ouirgane in the High Atlas Mountains, where I enjoyed pleasant walks and visits to interesting sites of local industry. At the salt works near Tassa Ouirgane I saw the brine wells and evaporation ponds that are operated by local families, and I was also able to visit the rock salt mine near Telouet. Then there was a visit to the mosque at Tinmel to see its beautiful 12th century Islamic architecture. The interior, which is partly restored, is open to tourists and is of some splendour, although most of the roof is now missing. The trip finished with a pleasantly enjoyed afternoon and morning in Essaouira, with its lively and photogenic harbour, albeit after a rather long drive there and then back to Marrakech. The accommodation in the villages was basic, but staying with the locals was interesting, and the riad at Essaouria and hotel at Marrakech were comfortable. The transport arrangements were very reliable and Hassan was a careful driver. Abdou was an excellent guide who knows the area well; he found things I was interested in and some good photographic venues. This was the fifth time I have booked through Mohamed and I definitely look forward to doing so again

One Fine Day in Marrakesh. With only a short time in Marrakesh, I really wanted to absorb the best parts of the city without wasting any time (and money!). Mohamed organised everything for us, an excellent city guide to take us around, taxi's from our hotel into town to avoid us getting ripped off, and tables for lunch and dinner at good local restaurants (with or without wine!) It was amazing to be taken round by real experts who have both a genuine passion for their country, the city, and it's culture and also as they are really warm people, you will leave with the invaluable sense of having connected and made real friends with the people of Morocco. Feel free to e-mail me for more info & comments on lisettecruse@yahoo.co.uk

Morocco in a nutshell. Just a week, to walk barefoot in the sands of the Sahara, breathe the mountain air of the Atlas, and meet the incredibly friendly people of this country, and Mohammed our guide ensured that we didn't waste a minute. As we travelled he talked with us about the politics and history, the agriculture and the wildlife, and his knowledge, enthusiasm and love of this country coloured our whole trip. He was quietly efficient, quickly dealt with any little problems that arose and his sense of humour kept smiles on all our faces. Truly an excellent guide.

What a great guide!. Mohamed was an excellent guide on my one week, non-hiking trip around Morocco, which I booked through Exodus. He had a great knowledge of the history and people of Morocco, as well as the plant and birdlife, and he kept our diverse group constantly entertained with his great sense of humour. His organisation was seamless, and I think his English may even be better than mine, with the extensive colloquialisms he knows.In addition to all of this, Mohamed's love of gadgets comes in very handy for fixing cameras, and he had a solution to any situation I managed to get into – e.g. locking my bag keys in my locked bag… Should I go back to walk the mountains of Morocco, it will be with Mohamed as my guide!Thanks again for a great week!Sarah C.

Great trip, great guide!. I did the Mountain Toubkal Climb in September 2013 and had a great time thanks to our guide, Mohamed Maachou. Mohamed is very professional and knows Morocco like the back of his hand. There were 15 people of different age in my group and he looked after all of us. Mohamed is patient, very well organised and has over 13 years’ experience as a travel guide. The rest of the staff were also great and really helpful. I was amazed by how much good food they managed to cook on the mountains over 3000 metres! I definitely recommend the Mountain Toubkal Climb with Mohamed!

Great trip, great people, fantastic guide.. From meeting Mohammed Maachou at the airport to him waving us goodbye two weeks later, our diverse group of trekkers were his priority guiding us through the Atlas Mountains. His knowledge of the area, wildlife and flora made the trip enjoyable for all of us. He constantly kept us smiling with his wicked sense of humour and his uncanny skill of mimicking our regional accents! The trek was tough in places but Mohammed quickly assessed and set the right pace to keep us together. Along with the domestics team of chef and muleteers looking after our needs, Mohammed gave our group an experience to remember forever.Diolch yn FawrSteve R

The best thing I have ever done!. I was part of a group from Keele university that climbed Mount Toubkal in August. We couldn't of asked for a better leader. I always felt safe with Mo, he knew the mountain like the back of his hand and what seemed like everyone in Morocco! Mo went out of his way to look after us and his fab sense of humour really united the group! The trip was the best thing I have ever done and would highly recommend it!Thanks Mo! Lucy xx

Peaks & Valleys trek. As a single female traveller I was quite nervous about my first time ever trekking trip , let alone in the Atlas Mountains, but I needn't have worried at all. I booked with Exodus and Mohamed Maachou was our Guide, He looked after me and our group wonderfully. His first precedence was our safety. His knowledge of flora and fauna was outstanding I really learned a lot and his great humour meant a smile was never far from our lips . Being one of the oldest in my group I was again worried I might be a hindrance, but I was looked after impeccably, never once did I feel I was holding every one up. The food was delicious and I have taken some particularly yummy Moroccan recipes back to the UK thanks to Hussiain our talented cook. But don't kid yourself, this trip was no pushover, nearly all in the group were seasoned trekkers and they all said it was one of the hardest they had ever done. (Remember to take at least one walking pole, you will need it) The sights, the sounds the smells of Morocco, loved it so much. Mount Toubkal ... been there done that, just awesome. Memories to last a lifetime. Recommended

Peaks and Valleys of the Atlas. A brilliant time had over peaks and ridges although very strenuous, possibly too high to quickly? Mohamed Maachou was an inspiring guide getting the optimum trekking speed of a mixed group very quickly. He was extremely knowledgeable and amusing and dealt with all problems expertly.I would definitely recommend Exodus and especially Mohamed should you wish to travel to Morocco.Hugh

12 days Peaks & Valleys trek. I booked this hiking holiday with Exodus.I was warmly greeted by Mohamed at the airport and we started for a 12 days trip in the Atlas mountains on the peaks & valleys tour. We had a very diverse group of different age & fitness levels. Not an easy walk in the park this is a rewarding one over 4000m peaks and on/over (very windy) ridges, beautiful skylines and amazing vistas/colours. During the day you might sometimes curse the steep intervals but once back in the camp all the hardship is quickly forgotten as the cook and muleteers had already prepared camp and delicious food was waiting for our hungry stomachs.I can surely recommend this trip as Mohamed is a great experienced guide, and he and his team make this walk a very nice experience.Go for it!

Mount Toubkal Trek. I booked this hiking holiday with Exodus after an enjoyable hike up Kilimanjaro last year. Our guide, friend, meeter, greeter and fixer, Mohamed looked after us with skill, care and humour and took us up and down arduous Atlas trails culminating with Toubkal. This trip represented fantastic value for money.

Trek to Jebel Toubkal. I wanted to do the trek to Jebel Toubkal in November, 2012 and found about Mohamed in a website of guides in the Atlas Mountains. He was very professional form the begging answering all my questions, doubts and quickly replying to all my mails. The trek was absolutely great and despite of the bad weather we had on the day of the last trek and that we could not reach the top, I had an amazing and unforgettable trip that I will surely repeat one day! I was guided by Mohamed's brother (Abdou) who made me feel safe at all times. His knowledge of the mountains and the Valley is incredible and in addition to the awesome trekking, I learnt a lot of the local culture and people. Thank you, Mohamed for organizing this trip for me!! It was exactly what I wanted and what I needed!

Deeply enjoyable mountain experience!. I think everyone needs to experience something like this in their lives.Wonderful, simple living, with delicious food provided and a welcoming presence by the local people. Mohamed is a complete don, he knows the area like the back of his hand and is incredibly knowledgeable...about everything it seems! But seriously, its a great comfort to know you're in good hands and the whole trip ran very, very smoothly. Expect wondrous views, long walks in the sun and cries of joy when you reach the summit!

AMAZING. Mohamed is an excellent trekking leader. His skills, knowledge and passion for the atlas mountains allowed me to experience something I would of never have been able to. His personality made it possible for not only every one to complete the challenge but to become closer as a group. truly one of the most amazing things I have done with my life... Mohamed made that possible. I highly recommend!

Excellent Tour Guide. I have just come back from trekking in the Atlas Mountains with Mohamed as our guide. Mohamed, a proud native, has a lot of knowledge of the peoples, history, flora, animal life, geography and culture of the region. Mohamed is a very experienced Mountain Guide,he has great personal skills and he makes each person in the group feel special. He has great rapport with the muleteers and staff at the gites where we stayed. Mohamed speaks English extremely very well and can also speak French. Any trek taken with Mohamed will be remembered for the fun, enjoyment, spectacular scenery, challenge, culture, superb food and the great outdoors. I highly recommend a visit to Morocco and the High Atlas Mountains with Mohamed as host.

A fantastic trip. I had a week long charity trek with Mo and a group of friends from university in the Atlas Mountains. Mo was extremely knowledgeable on the area, well organised and had a good rapport with the guides and anyone else we came across. His friendly attitude and good sense of humour definitely helped in getting us and - more importantly - down Mt Toubkal.Highly recommended!Cheers Mo!

Fantastic Trip. There's something special to be said about a man who can drag you up and down a mountain in good spirits. Mohammed is one of those people. From the first day of walking to the last his humour and easy-going attitude was impeccable. He set a sensible pace, not too fast to leave people behind yet not too slow as to frustrate faster walkers.The scenery and views were stunning and, being a local, Mohammed knew when and where to look.Highly recommended to anyone with working legs.

Mount Toubkal Trek. Oulad Driss trek,Telouet, Ait Ben Haddou & Todra Gorge. For the fourth time I booked through Mohamed Maachou at Active Treks Morocco. This time for a desert trek in the area of Oulad Driss (near M’hamid), and visits to Telouet, Ait Ben Haddou and Todra Gorge, en route from Marrakech. Telouet and Ait Ben Haddou are both well worth visiting, although a guide was not available at Telouet. It was pleasant to visit Ait Ben Haddou in the evening, via the stepping stones across the river, when there were not too many people about and no hassle from anyone. The panoramic view from the top makes the climb worth it. On the way to Todra Gorge we followed a piste route from the upper end of Dades Gorge, which was quite adventurous. Information from locals as to whether the route is currently passable (in part it follows an intermittently dried-up river bed) is necessary, together with a 4WD vehicle and a driver who is skilled in piste driving. Some maps don’t distinguish between piste and surfaced roads. We saw a lot of nomads around their camps, and some in caves, and women returning with donkeys loaded with grass they had harvested, and other women climbing rocky slopes to collect vegetation for their animals. This was a great opportunity to see an area that is not easily accessible, and gave a fascinating glimpse of nomadic life. Todra Gorge itself is a spectacular natural feature, but is more touristy than I had expected. The desert trek which took five days, followed a circular route southwards from the small oasis of Oulad Driss, and was guided by Mohamed’s colleague (and cousin), Abdou. We also had a cook, camel driver and two camels. We stayed in a fixed camp at Oulad Driss and for one night in the desert; these camps were basic, but adequate and with showers. Other nights we made our own camp. The food was plentiful and very good, with refreshing salads for lunch. The trekking was for up to 5 hours each day. The terrain underfoot was low dunes and gravelly plateaus, but given the temperature, was quite challenging at times. A camel was available for me to ride, but I preferred to walk. We started walking before 8am, then around noon stopped in the shade of trees for lunch. The temperature reached 38°C in the early afternoon, and we didn’t start trekking again until after 4pm when it had started to cool down, then we walked until around 6pm. We came across a well most days, but I drank bottled water - I needed 3 litres per day. The scenery was not spectacular, but it was pleasant and I enjoyed the general environment and the experience of travelling in the desert. Altogether it was a highly successful and enjoyable trip, and I was well looked after throughout. The transport was reliable and the food was good. The trek was efficiently and capably organised by Abdou. On a future occasion I would choose a cooler time of year for trekking when it would be possible to walk throughout the day (my trek was over the 2nd and 3rd weeks of April). As I book solo, it costs me more than if I travelled with a group, but it does mean that I get treated on an individual basis which is more to my liking. Walks can be arranged to suit me (I don’t cope well with rugged terrain - I’m getting old!) and more time can be given to things that I am specifically interested in. I will definitely book through Mohamed again.Once again, a big thank-you to Mohamed and to Abdou. CarolM, London
