The purpose was to visit historical places and learn more about the culture and people. Our guide was Hassan Ouaouich, very friendly and knowledgeable about places and events in each area visited. My favorite part from the trip was the Desert Camp in Merzouga. Tenere Tours is highly recommended! Certainly will use their services again.
Wonderful experience. We had a very nice trip！The guide is very friendly and humorous.We all recommend this group.we reviewed great sceneries on the road and in the desert .

With Great Tour Guide Comes Unforgettable Experience. 6 of us decided to go for a 9 day tour in Morocco. We had a few cities and sites in our mind and hence, we sent our requests for private customised tour via email to different companies. Tenere Tours responded in a matter of minutes, with the full itinerary with other must-go sites that we have missed. The most importantly, they offered a great price! Rachid was very helpful and quick in answering questions. With his help, our application for Morocco Visa went well. We arrived at Marrakech Airport on the same day but different time (5 in the morning and 1 in the evening), yet Rachid and Ali went twice to pick us all up to our riad and helped us in settling down. With a skillful driver (Ali) and a hospitable tour guide (Rachid), we travelled in a really comfortable way on a mini van through Marrakesh, Essaouira, Ouarzazate, Merzouga, Arfoud, Fes and others. They would tell us stories and histories about the cities, stopping at different spots for nice panoramic views and photo-taking session, and sometimes throwing us with jokes. The whole journey was full of laughter and we got close really quickly. Something worth mentioning was that, they would celebrate the Islamic festival (Eid Al-Adha) on 12th of September, 2016, and because of this, we had the chance to explore a few authentic local markets that were really busy with people trying to get ready for their big festival, buying and selling goats, sheeps and other spices. The stop at the market on our way from Marrakech to Essaouira was quite random, but in my opinion was the best part of the trip!! Buzzing through the crowd, observing the locals' way of living, their culture, religion, food... EVERYTHING! That was AMAZING!!Throughout the journey, I was amazed by the various landscapes in Morocco. Dry land with cactus; ground with troves of marine fossils; mountains of different colour (red, brown or black); Sahara deserts with shrubs; national park with trees just like those in tropical country (My hometown: Malaysia!). Moroccan cuisine such as tagine, couscous, zaalouk, b'stilla, all tasted amazing! They are not spicy and hence, no worries. Their mint tea was refreshing and I think I am addicted to it (they called it Moroccan whiskey with zero alcohol, LOL!!) Rachid recommended us to local restaurants with tasty food at a reasonable price. He even helped us to bargain as we do have language barrier with the locals. The accommodation arranged by Rachid was brilliant. The staffs at the hotels and haimas were all helpful and warming, greeting us with smiles and always welcome us with their mint tea. Breakfasts were included and the hotels are all at the right spots, allowing us to walk around and explore the town by ourselves. The night in sahara was lively with their traditional musics, songs and board game. Rachid was a really responsible tour guide. When one of my friends fell sick in Sahara desert (probably due to motion sickness after riding the camel, or maybe because of the heat), he rushed to us, took good care of my friend, and stayed all night with us. His sincerity in making friends and his generosity show us the best side and also the beauty of Morocco. Once again, thanks a lot for the trip of a lifetime!!!!! We highly recommend this company to anyone.  Tips: - Travel in a larger group comes a better price. - Ask for permission if you would like to take photos of their stalls, or else you might end up being scolded.

Best part of our trip. We travelled with our guide, Mohammed, for 3 days from Marrrakech, to Merzouga in near to Sahara, to Fez. We had a great time talking to him during the journey - he shared stories about life in Morocco and made some stops that were off the beaten path for us. We definitely felt like we were in good hands and were able to relax and just enjoy the experience. We covered a lot of ground over three days but it didn't feel like it because there was something spectacular to see around every corner.

9 day tour of Morocco organized by Rashid- guide Ali Ala. This review will be about the service and the experience we had with our guides. My sister has travelled a lot throughout the Middle East and Northern Africa. , and she recommended this specific tour as being one of the best in Morocco. My wife and I didn't want to spend the 9 days rushing from one city and site to another, so we contacted Tenere Tours and asked if could customize our tour to see only the following: Marrakech, the dessert, Fez, and, Chefchaouen. Hassan replied to our email in a matter of minutes and he helped organize the tour and later, when we arrived late to Marrakech due to a delay in the airport, his brother Rashid picked us up and personally took us to our beautiful Riad. Despite it being very late in the evening, Rashid sat down with us, and while sharing tea, got to know us and reviewed what we wanted to do over the course of the 9 days- very professional and courteous. He introduced us to our driver Ali, who was responsible for taking us to our sites throughout the country. Ali was super friendly, knowledgeable, generous and most importantly accommodating. My wife and I weren't interested in waking up too early in the morning, so Ali would come and pick us up at 9:30/10:00. When we had to be at the port of Tangier early in the AM, Ali was ready at 4:30AM. We went during Ramadan, and despite not eating/drinking anything for the entire day, Ali was always cheerful, helpful, knowledgeable and engaging. We got to learn so much more about the culture, history and traditions just by being with him for the entire tour. In addition, we met professional and certified tour guides in each major city (Marrakesh, Fez, even the dessert), who taught us a great deal and even bargained for us! Our two nights in the desert were unforgettable. We rode camels, drove over the duns, visited Berber and Bedouin families, enjoyed traditional Berber music under the desert ski and enjoyed incredible service. While on the road, we crossed paths with Rashid and a tourist from Chile. Rashid stop his car, came and greeted us and even the tourist got out of the car to say hello. He was as excited as we were about the beauty of Morocco and the superb service Tenere Tours was providing for him.Rashid's professionalism and hospitality combined with Ali's good nature made our 9 day trip to Morocco an unbelievable and unforgettable experience. We highly recommend this company to anyone.

Everything You'd Want and More. We decided to book with Tenere Tours for our two week exploration of Morocco. Authentic Moroccan Experience. We had a very good experience with Tenere Tours since we contacted them to start organizing our trip to Morocco. Rashid ( who helped us organizing and also was our guide for our 10 day trip), was extremely responsive to all our questions and flexible with our requests. He designed a trip to ensure we would experience pretty much everything this Country has to offer : mountains, desert, beaches, good food, music, chaotic cities, charming towns and very nice people. We were able to appreciate and learn about their culture, way of leaving, religion, history and food. We drove a little less of 2,500 kms for 10 days. Their 4x4 SUVs are in good condition and they know the roads very well. Roads are a mixed of good highways and more local roads. We were 3 adults, and as we had a driver & a guide the 3 of us had to share the back seat, this is something to consider depending on who is traveling. We travel during the month of Ramadan. 2 advantages: first, you get to see in deep how they live this month and the importance of the religion in their culture; also, I understand is a less "touristy' time, so there is less congestion. The only downfall is that most of the good restaurants in the big cities are not open for lunch, and at night if you are an early bird (like we are), you have to wait after 8 pm to get served in many places. The only thing that I would do different, is maybe go a little more upscale in the hotels. In general they are decent and clean, good service and food, but having been there, I now think with a little more money is worth the upgrade. If you travel during the summer sunblock, sunglasses and a good hat is a must! We reached temperatures over 45 Celsius in the desert. Overall we had a great experience, and left Morocco feeling is a Country rich in culture and history, with very kind people that understand the important role that tourism plays in their economy. Both Rashid and Hassan were very attentive, punctual, organized. Always making sure we were having a great time! They are fun to travel with and very knowledgeable of their culture and Country.

Best kept secrets of Morocco- insights, the best guide and much more. But also many highlights and great experiences so hard to decide what we may have amended. Definitely the night in the Berber camp at Merzourga was a highlight, amidst the spectacular red dunes of the Sahara, stunning clear sky and lots of fun for the kids. But the other places each had something to offer the tourist. My most nervous part of booking the tour was sending the deposit! Always a bit worrying sending money to an organization you don’t know, and we elected to use a bank transfer over Western Union (the latter which is easier for Soul Adventure I think). We paid a 10% deposit and the balance on arrival, and I am pleased to report my caution was not required as everyone and everything was as arranged prior. I can also report Said is also utterly and completely honest – twice we amended or changed hotel arrangements and twice he ensured we received the refund of any difference quickly (aside from loaning me cash when we ran out of ATMs one day!).So I would completely recommend Soul Adventures for your Morocco Tour and would happily respond to any queries or questions. The tour was easily arranged, priced very competitively and performed professionally throughout. As a family we loved it and had a wonderful trip with Said.Finally – we travelled completely during Ramadan which did have some impact but much smaller than we had expected. No trouble eating food and drinking in public at all, and most restaurants are open for tourists. We had one day in a more remote village where one place was closed, but Said found a second restaurant which was able to serve lunch. That was the only time over 2 weeks. Of course we also had to be a little flexible with Said, given he was fasting all day, allowing a later start time and a rest during the heat of the day. But there are far less tourists than usual and most Riads were not busy at all (choice of rooms). So overall there are no issues travelling during this time if you have to (for us it was dictated by school break).Go ahead and book with faith in these guys!

Said was a great and very patient host, very accommodating for our needs and wishes, as well as his drivers and the guides that he selected in every place, all very competent and knowledgeable.I recommend this company to everybody willing to visit Morocco, any time of the year.

Loved every minute of it! Thanks to Soul Adventure. We had one of the most memorable trips in Morocco and I attribute this in large part to soul adventures. Said was a great host who clearly loves his country and his work. Thus, touring with him becomes a pleasure where there are new experiences at every turn. A first class adventure experience. Three of us chose to travel with Soul Adventure 4x4 primarily because of the excellent reviews they get. We loved Morocco. I do not think words can make these guys justice. The driver is what makes or breaks the trip, in my case the driver Youssef made it. It was my wife & I on our honeymoon, we went to Spain then by ship to Morocco, the driver picked us up on time from the port, drove us to all the places we asked him for, we even needed to try things outside of our agreed upon trip (a Moroccan bath which I recommend anyone to ask for that in their trip) and he spent the extra time & effort to find us one of the quality hammams (tourists baths as they call them), we were even a bit picky on the food, and the driver accommodated all of our requests and took us to the right places (restaurants) to try the types of food we were craving. The hotels were so unique and awesome. He even helped us with bargaining with the locals at the market for the shopping we did. The other tour guides (because in the old parts of the cities we visited (Fes & Meknes), the company hired a dedicated tour guide and they were very friendly and knowledgable. Also the driver has the advantage of speaking the 2 main languages spoken in Morocco which is Arabic & Amazighi and his English was really good. I highly recommend this Soul Adventures and their private tours. And just to be fair the owner/manager of the company used to call the driver a few times a day to follow up on us and spoke with me a couple of times to check on us and make sure everything is ok and all is according to the plan.Now as for Morocco, it is a beautiful country, we only had 5 days to spend in Morocco but I wish we had more time to see more, the hotels we stayed at the majority of times were called (Riyad) and the manegers/owners of these Riyads were very friendly people, I remember there was a wedding in Meknes after midnight and I really wanted to see it, so the owner of that Riyad opened the door for me and let me record the wedding and watch the locals dancing in colourful clothing, was beautiful. I even wanted to try McDonald's while we were there and they sent their driver to get us a meal (we paid extra obviously but they were very accommodating).Just a general tip if you are going to Morocco:1. If you agree on paying by euros, make sure you bring euros with you. Same if you agree on US dollars then bring US dollars with you. I am from Canada and I did not bring Euros with me (which was a mistake) because the local exchange rates are different from the international rates. And on that note, Morocco is a very safe country, the people are not wealthy yet very friendly. And the driver is super trustworthy, he helped me many times in finding local currency exchanges to pay for things, I even made a mistake and paid him extra one time, and he corrected me and paid me back and that was very honest and kind of you, he really deserved every euro of tip I gave him.2. Cellular internet is not the best in Morocco (I mean the data on mobile phones) but at all the hotels they was wifi connections and it worked so that was good.That's it really, again, thank you Said from Soul Adventures and I look forward to coming to Morocco again for another trip (hopefully soon).

WOW!!! The best tour we could have asked for.. We could not have asked for more out of this tour. June-July 2013 Morocco Trip. My wife and I had such an amazing trip for our honey moon, thanks to the Soul Adventure tour guides. A guide with genuine care. Our guide Mohammed is very professional, not only providing travelling services, but also taking care of our needs. Lovely and unforgettable tour. We are so lucky to have chosen Soul Adventure 4x4! Wonderful, Personalized Service. We were extremely pleased with our experience with Soul Adventures 4x4 in Morocco and would recommend them without hesitation to all types of travelers. The most amazing trip ever with Soul Adventure. Perfect trip across a beautiful country. Excellent. We travelled from Fes to Marrakech doing a private tour from Soul 4x4. You can't go wrong with these guys. They are 100% reliable, and were extremely accomodating. Our guide Said was very knowledgeable. All in all great.

Seven stars! See Berber Morocco!. This small, family-run tour company is the best! From the beginning they were extremely responsive and helpful, starting with the planning of the trip and continuing all the way to the end. With e-mails flying back and forth, Said took our rather vague preferences (we want to stay in riads and auberges and do a lot of walking… Oh, and also, not too many day in cities…and we are interested in local food) and constructed a wonderful personalized 10 day tour of (mostly) Berber Morocco that was perfect for us. Their choices of "riads and auberges" for us to stay in were outstanding, truly Moroccan places of various kinds that pleased us immensely. Many were so out-of-the-way that we would never have found them on our own. They ranged from rather simple kasbahs to former palaces (one was even in a beautiful building parts of which dated to 1378!) but all were very clean and comfortable and every single one had friendly and welcoming management. Most were locally owned and operated, which I appreciate, both because I like to meet local people and because I prefer to spend my tourist dollars where they will benefit the local economy. Mohamed was a truly excellent driver--the best I've had in this kind of tour. I always felt completely safe whether we were moving at high speed on the highway, threading our way through chaotic city streets, or bumping down a rocky 4-wheel drive track leading to a nomad family camp. Said was with us too, and together the two of them took perfect care of us. They were friendly and good company, and showed us many facets of Morocco we would not have found on our own. They arranged local food (wonderful) for us and sought out local markets to show us. I was especially grateful for Said's help with bargaining; I always felt he was on our side in all transactions. Finally, the local guides they found and recommended for the cities and historical sites were always excellent. Overall, I can't think of a thing I would complain about.  I highly recommend SoulAdventure4x4 for your trip to Morocco -- Their prices were far lower than comparable tours arranged by USA or European travel companies and you will get a much better, more personalized experience.

Great tour! Worth every penny!. Lahcen was our guide and he was delightful (even during Ramadan). He speaks more languages than I can count and knows everything there is about Morocco. The tour, while a little more expensive than I had initially planned, was well worth the money as I always felt absolutely secure both with Lahcen as an individual, and in the car (which was comfortable and rugged).Just as a small example of the kind of care Lahcen takes with his tourists, he brought us to his home and introduced us to his brother and children. It was such a warm gesture and it speaks to the kind of people they are.As far as tours are concerned, this was excellent. We went everywhere we wanted and stayed only as long as we wanted. Lahcen and Said come from a berber family so they know the land better than anyone else, and it showed at all times.I would strongly recommend this tour to anyone considering a trip to Morocco!

MANY MANY THANKS AND INSHALLAH SEE YOU NEXT YEAR.. I have just travelled yet again with six friends (f) in two 4 x 4 in Morocco, yet again with Mohamed and Brahim as our guides/chauffeurs. Another exceptional journey thanks to their knowledge of the region, their easy contact with all the locals (Berbers like themselves), their constant good humour – and sense of humour – and superb organisation. It was life made easy without ever losing the feeling of adventure. However, of course they can’t do the impossible and it was on occasion very cold in the little local auberges (whch one would never find on one’s own) and on occasion there was no hot water .... but if you choose to travel into the interior, on little routes not even marked on the map, to areas of extraordinary beauty which the majority of travellers will never see, you accept in advance that there will be moments of questionable comfort. If you don’t have a spirit of adventure and a very open mind you will not have embarked on this sort of journey. The scenery is breathtaking, ever-changing, fabulous .... I run out of adjectives! We each took over 500 photos. Mohamed speaks excellent Spanish and his English gets ever better, especially after being with us for ten days! They both know some words of Dutch and German as well as Swedish now. Brahim speaks very good French, and of course both speak Arabic and Berber.I find them both very attentive and caring, whether you are the youngest in the group (-40) or the oldest (myself – 80). I cannot recommend them highly enough, and by writing this for Trip Advisor I want yet agaIn to say MANY MANY THANKS AND INSHALLAH SEE YOU NEXT YEAR.

A great trip overall. We really enjoyed our four day trip (Marrakesch-desert-Fes) with Soul Adventures. We were travelling with our two children aged six and eight and our guide Said could not have been more hospitable and accommodating. Most importantly from our perspective was how safe we felt. Our driver was extremely skilled, which matters a lot when driving through the hairpin turns of the High Atlas, and we always felt like Said was looking out for our best interests. Perhaps the best illustration of this was after we had eaten an overpriced lunch at a restaurant that did not deliver what it had promised, Said went in and negotiated a refund on our behalf. We didnt ask him to do this, but he noticed my husband's annoyance with the restaurant and just quietly solved the problem for us. This is just one example of the very high level of customer service we continually received. The hotels, restaurants and camel trek that Soul Adventures arranged for us were great, and we really felt like we got great value for our money with this trip. We highly recommend Soul Adventures.

The only way to see Morocco.... We have just finished the most fantastic vacation-thanks to Soul Adventures 4x4. I can honestly say that this is the only way to visit Morocco. We started in Fes and ended in Marrakesh, through Merzouga and the Gorges. Soul Adventuress 4x4 filled the itinerary with many delightful and unexpected authentic experiences along the way that there is no way we would have done with a group tour or if we were traveling on our own. Our guide (Mohammed) took us deep into the remote villages and valleys in the heart of Morrocco, shared with us his passion and knowledge of the people and their traditions. Because of his extremely personable personality, we were able to see first-hand how many of the nomads and other native Moroccans live. Where other guides and their clients would just walk or drive by a nomad camp, Mohammed would manage to get us invited in for tea. He was great with the kids and quickly felt like part of the family. He was very attentive to ensuring we were satisfied with the hotels and restaurants and went above and beyond in providing us a relaxing and adventure-filled vacation. Whenever the drive got a little long, Mohammed would pull over, crank up the tunes and get us all dancing and laughing. The planning process was simple and very prompt and Soul Adventures 4x4 delivered far more than they promised and at great value. I recommend Soul Adventures 4x4 without hesitation to anyone looking for to really experience Morocco-I just wish that everyone we know could enjoy this same experience.

Incredible. This review is so long overdue but I just have to give praise to Mohammed, our guide, for making our stay in Morocco absolutely amazing and unforgettable. Unbelievable Morocco experience. The trip to Morrocco has been one of most unforgettable trips i have made in my life. Fantastic tour guides. My boyfriend and I just got back from a week in Morocco, and just to hit the punchline up front - we could not possibly imagine having enjoyed our trip without Lahcen, Said, and Mohammed, who together run Soul Adventure 4x4. Look no further for a guide – it’s easy to be skeptical of these Tripadvisor posts but trust us when we say that these guys made our trip; they were easy to communicate with in advance, planned a fantastic trip, but most of all, were incredibly genuine, good people, and we left feeling as if we’d made good friends in Morocco.We’d done an exhaustive amount of research before leaving New York for our trip, both on TripAdvisor and elsewhere, for the right guide, since we had a pretty specific idea of what we were looking for. A touch of the real Morocco. We arranged for a private tour from Marrakech through the Atlas Mountains, Ouarzazate, Tenehir and Merzouga with Soul Adventure 4X4. For those who want to see Morocco beyond the what t typical tourist company can arrange, I highly recommend this company.

Memorable, exotic vacation!. My husband , 3 kids and I chose Morocco for a family vacation this year. I was not very involved in the planning of the trip, as my husband did all of the research and found Soul Adventure 4x4 through Trip Advisor. Said and Lahcens friendly faces greeted us at the airport and our adventure began. We toured many cities and covered very diverse terrain including the magnificent atlas mountains. exquisite trip with Said who took us to blend it with the locals. My husband and I recently visited Morocco and experienced the best vacation ever! i want to share my favorite part of our trip with anyone who is looking forward at visiting Morocco. my favorite destination was the desert of Merzouga, so here is what we experienced :After a peaceful night of sleep we departed with Said in his 4x4 to visit the local villages. In the village of Khamlia we watched the traditional dances and music of Gnawa. We visited bazaars and bought ourselves turbans to prepare for our afternoon camel trek into the dunes. For lunch Said took us to his family’s home where we enjoyed a delicious homemade traditional dish of Kalia and tea made by his grandmother. After two hours of camel trekking into the highest dunes in the world we arrived at the oasis which is located bellow one of the highest dunes of the desert. We enjoyed a cup of tea while meeting other tourists from around the world. Dinner is prepared by the camel men that led us to the oasis. After dinner we enjoyed the dances and the music of the drums played the same men who cooked our meal. These camel men are truly amazing, they speak many languages, trek us through the dunes, cook our meals, entertain us with dancing and music, tell jokes and fix your turban! Very hospitable. Before we retired in our Berber tent for the evening we walked through dunes, enjoyed the stars and listened to the camels chewing. We awoke early the next morning to enjoy the sunrise over the dunes. It is amazing how the sand dunes changes color from beige to a yellow orange color during this time. After this we camel trekked back to the Kasbah for showers and breakfast. It was now time to say goodbye to Merzouga. If you ever plan on visiting Morocco, Merzouga is a must see. Our tour guide, Said, was one of the best guides I have ever had the privilege of dealing with, he was knowledgeable about all the destinations we visited, humorous and very gracious. Soul Adventure 4x4 made this trip absolutely enjoyable by making it completely carefree. My husband and I will definitely return to this beautiful country to experience more of what it has to offer and we will definitely use the same excursion company.

“Highly recommended....”. I communicated with Lahcen before flying out of Canada to Morocco and we finally touched bases in Marrakech... Mohammed, our guide/driver picked us up and we were very lucky to have a very good car only to ourselves... it was really a private tour...I don't want to bore anyone with the details... if you want you can email me and I'll tell you all about it...just in a nutshell... Mohammed was awesome! He showed us everything there is to be seen... even adjusted the itinerary (even though it meant more intensive driving for him) to make ensure that we can catch our train back to Casa in time... amazing guy... he's given us so many good memories to reflect on... the camel ride, the night in the desert, Todra gorges, and the beautiful beautiful Atlas mountain...funny story: he came a couple of days before the tour to collect a deposit... and being the North American-raised that we are, we were hesitant to give cash away to a stranger... and so we had this long long conversation... and how quickly within 2 days he turned out to be one of the man we will always remember Morocco by!overall we highly recommend "souladventure" if you are going down there...

Airport Transfer. Hi, I can only comment on airport transfer as my trip was too short this time to book tours but I would highly recommend Easy Take, Prompt, pleasant and very knowledgeable. Excellent service. After being let down by our hotel, Savoy Le Grand, I found this company via trip advisor.We were travelling with a 6 month old with luggage. I emailed the company and was met with quick response and very reasonably priced. Jabran was our driver from airport to hotel and then picked us up to go elsewhere during our trip. Hertz failed to provide to us with the correct baby car seat. Jabran went over and beyond his job and helped to sort this out promptly... To top it off he made sure we took the right path to agadir. We followed him out of marrakesh until we saw sign of the motorway to agadir.Jabran service was excellent and was very helpful. I cannot fault him or the company he works for.Amazing!!

Easy to Book Easy Take 10 out of 10. Jamal Boukoune the manager made our initial airport transfer easy to book over the internet so we also booked a full day excursion to the Atlas Mountains. Our driver Jabran was waiting for us when we arrived in the hotel reception he was polite, funny and also knowledgable regarding not only the area we where traveling to but all other aspects of living in Morocco. We also used Easy Take for a further half day excursion and on our return to the airport Jamal took the time and trouble to call to make sure we had enjoyed our stay and that the excursions where what we wanted.If we could give six stars we would, we would certainly recommend this company to all going to Marrakech or to those travellers needing transfers from Marrakech to another town or city.

Plesant day out.. Beautiful falls but lots of steps down to see it. I have limited mobility and it was a real struggle for me. however it was worth it. lots of wild monkies you can feed,. they are happy to take your food and sit on your shoulders but they dont like you to touch them lol.

Very enjoyable day trip to Ourika Valley. We were lucky enough to hire Easy Take through our riad, Riad Alamir (also highly recommend) for a day trip to the Atlas mountains for our family of four including two boys 9 and 7. The driver, Shabran, was very friendly and informative. His English was perfect and he described the points of interest all the way from Medina to the Atlas mountains. He helped find a great guide at Ourika valley falls and stopped whenever we wanted to take photos or look at a Berber house. He even helped get a good deal on a roadside camel ride which the boys begged to do regardless of how touristy it was. The SUV / minivan was air conditioned and very comfortable. The boys were able to choose the music Shabran played and they learned a bit about Moroccan reggae. What was planned to be a simple taxi ride turned into a memorable part of an already fascinating adventure.

Great transport company. I have been using Easytake for 1 year or so each time I have visited Marrakech The drivers are very reliable, have clean cars and always on timeI would highly recommend this company
Very good driver. We used Easy Take to get from Marrakech to Casablanca airport on the day of our flight back home. Driver was very good and we arrived to the airport on time.

Transfer and tour. Samir was a total pleasure, he did our hotel transfers and took us up to the Atlas Mountains on tour. I would definitely recommend this company. Their speedy replies to emails, their punctuality and excellent friendly approach gives a pleasurable and personal service.

Easy Transport!. Emailed Jamal with our booking and he replied quickly to all of our questions. We were met at the airport by Hamza, even though the flight was delayed, Hamza was excellent. He was knowledgable and told us some of the history of the Medina as we drove to La Palmeraie. Good driving skills and very punctual. The SUV was modern, clean and comfortable and had a babyseat for our 18 month old.Jamal was in touch with our driver Hamza making sure everything was ok. Great service. I would highly recommend to anyone arriving in Marrakech as just such an easy way to avoid the hassle of airport taxis. The same driver dropped us back to the airport which was a nice touch to see a familiar face. It's all in the name. Easy!

Perfect Transport. We had the pleasure of having our driver take us from Marrakech to Essacouira and then take us back some days later. The driver was brilliant in presentation, knowledge, driving skills and so very punctual. The SUV was modern, clean and so comfortable.The owner kept in regular cell phone contact with our driver ensuring that all was well and that we were happy. Just the best service.

Reliable, hassle free. We were not sure we would be able to fly due to a medical issue. When we were cleared to travel, we contacted Easy Take and requested airport pickup service in Marrakech with a very short notice. I am Moroccan and I am extremely sensitive to the amount of unprofessionalism plaguing the tourism industry in my country. In this particular instance, we received a prompt response and sure enough, Mr. Jamal was waiting for us and provided a great service coupled with a pleasant conversation.They showed up, assisted with luggage, quoted a reasonable price and delivered.

Fantastic service from start to finish. I found out their details on trip advisor and emailed Jamal , he reply the same day and I booked a taxi from the airport to our hotel. When we arrived we were greeted by Samir , who helped us with luggage. On the way to the hotel he was very friendly and telling us about various sites to visit around marocco . I have been to marakech 3 times so we talked a lot about that. There were 4 of us traveling and he turned up with a very spacious 7 seater. Also worth a mention that you can pay in drams, euros or sterling. A few days later we had problems and had to change hotels, I phoned jamal and he sent a driver straight away to help us all move and ferry us backwards and forwards. After that we used easy take several times to go on days trips, we went on a trip to ouzard valley waterfalls and then to beach resort essaouira , both were great value for money. With English speaking drivers, Samir was especially great telling us loads of info on the way. Finally hakim returned us to the airport . Great service for the whole 2 weeks. I will use again next time I go.

Very Very Good. Perfect in fact!. I cannot complain about one single part of the process with Easy Take, The communications through email were excellent and even though I gave Jamal the incorrect flight time, he was still there waiting when we got there.He was bang on time on the return leg too, he was smiley, chatty, showed us some of the sights as we drove past.Was cheap enough too.Cannot recommend enough!

Excellent service with a smile . Found the details on trip advisor and contacted them while in Marrakech after the Riad was quoting me extortionate prices for my excursions. Jamal the owner was very helpful with advice and organising my excursions. Sameer the driver was extremely helpful and punctual. He also offered advice and gave us lots of interesting information about the places we were visiting. We had three excursions with easy take transport Casablanca, Esouaria and Ozoud waterfalls and Sameer made sure that we were always comfortable. Jamal also organised our quad biking excursion as again I was being quoted extortionate prices by the Riad and other online companies, very reasonable prices and again they picked us up from the Riad and dropped us back. Jamal offered us free airport transfers for our return journey when our Riad quoted us 150 mdh. Overall I can't recommend these guys enough and would use them again without question.

Outstanding service. I booked three different tours with this company. From marakech to Essaouira and from Agadir to Marrakesh. And from the hotel to the airport. Contact is fast and in English via email. They make agreements based on the needs of the client. They are flexible when you changed travel plans. On all three trips they had plenty of time.Transport is offered in fairly new cars with plenty of space and air conditioning.The most important thing I found that the driving style of the driver is good and safe. The drivers abide by this company to the traffic rules . For traveling with kids this is very nice.

Visit to Be Life Aqua Park. I was lucky to have come across Easy take transport while in Marrakesh. Jamal the manager has been one of the most friendliest, straight forward and honest person and is a treasure for the company.I booked through the website and received an email and a call within a minute of the booking. The company is multi lingual--Arabic, English and French (may have more). Their collection timing is on the spot and go beyond your expectation to ensure you have a great service.We booked a two way journey for a family of 8 to an aqua park. The journey was full of insight into Marrakesh and Morroca life and culture. A complimentary child seat was provided with very clean air conditioned transport. One point I have to make on my review is the poor review given to the company and having read it. I do not feel it is justifiable in any way but also it is important for readers to look at the overall reviews made.Wonderful in a sense

Excellent Service .... We used Easy Take Transport services to pick us from Casablanca airport to our destination in Marrakech. We were assigned Samir as a driver who was on time and he never complained though he spent more than an hour waiting for us because our luggage was delayed. I would use Easy Take Transport again and I would recommend their services to anyone seeking professional transport from/to Marrakech.

Very reliable. We were given this number by a friend so decided to try them as the hotel we were staying in were charging way too much for the airport transfer. We booked them online and they replied within minutes. Very easy to communicate with and very reliable. All the cars and jeeps are really nice and comfortable. We were let down by someone else when we needed to be collected from the bus station and we contacted easy take transport and they were there waiting. I would recommend them fully and so affordable.

Perfect ride with great people. Their company is very easy to communicate, i did all my organization with couple emails, not even had to call them, as soon as i got off from airport, our driver welcomed us with my name on it. Our ride was a suv with ac on. Overall it was great. The price was also reasonable. They also left and pick us from lobby as well. You feel safe and comfortable to have these people.Milli

Timely, friendly AND very easy to take. Our driver was exceptional, and told us about the city. We had a great conversation about Marrakech on the drive in from the airport. Nice way to be introduced to the city. The car was air-conditioned and very spacious. Definitely sign on to this service

Amazing service, i would highly recommend them. Excellent, friendly and reliable service. Easy to book online and always got a quick response from Jamal. On arrival Jamal was waiting for us with a sign with our surname on so he was very easy to find and immediately offered to help with our luggage. The mini bus was clean, tidy and modern with air con. On route to the hotel Jamal was very friendly and chatty, he gave us lots of interesting facts about marrakech and suggested several places of interest that we may like to visit during our stay. Top class service and after several price comparisons online he was also the cheapest. Will definitely be using him again when we go back next year.

Very reliable excellent service. Seen as this was our second trip to Marrakech, this time we opted for a rural holiday in a villa on the outskirts of Marrakech, as opposed to the city like last time. We therefore, needed a transfer from the airport to the villa, about 40 minutes away.We contacted several companies before and Easy Take was the cheapest and above all with excellent reviews here, so we booked. Jamal was excellent with any questions and info regarding an enfant car seat for our son, everything fine.Humza was waiting at the airport for us and helped escort us and our luggage to the car, nice, clean, air-conditioned. He spoke excellent English and French and was very kind and chatty. I have already recommended them to my aunt for her holiday In August (and again, after price comparisons, they also work out cheaper for day tours too, looks like we've found a gem ;-) ) and I will certainly contact them again in the future. Thank you Jamal and Humza for making our transfer go smoothly and your more than honest prices.

Amazing service and very reliable. We used Easy Take Transport 4 days in a row while in Marrakech for airport/hotel pickups and some tours. Hamza was our driver and he was excellent. We can't say enough about how nice he was and knowledgeable about the area. He was always waiting on us, accommodated any special requests we had and provided several suggestions on places to eat and visit. Definitely made our trip an enjoyable experience

Reliable Efficient Service. Excellent service. Very easy to book and quick response from Jamal. The car that came to pick us up was clean and on time. The driver was very friendly and took us to where we wanted to go. Far less hassle then taxis. Would definitely use this service again on my next trip to Marrakech!

Trust worthy and reliable. After being let down by another company to pick us up from the airport, I looked on Trip Advisor and chose to use Easy Take Transport because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed at all and in fact whilst on holiday I recommended the company to other guests staying at the hotel who were going to try their luck and haggle with local taxes but instead they got a good deal used Easy Take Transport. When we arrived at the airport Jamal was waiting with the card with our name so he was easy to find. He took us straight to the mini bus where we had arranged two baby seats which we had requested. I rushed back out to see if I could find Jamal and luckily Jamal had noticed the bag left in the car and returned back to where he dropped us. He was very prompt with answering to emails even late in the evening and I would highly recommend using his service.

Excellent Service. Having been let down by another transfer company based in the UK, last minute, I turned to Trip Advisor and Easy Take transport services seemed like the best choice. I was quite apprehensive as they were based in Morocco but email conversations soon put me at ease. Samir was our driver on both our journey to and fro the airport. Best Transport Service in Marrakech. The drivers were very friendly and it was very easy to communicate with them both in and outside of the country. Fantastic service with good drivers and excellent customer service, would recommend to everyone and will definitely use again next year!!!

Best transfers in Marrakech!!. From first point of contact with Easy Take Transport, communication with Jamal was efficient and accomodating. We also booked a day trip to Essaouria and Hamza went above and beyond for us! Thank you! Definitely would use this upon return to Marrakech and highly recommend for other travellers. A++++.

Amazing Service!. I travelled to Marrakech on my own to meet friends and wanted to arrange transportation from the airport to my hotel in advance. I emailed my request and received a response very quickly from Jamal, the owner. I had a few date & time changes on my departure & all were handled efficiently. Jamal met me at the airport and was easy to find. On the trip from the airport to my hotel Jamal advised that he could arrange quad biking & a private city tour for my friends and I. His rates are very competitive & he is an amazing tour guide! I recommend Easy Take Transport to anyone travelling to Marrakech. Thank you Jamal...you are the best!

Great company. Highly recommend, picked us up promptly from airport in comfortable spacious vehicle, dropped us off with a guide who showed us to our riad for no fee and the same on return trip to airport. I had issues booking with other companies but really helpful communication with this one.

Great airport service . We were picked up late at night (after 10pm) and taken to our hotel by a friendly driver. The same can be said for the trip back - a great efficient service and very reasonably priced. Definitely recommend!

Excellent transport service. We are a couple from Iceland and spent two weeks in Morocco. We landed in Marrakech and Easy take transport picked us up at the airport to take us to our first destination Taghazout, around three hours driving time. Some days later the same driver took us back to Marrakech and he also took us on a day trip to the Ourika Valley. We got excellent service, our driver was always on time, he was cautious, and was a good guide that was inspiring to talk to. He spoke both english and french. The prices we paid were reasonable. We can highly recommend Easy Take Transport if you need transport in Morocco.

The Only Way To Travel In Marrakech!!!!!. I was referred to Easy Take Transport through a business associate. He connected me with Jamal who owns this company. His name was Samir and I highly recommend you request him. He was with me from 9am -2am. Always made sure I was taken care of everywhere we went. He knew all the great spots to see and the ones that were too touristy and not worth it. I never felt unsafe or concerned about anything while traveling with East Take. The owner emailed or called through out my trip to make sure i was ok and if I needed anything. They really know wheat they are doing and I wouldn't travel any other way in Morocco.  I look forward to returning and using the service again. Thank you Samir, Hakim and Jamal. You guys rock!!! Spencer

The best transport company in marakech !!!. Being recommended by a close friend I knew I couldn't go too far wrong . Excellent Service. We used Easy Take for airport pick up and drop off on our recent trip to Marrakech. They were on time both ways and held up a sign with our names on in on arrival. E-mail communications with Jamal were excellent and our driver, Hamza, was a very nice young man, who spoke excellent English. We will certainly use Easy Take again on our next trip.

Accomodating and friendly. Polite and friendly, very flexible with timings. We were very disorganised and only remembered to book airport transfers the night before we left the UK! However 2 hours later they responded to my email and sure enough were there the next morning holding a sign with our names. On the way to the Riad he told us a bit about the city and had even got in touch with the Riad to arrange for them to have someone to come out and collect our luggage. We booked them again to go back to the airport as we felt they were so reliable.

Fantastic service. Highly recommended. We used Easy Take for airport transfers and excursion to Atlas Mountains. It was great that they responded quickly to emails. Service was great. Always arrived on time with good vehicles. Drivers were friendly. Also great value and gave peace of mind. Would definitely use again in the future.

Best in Marrakech. We used Jamal's transport company as a group of girls on a short city trip. The were very reliable, flexible, on time and simply fantastic. Congratulations to Jamal and his team and thanks Hamza for the tips on Argan oil. I will definitely use Easy Take transport every time I go to Marrakech.

Perfect service!. For four ladies traveling, I had concerns about coming into Marrakech at night and finding our way to our Riad, so I chose Easy Take based on the reviews. They were very responsive via email and were waiting for us with a sign as we came out of customs. The driver was courteous and friendly and the van was spacious, clean and looked new. Riads are all in the medina and so you can't take a vehicle in later in the day. The driver had arranged for a man with a cart to take our luggage to the Riad. That was quite an experience as the area was full of people, donkey carts and motorcycles. The man with the cart got us right to the door through the crowds, twists and turns safe and sound (tip him well). For our return to the airport, I emailed Easy Take the day before and made arrangements for an early morning pick up. In this case because there are very few people on the narrow streets, they can come right to the Riad. They arrived on time and were responsive to some last minute changes. I highly recommend Easy Take.

An absolutely amazing service!!!. One word: Outstanding!! We used Jamal transport company and his amazingly nice and very professional drivers to coordinate our stay in Marrakesh (trips around Marrakesh including restaurants and night clubs) and we were amazed by their service. Always on time. Hamza was our favorite but Every single driver was nice. Polite. Considerate. Very helpful and informative. Cars were very clean. I highly recommend Jamal transport company. Best in Marrakech.

Outstanding Service!! Best in Marrakesh. We visited Marrakesh for 5 days 4 nights as a group of 9 friends coming from 7 different countries and wanting to do different things at some point. We have used Jamal and his very professional team of drivers to coordinate all the trips ( including restaurants and clubs ride in the middle of the night) and they have been awesome. Faultless service from day one till we departed. Definitely to be recommended.

Seamless Round Trip Airport Transfer to Marrakech Riad. Driver met us outside arrivals with a placard and spoke English. Car was a very nice SUV - clean, safe, air conditioned. The driver was excellent (felt very safe even in the crazy streets close to the old city) and called our Riad and arranged to have someone meet us to carry our luggage (cars cannot drive deep into the old city). Return pick-up was punctual and they arranged for a porter to take our bags from the hotel to the car pick-up point. They were also flexible for a last-minute pick-up time change when we needed to depart earlier than originally expected. Fair price.

Perfect service. We used Easy Take to take us to our hotel from the airport, we were so happy with their service we booked them again to drop us off back to the airport. Both our drivers were extremely nice and considerate. The car was comfy and clean. I would definitely recommend them!

Safe, good price, comfortable. It was a good experience booking the transport before arriving to Marrakech. In this way, we were able to get a comfortable transport that was waiting for us at the airport instead of having to deal (almost fight) with taxi drivers. The price was sent to us via email before arriving, and it was cheaper than other transport companies (12€ from Menara airport to a Riad in the Medina). The drivers are very friendly and the cars are in good conditions.
Perfect Service. Ordered Airport / Hotel return transfers via email. Worked perfectly with both transfers on time. Would certainly recommend.

Personal and Efficient Service. We used Easy Take for transfers to and from the airport and for a day trip to Essaouria.Both Jamal and Samir were prompt, polite, friendly and informative drivers. I would happily recommend to anyone looking to arrange tours or transfers in Marrakech or the surrounding area.A great service, thank you.

Good transportation!. Excellent transport for airport to city and also very cheap, hassle free as someone is holding a board with your name on it so there is no waiting about. However when i booked through the agency i was told that the taxi driver will be English speaking but he was not however it was not a problem as he took us to the right place.

Driver always there on time,. always felt safe and vehicle excellent. Used easy take after good reviews here. We were impressed by the quick response from Jamal, the very good prices quoted. We were taken from the airport, to and from golf courses and on a trip to the Ourika Valley and the cascades. We always felt confident and comfortable in the car and Hamza was always charming and helpful. The car is very clean

Excellent tour service from Mr Samir. We spent ten days touring Morrocco with Mr Samir. I would definitely recommend, if you would like a private tour. We knew we were in safe and reliable hands.We had no complaints against him and our trip was absolutely smooth.Being with them made us feel absolutely at home and by the end of a week when it was time to go back, it felt that we were parting with friends.

Airport transfer and Day trip. We used Easy Take for a day trip to Atlas mountains and also for a airport transfer. On both occasions , the drivers (Hamza / Samir) were very punctual and the cars were clean and comfortable.

Mr T khan. Company is very good, the driver Abdul hakeem was very helpful, he explained everything, always on time, very patient and kind. We used them throughout all our tripFrom airport to airport and all sites! Very much recommended

100% RELIABLE. Airport transfer - excellent. We travelled to Marrakesh for Christmas 2015. On the last minute I tried to book transfer from the airport to the hotel. He had already contacted our hotel and arranged for us to be picked up at particular place by somebody from hotel staff as the hotel was in pedestrian area. We immediately booked return transfer for our last day in Marrakesh and everything was just perfect that day also. Highly recommend. And thank you once again, Jamal! For your excellent service and your trust!

Taxi and day trip. We were in Marrakech for a few days and had no prior knowledge of Marrakech or Morocco, so upon recommendations we booked easy take to pick us up from the airport. We had a wonderful day, full of interesting sights, sounds and smells and got an insight in to the culture and history of the area and would thoroughly recommend him :-)

Mr Janzib . Excellent taxi service, 100%recommend. Brilliant drivers, speak English. I used them to pick me up and drop me off at airport, for a day trip to casablanca and to visit sites in marrakech and I can only say good things about them..awesome

Great Service!. I booked an Airport for my Parents who where Traveling to Marrakech over Christmas from the Airport to their Hotel via email and spoke with a lovely guy called Jamal. The driver was waiting for them on their arrival, they said the driver was very courteous and friendly and the car was spotless and very comfortable they where really delighted with the service, so much so that they arranged there and then for the car back to the airport a week later with the driver and again that all went seamlessly! great company and service - thank you for making my Parents trip a little easier.

comfortable transportation. We booked transportation for 9 people towards the parapente site, half an hour outside of Marrakech. Driver + comfortable mini-bus. Very safe. Only the driver didn't speak much French, so communication wasn't easy.

100% reliable. We used Easy Take for our transfer from Casablanca airport to our hotel in Marrakesh and later for a transfer to Imlil in the high atlas and from Imlil back to Casablanca airport.Communication with Jamal was via email, he was very responsive and flexible in meeting our requirements at very short notice. Great service. Easy. It was very easy with easy take transport. The booking was easy, well communicated. By arrival at the airport, the driver was waiting as promised with a sign. Excellent service, First Class. Just the best. Samir our driver was superb, always on time and very helpful to all 6 of our family. Excellent service!. While being in Marrakech we have booked two trips (to Atlas mountains and to Essaouira) and transportation to airport with Easy take transport. Great guide and high sevices. Having read all the reviews, my wife and I booked Idir from London for a day’s city tour in Marrakesh. Professional service. Very good service for a day trip. We went to Essouira and it was perfect not to worry about roads, traffic, oil etc...! Excellent airport transfer service. Excellent service airport tansfer, Jamal was punctual and drove well. Good vehicles too. They were half the price of the quote my hotel gave me.

As the name suggests...easy!. My friend and I got a lift to the Ouzoud Waterfalls with Easy Take. The experience - from booking to drop off - was very easy and hassle free. Price was competitive. Would recommend.

Excellent Service!. Very professional, punctual and polite drivers. We used their service two times in our stay at Marrakech. One transfer for Essaouira and the other to the airport. Definitely recommend it!
Professional. Amazing service. The driver was always on time, patient, and drove very safely. Whether for couples or families with little children, I highly recommend it.

Wonderful Service. This transport service was wonderfully pleasant. Best Service. excursions. these people are professional ,prompt , courteous and just the nicest people .Their cars very clean , somewhat new , We booked them for 10 days and we can say that we had a great service .Their drivers very safe ,very helpful and very patient . we were a total of 21 people including children and infants , and they were very accommodating .
Good service. Our transport was spacious and on time, both our drivers where very pleasant and helpful...we even got a free city tour

Safe and Reliable = Peace of Mind. We used this company for several trips during our week stay in Marrakesh. There was 19 people in the group and the mini vans were excellent and the drivers were nice and professional.The price was also reasonable .Thank you for making our holiday even better.

Good service!. We had really great experience in Marrakech. We booked this tour for three days: camel ride, ouzoud waterfalls, ourika valley, atlas mountain and essaouira. The driver really nice and good in english. Our driver was Hasan. He also helped us to find a local guide. This is recommended tour in Marrakech. They also really responsive if want to ask anything via email. The only input i want to give is it would be good if you can put the local guide included in the price. Once again.. Thanks for the best experience you have given to us in Marrakech!

Brightest point of any service in Marrakech!. It is very simple: if You want to travel around Marrakech the only choice is Easy Take. Lightspeed communication with e-mail. Use them as airport shuttle, it will cost You half the price of taxi and no risk to be ripped. Comfortable, clean new vans instead of scammers in falling apart cabs. Only thing to remember is to make a request by e-mail day before. We were also on private trip with driver Hakim to Essaouira and Ourika. I really don't know if they make us some special price (maybe off season?) but we traveled on our own van for same price other companies ask for 4 places in 16-passenger buses. Hakim is very kind guy and if You need someone speaking also Italian he will be your choice. Thanks a lot Hakim!

Taxing about the city . Everybody's pet hate in this city .. Having to take taxis and being either ripped off or dropped in the wrong place unable to communicate with the driver ! Now we just call jamal (or email ) and an English speaking driver is available almost immediately in a lovely legal SUV and takes us direct to the door. I have also taken a car just for the day to visit the sites ..it takes all the pressure off of my visit..driver will wait outside and then drive you to next tourist site ..cuts out the hassle and fixed price for the day .. Actually cheaper than "tourist price " in the small taxis

Wonderful day trip to Essaouira. Our day with Easy Take was fantastic. Our guide Jamal spoke excellent English, pointed out interesting and unique sites along our drive, and customized the itinerary according to our specifications. He was timely and the vehicle was very nice, and their price is quite competitive and reasonable. Highly recommend.

Highlight of our holiday. We spent last week in Marrakesh, a trip organised, last minute, as a birthday treat by my husband. We researched things to do and see, and decided on a day trip. It was difficult to choose a tour company as so many reviews were excellent on trip adviser, but having contacted a few I was very pleased to receive an immediate reply from Easy Take Transport who offered a choice of day trips. Reading that a couple of the trips were quite a distance, over 3 hours driving in each direction we opted for a shorter visit to the Ourika Valley. Our driver/guide arrived at our hotel a little before the arranged time. The car was large, clean and comfortable and while our driver didn't speak brilliant english we enjoyed the challenge of using our little French and managed to communicate well. His enthusiasm and pride in his country of his country were infectious. Breakfast at a Berber house was the highlight of our holiday. Sharing freshly cooked bread with such wonderful, welcoming people was a joy.Our local guide, (Omar) up to the waterfall was knowledgeable about the area both historically and geographically. Clambering over the rocks up the mountain is not for the faint hearted but well worth the effort and Omar ensured our safety through out.Overall a brilliant day out. thank you to all

Amazing!. My friends and I had a 2-day tour with Mohammed and he was friendly and fun. Long drives but good driver and comfy car. The tour includes all the places we wanted to go. The facilities in zagora desert was better than we expected, decent tents and clean bathrooms. Great value and would definitely recommend! :)Visited Jan 2015

Just Ok. After reading all the positive reviews about this transport company and how knowledgable they were we thought we would book two trips.First was to Essaouria and second to Ourzazate & Ait Benhaddou. I won't go into detail about the two locations because that is not what I am reviewing.Our driver was very friendly but didn't speak hardly any english, we booked the trip because people had said how knowledgable the driver/guide was.Ourzazate trip was basically pointless because it took us three hours through winding mountain roads and we had no idea what we were going, some background information would have been nice. Maybe we should have more prior research before taking the trip but the way it was billed was as though it's a tour guide/driver to the location.As a driver this trip was 100% but as a tour this was a poor choice of company. I feel bad writing the review due to the fact he was such a nice guy but not speaking english hampered the trip.

Atlas Mpuntain/Ourika Valley and Essaouira trip. Jamal +212666237327 the owner of the agency gave us special attention. Since the agency is small u get personalised service. The prices are affordable n better than most other tour agencies.

good professional service. My friends and I had a great holiday in Marrakech in September 2014 . We had two lovely day trips with Jamal and we found he was very polite and spoke very good English and he was the perfect driver and guide .We went to the atlas mountains and the west coast stopping at places of interest.  thanks Jamal for everything  chocolate-chocolate-chocolate.

Excellent safe service for women. We were 4 women travelling alone and felt very safe and comfortable with Jamal. He was happy to change plans even at short notice. We went to the Atlas Mountains and he took us to any stops we asked. We asked about argan oil and he took us to a shop where they made argan oil but there was no pressure to buy. At the top of the mountain Jamal found us a safe guide. As we finished early from the mountains he took us around the city to the palmerie where we went on a camel ride. He also bought us the cactus fruit that we had never seen before. We asked for him to take us to the hotel, he did so at a good price and was on time. Absolutely recommend choosing easy take if you're in marrakech. Great trustworthy family business. Thank you!

Send them an email; they'll reply within 10 mins; top quality cars and drivers.. I contacted other tour guides, but EasyTake replied almost immediately and offered good rates. Travelled with Jamal in his newish car. He was the perfect driver and host (he has alot of information about Marakesh and the best places to stay, visit and buy from.) All my dealings with them were professional and friendly. I would certainly use them again and suggest anyone in need of a driver with a comfortable car get in touch with them immediately.

Excellent service. My wife , my son and I has a great time in Marrakech, Essaouira and Ourika thanks to Easy Take and Jamal who was really professional in his work and very knowledgeable , his tips and ideas was very useful for us. His prices was very reasonable and his way of driving was very good and safe. The car was modern and had air-conditioning , also it was prepared was a chair for my son(7 years old).Thanks Jamal for everythingVisited Aug 2014

Amazing team and very professional!. It was my first time in Morocco and having this company help us travel around Marrakech, Essaouira, Ourika etc.. it was worth the money! Always feeling safe, the driver was super nice (Hakim) and very knowledgable about everything. We highly recommend this company to pick you up and bring you anywhere... ;-) The car was new, comfortable. Very quick to plan things for the next day even though we were about 40 minutes away from Marrakech in a private villa.

Great city tour with Khalid. We didn't book any tours until we arrived and found some great reviews on trip advisor so decided to give it a shot. They were very prompt in responding by email and we had it booked for the next morning. We did the city tour today and Khalid was very polite, accommodating and knowledgeable about the city. He is takin us to the Atlas Mountains tomorrow. We are very happy with our choice!

Reliable, good prices, easy to book. We were staying in a private villa around 20km outside Marrakech and I wanted to arrange a transfer from the house to the airport. I sent an email via the Easy Take website along with an approximate location of the property and they emailed me back very quickly with a reasonable price.The day before pick-up, I phoned Jamal to give him the phone number of the guardien of the property and he sorted out all the fiddly details regarding directions. Luckily Jamal speaks good English because my French is pretty poor and my darija is even more basic! On the day itself, Jamal arrived slightly early in a lovely, clean vehicle and took us to the airport with no hassle.I'd definitely recommend Easy Take for airport transfers and will happily use them again on my next trips to Marrakech. Thank you for taking the stress out of departure day

Excellent service, strongly recommended. We choose Jamal because one of my friends booked a trip with him last year and was very happy about it.She was right. Jamal picked us up at the ryad right in time with a comfortable car, then we went off to Zagora (desert) with several stops for interesting sites & views.It was never a problem for Jamal to make a stop for a drink or a toilet break.We arrived in Zagora in the evening, took the camel to go to our tents in the desert. It was a magical evening. The next day, Jamal picked us up again and dropped us next to our ryad in Marrakech. The last day of our trip, my friends and I spent the day at Rhoul Palace, which was quite far from our ryad so we had to take our luggage (three women, no further explanation needed). So Jamal suggested he would pick us up at the Palace and drop us at the airport. That was really helpful to avoid the stress to be at the airport in time etc. Since we were hungry, he stopped at a great pastry shop. At the airport, he helped us with our luggage and accompanied us to the check-in.Conclusion: we never felt unsafe, Jamal provided an excellent service (always in time) and could answer all our questions. Also strongly recommended for women travelling alone.Thanks Jamal for this great experience!

A must do when in Marrakech!. We have just returned from a fabulous week's break in Marrakech. One of the highlights of our week was our day tour with Easy Take. Jamal was efficient and informative. We felt very safe in his hands/vehicle! He picked us up promptly from our hotel and whisked us away for a fabulous day in the High Atlas Mountains. We then enjoyed a guided hike into the hills with the wonderful Solomon (thank you Solomon!). Afterwards a lunch in one of the Berber villages before being picked up for the return journey to Marrakech with Jamal. Highly recommend Easy Take. Next time we will go on one of their desert trips. They also provide transfers. A fantastic day experience! Thank you Jamal!

Totally reliable friendly and punctual service. We were picked up at the airport and taken on a fantastic Sahara trip by this friendly small company. The service was punctual and entirely reliable. The service was used by our Riad and they are pretty smart folk who will only use services that they trust. If you are looking for a blue chip transport service in Marrakesh look no further!

10 bookings - on time for all of them. I pre booked 9 pick-ups with Easytake between January and our visit to Marrakech in April after having read good reviews in Trip Advisor - we added a 10th pick up whilst there.Pre booking the trips was so easy - Jamal responded to my e mails very quickly and in a pleasant manner. Became quite concerned just before our trip in case Easytake weren't as good as reviewed but needn't have worried thank goodness!!Jamal or one of his team were always ready and waiting for us on the dot. The vehicles were comfortable and good looking and with air con, and looked as though they had just been cleaned inside and out. All of the drivers were friendly, welcoming and helpful.When taking us for our flight home, Jamal actually took us into the airport building itself and right up to our check in desk - so very kind Jamal - much appreciated - you will be fondly thought of every time we think of our lovely holiday in Marrakech

Excellent service all round.. Just back from a holiday to Marrakesh, where we used Easy Take services on a few occasions. Jamal and his drivers were very polite, informative and helpful, and always on time for taxi runs. We also booked a day trip with Easy Take to the Atlas mountains, booking a minibus for the 9 of us, and had a wonderful day out. I would definitely recommend their services.

A very good driver. Me and my girlfriend went to Marrakech last weekend, we had a wonderful stay at the Riad Jenai and we had the pleasure to meet Jamal Boukoune from Easy Take Transport, who came to pick us up at the airport when we arrived and took us back to the plane when we left. Impeccable service, great punctuality (especially at the departure, which was quite early in the morning), very comfortable car, and Jamal is very kind, helpful and tactful. We arranged the transfer service through the Riad Jenai, and of course we'll do the same next time.

Excellent day trip to the Atlas. My friend and I had an excellent day trip with Jamal who picked us up in Marrakech promptly and very close to our Riad. All the booking arrangements went very smoothly and Jamal responded to e-mails promptly.The vehicle ( SUV) was spotless and comfortable and he drove very carefully through the city and through the countryside to Asni and then to Imlil. Jamal speaks good English and took an interesting route to Asni which meant that we saw more of the countryside than if he had gone directly.In Imlil a very nice young Berber guide showed us around and we had a good walk through the hills to a guesthouse where we had a good lunch of salad,bread,tagine and fruit. This was charged extra,but at 8 Euros per person was a reasonable cost in our view.Our return journey was also interesting an again Jamal looked after us well,stopping at a good café for coffee on the way back to Marrakech.All in all a very pleasant day out,thanks to Jamal .

Quality service. We booked Jamal before leaving the UK as our time in Marrakech was short. Very professions from the email correspondence and he even called our Riad the day before to confirm! We booked the full day excursion to Ouarzazate and met at a mutually convenient location at 7.30am. Jamal was already waiting in his pristine 4x4 and made us feel very relaxed and welcome. His English is very good and he pointed out the sights en route. His driving is excellent and he made us feel very safe in rather challenging driving conditions over the High Atlas Mountains where low cloud decreased visibility to only 5 yards in front!Stops were plentiful along the way where toilets and facilities were clean and mint tea delicious! The kasbah was spectacular and great fun crossing via the stepping stones! A well run professional service. If in Marrakech don't hesitate to book this family run service.

great day trip outside Marrakech in February 2014. After a bit of a search, I read in TA about this company. I called Jamal and we fixed a day tour from Marrakech to Lalla Takerkoust, Asni , the High Atlas and back to Marrakech through the Ourika valley. Our little group of 5 ( incl one teenager with 14) easly fitted into Jamal´s comfortable van .Jamal is a very good driver, reliable and stopped whereever we wanted him for fotos etcJamal´s English is excellent and he was very knowledgable about the sites we visited but also gave us a good insight / stories about the country, people, food etc etcAll in all, a really nice day and certainly a highlight of our vacation in Marrakech, highly recommandable!

Excellent service. We booked two trips through Jamal (Essaouira and Ouarzazate) and were impressed with the prompt email response and confirmations. Khalid was our driver on both days and he was a great guide; answering questions, pulling over for roadside photos and offering suggestions at both locations. We met Jamal on our airport transfer at the end of our time in Marrakech and it was obvious that he was very interested in our satisfaction and the quality of service from his family's company. This level of personal service you rarely find. There was a little bit of back and forth over email to confirm some of the smaller details around pickup dates/times but perhaps some of that was due to our writing style.

Ourika Valley Wow!. This is a very efficient, reliable firm, offering very good value for money. They delivered a reliable and friendly Airport transport service. They also delivered and excellent day trip out to the Ourika Valley and Atlas Mountains which, although had a few pre determined tourist traps along the way is still a great day out. The Minbus provide was modern and very comfortable.

Ourika Valley Trip. We decided to book this place after looking at the options on Tripadvisor. The driver/guide (Khalid) showed up promptly (early in fact) ready for our days tour just before 09:00.The car was parked around the corner, as it would have been impossible to get to our Riad down the narrow streets, but he came to the Riad to meet us, and walked us back to the car. We were the only two people on the trip, and the car was a very new Korean 4x4 style vehicle, and very comfortable.Khalid made it clear at the start of the day that the trip was our day, and he would stop where he knew the good places were to stop, but if we wanted to stop for any reason we just needed to request and he would stop for us. We saw many other tours whilst in the mountains, but these seemed more organized - and not in a good way! - there did not seem to be the flexibility on stopping where they wanted.The mountains are beautiful, and the scenery very pretty and we got some great photo opportunities. We headed down the Ourika valley - note this was December, and was supposed to be a quiet time. You could tell from the number of restaurants there, and how empty they were that this was the quiet time. In the height of season when people are escaping the heat of Marrakech for the coolness of the mountains - I can imagine it is bedlam in the mountains. We did the walk with a walking guide up the waterfalls. It was approx an hour to the halfway point, and our guide was not keen to take us for the further hour - and i'll be honest we were not that keen to go any further anyway - so we walked back to have our lunch. (Our choice - we could have eaten first if we had wished, but the walk was quite strenuous so am glad we did this way around).The lunch itself was very good, the food was superb. I was not sure if the cost of food and drink was included in the trip or not (as I could not remember) - but it was not. The restaurant was not expensive either, but it was obviously part of the tour, as it was the busiest restaurant in the area.On the way back we stopped at this herbal place. It did nothing for me, but my wife enjoyed it, and again the guy that showed us around was very knowledgeable.Khalid's English was very good, but we did between us (with my non-existent French/Arabic or Berber language!) sometimes have moments of conversation that were lost in translation. This unfortunately included when it came to making the payment at the end of the day. No cross words - and I do not believe it was intentional - we were all tired, but it meant heading back to the Riad at the end of the day to confirm the price with the guy from Riad that had booked it, and when we wrote it down on a piece of paper we were all in agreement on the price.I would recommend to the owner to perhaps supply some water to the customers in the back of the car gratis as we only took a small bottle, and we did not stop again until before lunch to get more refreshments. To be fair we did not ask to stop - but gratis water in the car would have been a nice touch.This did not detract from the day though - was definitely our favourite day in Marrakesh, and I would recommend this company to all.

A highlight of my trip. I booked day tours from Marrakech to Ouarzazate and Ourika valley. Jamal was quick to respond to my e-mails and kindly provided airport transfer. The prices were competitive and the vehicle was a modern 4x4. Khalid, the driver, was punctual and informative. The tours covered the varied landscapes of the Atlas mountains as well as cultural items like Aït Benhaddou and breakfast at a Berber home. I would be very happy to book another tour with Easy Take in the future.

The best day in Marrakech. We went to the atlas mountains with Jamal and his new land cruiser. The trip included two amazing vallys, a stop at some local agan oil producer, a lovely lunch (not included) and a hike to two nice waterfalls. We could stop whenever we wanted during the day.
