I recommend this family company to everyone that considers the atlas mountains.

Great!. When the original tour company failed to show up on the scheduled day, we scrambled to find another tour company for a few days later, luckily I found Easy Take. Jamal the owner was very responsive and answered all our questions. The driver was on time, personable, and made for a great day trip. We hired several drivers in our 12 day trip to Morocco and Easy Take and the driver we received were by far the most professional operator we encountered. Would recommend to anyone and look forward to hiring them again in the future.

Affordble Quality. Jamal, the Owner, of Easy Take Transport has invested heavily in "Top of the Range" vehicles to meet most Client needs. His English is good and service reliable. I have used Jamal's services many times now, from trips in a 4x4 through to Airport Collections when we needed a Minibus for a larger groups. As a regular visitor to Marrakech, I have used many different vehicle services in the past but none have met expectation as well as Jamal and his new fleet of vehicles.

Trip to Asni and Ourika valley. Today we went on a one day (9am-5.30om) trip we had booked previously with Jamal who was very helpful. Khaled the driver was on time and collected us from our Riad. The drive was very comfortable in his new 4x4. Khaled was very knowledgeable about Marrakesh as well as the valleys and villages and gave us an interesting insight of Marrakesh. He stopped wherever we wanted to take pictures and had organised his own stops at a Berber family house where we drank nice Moroccan tea and tried pure honey and home-made butter. Other stops were at places with nice panoramic views and an argon oil cooperative where we bought pure argon oil and honey. And of course we stopped for a nice lunch at one of the restaurants in ourika valley where we also linked up with Khaled's guide for the waterfall which was an amazing trek all the way up to the waterfall which took us 1 hour in total (Tip: wear good trainers/trekking shoes). Overall Khalid was a very cool, trustworthy and friendly guy who made the trip very enjoyable for us, he took many pictures for us!!! We totally recommend him especially if you are here as a couple/family and want to organize a private trip. The price was very reasonable, you are getting what you pay for, so you can't go wrong!!!

Day in the Atlas Mountains. Khaled our driver picked us up on time and was a wonderful patient driver - knowledgeable and we had a great day; sightseeing, the stops at the cooperatives and the tea and visit with the berber family were all memorable. Thanks very much to Khaled and I would highly recommend him.

Atlas Mountain Tour. Visit to Marrakech for a few days and found Jamal via TripAdvisor. Understands English, very clean/new car, on time and friendly.  Jamal took us for tea with a local family and arranged a guide for a tour of the mountain.Overall a excellent day. Highly recommended.

Enjoyed Morocco - thanks to Jamal. Jamal is English speaking, punctual, reliable and honest which makes him a great tourist companion. I had initially requested Jamal’s services for an excursion to Ourika Valley, which was fantastic. Jamal picked me up from my Riad in Marrakech right on time and drove me to the Atlas Mountains in his nice SUV. He showed me all the sights, including a visit to a Berber family home. Once we reached the mountains, he even hooked me up with a guide leading a group hike to the waterfalls, which was really enjoyable and cost effective. Having had such a great time, I availed of Jamal’s services the next day too, which was my last day in Marrakech. I left my bags in his car and he showed me all around Marrakech, including the Bahia Palace, Saadian Tombs, Koutobia, Hammam etc. and dropped me off to the airport later. I had forgotten one of my packages in his car and he even arranged for it to be delivered to me at the airport, which speaks to his honesty and customer service. All I can say is that my trip to Morocco wouldn’t have been half as enjoyable had it not been for Jamal. So thank you Jamal, and I hope you can be available whenever I am next in Morocco.

AIRPORT PICK UP - SIGHTSEEING - SHOPPING -IN AND AROUND MARRAKECH. This is an excellent company...a family company...... run by Mr JAMAL Boukoune. They have excellent vehicles, well kept and spotlessly clean. EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEYAlways ten minutes early, never late, excellent English, and an encyclopaedia of local knowledge. Take the one hour drive to the Atlas Mountains...... and experience Richard Branson's hotel for lunch, or visit the classic hotel where Winston Churchill visited and undertook his passion for painting.

A+++ service. Straightforward, professional and honest.. Used easy take transport at very short notice (within 24-36 hours) for transport from one hotel to another (Essaouira to Marrakech). Khaled was our driver for the trip. Very professional and friendly person. Turned up on time. Excellent knowledge of Marrakech.

All Good. We used Jamal at short notice to take us on a day tour to the Atlas mountains, he arrived punctually, is polite and well turned out and also has good knowledge of Marrakesh and its surroundings. He has just acquired a new 4 x 4 which still has that new car smell :) Overall very reliable and reasonably priced and would happily use again.

Excellent Service - Our Brother in Marrakech. I was on holiday in Marrakesh for nine days and needed to hire a driver for a few excursions. I found Jamal to be a great choice and would recommend him to everyone.I looked up a few on TA and came across EasyTake tours - I emailed Jamal and he was very responsive and gave me a very good price for our first excursion, which was a trip to Casablanca to visit the Hassan II mosque. Jamal arrived early to pick us up in his mini-van which was perfect for us, very clean and with plenty of space. We are a family of six which meant having to tumble the seats in his vehicle whenever we got in or out, which Jamal was immdeiately on hand to do.He was very polite and attentive to our needs and even suggested a few extra things to do, like having our picture taken outisde the famaous Ricks Cafe and also advising on a great place to eat along the corniche.I was so impressed with the service and value that I decied to use him for the remaining excursions, the second trip being a tour to the Atlas mountains. Again Jamal arrived ahead of time with his car cleaned from the previous day, he arranged the whole day for us with his various great contacts. We headed out early and stopped at a berber village where we met with a berber family who Jamal knew very well. We had a tour of their house and were then served a fantastic breakfast, with the best mint tea we'd ever had. We were served fresh bread, honey, olive oil and nuts - all of which were local produce and tasted fantastic. We were then taken to the next stop which was a berber village at the base of the Atlas mountains, here we met another friend of Jamal - whose name was also Jamal. He was a young berber guide who took us through the Ourika valley to the first waterfall and then upwards again and finally back to his village. The younger Jamal was also very good and really took care of us through our climb which was challenging in places.We used Jamal a third time to arrange a couple of activities around Marrakech - the girls wanted a spa treatment and the boys wanted to go quad biking. Again Jamal looked after us arranging everything without fuss and at a very reasonable price.Our final excursion was to Essouria, again Jamal arrived well ahead of time and we headed out to Essouria. We stopped along the way at a cafe and also at an Argan oil co-operative, where we had a tour of a small factory producing argan oil products. We then went to Essouria, where we stayed the whole day with Jamal waiting for us.On our last day in Marrakech Jamal also arranged one of his drivers to provide a taxi service for us around a couple of places in Marrakech, since he was busy with another tour. However, he did finally pick us up from our hotel to take us to the airport for our return flight in the evening.Overall, I was very impressed with Jamal, great manners, much more than just a transport service and never did I feel that I was under any pressure to buy additional services - as was often the case with other situations in Marrakesh. Great value for money, reliable, genuine and honest.

Jamal is a very correct and professional driver. I have used Jamal transportation a couple of times now for my business visits, traveling with some very important persons from our company, and would like to share that Jamal is a very professional driver and correct with his guests. Always on time, car very clean and speaking good english as well. Prices are very competitive and he fully respect and keeps what he has agreed in the begining of the tours.Thank you JAMAL, we will continue to use your transportation services !Rui Cruz - Portugal

Excellent transportation in Marrakesh!. We hired Easy Take Transport when we were in Marrakesh last week based on the Trip Advisor reviews and could not have been more satisfied. Adbul came straight to our Riad in Marrakesh to pick us up and led us to his clean air-conditioned van. We made the trip from Marrakesh to Agadir and it was lovely. Adbul was an excellent driver and spoke English quite well. We enjoyed our ride to Agadir so much that we decided to hire them for our trip back from Agadir to Marrakesh. Once again, Abdul was excellent. I would highly recommend them if you need transportation in the Marrakesh area!

Very Easy and Responsive Service. Jamal is a very smart and easy to communicate with. He will always be alert to your requirements during the transport. He will not take any advance amounts, just depend on your honesty and emails. And he will be in advance waiting for you. All this with a reasonable price.Definitely will depend on him next times even more.
Our friend in marrakech, thank for everything ,JAMAL !. He is a realy good driver and alsow guide. Hope to meet again.Our friend in marrakech, thank for everything ,JAMAL.

save first clas transportation!. I booked a transportation from Marrakesh to Essaouira and return. Iam a mum with 3 teenage kids, travelling alone without my husband.Jamal our driver did a very good job. He took us very careful and secure fromMarrakesh to Essaouira and return. We had ha huge SUV. Clean and in good condition.We stopped at ATLAS Cafe( half way to our destination). This was also very comfy, good coffee, cakes, fruits, water etc and clean toilets.I highly recommand this Transportation Service. We will definately book again!Alexandra O from Duesseldorf March 2013

First class service :). The service provided by "Easy Take Transport" was simply impeccable from pick up to drop off. The driver "Jamal", who was responsible for our itinerary in morocco, was very welcoming and helpful. Considering the reasonable price and the professionalism shown by the staff, I will definitely be using their services again.. Highly recommended, Happy traveling in beautiful Morocco :)

Highlight of Marrakech visit. Conor and I booked two days trips through Atlas and Sahara tours and were so impressed with Mustapha's prompt replies and flexibility. We went on the Essaouira and Atlas Mountains day trips. By far, the Atlas Mountain trip stole the show. Our lovely guide Mohammed was so friendly, open, and willing to share with us the history and daily aspects of the villages that populate the Imlil valley and mountainside. Mohammed led us on a 3-4 hour hike up and around the mountains, shared local apples and dates, and took some beautiful photos. At the end of the hike, we were treated to a beautiful lunch at the top of Mustapha's guest house, where we enjoyed lentil soup, salad, and a beef tagine, followed with more fresh fruit. A huge thank you to Mustapha, Mohammed, and Hassan!

Atlas and Berber village day tour . The best day trip we have ever been on by a country mile. We were picked up at our hotel at 9am sharp by our driver Fattah who was so friendly and an excellent driver. We then picked up our guide and headed for a camel ride which was amazing and our guide Mohamed took some excellent pictures for us. After this we headed up the mountains to there own Riad(hotel) which Is simply stunning and the lunch provided was one of the best meals I/we have ever had and the view you get to eat it with is priceless. After lunch we headed up the mountain in the top spec land cruiser and into the Berber villages. We went over some incredible terrain and saw some stunning scenery and not once were we scared as Fattahs driving was 1st class. Throughout the day Mohamed's commentary and knowledge of everything really gave us the personal feel of Morocco. We can't wait to comeback and book our next tour with them.

Enjoyable tour. Took the day tour to Atlas Mountains. Just would like to say a big thank you to Hassan our driver and Mustupha our guide. These people are genuinely nice people and extremely helpful. Nothing is too much for them, the driver even stopped at the YSL gardens and waited for myself and my wife. I would recommend these guys to anyone, worth paying the extra money! We even changed the time the night before and I had an email confirmation within minutes.

Unforgettable experience. . Really great experience. If you haven't ridden a camel before this will suffice. A short walk and although close to the road you are taken into the valley and away from the 'urban'. The food and location at lunch was superb!! And, the walk afterwards, through the Atlas, thoroughly enjoyable. Our host was very friendly, knowledgeable and spoke good English.

Unforgettable journey with a remarkable tour service. from collection to return, Hassan our driver welcomed us at our hotel and took us into the mountains. stopping to purchase water and some complimentary chewing gum! (Thankyou Hassan!) to meeting our trek guide and local berber, Muhammad (apologies if any names are mispelt) he led us to the company riad where we enjoyed authentic mint tea and nibbles on the roof top with views from the base of toutkal. Wow.Muhammad led us on a 3 or was it 4 hour trek up to a height of 2100 metres before descending down through a berber village back to the riad for an incredible moroccan salad, tagine and fruit platter.words cannot express how impressed we where with this tour, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and should a future trip to morocco be planned we will definately be looking to organise this through atlas and sahara.to add, we booked our holiday via thomson and after listening to the excursion options to the atlas mountains did our own research and found this company.with out hesitation, book with these wonderful people.thanks to everyone involved at Atlas and Sahara, our kindest regards.Pete and Charlotte.

Great daily tour to Atlas moutain. We spent one day in Atlas mountain with the Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. It was a great experience for us. Our guide showed us a lot of a nice and new things for us and we spoke with him during our way up and down. He explained us the Morrocan culture and tradition as well as showed us a loot of birds. We could spend the whole day in nice company and enjoyed the nature. It was an amazing time. During the way up we had a break for Morrocan tea and amazing dates. When we finished the trip, the late lunch was waiting for as in Riad Jnane Imlil located in Douar Targa Imoula, Imlil. The food was amazing and we returned the empty dishes. We really recommend this company. Don't worry that the prices are higher than in other companies but you are sure that you will get a good quality.

Great tour to Sahara and Atlas Mountains. Our tour guide was very friendly, informative and experienced! Our favourite day was hiking in the Atlas Mountains and spending a night at the wonderful Riad Imlil Jiane. The scenery and sights were spectacular, however it would have been good to be able to spend a little more time at certain places. The staff were generous and made us feel very welcome on our trip. Overall a great experience - thank you very much!

Great great tour company. Had two age boys and a dad who suffered from vertigo ( me ) - therefore we needed a lot of guidance on where we travel out to. Atlas and Sahara tours were awesome - they carefully helped us plan hiking , cycling and mule riding - they completely went out thier way to make sure we were fully taken care off. Would totally recommend them for all activities - they are very knowledgeable - in addition to this you MUST visit ( and stay as long as you can ) in their the riad they are partnered with ( jnane imlil) , awesome people , delicious food and what rooms and views - planning more trips there Thank you Hassan , his brother , uncles and the mules for an totally unforgettable expirence - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Well organised tour, great food but scenery messy . My friend and I booked a one day tour, including a wonderful (vegan on request!!) lunch. We were promptly collected from our riad in the Medina. Hassan provided us with a well paced, friendly and informative tour. However, the scenery has been spoilt by the large amount of rubbish around the village and waterfall. A constant stream of tourists going in and out made walking difficult and took away from the idea of a remote and peaceful landmark. I understand that this is not the responsibility of the tour company, but visitors should be aware. In addition, the trek is only suitable for those physical able and reasonably fit.

A truly amazing experience with an amazing company. My partner and I booked a day trip with this company during our time in Marrakech and it was by far the best experience of the entire trip. Mustafa and his team plan every detail of the trip to ensure you not only get to experience the sense of community, the truly stunning surrounds but also the hospitable nature of those who call the Atlas mountains home. We have done numerous tours, but our tour guide Mohammed was by far the best we have ever experienced. He had a true passion for the role and the area through which he guided us which really brought the experience to life. This tour is all about really getting a sense of the life in the Atlas, it's about experiencing the mountain climbs and the way of the people. It honestly provided a whole new view of Morocco and we can't wait to return and spend time with the team again. We were collected from our hotel at 10am driven in a beautiful vehicle to the Atlas Mountains. Here we met our amazing guide Mohammed, we truly was the best guide EVER. We has a beautiful trek through the mountains and then a meal at the most beautiful Riad in the world. We were then driven to the location of the camels where we had a beautiful ride with them.If you're looking for a truly life changing experience with a company that understands and is passionate about what they do, this is the company. Wewould not have seen the Atlas any other way! Thank you so much to the team (especially Mohammed).

Winter Toubkal trek and more. I'd used Atlas and Sahara tours a few years earlier and I was very pleased with the service back then. This time my partner and I were picked up at the airport by the lovely Hassan. He dropped us off at our first riad in central Marrakech. The next day we headed up to Imlil, again courtesy of Hassan. I was really pleased to meet up with Mustapha again and even more overjoyed to learn that Mohammed, the guide who led our Toubkal trek a few years ago, would again be working with us. We all hugged, loaded up our gear and headed off for the hills. The new Toubkal refuge is an improvement on the old one. We ate and chatted with other trekkers at the refuge and then caught an early night ready for the 4am wake up call. With head torches and crampons on we headed up into the snow and ice. We had no issues with altitude sickness this time and we made it up and down in good time. We then stayed at a lovely riad in Imlil with Mustapha and another riad in central Marrakech, again all arranged by Mustapha. Imlil and Marrakech are special places for us; the sights, the smells and sounds are a joy to behold. But it's the people that have made it special for us, particularly Mohammed, Hassan and Mustapha. A huge thank you.

Amazing Tour!. Very professional!Amazing people!Our tour guide was Hassan and he was great - taught us a lot! Where we went to eat was the most beautiful scenery have ever seen. It is worth every penny! Must go!

Very friendly staff and great service. Our tour guide Hassan is really friendly and they were able to pick us up from the airport to start a tour on our arrival. The imlil valley trek is nice, and we were taken around areas we wouldn't have known how to get to. We visited villages, mountains, and a waterfall.To top off the tour package, we stayed at the tour company's riad called, 'Riad Jnane imlil'. Their service, staff, meals and location is excellent. The rooms are beautiful and I wish I had stayed in the riad longer!-Sandra

One day trip to Atlas mountains. This is a fantastic and well organised tour and perfect for a three hour to four hour walk for fairly fit and energetic people. Fantastic lunch at the end but overall a super activity with great views and a nice experience of the atlas mountains. Of course there is a lot more for those who want to do more.

Walking trip in Imlil. We booked with thos company on the strength of the reviews and did it all on on line. We had opted for the 4 hour walk, but trimmed it down to 3 hours as it was an extremely hot day. We were picked up by Hussain at our Riad, who drove us down to Imlil. We then met our guide Mohammad in Imlil, who took us around the lower edges of the mountains which surround Imlil, as well as to the waterfall close by. Note you will need proper walking shoes, as it is quite rocky in places and steep and you may need to walk through the small waterfalls. Both were friendly, but their English was limited which we didn't mind. Lunch was at the Riad Jname Imlil, where we had a delicious 3 course lunch which included a beef tangine. This was possibly the best meal we had whilst we were in Morocco! We then met Mustapha who is one of the brothers who own the company (and Riad). He showed us around the Riad and the different and unique rooms which you could stay in. A day probably doesn't do the place justice, but you do get to enjoy the stunning scenery. We did regret not spending a night and going for another walk, so if you like nature, stay another day.

Best day in Morocco!. Mohammed was our tour guide and is now our friend, I truly hope that we cross paths again as he was absolutely fantastic and really does know the history of his local area in the Atlas Mountains. We started the day by getting picked up by the lovely Rachid in his 4x4 car, he came and called for us at our Riad which was close to the markets (where you couldn't drive down to). We then stopped to get some water brought by Rachid and then got the chance the take photos at whichever spots we wanted him to stop at... We then met Mohammed at a cafe (for more tasty Moroccan tea of course) opposite where our camels were waiting for us, my female camel 'Fatima' and my partners camel got on very well and the camel handler adored them and clearly looked after them well. Mohammed was continuously educating us all day, and we loved every story and fact.After our camel ride (your thighs will hurt after 1.5 hours hehe! - but it's worth it!) we stopped at the local Saturday market (very old Sch but such an awesome experience) where Mohammed's father was too, we ended up buying two matching hand made traditional dresses to wear for the rest of the day - such good times. This was something extra, Mohammed did not have to show us this market. We then met back with our driver Rachid who drove us all to Imlil for a break. We had a wonderful meal at the Riad Imlil which is by far the best view I've had whilst eating lunch! So peaceful and calming. The waiter was very friendly too. We got to wear the camel leather slippers too which then led to my partner buying a pair later on in the mountains! After we had eaten and got the chance to have a nosey around the Riad rooms, which were very quaint peaceful and seemed a honeymoon style of place to stay, we headed off for our 2.5 walking trek up in the mountains past the villages, right until the last one.Again, we cannot stress how much fun we had and will never forget this day.In the local Berber language if you say 'ten minutes' quite quickly this is basically how you say thank you ;) (was my way of remembering)Don't forget to wear comfortable shoes for the trek! Kathryn and Anthony 15 May 16

Amazing!. We wanted to do 1 day of hiking and 1 day of mountain biking. They came up with a great itinerary, picked us up from Marrakech, set us up with mountain bikes and guides for both days, and a GREAT Riad to stay in (Riad Jnane). We were very happy with the guides on both days, very friendly, very knowledgeable and we enjoyed our time with them.

5 day private tour as a family of 4. Simply excellent, I can't recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours highly enough for their very high standards of service. My husband and eldest daughter (age 12) were both very well catered for with their gluten free diets. Everything was understood and clearly passed on to chefs at all the restaurants and Riads where we were. Mohamed, our tour guide for the full 5 days, looked after us in the Sahara Desert and High Atlas Mountains. We always had plenty of delicious food to eat and a constant supply of bottled water. He ensured our 10 year old daughter was happy but sensitively gave us plenty of space too. Our enjoyment of the trip and welfare were top priorities and the people we met along the way we're warm and friendly. Mohamed's understanding of English is outstanding. Morocco is vast, beautiful and safe and well worth exploring. It offers great value for money, is fascinating, unspoilt and a world away from home. Brilliant memories we will treasure, we all loved it We hope to return to climb North Africa's highest peak, Mount Toubkal in the High Atlas Mountians as it is relatively accessible to all, not just experienced climbers! Can't wait. Tour date: 30/5 - 3/6/16

Superb day trip to Imlil and Asni.. We had a fantastic day organised by Atlas & Sahara. Collected on time from our hotel in Marrakech, water provided and the excellent services of our driver Hassan. Great English and a good local knowledge plus careful driving in the crazy city! We met Omar our guide at the camel station in Asni. He was incredibly courteous and thoughtful to ensure our trip met our expectations. Also very knowledgable and multi-lingual, we felt safe in his hands. Our camel ride was very pleasant! Hassan met us at the other end with the car and then he and Omar accompanied us to Imlil. Lunch was provided at the Riad Jnane- beautiful in every respect and a welcome rest with breath taking scenery. After food we trekked to the highest Berber village this side of Mt Toubkal with Omar leading the way offering regular local info and interesting facts- he really is a superb guide! Never too fast uphill, always checking we were comfortable with the pace and always mindful of water in the heat. About 2.5hrs in total bringing us back to the car in Imlil village. We returned safely back to Marrakech with even a considerate stop at a women's cooperative for Argan oil after an earlier conversation asking about fair trade purchases. They were the perfect hosts! Also our thanks to Mustapha- all organised online with promptness and care. Well done Atlas & Sahara- we hope to return!

Brilliant day out......well recommended!. We booked the one day excursion (camel riding and afternoon trek) and we can't rate it highly enough! Our driver met us at the hotel at 9am and drove us to meet our fantastic guide Mohammed. A chilled cup of mint tea before meeting our four legged friends (of the humped variety). Had a meander through the valley on the camels (no spitting or biting.... Actually really nice) before meeting the driver again and heading to the beautiful riad for a lovely lunch with the most spectacular views of the mountains ❤️After lunch had digested we had a look around a couple of the bedrooms in the riad...... Beautiful. We were gutted that we hadn't planned an overnight stay.However onwards and upwards (literally) as we made our way to the waterfall. Not too strenuous a walk although sensible shoes probably best. Returned to meet our driver in the town before heading back to the madness of Marrakech.Fantastic day! Met the lovely mustapha too..... Nice guy who responds quickly and efficiently to any touristy questions.Would highly recommend this company. Will certainly use them when we plan to stay longer to experience more of this beautiful country

Amazing tours to Imlil Valley and Ait Benhaddou. We went on two day tours with Atlas and Sahara, the first being the one day tour to Imlil Valley and a couple days later we went to Ait Benhaddou and Telouet. Both tours were great and beautifully organised, but the hike in Imlil Valley definitely was the highlight of my week in Morocco. Both mornings, we were picked up at our riad on time and dropped off as planned every evening. Mustafa, who runs the company, is a very nice, friendly man and he is very responsive to emails. He also owns Riad Jnane Imlil, which is a gorgeous Riad in the heart of Imlil Valley. While we did not lodge there, we had an amazing lunch at the rooftop and I would definitely recommend it as overnight stay to people who want to hike/explore Imlil for two or more days. Our hike was about 2.5/3 hours long and it was definitely not difficult, just make sure you wear running or hiking shoes as the path can be a little rough at times. You get an amazing view of the mountains and our guide, Hassan, is a really nice guy. He was born in Imlil so he knows the area a lot, and he can adapt to your walking pace. He never pressured us and was very supportive when we stopped to take pictures. He also took some for us!The second tour (to Ait Benhaddou) involves a very long drive to and from the Ksar. While you are busy for the whole day, you actually spend only a few hours there. This was expected, and it is still definitely worth doing. Even the car ride is entertaining because the landscape is simply beautiful and scenery changes a lot. Overall, I had a great experience with Atlas and the Sahara and I would definitely recommend this company and its tours to anyone!

Fabulous day. Despite our late inquiry about the trip, Moustafa was extremely efficient and quick to respond providing an array of options for a day-trip to the Atlas Mountains. We chose the option of a short-hike in the Imlil Valley. We were collected from our hotel in Marrakech and driven to the Imlil Valley where we were met by our guide and taken to the Riad Jnane Imlil Guesthouse for tea before setting off on a lovely hike through the surrounding area. The scenery was simply breathtaking and our guide was extremely professional and courteous . After the hike we enjoyed a delicious lunch of local cuisine at the Guesthouse. The day turned out to be extremely enjoyable, with beautiful scenery, friendly and courteous service and a lovely Guesthouse. Congratulations Atlas and Sahara Day Tours.

Atlas mountains tour and cooking class. We had a fantastic day in the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. Mustapha was very efficient and quick to respond to emails regarding the day and our reservation. Rashid picked us up from our Riad in Marrakech promptly in the morning and drove us into the mountains. His English was very good and he allowed us to stop at various points along the route to take pictures. He also told us about the places we were passing along the way. Once we arrived we had a cooking lesson and learnt how to make beef Tagine. The Riad staff and chef were extremely nice and let us take an active role in the cooking! We were then taken on a 2.5 hour walk in the surrounding area (passing waterfalls and mint tea stops along the way!) with Hassan who was very knowledgeable and willing to answer all our questions about the mountain communities and the nature. We ended our day with the tagine we had made previously. Rashid then drove us back to our Riad in Marrakech. All in all a very enjoyable way to experience the Moroccan mountains. We would recommend the tour to anyone. Definitely remember a camera and trainers for walking, plus a jumper and sun cream as it's cold but the sun is strong!

Amazing trip!!. We did the 1/2 day camel trek in Asni valley & 1/2 day Hike in the Atlas Mountains Day.This trip is amazing value for money!! You are collected from your Riad/hotel in the morning and driven off in a very comfortable 4x4 which is clean and modern. There's bottled water available all day. The driver is happy to stop off along the way if you see a certain view point or market of interest. Our Guide was an amazing guy called Mohamed who was full of information and had fantastic English. We rode the camels for about an hour and a half through the valleys and were met by the car at the other end, we drove to a beautiful Riad where we had a delicious 3 course lunch (you can choose your main course ahead of time) and looked out from the Roof terrace across the mountains. We then went for a trek for around an hour and a half which was amazing. My mother and aunt were unable to do this so a car trip was organized for them to see the highest point to which you could drive. When the walk finished we were met by the car and driven back to our Riad. This trip was one of the highlights of our holiday. The drivers and guide were super friendly and helpful. The extra steps taken to ensure the non-walkers had something else to see made it a really special. Sometimes these added extras (differences) can cost but they included it in our price. Overall i would definitely recommend this tour and tour company to anyone going to morocco!! On top of everything else Mustapha the owner is fantastic at answering all your queries and helping with all your questions.

Imhil valley and cooking class . We booked our tour before we arrived in Morrocco, having paid a deposit. We were picked up from our riad at 8.30am and taken to the valley for a mint tea on a lovely roof top setting. We then did an hours cooking class and went on a 2 and a half hour hike up through the valley. When we came back our food was ready and delicious! It was a great day, thank you atlas and Sahara!

Don't miss this amazing trip. We did the 1/2 day camel trek in Asni valley & 1/2 day Hike in the Atlas Mountains Day. This trip is amazing value. First of all, Mustapha, the owner is helpful and quick to respond to queries - whatever time of day. You are collected from your Riad/hotel in the morning by a lovely friendly driver and driven off in a very comfortable 4x4 which is clean and modern. There's bottled water available all day. The driver is happy to stop off along the way if you see a certain view point or market of interest. We met Rashid when we got to where the camels were and set off on. Rashid was so friendly and had so many interesting stories. We rode the camels for about an hour and a half through the valleys and were met by the car at the other end. Rashid came in the car with us and we drove to a beautiful Riad where we had a delicious 3 course lunch (you can choose your main course ahead of time) and looked out from the Roof terrace across the mountains. Lunch is leisurely and then we set off on the trek. I was travelling with my mum who is in her 60s so we opted for a slightly shorter walk of around 1 and a half hours. The walk is through the countryside and 3 different berber villages. Rashid kept stopping to tell us little bits about the area we were in. He knew all the locals we passed which was actually really nice and was such an interesting and friendly man. He was also very helpful and considerate with my mum helping her on steeper parts of the path. When the walk finished we were met by the car and driven back to our Riad. I cannot recommend this trip enough. It was such good value for money and if I go back to Morocco I would book one of the longer overnight trips. All of the staff and guides are so lovely!

Great tour to the High Atlas Mountains and Asni Valley. We had a wonderful time with Omar as our guide and Abdil as our driver. We opted for the full day tour - 1/2 day to the Atlas Mountains, where we hiked through numerous Berber villages and had a stunning lunch on a rooftop terrace of a riad, and 1/2 day in the Asni valley, riding camels. We had a choice of riding between 1-2 hours, whatever we wanted. I was terrified of the camels and opted for just one hour. All around, a wonderful experience. Hiking through the mountains was a highlight of my entire trip! I highly recommend this company.

Excellent day!. Two of us enjoyed an excellent day trip to Aid Ben Haddou. It was a pretty long day as Aid Ben Haddou is about 180km from Marrakech but we had a great driver, Mohammad, who we felt completely comfortable with especially as there were occasions when he could have risked over-taking longer, slower vehicles but simply didn't. Our guide was Faisal...we have had many guides throughout the world but he ranked along with the best. A personable young guy, he had the knack of being able to give us sufficient information without overloading us and was always ready to give detailed responses to the questions we had. He certainly enlightened us about many aspects of Morroccan life. We stopped at a kasbah in Telouet where he gave us a guided tour before reaching Ait Ben Haddou itself where we had lunch, included in the price. There were 5 set meals and we could choose what we wanted, though all began with either salad or soup and ended with an orange and dates....a pleasant, filling meal. Afterwards, Faisal gave us a conducted tour of the kasbah and we had the joy of meeting a very elderly lady, one of only five families still to live in the kasbah, who enabled us to tour round her house...even better was the fact that Faisal had stayed with her a few times before as she was his friend's grandmother. That sort of personal touch really adds to a visit! The ever changing scenery on the journey was fascinating and well worth the day out in itself.

Top service providing an excellent experience.Worth he money. We booked a day horse riding. Communication beforehand was excellent, only a small deposit required and requests for further info (such as Are helmets provided) answered promptly (Yes). On the day, our guide arrived on time. His English was excellent and he was a very experienced mountain guide. Our car was large and comfortable and our driver was very friendly too - he also drove safely and considerately. The horse riding was outstanding. Rachid rode with us and the horse provider walked/ran with us the whole way. We rode over a pass and back down the other side, where or driver was waiting for us. In the Imlil valley, lunch was excellent, with fantastic views and then Rachid took us for a walk in the valley - a nice one way walk, since our driver was waiting for us down the valley. All in all, an excellent day out with great service. We were royally looked after and I would recommend Atlas and Sahara to anyone. It really is worth the money!

Not to be missed. If you visit Morocco without booking a trip with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours you will have made a big mistake. The trip exceeded my expectations and will remain as a favourite holiday day still in years to come, I'm sure of it. Logistically the company are faultless: quick responses on email, punctual, informative, organised, and remarkably priced. My friend and I went on private day trip, a camel ride and a hike in February with our excellent guide Hassan and our driver Rashid. Hassan is full of local stories, adventures, opinions and explanations; he has a brain to be envious of, and Rashid has a warm smile you will never forget. Ultimately the day is so magical because will make you feel like you are with old friends. Aside from how comfortable you will feel, you will see stunning sights, be exposed to rural culture, eat delicious food (the best I had in Morocco) and in a Riad that should be featured in a travel magazine as a best kept secret. You won't regret booking a trip with this company; I am so jealous you have it all before you, I know you'll have a fantastic time.

Incredible Day! highly recommended. We did the 1/2 day camel trek in Asni valley & 1/2 day Hike in the Atlas Mountains Day tour. It was the absolute highlight of our Marrakech trip, the camels were great fun and the atlas mountains absolutely beautiful at this time of year. Our tour guide Hammid was so enthusiastic and passionate about his work that it felt like we were being shown around by a close friend. With a group of five ranging from 29 years-70 years we were a little worried it might be too much but Atlas tours replied to all my queries within minutes on email and when we arrived Hammid made it an incredible experience. We all agree it was one of the best lunches we had ever had! thank you Hammid :)

Great trip. We have booked the 2 day to Zagora with camel ride. We stayed in the desert camp to see sun set and sun rise. All, the trip is well organised. All the stops we have made, they all have clean toilet and clean food. Before we have booked, we didn't realise how long it takes to go to Zagora. It is about 7 hours drive with 1 hour rest. The slight is amazing on the way! The atlas is so beautiful, and full of colours.

Fantastic, personalised trip! . We had 4 days in Marrakech and knew we wanted to spend some time walking near the Atlas Mountains. We researched a few companies and Atlas and Sahara Day Tours came out on top as they offered such a variety of trips to individual groups.We wanted to spend as much time as possible walking and exploring the foothills so the fact that we drove direct from Marrakech to Imlil Valley was perfect - we have been on trips in the past where there are many stops on the way to see shops, markets, villages etc. While this may appeal to some people, it wasn't what we wanted this time so we were delighted with this.We met our guide Mohammad and chose the walk length suitable for us. The setting is beautiful, the cherry and apple trees were in bloom which really set off the views! Mohammad was a fantastic guide, he answered all our questions, was very friendly and even took us to his house for tea!The lunch provided on the roof top at the Riad was delicious and had unbeatable views! My partner is interested in returning to climb the mountains so we were shown the rooms in the Riad and they are beautiful!Mustapha was extremely helpful when emailing to arrange the trip and was friendly and welcoming when we arrived at the Riad. If anyone is interested in climbing/days of trekking, the options are very customisable by the sounds of it! I think at least one of us will definitely be returning! (I may just come for the view and leave the climbing to my other half!)I would highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours to anyone travelling to Marrakech for a day trip (at least!) it's an idyllic setting away from the hustle and bustle with a variety of options including treks, walks, donkey rides etc - it's not just for active climbers!Hopefully we will be back in the not too distant future!

Camels, donkeys, a hike and more - A trip through the countryside of Morocco. There were 6 of us, 2 teens: 18 and 13, two parents and 2 grandparents 74 and 78. We had a wonderful couple of days with Sahara Atlas tours and our guide Mohammed. the van was comfortable. we rode through beautiful scenery, saw goats in trees, back to Marrakech the first day, picked up again the second day we visited the waterfalls in Ouzoud and saw the Barbary apes. we went for a lovely walk,- part donkey ride,spent the night in an interesting casbah, visited the natural bridge the next morning. had lunch at a Berber home - a real treat.Mohammed was a charming young man, worked hard to see that we were well taken care of, always ready to answer our questions.

Brilliant day, brilliant people, brilliantly organised!. We only went to Marrakech for a long weekend, but having seen that in this short space of time we could go on a trip through the mountains and ride camels through the valley, we jumped at the chance to explore beyond Marrakech. It was so easy to book, and Mustapha replies to emails so quickly, and leaves no questions unanswered. It was all very clear and he was incredibly helpful. We had a driver pick us up from our hotel on the dot. The drive was very comfortable, and landmarks were pointed out. Our guide, Mohammed, was FANTASTIC. Ensure we did a trek that would suit our ability, and was incredibly friendly and helpful. The camel ride in the afternoon was great fun too, albeit a little uncomfortable, but camel's aren't particularly comfortable to ride! Lunch in the Riad with the breathtaking view, all very authentic and delicious! I cannot recommend this company enough, so much so that I am going back in September to climb Mount Toubkal. Thank you to everyone who was involved in making our day so brilliant. Selina

Great day. So glad we booked this trip on our holiday to Marrakech. We were a group of 6 friends (3 couples). We did the half day camel ride & hike, we visited an argon oil cooperative and had an delicious lunch in the Atlas Mountains in a beautiful setting. Excellent organisation, English speaking local guide, reliable comfortable transportation. The day trip gave us a taster of the Atlas Mountains & we would love to go back to do some serious hiking, we would recommend this company if you are visiting Marrakech & want to visit the mountains.

Memorable, Personable, Incredible. 4 day trip from Marrakech to Fes.. We had such an incredible time with Rashid and Rashid! We really couldn't have asked for anything more, from the moment we met Rashid at our Riad in Marrakech when he personally came to pick us up and walk us back through the maze of the Souk to our vehicle, until our drop off in Fes 4 days later when they both ensured we were met by our guide to our Riad. The vehicle was excellent; spacious, clean and air con in perfect working order! and driving was to a high, safe standard!They made us feel safe, looked after us, educated us on many aspects of life in Morocco. They respected our privacy but also interacted with us; we enjoyed friendly conversation and many laughs! And the music... What a soundtrack they provided us with! Just perfect... and even provoked a few tears upon leaving the desert. Such incredible memories, ones that will be treasured forever.They went above and beyond and exposed us to experiences that weren't part of our already incredible itinerary such as meeting and exploring a Nomadic Camp whilst driving to our next destination; stopping off to pick up and purchase us a Tinariwen CD having expressed our enjoyment of the band back here at home. So many personable touches were made.We can't forget our contact made with Mustapha either! From the moment we e-mailed to get an idea of what we wanted to do until the very day of our trip his communication was excellent! Fast, informative and really appreciated!We really didn't want our trip to end and honestly felt a little sad when it did! We had thoroughly enjoyed our time with them and the experiences we had. We would certainly recommend your company to anyone thinking of touring Morocco! Thank you again for such an incredible experience and we hope to one day be back again!!

Amazing experience with Ahmed to Atlas. We booked this day to Atlas with Trekkinginmorocco,net based on the great tripadvisor reviews .This was an amazing experience and one of the absolute must-do activities while in Marrakech. Omar picked us up from our Riad in Marrakech and took us in a very comfortable car 4x4, and even with bottled water). Our guide Ahmed is very knowledgeable about the area and we enjoyed talking to him. He was great with our kids and even took us to the bus station to buy our onward tickets. The $160 for 3 of us while not inexpensive, was worth it for the wonderful experience we had. Highly recommend Trekkinginmorocco,net

Amazing amazing amazing. I had started an email correspondence with the owner, Mustapha, a few months before our trip. He had made several suggestions and I chose a day trip and an overnight. I have to admit, maybe because I live in New York City, I'm a bit paranoid and skeptical. I really didn't want to send the deposit because I was nervous it was a scam, but I decided that they had such a good reputation on Trip Advisor, that I would do it. I was then asked to pay the balance in cash on our first day in Marrakech - the alarm bells started ringing for me. I REALLY did not want to do that. It turned out, that we ended up paying him in the middle of the trip and I'm sure if I had expressed my concerns, we could have done it at the end. Mustapha was great and fast to respond during our correspondence and by the time I met him, felt like he was a friend. We were picked up exactly when we were supposed to and spent several days with our guide Mohammed and our driver Hassan. Mohammed was the nicest, kindest guide who always took into account that we were 6 people ages 12 through 80 and was always able to adjust activities for the individuals in our group. They took such good care of us during our trips and we really felt glad that we could help support the local economy. My kids have decided that their camel trip was one of their favorite things they did, and our lunch at Mustapha's riad was one of the best meals we had. The area is so beautiful and really unexpected for me, as I didn't realize that Morocco would have such a bountiful Garden of Eden.

Toubkal trek and tour. We booked a tour with Atlas and Sahara Tours over email. We dealt with Mustapha who was very responsive and flexible in tailoring our needs and preferences for the tour. Everything ran smoothly. We were picked up at the airport with no issues. On arrival at the Riad (another good review to follow), we were met by Mohammed who was extremely friendly and helpful. We met Mustapha too and he was friendly and happy to chat to us all about life in Morocco. We did the 2 day trek to Toubkal with a great guide (Lasson) and a 2 day tour around Southern Morocco and the Atlas Mountains with Hassan. Both guides were fantastic and looked after us well. On the way to Marrakech, Mustapha checked that we had accommodation and offered to book us somewhere. We already had accommodation booked but appreciated his offer and thought. When we arrived home from our holiday, Mustapha sent us a follow up email to check we had enjoyed ourselves. The customer service and organisation from Atlas and Sahara was perfect. When we return to Morocco, Atlas and Sahara will be our first choice!

Great experience!. We booked a day tour with camel riding, lunch and hiking and really enjoyed the day. Our 6 year-old daughter had a mule to ride while we hiked and we were very happy that the animals are in a special program to safeguard their welfare. Our guides were very friendly and knowledgeable - spoke great English - Rashid was a careful driver which we much appreciated especially with our child and Lahcen was so kind to show us his house (with the impressive view from his terrace), where we where offered tea and delicious coucous. The mountains with snow and all the trees blooming were a fantastic contrast to Marrakech and we felt very safe and comfortable. Will definitely return. Thank you Rashid, Lahcen and Mustapha

Truly special day trip to the Atlas Mountains. My husband treated me to a day tour to the Atlas Mountains for my birthday. This included a 2 hour camel trip through the Imlil Valley, lunch then a 3 hour walk through a Berber Village. We had a wonderful guide (Larson) who explained the culture, village lifecycle, Atlas Mountains in a lot of detail. Mustapha was consistently responsive to all my email queries, and it was a pleasure to meet him in person at their Riad. The lunch that they provide on the day tour was one of the stand out meals on our trip, it's also set in beautiful surroundings with the snow capped Mountains right in front of you. This day tour was a the highlight of our trip, don't do Marrakech without a visit to the Atlas Mountains and go with this tour company for an authentic experience!

Just so easy.... Such preparations as we made for our long weekend in Marrakech were done in a hurry the day before we went and involved a glance at the reviews followed by a brief exchange of emails with Mustapha. I told him where our riad was, that we'd like to walk in the mountains and said be ready to be collected at 9 a.m. It hardly seemed enough for him to go on and he didn't even ask for a deposit, so I wasn't sure that anything would come of it. As it turned out, Hassan, the driver was punctual ( found us with no problem despite the chaos that is Marrakech ) and, though very young, was careful and competent to the point that we didn't have to give our safety a second thought. The Imlil Valley was just spectacular and Mohammed, our guide as we trekked, was a superb companion. Knowledgeable, friendly and unintrusive. We were offered walks of 1, 2, 3 or 4 hours. We opted for 3 and afterwards were fed fantastically ( though they don't do booze out in the mountains so no glass of wine or beer ). We had such a great day we did another tour a day or two later, this time to Ait Benhaddou, beyond the Atlas Mountains, in the direction of the desert, where they shoot the films. This time we were driven by Rashid, who was ace, and we had another Mohammed to guide us. Again, a really, really nice person and excellent teacher who it was just nice to have around. We tipped 100 Derhams, which seemed to be gratefully received.Two quickly improvised days that brought Morocco alive for us and which we'll remember forever.

Far exceeded our expectations... excellent!. This day was brilliant. We had an excellent driver and an extremely knowledgeable guide who answered every question I had about the Atlas Mountains. We were expecting a packed lunch but we had an extravagant Moroccan lunch included in the most spectacular riad in the mountains... on a picturesque rooftop.Walking the in the mountains was amazing and camel trekking brilliant too. I could not recommend these guys enough. Payment was simple through paypal and email communication excellent. Well worth the money.We were 2 women (in 30s) on a holiday in Marrakesh. We felt totally comfortable at all times and not hassled at all. EXCELLENT!

Best experience of my life!. We went on the 3days and 2nights tour to the Sahara Desert with a group of people. We bonded well as a group making it a memorable trip! The first night we stopped by a hotel in the Dades Gorges and it was a pretty boutique hotel. The following morning we set our way to the desert and it was a hell of an experience! Walking through the desert on a camel during sunset, the orange dunes, complete isolation was amazing. We camped out in the desert in a tent, with campfire entertainment and berber music. Our driver Abdullah was amazing and a good man who made this trip fun.

Dont be confused by the low cost alternatives. So i booked ahead and then got to Marrakech and got blasted with cheap alternatives.. We then looked into this with our Riad and found that the cheap ones were just that, cheap! Atlas and Sahara had lunch included a rest bite at the most amazing riad in the mountain, guides that's spoke English (thanks Rashid) so well i thought he lived in UK/US for a while. I cannot recommend this trip enough.. €80 per person for a full day! My old back packer side would say stay in the mountains on your own but as a romantic holiday this was perfect!

Terrific experience!!. We took 4 days and 3 nights trip to Sahara Desert with this company. The arrangement was done very quickly; we got quick response to our emails - as we were concerned about making such a long trip during winter! It turned out my fears were baseless. After reaching Marrakech, Mohammed picked us up personally at the airport, took us to Riad. After couple of days we started our journey where ever-smiling, always-explaining, English-speaking (actually he is multi-lingual and can speak in 5 languages) Rachid was our guide and ever-calm Mustafa was our driver. Over the next 4 days and 3 nights, we went to Berber villages, Ait Ben-haddou, Dades Gorges, Todra Gorges, Merzouga, Erg Chhebi then back through Ouarzazate to Marrakech... the pinnacle was the night we spent in the desert in Erg Chhebi! Children (and us adults as well) will never forget the camel-riding experience! We stayed in very nice places, had very nice local food and had so much fun & laugh... Rachid had been amazing! The long drive was a bit boring at times - but at the end it was definitely worth it! I would highly recommend this company if you have plans for Sahara Desert or Camel-riding trip in Morocco. We will visit Morocco again and tour with this company.

This trip made our holiday. We hired a taxi for the day from Babilonne Tours and this trip was wonderful. Yeussef, our driver, was reliable and interesting and nothing was too much trouble for him. The route to this valley is amazing with outstanding views and lots of crafts and small stalls on the way. We called at a traditional Berber house and were given sweet mint tea and flat bread. We were shown over the house which clung to the hillside. We are over 65s and found this visit easily manageable. On reaching the top of the valley we had lovely views of the snow topped mountains and ate a tasty tagine on a roof top terrace. This tour is a must!

Camel ride Asni Valley and Off Road 4 wheel drive through Tachdirte Valley. Totally amazing, an unbelievable and unmissable experience. If you visit Marrakesh this is a must! I cannot recommend the whole experience highly enough including lunch at Mustaffa's Riad in Imlil. We were fortunate to have a brilliant guide in Hammed, he made our trip such memorable experience with his knowledge and friendliness. My husband was grateful for the very experienced driver, Hassan, who drove us safely through the dirt passes with skill. If we return to Morocco we plan to stay in Mustaffa's beautiful Riad in Imlil with exceptional views of the highest peak in the Atlas Mountains. This company's reputation is everything to them, and their attention to every detail makes your experience beyond expectation. Thank you.

Excellent!!. We can't rate the company highly enough. We planned our visit to Morrocco very last minute and wanted to see as much of the country as possible. Firstly, Mustapha's correspondence by email was very quick and efficient. He even emailed back as late as 10pm at night which was really appreciated due to the imminence of our departure date. Hassan our driver was incredible. Really friendly and knowledgeable. He got in everything we asked for on the tour and more! The 4x4 vehicle was comfortable and modern. I would recommend the company to anyone!!

Fantastic tour!. We took a 4 night trip from Fes to Marrakech last week. There were 7 of us travelling (4 adults and my 3 daughters) and we all agree this tour was the absolute highlight of our 2 week Moroccan holiday! Firstly, the van was very comfortable, clean and safe. We had Jamal as a driver and Hassan as our guide. Both of whom are lovely guys and were very considerate to the fact we were travelling with small children. Hassan was an excellent guide and very knowledgeable. My only suggestion would be that he get a microphone for the back seat passengers. My parents found it difficult to hear when he explained things en route (which was quite a lot). Also, he is a very chatty guy and would talk to the driver non stop, which made it hard to interrupt to ask questions!The highlight of the highlight though was going by camel to the nomadic camp in the Sahara Desert and then sleeping through a sand storm. My children will be talking about that experience for the rest of their lives! And camping will never be good enough for my 4 year old again unless we arrive and depart by camel!! And we loved staying in Imlil which was just gorgeous at this time of year with all the snow. We met Mustapha there who had arranged the whole tour by email with me and was always very prompt replying to my questions and concerns before the trip.Thank you Mustapha, Jamal and Hassan! You showed us a beautiful part of your country and gave us some wonderful memories! I highly recommend these guys!!

A private guided visit to the Glaoui kasbah at Telouet. In the 1960s Gavin Maxwell wrote the received work on the House of Glaoua, 'Lords of the Atlas'. Thami el Glaoui was Pasha of Marrakech and a pro-French Berber war lord (1893-1956) who built the magnificent kasbah at Telouet, using 300 imported craftsmen to adorn its interior. The kasbah is now a semi-ruin, but still very well worth visiting. Atlas & Sahara Day Tours provided me with an English-speaking guide, a Toyota Land Cruiser and a Berber driver so that my wife and I could follow the Maxwell trail and explore this remarkable mountain fastness and its high Atlas surroundings. Jamal was a faultless and considerate driver and Rashid was by far the best and most thoughtful guide I have ever experienced. He was seriously interested in our subject and went to great trouble to translate and explain the whole Berber culture and their struggles both during and since the French colonial period. Nothing was too much trouble. I cannot recommend this company highly enough.

The best thing we did in Marrakech. My husband and I had an amazing experience with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. We were picked up from our Riad right on time and driven to the Imlil Valley with a friendly driver, Hussain, and our guide for the day, Hassan.We began our tour after meeting with Mustapha, the owner who is so friendly and accommodating, and having a traditional mint tea and biscuits. Hassan was extremely knowledgable and interesting and even invited us to meet his family and have a tea in his home, which is an experience I'll treasure. I could not recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours more and will definitely use them the next time we visit Morocco.

The highlight of our Marrakesh trip! . Could not recommend this trip more. We did the 4 hour hike and it was the highlight of our trip. Our guide Mohammed was superb and full of interesting information which provided so much insight into the area, the history and the local people. Lunch was delicious and our favourite meal of our trip to Marrakesh. The walk we did took you up some fairly steep inclines and through villages via some breathtaking reviews and a waterfall. Everything was very well organised with superb communication before our trip and the transfer to and from Marrakesh went without a hitch. We also stopped at the Argen Oil shop on the way back which is worth a visit. We're already planning a return to do a 3 day hike!

Excellent stay in the Atlas mountains. Took a tour into the Atlas Mountains. Easily arranged via email with Mustapha. Collected from our Marrakesh Riad by our guide, Hassan. My wife took a camel ride en route - they attached my camel to hers as I didn't want give it another go having ridden one in Egypt a few years ago! We checked into Riad Jnane in Imlil. Wow! From our bedroom we had a view up Toubkal through a massive panoramic window and over Imlil through another window. The Riad was clean and beautifully furnished with really nice service and food for lunch, dinner and breakfast. It turned out that Hassan grew up in the area and as we walked up the mountain with him the following day we realised he knew literally everyone. He also imparted so much information that really informed us so much about Morocco and also made us reflect on a few other things. How nice it was to see kids playing out, playing football with empty bottles and doing hopscotch in a village where many houses have no electricity. And how polite they were. Almost every child we passed said 'bonjour' to us. When we reached the top the views into the stunning into the valley and looking over the villages. A really great experience run by knowledgeable friendly people, particularly Hassan. Thanks Ian & Jacqui

Well worth the drive. We passed villages and houses clinging to hillsides and an upcoming desert hotel - wow! The mountains are amazing next to the flat landscape and worth a visit to at least the first waterfall.

Great day out exploring. Highly recommend this jeep safari. My 8yr old son described it as 'the best day ever'. The tour takes in a pottery place, an argon oil factory and a superb place for lunch (best tagine on holiday). There is lots of off-roading and the guide was simply brilliant. Our hotel said Mustafa was the best of the local guides and they weren't wrong. Super day out and worth every penny.

Excellent Service. We were in Marrakech for a long weekend and want to to get out of to the mountains. Mustapha was very helpful answering e-mails promply, The driver picked us up from our hotel promptly and delivered us to the riad Jnane in Imlil. A small riad with a very friendly owner. Being the low season we were upgrade to a wonderful room with a picture window over looking the snow capped mountains. We did a couple of short treks and our guide Mohammed was very well informed (having been born in the village and been a guide for compaines like Exodus) with excellent English. On the second day we had lunch on the mountain being met by our cook who had taken a shorter route witha donkey. The food was great and the view was amazing

Amazing Trip Through the Atlas and Deset. We were 5 girls and most of us were a little apprehensive about the camping part of our Morocco trip but it turned out to be the undisputed best part!We did a 3 day two night tour that started in Marrakech and went through the Atlas for one night and then all the way to Merzouga and eneded in Fez with Jamal as our driver and Hassan as our guide.Before the trip, Mustapha was amazing... he patiently waited until I was ready to book (coordinating 5 people is always difficult) and answered all of my questions promptly over email. I had actually asked Mustapha about seeing more of the Atlas mountains before the trip and while he didn't recommend it because of the driving time, I am pretty sure him and Hassan tweaked the trip so that we spent one night in the Atlas and saw a bit more which was much appreciated!Jamal and Hassan came to pick us up. Jamal did not really speak English but always seemed to be in a good mood. Hassan spoke perfect English and answered every single random question that we could think to ask! There is a lot of driving on these tours since you basically go across Morocco and back in 3 days so that's unavoidable but there were plenty of stops on the way and the trip was beautiful. Everywhere we stayed was wonderful and seemed like we were just staying at a friend's home (even our time in the desert camping) and we all enjoyed the trip so much!

It is impossible to name just one highlight because we had so many of them!. We are a couple from Finland and we took 4 days tour which included for example one night at the Sahara and trekking in the Atlas mountains. Our expectations were really high, because of the excellent reviews of the Atlas and Sahara Day Tour. Even so, we were positively surprised and 100% satisfied with our tour.Booking a tour was really easy and Mustapha answered every e-mail really fast and with good English. From our tour it is impossible to name just one highlight of our tour because we had so many unforgettable moments! We saw really amazing places, met nice people, learnt much about Moroccan and Berber culture, ate really delicious food and stayed in wonderfully situated riads. Besides we loved our guide Mohamed, he is absolutely the best guide that you can have!! If you are going to Morocco, you should definitely attend a tour by Atlas and Sahara Tours. There is no way you could spend money better.Vaikka odotukset olivatkin korkealla, niin Atlas and Sahara Tour täytti ja jopa ylitti ne! Olimme 4 päivän kierroksella, joka kattoi muun muassa yön Saharassa sekä vaelluksen Atlas-vuorilla. On mahdotonta tosin mainita vain muutama matkan huippukohta, sillä niitä oli niin paljon! Oppaamme Mohamed oli aivan loistava tyyppi, hän piti meistä erittäin hyvää huolta ja opetti meille erittäin paljon marokko- ja berberikulttuureista. Suosittelemme erittäin lämpimästi, ehdottomasti loistavaa vastinetta rahalle!-Jesse&Jenna

1 day walk and camel ride. We only had a long weekend in Marrakech, but wanted to get out of the city for the day. The email communication was excellent, the guide and driver were right on time and we felt this was great value for money. We did the one day excursion -- a circular walk from Mustapha's Riad through the Berber villages. I can imagine in spring the view would be even better! It was Jan. so a little dry, but so nice to see the countryside and villages. Our guide, Rasheed, answered all our questions and his English was amazing. He was a pleasure to spend the day with and so kind. We had lunch at the Riad (delicious) and then a camel ride. I really wanted to ride the camels (husband not so keen). It was well organized and a fine thing to do, but you are riding on the camels in a dry-ish river bed which follows the main road. You aren't right beside the road, but I felt a bit foolish on the camel and so felt a bit ridiculous. Mind you, this was totally me! The actual camel ride and experience was great. I think if you REALLY want to ride a camel, then book it (as I REALLY wanted to ride and don't know when/if I will again). They are really amazing animals. But I think I might have actually enjoyed a full day trek a bit more. But again, this was down to my decision. The company gave me exactly what I asked for and more. Would book with them again...highly recommend!

Wonderful day out in the Atlas Mountains. The organisation and communication in advance of the trip and all the help provided by Mustapha was brilliant. Rasheed and Hassan our lovely guide and driver also then ensured we had a wonderful trip through the Atlas Mountains to the Kasbah and Ourzazate - would highly recommend Atlas & Sahara Day Tours!!

Great trek. We did the two day trek to Imnane Valley. Great trek for people with no trek experience. The organisation was flawless. We were a group of 4. The sleeping arrangement, trek and transport was organised by the owner Mostafa. The guide who was also named ‘Mostafa’ was very professional.

Remarkable tour company made the best for us. We made 3 tours with Atlas & Sahara. They deserve a most detailed review from us as we travelled 30 countries and never had the service and experience this company provided for us. All of the tours we made is private. They provided us excellent 4x4 ride, with driver and tour guide. We are grateful to Mohammed (tour guide) who offered and make everything we asked. During the trip he took hundreds of pictures and i have uploaded some here. some of them are now priceless as we couldn't get them otherwise.Tour 1: One Day Tour to Addaden valley Day trip, undiscovered Atlas Mountains.This trip is mostly thru the dirt road going up the mountain, and we ended up with the breathtaking scenery, visited local souk (marketplace), berbers village. There were many more stops during the trip, stopped for tea break and find the simplicity of Moroccan life.Tour 2: Three days Sahara trip to Merzouga. This is the most popular Sahara tour to get the best. 2 nights accommodations and meals was good. Many stops on the way, including Kasbah. Tour 3: One day trip to Essaouira. We made the trip as we had an extra day, and thought to be in another part of Morocco. This coast line city with fishing market and old Medina is a beautiful place to visit. Eat fresh fish, walk by the sea is different than climbing up the Atlas Mt.We started our booking early, and the owner, Mustapha was excellent who communicated with us in daily basis, provided us all the info we needed. I am thankful to them. When we finished our tour with Mohammed (tour guide) and Rashid (driver), the moment was emotional, and all of us felt and become friend during our visit. My wife left her shoes in the hotel near Sahara, and Mustapha ad his team managed to get those shoes back to us when we were leaving Marrakech airport. I am not sure where else on the planet we can get this service. Many thanks guys...my friends will visit Morocco with you.

Day trip. I have just returned from Morocco and would definitely recommend Mustapha. He was very prompt and efficient with communication from start to finish. Mustapha was so understanding and flexible in making a trip that suited me- nothing was a bother.I decided on the 1/2 day trek in the Atlas Mountains (Asni Valley and Imlil) from Agadir and then to Marrakech overnight and to return back to Agadir. Rasheed, our driver picked us up from our hotel in Agadir and took us over the Atlas Mountains. He is a fantastic guy and his English was good and had very knowledgeable. A very comfortable journey in a 4 x 4 through out and most importantly with a careful driver too!The meal in the riad was prepared by Omar, something we will never forget - the experience was unique, authentic and so delicious probably one of our nicest meals on the holiday.We walked through a few villages and had plenty of chances to enjoy the great landscapes and definitely needed after such a feast. Lahcen our guide was from one of the villages we hiked through, and he had many interesting stories about life there. A lovely guy who constantly looking out to see if we were ok and happy to change the route to an easier trek.The service we received throughout was very professional and I would highly recommend Atlas & Sahara tours for exploring the Atlas Mountains. I would love to go back with more time in the future and I would definitely book through Atlas & Sahara tours again!Thank you Mustapha, Rasheed, Omar and Lachen.

2 days in Imlil, 2 days in Marrakech and one day in Essaouira. Best tour company in Morroco ever!Based in imlil, Mustapha has been amazing at organizing a great holiday for me and my tight budget. The mountain guides were amazing and thanks to them and their expertise I was able to climb my first 3000+ peak!Food was included and delicious.Transfers were included too making this holiday totally hassle free!Thanks Mustapha and team for being so welcoming!I warmly recommend these guys!

Well worth the day. My fiancé and I went on a day trip yesterday with a half day hike into the mountains then a half day camel ride, our guide was Omar. We had a great time and would highly recommend it. It cost £80pp so a little steep for Marrakech but was well worth it. We learnt a lot about the culture and language and it was a great bit of exercise into some of the most lovely scenery we've experienced anywhere! If you have a day to spare you can't miss this!

The best thing we spent money on. Our 3 day journey through the Atlas mountains to the Sahara will be something we will always treasure and was made possible by our amazing guide Hassan and driver Rashead.From the moment we were picked up from our riad to the moment we were dropped off , we were treated to an interesting and beautiful tour of the country. Hassan was knowledgeable, kind, friendly and engaging, that the whole experience was one which added to our journey.We would thoroughly and without reservation, recommend this tour for anyone wanting to see Morocco and the amazing beauty of the region and culture. And to be guided by a man who clearly loves sharing knowledge about this amazing country.We would definitely do it again. If you are in Morocco, ask for Hassan, and prepare for the trip of a lifetie
Such a special time. We had the best time! The sights are beautiful, the tour is customized, and the tour guides are very knowledgeable. We would highly recommend this tour.

Great trip and amazing experience run by nice people. We organised this trip before we left for Marrakech and it was our first trip there. The communication was great and we paid our deposit hoping for the best. We were promptly collected by the driver Jamal at 9am from the Riad we were staying at. We were driven in a land cruiser to meet with our guide Mohammed. I must admit the whole setup was fantastic and the people involved were brilliant. Mohammed was such a nice guy very knowledgable and accommodating. We had a camel ride and am sure my wife's screams can still be heard there lol but was a great experience. We had the most amazing food at imlil at mustaphas hotel over looking the Atlas Mountains and great scenery. We would really recommend the tour and the operators. Thanks again love Amjid & Fozia

A Memorable Trip. Mustapha Errami, the owner, organised a memorable couple of days for us, a group of four, in and around Imlil. His communications were always prompt and his suggestions very helpful. We were picked up in Marrakech and driven through the mountains to Asni where we met our guide Mohamed Maachou and then travelled on to to Riad Jnane. On arrival, we had tea on the beautiful terrace of the riad, with a spectacular view of the mountains in the background. The decor within the riad also is quite breathtaking, with beautifully painted ceilings and colourful tiles on walls and floors. Our rooms contained all that we might need with air conditioning for the cold evenings.Delicious meals of salads and tangines were prepared each day by Omar who also showed us how to make a vegetable tagine. Everyone at the riad is so friendly and accommodating which made our stay there so special. Mohamed planned two easy walks for us during our trip as one of the family is 81 years old. The first to Aremd involved walking on quite steep slopes. Mimi the mule accompanied us and offered an easier way to travel for my husband’s mother. On day two we walked to Tamatert and had tea with a young family in their home. The scenery is so beautiful, the air so clear and Mohamed provides an knowledgeable and extremely interesting insight into life within the villages.Such a short trip but so many delightful experiences.

Great trekking in the Atlas Mountains.. My wife and I decided to spend a few days of our honeymoon in the Atlas Mountains. We contacted Atlas and Sahara Day Tours before leaving the States. They were very responsive to our questions and presented themselves as a professional company. We were met promptly by a driver at our lodging in Marrakesh in the morning. He drove us up into the Atlas Mountains in a nice SUV and drove in a safe manner. Once we arrived at the riad, we were met by the owner of the company. He was very friendly and we enjoyed speaking with him. The best part of the trip was the flexibility. The first snow of the year happened during our stay. The storm impacted our itinerary, but the company was very flexible and allowed us to switch the dates that we stayed near the riad and the dates we were supposed to hike to a nearby village. Our guide to the village was great. He spoke excellent English and was fun to talk to.
