It was nice that we got to just carry our day packs while the rest of our gear and the food supplies were carried by a mule. The hike to the village wasn't too strenuous, but lasted several hours. The village itself was nice and peaceful. There were no cars and the villagers still lived relatively traditionally. There wasn't much for us to do once we got to the village, but it was probably good for us to unwind a bit and just relax.At the end of our two day tour, we met again with the owner and he again welcomed us and was eager to hear about our trip and ask if there was anything that his company could do to improve the experience. I would highly recommend this company for people looking for a couple of days away from the big city and seeking a nice outdoor experience.

Perfect day trip to Atlas mountains. Driver/guide was local, knowledgeable, spoke good English and had a great sense for appropriate pace of the day. We really enjoyed the excursion and would certainly recommend to others. Easy pickup and drop-off from our hotel.

Day hike and camel ride. We had an absolutely incredible time with Atlas and Sahara Day tours. Our guide, Muhammad, was simply phenomenal. The views were great, the company was professional, and the experience was one that will remain with us for many years.

Excellent day. We booked a day trip with Atlas and Sahara tours, Communicaton throughout was excellent. We had to postpone our trip due to illness, Mustapha was very good in rearranging it for us once we were feeling better. I would definately recommend this , our driver Rasheed picked us up from hotel and drove us to the Imil. We met our guide Mohammad, who took us a on a two hour walk with the most stunning views of the high atlas mountains, we walked through the beautiful walnut grove and on to a berber village. Mohammad spoke perfect English and gave us lots of information on route. Once finished our walk we ate an excellent meal at the Riad Jnane Imil which had the most stunning views. We also got to view the rooms there which looked amazing. This is a fantastic trip to do and would recommend Atlas and Sahara tours, if you are planning a trip to Marrakesh.

Nice trip to the mountains. We came for a short 1-day trip here, everything was really nice, punctual pick-up, a young funny guide, beautiful walk and a very good meal! Hard to find in Marokko, but of course you should be prepared to pay a bit more in order to have this kind of privacy and service ;-) But it really is worth it!

Brilliant tour - great guide and amazing views!. We went on a 1 day tour to the Imlil valley with our great tour guide Muhammad, who spoke excellent English and kept us entertained and informed all day. We were taken to a weekly market which was a cool experience, Muhammad seemed to be the most popular man in town! We stopped for some mint tea at his father's shop which was a nice touch. Once we got to Imlil valley we set on a 2-2.5 hour walk (take some decent footwear), stopping off at a couple of Berber village shops along the way. Muhammad didn't hurry us along and allowed us to enjoy the views at our own pace. We then had a perfect lunch in the riad he manages, with great food and even better views. On the way back Muhammad was kind enough to stop over at an Argon oil cooperative, which wasn't on our original itinerary. Excellent trip, definitely recommend.

A lovely day in the mountains. We booked a family trip with half a day camel trek and half a short hike in the atlas mountains. It was great and we all enjoyed it very much. Our Berber guide was very nice and everything was as described. On reflection I think my nine year old could have handled a longer hike but that was my issue, not the company's.

Dress appropriately for the walks!. Four of us booked two tours with this company.A walking tour of the Marrakech Medina- excellent.And a day trip into the Lower Atlas Mountains for a walk and lunch. I had e-mailed ahead and said that I 'liked walking but was not good on slopes' I was told not to worry as the walk was 'easy'Not sure of the Moroccan definition of the word 'slope' but the first hour was pretty much all climbing. Took it slowly, lots of stops for water and photos. Even so I slipped on the scree, banging my knee.Coming down is always more difficult and this time my husband slipped (parts were extremely loose underfoot) necessitating clinic, hospital, repatriation, operation, leg brace for 6-8 weeks. I feel this could have been avoided with a little more detail of the walk involved. We would have taken our proper walking boots.Would I use this company again. Actually - Yes!I cannot fault the organisation, lunch looked fantastic (unfortunately we could not take full advantage of it) Mustapha's brother stayed with us at the clinic and also went to the hospital with us. And Abdul, our driver, didn't leave us until he delivered us safely back to the riad at midnight. His translating at the hospital was unbelievably helpful and he wouldn't even take a tip.

The highlight of our trip to Morocco!. If you are looking for a tour company, I highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours! Firstly, Mustapha was always quick to reply and provide help whenever needed prior to the tour. Always quick to respond to my emails. My boyfriend and I went on a 3D2N Sahara Tour from Marrakesh to Fes. During the tour, both our driver (Rachid) and our guide (Rachid) were of great company! Rachid spoke fluent English and taught us a lot about Moroccan culture and have truly helped us to feel more at home being in a foreign country. They always made sure that we are well taken care of every step of the way during the tour. We even became friends at the end of our tour! It was truly a great experience hanging out with both Rachid and Rachid. Will definitely choose them again next time we're back in Morocco! :)

Fabulous Company. We had a eight day tour including Marrakech, Sahara desert camel trek and Atlas Mountains. The guide (Driss) and driver (Jamel) we're very knowledgable and friendly. We felt very safe throughout our journey. The food,organization and accommodation was impeccable. Highly recommend to all

5 stars - The Atlas Mountains are a must see. The organisation of the trip was outstanding - Thank you Mustapha.. We did a day trip in the foothills of the Atlas Mountains. Our guide, Rashid had a very high level of English and was keen to tell us all about the area and their culture. We learnt so much from him and thoroughly enjoyed our time with him. On the way to the Atlas mountains we where able to stop of at the Aragon oil co-op - a super treat.The walk was great, sometimes tough in the heat but our guide went at our pace. Rashid was very willing to take pictures of us, always ensuring the great views were captured as well. We finished our day with a fantastic filling meal on the roof top of the Riad that Mustapha owns, a wonderful way to end the day.

Atlas mountain trek avec Mustafa, Mohammed, Omar and co.. Wonderful experience, helped by the fact that I had Mustafa, Mohammed, and Omar to myself for the entire trip. Very helpful, lovely pleasant, welcoming, friendly, and kind people. Definitely will be back, maybe next time for my honeymoon, or to scale even higher with Omar next time!All the best guys. Very nice to meet you all. Sami

Best Tours in Marrakech. This is the only tour company to use when in Marrakech.Communication with Mustapha is impeccable and he answers every e-mail within the hour.We took 2 tours and they were both great with polite and English speaking guides.

First Class at all times. I have been out in Imlil now on 3 separate occasions and used Mustapha and his brothers twice. Having stayed at the Riad he owns and manages with his two brothers Omar and Mohamed I can simply say that it the service I received and the polite and business like way in which they run the tours is fabulous.As a professional photographer they go out of their way to extend hospitality and show you more. Riad Jnane is very comfortable and the food all cooked by Omar - fantastic.Extensions this year mean there are more lovely rooms, internet is slow but it is in the Atlas mountains - what would you expect ?Will be returning again and be using the services of the company.Thank you

The great guide Mohammed. Staying at the Riad Les Trois Mages in Marrakech and organised the guided tour through them. Collected from the Riad at 9.30am by Mohammed who spoke excellent English. After about 2 hours we reach Imlil where we were met by our English speaking guide Mohammed. We were a party of 4.Mohammed explained that we were going on a circular walk into the lower Atlas mountains. The ascent was sometimes steep and Mohammed kept the pace just right so that we could stay together. My wife did find this hard work & Mohammed would ensure that we had regular stops to rest and drink water. The views were stunning.On our way down, we went via a small waterfall which was full of Moroccans having a great time. We stopped for about 15 minutes for a rest and to take pictures. Mohammed had brought along extra water for us.Mohammed took us to the Riad Jnane Imlil where we had a huge lunch. Our starter was a whole variety of salad followed by chicken tanjine. Dessert was fruit. We were really stuffed. The cost was DH 150 per person which was excellent value.Once we had finished lunch, our driver took us back to our RiadAn absolutely enjoyable day out which was all down to our guide Mohammed taking us into the mountains at a easy pace.Really worth doing.

Personal, Private and Perfect. We booked a day tour with a half day camel trek and half day hike through the Atlas Mountains. Mustapha was very helpful in the organising and the day went without a hitch. We were picked up from our hotel by Rashid and driven towards the camel place, through the centre of Marrakech where he dropped in a few interesting facts about Marrakech here and there, we also stopped at a Berber Market which was on that day, When we met at the camel pick up point we met our guide Hassan who led us on our camel trek but stayed relatively quiet to give us the chance to enjoy the experience. We were then driven to a Riad where we had our own private terrace for a three course traditional Moroccan meal where we could admire the views and witness the Walnut harvest. We then went on a hike with Hassan, sturdy shoes highly recommended as the terrain was a bit tough. The views were stunning and Hassan is clearly very knowledgeable. We were then driven at the end of it all back to our hotel. An amazing day and one of the most memorable things we have ever done. Thank you so much Mustapha, Hassan and Rashid.

Perfect day. To say we enjoyed our day was an understatement. Getting past the precise organisation, the luxurious transport, perfect English speaking guide and a meal at the end of the day to die for, this was a day that remain in mine and my new husband's memories for a long long time. When you book a one day tour to anywhere you always feel that you'll barely be able to scratch the surface, but this trip ticked more than all the boxes. Our guide was gracious, entertaining, insightful and patient. We asked for the long walk (3 1/2h) and it was judged to perfection. The scenery was stunning and the pace was enjoyable. There were lots and lots of photo opportunities. If we could stay for longer we would, in fact we got a sneak preview of the new rooms... If only we weren't leaving tomorrow. Would highly recommend and we will be back.

Hike the Atlas Mountains!. This was by far my husband's and my favorite part of our trip to Morocco. We had an unbelievable English speaking guide Rashid. He was extremely friendly and knowledgable and made our experience one to remember. We hiked through many local villages and ate lunch at a restaurant with 360 degree views of the Atlas mountains. The food was delicious. The entire experience was very rewarding, and we are thrilled that we did it!

Beautiful experience expertly organised. My Girlfriend and I booked a trip to the Alas mountains whilst in Marrakech a day earlier. Mustapha was very accommodating and was able to help show flexibility with our budget. We were collected in a big comfortable car and taken to the camel ride which was great fun. We were then taken to our Riad Jnane Imlil for lunch. We had the whole Riad to ourselves and the view from the balcony was simply breath-taking. The lunch was truly exceptional throughout our stay in this Riad. The chef cooked the best food we had whilst in Morocco!The hikes from the Riad were wonderful and not too strenuous and everything was very well organised. Would highly recommend using these guys.

great day out with an excellent guide!. really great day out, we had a fantastic time. the pick up was prompt, the car comfortable. the guide met us and spoke very good English and was very well informed about all of the local area. we had a lovely trek and then went to the hotel for lunch which was delicious and served on the roof top terrace with views of the high atlas. we then were taken for a camel trek which was well organised and good fun. I would definitely recommend using this company, they were very communicative and helpful during the booking process and very reassuring in the depth of their knowledge.

Best Tour guide ever!. We went on a memorable day trip to the Atlas mountain region. Our incredible guide Mohammed was not only a mine of interesting information about the area he grew up in, but was sensitive to our pace (travelling with young kids and a lot of camera kit) and particular wishes at all times. The kids will never forget crossing a stream on camels!

4 day Atlas and Sahara Tour . We are two 25yr old Australian girls who completed a four day/three night tour of the Atlas Mountains and the Sahara during our stay in Morocco. This tour was great from start to finish, with our original booking with Mustapha an easy and efficient process. Mohammed our guide and Rachid our driver could not have been better. They were both extremely knowledgeable. Mohammed was engaging and full of information for every place we visited. Both Mohammed and Rachid had great insights into the different areas of Morocco, combining their extensive knowledge of the area with their personal experiences and way of life. Both went above and beyond for all of needs and concerns. When we fell ill, Mohammed did everything to ensure we were comfortable and we were both very grateful. The tour itself is incredible, photos don't do the places justice. Highlights include the nomadic camp and camel ride into he sunset in the Sahara, the drive through the Atlas Mountains and the Dandes and Toudra gorges and the beautiful hike through Imlil.We thoroughly enjoyed our tour and would recommend it as a must do for anyone visiting Morocco. Pauline and Mirjana

Highly recommended. This was such a wonderful highlight to our holiday in Marrakech and a real contrast to the city. What a great service - Mustafa was able to balance the needs of both my husband and myself so that we both had a walk to suit our different abilities - a shorter one for me then an amazing lunch at the riad, followed by a more exertive walk for him while I enjoyed a quiet time on the terrace. We had a glimpse at a traditional village and culture and a wonderful day in the High Altas. You just don't know when you book something like this online, but Mustafa's team were kind, attentive and helpful through the day and we would highly recommend them.

Camel Trekking in Asni Valley. My family had an amazing camel trek in Ansi valley which was provided by this great company. Arranging this trek was such an easy process as Mustapha was always very helpful and prompt when answering questions. We cannot praise our guide Mohammed enough, who was simply fantastic! He was very articulate whether he was speaking in Arabic or English and extremely knowledgeable in the history of the villages that we passed during our trek and its people. He is proud of his berber culture and rightly so as they are amazing people who make everyone that visits Morocco feel very welcomed. So thank you!We also have to say a big thank you again to Rachid and Syed who also accompanied us during our trek. They had an extremely long day that started at 5am with them bringing the camels to our starting point and also having to look after them and guide them during our trek.The camel ride itself was incredible, the views were stunning and really showed the true beauty of Morocco- this was by far our best day of our holiday! Following the 4 hour camel trek we had a lovely tangine at Riad Jhane Imlil (so big thanks to chef again).The hotel itself is amazing with beautiful views of the Atlas Mountains. All in all this was a fantastic experience that we will never forget and we look forward to planning more treks with Altas and Sahara tours next time we are in Morocco.

Atlas Camel Trip and Trek. An amazing day with our guide Hassan who really looked after us and showed us the best of Moroccan culture. Nothing was too much trouble and he genuinely wanted us to get the best insight into the culture that he is so rightly proud of. Email advice and support from Mustapha pre our visit was prompt and helpful. Thank you all so much. Stay at your Riad next

Great trip and great people. A friend and I had a fantastic camel ride / hiking trip with Atlas and Sahara a couple of weeks ago. Mohamed and his driver (sorry - can't remember his name - great fellow though) were right on time to pick us up in Marrakech. The camel ride was very interesting and was point-to-point through farmland and national park. I was afraid that it would be just a short loop, but was happy that we covered some ground. Mohamed gave fantastic information about the people and landscape of this part of Morocco. After, we had a fantastic lunch at the company's beautiful riad in Imlil before doing a 2 hour hike in the area. Throughout we had great views of the mountains and small villages in the valley and saw many interesting sights. Overall, the company and Mohamed are highly recommended. Next time I am in Morocco, I hope to do a multi-day trip in the area with this company.

Looking for the perfect tour company to Morocco? You found it!!. I always prefer to use a local company rather than a US or foreign owned one when travelling, but it can be risky. With the Atlas I experienced the absolute best of Morocco with caring, knowledgeable guides for our 5 day tour, who went way beyond the itinerary in providing services. For instance after the airline lost my daughter's bag, our guide Hassan made multiple extra trips to the airport, used local contacts and did everything possible to help us retrieve it, even after the trip ended his efforts didn't stop. In addition to giving us a fascinating authentic experience, they made travelling pleasant easy and seemless by having crunched all the details and and anticipating our needs.While we regrettably didn't not stay at the Atlas hotel Inmlil, Mustapha invited us to be his guest for a absolutely delicious dinner under the stars in his spectacularly beautiful new hotel. Can't wait to visit again. This time I will take them to the Sahara

I can't praise this tour enough. I took my children ( aged 9 and 10) on a two day tour of the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara Tours. It was the first time my children had done anything like this, and my first time in Morocco. It was extraordinary. They bent over backwards to look after us and made the children feel utterly at home. The tour was amazing, treking up to remote villages and on the second day our mountain guide helped us to climb one of the peaks, encouraging and helping the children all the way to the top. What makes this company stand out though was the attention to detail: as well as the essentials, our guide had in his backpack Moroccan biscuits and nuts for the children, Moroccan tea to boil at the mountain peak, spare socks, everything we could have ever needed. Our guide was also incredibly knowledgeable, not just about the mountains, but about the history of Morocco, Islam and the local area. It was a fascinating two days and I cannot recommend or thank the guide enough.

A great day excursion from Marrakesh. We had a brilliant day with this company during a one week trip to Medina Gardens Hotel in Marrakech (which is amazing!). For peace of mind we booked this trip before travelling to Morocco. We were picked up (just us two) by a driver and guide and taken to Imil in the high atlas. Here we went to the Riad that Mustapha owns for a freshen up and some mint team of the roof terrace over looking Mount Toukbal. Mohamed (a very pleasant, knowledge, local, friendly guide) then led is around a 3 hour hike where we really experienced the mountains, local villages and local people. Mohamed couldn't do enough to help, he knew everyone (!) and even bought us some fresh fruit for the top! We then had a really generous lunch back at the Riad with salad, lentil Tagine, chicken Tagine and cous cous and flat bread. It was delicious! The Riad is stunning and the location amazing. We then got driven back down the valley for a camel trek along the (mainly) dried up river bed. This was a great experience and was quite exciting because of the terrain and water splashes. We were then driven back to the hotel. Mohamed was outstanding and we really enjoyed spending time with him. The experience was genuinely off the beaten track and the local knowledge of the guide was great. This have us the best insight into the real Morrocco of our whole holiday. The heart of this people is to involve more local people in tourism and to share the benefits of tourism with the local people. A sustainable and responsible approach which benefits everyone. We would love to do more tours with the company in the future - and wholeheartedly recommend them to you.

Wonderful ..... Words are not enough.. Brilliant tour wonderful helpers knowledgeable guides and such a lot to take in. The Moroccan country is truly amazing. The Berber way of life still existing in the north, women play a significant role and hold powerful positions, the architecture, the villages, the oases, everything is just so splendid. Memorable forever.

Everything I had hoped for. The best tour I have ever taken. Simply. We were treated to an amazing experience by Muhammed and Rashid that we could not have gotten from any other tour company. They have intimate local knowledge of the area the people and its history that provides a trip that I dont believe can be bettered. I wish we were staying longer so we could do more.

Excellent facilities for group expeditions. I led an expedition of 36 young people and 17 adults to the High Atlas and on recommendation had Mohamed, Mustafa and Ibrahim deal with our logistics. A camp site was made within trees on the outskirts of Imlil that had toilet and wash facilities as well as tentage. Mohamed provided a cook who catered for the whole group. Mohamed provided mules and muleteers and a further camp adjacent to the Toubkal Refuge. The Guides were excellent and worked well with leaders and young people. They made many friends. I came away from the High Atlas phase (we went on to the Middle Atlas & Erg Chebbi) very pleased with the support and friendship we had in Imlil and would highly recommend the company for groups to use.

excellent. words cant describe!. Just had the most fantastic day with our guide Mohammed and driver Racheed. From the very beginning we were made to feel welcome and are now able to take home an amazing unique experience. All I can say is don't go for the big companies. If you are in morroco and want a once in a lifetime experience you will not be disappointed spending your time with these wonderful people! Thank you to Mustapha as well for organising our day. We will be back !!

Brilliant...JUST brilliant!!. We did the Toubkhal 2 day hiking tour and it was absolutely amazing. Can't recommend this tour company enough. Everything went smoothly from the moment I first made contact with Myustapha to the celebratory mint tea after returning from the hike itself. Mustapha took care of everything. The guide he provided was excellent. He was so patient and encouraging even though he himself could have no water or food as it was Ramadan. The food that was provided on the tour was the best we had throughout our whole Moroccan trip (and this is no lie!!). The hike itself is a must. Mustapha (the owner of this tour company) went above and beyond to assist me. He even organised my overnight train tickets which were not part of his role at all. I really can't thank him enough for this. He also gave us plenty of helpful advise on other aspects of our trip. If you want a great tour and everything to run smoothly, use the best....use Atlast & Sahara Day tours :)

Magical experience. We had a wonderful time on our tour. We were joined by another English couple on our trip and they were really nice people. We set off early and drove into the mountains. This is where the pace of life slowed down and it all became pleasantly rural. The tour was run by Burbars, the people that have lived in the mountains for century’s. They were really friendly and welcoming. The walk was great, mixing with locals and seeing some incredible sites in the mountains. It was followed by a superb lamb tagine which we enjoyed on the roof in surrounded by towering mountains. We then got on camels for half hour and rode through a river bed, the whole thing was magic. We had a great guide and the setting was second to none.

Awesome guide, attentive company, and stunning views!. Mustapha was a pleasure to work with. He responds quickly to emails, is very accommodating to all questions, and is willing to work with you to make your experience perfect. Out guide Mohammad was incredibly knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Mohammad made sure we saw some amazing scenery and that we were able to have some genuine interactions with the locals along the way. He also gave us plenty of recommendations on where to buy goods and how the culture works with respect to bartering for merchandise. If I return to this area I would love to see and stay in the Riad that was being renovated at the time. The meal we at there for out lunch stop was delicious and I would have loved to enjoy more of the views and hikes in the surrounding area. The Atlas Mountains were such a unique surprise and different from Marrakech, that I truly felt like I had left Morocco and visited another country. Thanks again for the incredible hospitality and I would highly recommend this tour company to other travelers!

Beautiful day trip to explore the mountains. My boyfriend and I did a day trip from Marrakech to the Atlas Mountains (the Ait Mizane valley day trip).We were picked up promptly from our hotel at 9am and driven into the mountains - some of the roads were quite hairy but our driver was really great and pointed out some interesting things along the way.When we arrived in the mountains we were greeted with fresh mint tea at a riad and our English speaking tour guide who spent some time getting to know us and learning about us. He then offered some options for the walk (2, 3, 4 hour options).We went for the 3 hour option and set off. The valley was stunning and the local people were all really pleasant. Our tour guide was absolutely brilliant and would stop and talk to us about the local communities, the plants that grew in the valley and what they were used for, and offered to take some pictures of us along the way.When we returned to the riad we had our best meal in Morocco - the tagine was amazing!We took a scenic drive back to Marrakech to see more of the countryside.Throughout the booking process Mustapha was great to deal with and I would absolutely recommend this to anyone looking to get out of Marrakech.Next time we'll definitely book a trip longer than just one day!

Great experience. My husband and I arrived in Morocco in the heat of the summer, at the beginning of Ramadan. We were unsure whether we had made a foolish mistake to book a 3-day hiking trip in the Atlas mountains. But Atlas and Sahara Day Tours helped make our stay very enjoyable and memorable. Mohammed was a friendly and personable guide, who thoughtfully attended to our needs for water and food despite abstaining himself. Everything had been thought of. We especially enjoyed our stay at the Riad in Imlil on the second night of the journey. One of the most comfortable and luxurious stays we've had, fancy hotels included! The chicken tagine was particularly good, too. Mohammed noted my question about Moroccan argan oil, and he arranged it so that on our way back to the airport we stopped at the Women's Cooperative to buy some. Truly thoughtful, and generous.

Terrific company and tour. Excellent host!. We did the 3 day / 2 night tour from Marrakech to the Sahara and through the Atlas Mountains. Our guide Rachid, was amazing and really made the trip for us. He is very knowledgeable about the area and took time to explain the details and history of everything we experienced. We even stopped by his sister's house while hiking by her village for mint tea and it was a lovely gesture as it is currently Ramadan. Also, his English and French are near perfect and communication was a breeze. I recommend you request Rachid as your host with Sahara tours as we really could not possibly had such a wonderful without him. The driver (also Rachid) was patient and kind.

The Best 3 Days of Our Holiday. We booked the 3 day trip to the Sahara and then the Atlas mountains. Our guide Hassan was friendly and very knowledgeable and made sure we had everything we needed for our trip. The organisation and communication of the company was fantastic. The trip was expensive compared to offers we received once in Marrakech but worth every penny, most other companies will not include food and water and you will be part of a large mixed tour. I cannot recommend this trip and company enough . The camel ride and camping was brilliant much more than we expected the tent had a double bed and the camp had showers...definitely did not expect that in the desert. The food at every stop is exceptional much better than anything we found in the centre of Marrakech or at our hotel. The Riad which we stayed in in the Atlas mountains which is owned by the company is beautiful with incredible views and very friendly and helpful staff. Overall I cannot put into words the amazing experience this company will provide you with I would recommend them to anyone and everyone.

Excellent four day hike. We did a four day hike with this company in June. Excellent organisation and guiding. Quite expensive but if you are looking to save yourself the hassle of organising when in Morroco this company will not fail to deliver. Riad in an excellent spot and currently getting refurbished. Will be fantastic when done!

Great Guide and Amazing Views of Atlas. Me and my Fiancé had a day tour of the Atlas mountains and it was a truly awakening and memorable experience. Muhammad our guide who travelled with us in the morning with our driver as part of the tour operator package was very knowledgeable about the Atlas mountains and surrounding areas having grown up around there. He had a good command of the English language and was able to show us all the safest and best parts of the mountains, we saw local Berber people and dined on top of a Riad high up the mountains where we had the best views of the surrounding Atlas mountains and had the opportunity to meet with the great Mustapha whom we had contact with in the lead up to the day in arranging our trip and organising our meal on the rooftop of the Riad. It was at this Riad I proposed to my now Fiancé and was fortunate to have Muhammad (our guide) on hand to capture the moment. A truly personal, well guided and well organised tour overall with great staff who are extremely knowledgeable and will ensure you have a great experience from beginning to end.

Awesome Experience of Life in the Atlas Mountain Region. I booked a day trip via email and must say that Mustapha the company owner is friendly and fantastic. I was given all the details, options and pricings.We visited in early June 2015 and were collected from our Marrakech hotel by Rachid in a new 4x4 who is knowledgeable and polite - he was early hence no waiting around for us at all. The entire day was superb. From the hiking of the mountain to the top village, visiting the beautiful waterfall, walking through some of the villages located in the mountains, lunch with 360 degree view of the spectacular scenery to the finale camel ride.Mohammed was our trek guide has extensive knowledge of the areas as well as Morrocon history - certainly gained more knowledge.Thank you to Mustapha and his team. The beef tagine is incomparable to any others I have had elsewhere in Morroco. The riad is beautiful.

An amazing trek!. We have just returned from a 3 day trek in the Atlas Mountains and it was an amazing experience. We booked via the email address on the website and Mustapha was very responsive. We only paid a deposit up front via PayPal with the rest of the payment taken at the start of the trip. We spent 3 days on the circular 3 valleys trek with our excellent guide Rashid and our cook and muleteer Mustapha. We had great fun with them and saw the most incredible scenery. To see Berber life first hand and walk in the mountains for 3 days was excellent. The food was superb, the best we have had in 10 days in Morocco! To be greeted by Mustapha half way up a mountain pass with a freshly cooked tagine and salad is something to be experienced. The accommodation in Berber villages was warm, welcoming, had hot showers and Mustapha would again cook amazing food. Rashid couldn't have been a nicer guide, he was always there to help, chatted along the way and we learnt a lot about his way of life. The company is local to the Imlil valley and the staff are all local which gives you a very real experience. We ended our trip in Mustapha, the owners, Riad in the shadows of Mount Toubkhal which looks a wonderful place to stay. This review doesn't really articulate how spectacular this trip was. Imlil and surrounding valleys are unspoilt and the Berber people are truly welcoming. Highly recommended trip!

Riding & walking in the High Atlas with Atlas & Sahara Tours. Everything went like clockwork from when we arrived at Marrakech airport - transport to Riad Zayane Atlas in the Marrakech medina - lovely room and breakfast on the roof terrace. Pick up to take us to Moulay Brahim to meet Mustapha and our guide and translator Muhammed and Rashid our horse handler and the stallions who we rode over the mountains for 3 days. Full on and amazing riding through extraordinary landscape and Berber villages. Fantastic food including meals brought over the mountain pass for us by mule complete with cook and cushions! Arrived at Riad Jnane in Imlil - the best place to stay - beautiful rooms, wonderful food and service. Everyone so kind and helpful including the builders who are extending the building to give even better views from the roof terrace. Then a guided walk up Mount Toubkal including sliding down through the snow (spare clothes advised as snow was wet). An amazing and demanding experience and very enjoyable. Thank you Mustapha, Mohammed and the team. xx

4 night 5 day Atlas/Sahara. Our time with lahcen as well as Muhammad couldn't of been more pleasant. So worth the money. Both the Atlas Mountains and the Sahara are a must while in Marrakech. Mustapha was brilliant in keeping contact and I highly recommend anyone choosing these guys to guide you.Nice brand new, air conditioned vehicles, always asking you if you need a bathroom (which was my case, ha) at a completely relaxed, educational, fun pace.

Fantastic Day Trip in Atlas Mountains. We had a great day trip to the Atlas Mountains with our tour guide Omar. He was good company and very knowledgable, making the trip extremely enjoyable. The lunch in Imlil was one of our best meals of the holiday! We would fully recommend this company!

Great day trip. We had a trip to the Atlas Mountains and it was great. We were picked up as a group of 6 from our riad, and taken with commentary out to the mountains where we went on a camel ride. Following that we had a delicious lunch in Imli before a short walk to a nearby waterfall. We were in great hands throughout, with our friendly guide and driver, who pointed out interesting landmarks and made us feel very safe. The lunch at the local riad in Imli was also one of the best meals we had. The trip was great value and really easy to organise by email before I came out. I would recommend.

An amazing day trip in the Atlas Mountains. We had such a wonderful daytrip to the Atlas Mountains. Our guide Mustafa and driver Ibrahim were fantastic - very funny and informative, and really went above and beyond to make the trip the highlight of our holiday. We were collected from our riad promptly, and driven to the mountains, stopping in Asni for a 1.5 hour camel trek around the beautiful countryside and were shown all the different herbs and plants by Mustafa. We then passed by a berber market (this one was only on Saturdays) and headed up the mountains to Imlil valley.We had a traditional Morrocan lunch (really delicious) at the owner's (also Mustafa!) riad, which is being extended and is really well decorated. We then did a two hour walking trek up around the mountain trails and through the Berber villages. Mustafa was great at finding amazing photo opportunities for us (including a rickety rope bridge over a stream, a rock in the middle of a waterfall, and with the mountain villages as a backdrop). A huge thank you again to Mustafa and Ibrahim - the trip really was even more than we had hoped, and you made it a wonderful experience to cherish.

3 day hike in Atlas mountains and valleys. We had an amazing 3 day hike (26th - 28th April 2015) with amazing people, amazing views and an amazing guide. Mustapha understood our requirements and was responsive and helpful with the booking. Our guide Hassan was knowledgeable, fun and ensured our experience was the best. Our provisions and back packs were looked after by another Hassan who walked ahead with the mule each day to prepare our wonderful tasty meals. The Berber house in the mountain village and the valley riad which we stayed in were perfect. I would highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours, I will definitely be going back. Thank you for such a wonderful time.

Helpful, caring and kind!. Booking a day trip was made so simple via email as Mustapha answers quickly and helpfully. As we were a family group of 9 people aged between 18 and 81 we needed a tour to suit us all. Pick up was prompt and travel to the mountains safe and comfortable. Our guide Mohammed was friendly and his English good. We were also accompanied by Ibrahim and Abdul and their two trusty mules. During our walk we were all so cared for. In typical Brit style we didn't really have the right footwear on but we were all guided and helped when necessary. We were especially touched by the care given to our older members. Lunch was incredible and the Riad exquisite. We all considered our day excellent value. As it was my mums 80 th birthday the next day we were so touched again when Mohammed presented her with a gorgeous top and scarf. An absolutely brilliant trip.

Fantastic 1/2 day trek 1/2 day camel ride. I booked this trip a couple of weeks before we flew to Morocco- Mustapha was really helpful via email to advise us on what the best trip was for us and to assist in setting it up. The trek was great fun and we had an awesome tour guide. We wanted to keep the tour private for just myself and my boyfriend and Mustapha was very accommodating with this. I would certainly book this day trip again, I could not recommend this enough.

It's a must!. There are a multitude of reasons to book an excursion with Atlas and Sahara Day tours, the main being our wonderful tour guide, Mohammed!We booked two trips, the first being the day trip to the Ouzoud waterfalls, which was absolutely stunning, and due to the fact that we enjoyed the trip and the company of our tour guide so much, we then booked the Combined day trip to the Atlas Mountains (The trip I'd recommend the most out of the two) Spending two days with Mohammed, who isn't just helpful and knowledgeable, but accommodating and friendly, is what made the tour.We booked both trips extremely last minute, and Mustapha, who we had initial contact with, arranged everything on short notice.I really cannot recommend you use them enough!

Perfect day tour in Atlas mountains. Mustapha organised out trip to perfection. We were collected from our riad in Marrakech by a polite and friendly driver and driven to the foothills of the Atlas mountains where we were collected by our guide Muhammad. Because my partner is allergic to horses, they kindly moved our camels away from the main mounting point (where there were quite a few horses), and we got on from there.We enjoyed a lovely couple of hours riding through the breathtaking agricultural landscape and Berber villages, before being taken by car further up the mountains where we met Mustapha - who is just adding the finishing touches to his new guesthouse - which looks like it is going to be a fantastic place to stay when complete. We then ate some lunch, and headed off on a 2 hour hike at a leisurely and enjoyable pace, where we saw the tallest peak in North Africa right in front of us.Our guide was polite and incredibly knowledgeable - he adapted well to suit our pace of walking.Of course, you can't see a huge amount in just a day tour - but we definitely got a good feel for what life in the mountains is like. A perfect introduction for a more in depth experience - the next time we return! Highly recommended.

Amazing day in the Atlas Mountains. Did a day tour while on a short break to Marrakech, was one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide for the day Mohammad made the day even more memorable, with his knowledge and passion for the area.The walk in the foothills of the mountain have certainly made me want to come back and climb to the top of Toubkal one day! The camel ride was such fun and a great way to see more of the valley. 10/10 to Atlas Tours and the staff. Thank you! Sandra and Rich

4 day tour from Marrakech. Just finished our 4 day tour, really good! Our guide Rachid was very helpful and friendly, everything was well organized and went smoothly. Sahara dunes were well worth the long drive, a truly unique experience although our favourite day was the last day walking in the beautiful Atlas mountains.As it was a private tour we were able to do everything at our own pace, stop for pictures on the drives or pop into a kasbah that looked interesting.Rooms were pleasant and the food everywhere was fantastic so we are happy customers!

A day well spent. As we were only in Marrakesh for a short time, we wanted to get the most out of it.Atlas and sahara tours arranged a private one day excursion, including camel rides, trekking in the Atlas mountains and an excellent traditional lunch. Highly recommended!

Ourika Valley. What a fantastic trip! There are 3 of us in our family and the driver picked us up from our hotel bang on time. We picked up our guide, Mohammed, shortly afterwards and he made the trip really enjoyable. His English was excellent. We have been on personal guided trips in other countries and this was the best ever guided tour we have been on. The Berber house family were v friendly, the trip to see the waterfall beautiful and lunch by the side of the river was a lovely experience.

really great 4 with 4 children days recommended. 4 days of fantastic travels and sights into Ait Ben Haddou, Dedra Gorge, Ouzazate, camel trecking and sleeping in the sahara, Todres gorge, and the high Atlas at Imlil. All inclusive clean accomodation and a lovely guide Mustapha. my children are age 7 to 14. they had a geat time.

Wonderful day out. Just a quick note (now we are back home) to say how much we enjoyed out day with your company. Your guide was great and couldn’t have been more helpful. It was so good that you were able to shift the itinerary slightly to accommodate our needs through the day. For example, changing the camel ride from 2 hours to just one hour when the children were feeling tired. My daughter was really proud that she had ridden on a camel and a mule all in one day! The food was lovely and the scenery absolutely beautiful. I am so glad we booked with you.

day trip into the mountains. What a day! Our guides were incredible and so knowledgeable. it was a real privilege to go on this tour and the lunch we had at the end was outstanding. such a contrast from the city so whatever you do go on this!

When in Marrakech, Its A Must!. theres no way to skip a visit to Marrakech without atleast having one day trip with Atlas and Sahara Toursi sent an email and right away, they give me many option with price to chooseThe pickup time was on time the driver,our guide and the food served on the end of our journey is by far most delicious during our trip in the cityUnfortunetly we didnt have enough time to choose another option but the experience of relatively easy hike and scenery of Atlas Mountain and Berber Village itself are definetly a treaton our way down, we stopped by in our guide's house and stop for Morrocan Teahowever sometimes we feel pace is a bit slow because our guide stopped by many times and have few minutes chat whenever he meet some friends on our waybut thats okay, that gave us time to snap some decent pictures as welli highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours

I cannot recommend this company enough!. The organisation of the whole trip was outstanding with a fantastic guide and in awe of everything that we saw. We did a two day trek through the Atlas Mountains. Our guide, Mohammad, had a very high level of English and was keen to tell us all about the area and their culture. We learnt so much from him and thoroughly enjoyed sharing stories with him. The walk was great, a good mixture of uphill and flat with stunning views. Mohammad was very willing to take pictures of us, always ensuring the great views were captured as well. We stopped for lunch and were expecting a sandwich or something similar considering how remote we were. We were taken aback when a gorgeous meatball tagine arrived with pasta and fresh salad. We felt very well looked after and refuelled for the next leg of the journey. We stayed overnight with a local villager which was another fantastic experience. Getting to speak to locals through Mohammad was such a pleasure. We were once again very pleasantly surprised by the food prepared by the guides with such limited resources. Mohammad said to us that we weren’t tourists we were his guests, and that is the best way that I can sum up how we felt. The Atlas Mountains are a must see – stunning views, such contrasting landscapes and amazing locals.

Ok-but not much more. We booked a trip for 3 days to explore the valleys beyond Quarzazate towards Merzouga, a cable trip and overnight stay in the desert and the trip back to Quarzazate. This area is rich in nature, geology, history and culture, but unfortunately our guide was a driver, not a guide. We did not get any sponteous information and even when questioned, he did not have much knowledge, actually less than our guide book. This was rather disappointing, since our understanding was that we had booked a guided trip. The driver was speaking on the phone most of the time he was driving and made sure to meet his friends when we met other groups (which we frequently did, at most lunch stops and night stops. The desert trip included a big group and we had to walk to meet returning camels because the company was overbooked. Just do not have too many romantic notions about this Sahara experience.Otherwise, the country is beautiful and we learned a lot about the history and their way of building Kasbahs in the end from other guides. Tip: Take the trip but make sure you get an english speaking guide, which are apparently rare at this company! Or rent a trip mor close to the area wherer the guides have more local knowledge of the flora/fauna/traditions etc.

1 day MTB tour in the Atlas. A great day mountain biking from Imlil to Asni, via Tizi n'Tamaterte and Imnane valley with a knowledgeable guide (Marouane) and driver (Mohammed). Collected from our hotel precisely as arranged. Great lunch. This company is very customer-focused, and setting everything up with Mustapha from the UK was pleasant and efficient.

Amazing day. This is a must for anyone visiting Marrakech!We contact them via email (in English) before we left and were given a choice of tours. We picked the Ourika valley day trip which I'd highly recommend. Our driver picked us up in our at our Riad (which we were worried about since it was down an alley) in a big Toyota Landcruiser and drove us to meet our guide. On the way he was shaken down by some dodgy cops looking for money but it got sorted easily and we were back on our way. Muhammad our guide was fantastic all day, he spoke good English and there didn't seem to be a question he didn't have the answer to.Our day started at a traditional Berber house where we were shown how to make mint tea and made some delicious bread. We were then shown around the house to see how they lived before setting off into the mountains, stopping for some photos on the way. We trekked up to a number of waterfalls, our guide being very accommodating despite our slow speed. Once back down we had a delicious lunch then headed back to Marrakech. I think we were estimated to arrive back around 16:30 but it was nearer 18:30 (which we were more than happy about).A thoroughly great day and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Mustapha is your man.... I booked this back in the UK based on the good TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Our group grew from 8 to 12 then ultimately 17, but Mustapha accommodated us. He sends an agent to collect you from your riad for the hour or so journey into the mountains. He was the only disappointment - very grumpy and spent most of the journey on his mobile. We chose option 3 from the website with a hike and lunch in the Berber village rooftop riad. The food was the best we had in Morocco. A 'Berber 4x4' (donkey) accompanied us on the hike to carry water and snacks that were also supplied. We had a wonderful time and the 2 English-speaking guides gave us some very interesting facts and insight into Berber life. We negotiated a reduction as we were a large group - 40 dirhams each. Mustapha has a riad in the village so next time we visit we'd plan to spend a few nights there and do some more adventurous trekking. Highly recommended.

Really lovely day out with interesting and helpful guide. I booked with this company on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews, and was pleased with my choice. Mustapha was a good point of contact, by e-mail and phone, and the booking and payment etc all went perfectly smoothly. We chose a mixed one day tout, with half a day camel riding and half a day walking in the mountains.We were met at our riad on the day of the trip, by our guide Hassan and his driver. The journey was comfortable and smooth, although Hassan was not particularly talkative at this stage. We arrived at the camel ride and were given complimentary tea in a local café. Unfortunately, there was the obligatory tourist trap with one of the locals playing his instrument and dancing for us and then expecting money....... Also the toilet here was the worst I have ever used in my life, and no water for handwashing :-(The camel ride was fun, although did feel slightly vulgar - as a (comparatively) rich tourist passing through small modest villages and looking around, I did wonder whether the locals actually despised us for that, and it made me slightly uncomfortable. Hassan took some fantastic photos of us and was also much more chatty. He is only young, but fascinating to talk to, with a good philosophy on life and some interesting views. He is a well qualified guide, having studied for several years to become one, and he is totally against exploitation of tourists (unlike almost everyone else in Marrakech). Lunch was lovely and filling - in a small riad up a rather steep path - and afterwards, I just felt like going to sleep, rather than doing a hike in the mountains! Hassan is fit and nimble, but he was very understanding when I was struggling with the walking, as I am fairly unfit and it was also a hot day. So he cut the walk down to a more suitable length and pace, and made sure we enjoyed ourselves. The whole day was slickly organised and professional, and I would recommend to all.

2 Days Azzaden Valley tour. This has been an amazing experience. Breathtaking views, wonderful hospitality with guidance of Muhammed and Ibrahim who made this trip an unforgettable one. The whole arrangement by 'Atlas and Sahara Day Tours' was smooth and well organised. Thank you Mustapha, Muhammed and Ibrahim for giving us an incredible trip in this very romantic part of Morocco. I would certainly recommend this company to everybody.
Bloomin Awesome. not much more to say other than brilliant guide / food and knowledge. Very much recommended. Highlight: Mountain views

Spectacular trip, wonderful hosts, highlight of our holiday.. We were given VIP treatment from the start. Guides courteous and knowledgable, meals were fantastic. Walking at our own pace in the high mountains, through beautiful scenery, with our young guide. We learnt a lot about native flora, and about Atlas mountain village way of life. Our day included a gentle camel ride and was topped off with a hot lunch, brought from the restaurant by car and served to us at the top of a high mountain pass. It was the highlight of a wonderful holiday in Morocco.

Brilliant Day in the Atlas Mountains with an excellent guide. We booked this trip at the last minute and the communication by email and telephone was excellent. We opted for the Ourika day trip and were collected by the driver at 9am at our Riad - the weather was not great and the driver spoke only French. I was a little confused as I had ordered an English speaking guide as only one of us spoke French. At one point I was tempted to cancel the trip as the weather worsened and I was concerned about communication. However, en route we picked up the excellent Mohammed, our English speaking guide. He offered us the option of rearranging the trip because of the weather but assured us we would have a good time nonetheless. He was right! Mohammed is himself a Berber and provided us with a wealth of information on the Berber people and their culture. We visited a Berber home for bread, honey and, of course, mint tea and then continued up into the mountains. The weather cleared and we had a fantastic day including a delicious simple lunch overlooking the river in a Berber village and a walk into the mountains - which was as breathtaking as it was informative thanks to Mohammed. I would thoroughly recommend a day out with this company and will certainly be doing another tour with them when I next visit Marrakesh.

Fantastic Day Trip to Atlas Mountains with amazing guide. This tour company was amazing! I am so glad that I found them. Mustapha who was my email contact from London was really helpful, informative and communicated well. We wanted to do a day trip to the Atlas Mountains but with some flexibility in our itinerary, so he came up with some really helpful suggestions. The Tour Guide, Mohammed, was fantastic! He spoke perfect English, was a perfect gentleman with impeccable manners, he negotiated prices in the market at Tahanaout market for us and even at a little souk along the village road when we stopped to by Pottery. He explained all about the Berber life with great passion as he once lived in the mountains, and made us feel really comfortable the whole day. I could not recommend this tour company and Mohammed enough! Fantastic! Would definitely use them again.

Wonderful day trip to Ait Benhaddou and Telouet. We were a small group of three on our day trip to Ait Benhaddou and Telouet and we were totally satisfied with the whole day. Our driver Ahmed was very kind and knowledgeable and made every effort to feel us welcome. We spent a wonderful day and can highly recommend this tour and the tour agency of Mustapha and his team.

3 Day Trip with Atlas and Sahara Tours. I booked the trip 3 months prior and close to the travel date Mustapha provided me weather forecasts, which was helpful. We were promptly picked up from the Agadir airport and driven to Marrakech. The excursion was done with a spacious car from Marrakech to Zagora. We rode camels to the berber tent and stayed there overnight. During the drive we stopped at some interesting locations and of course for lunches. We also visited Imlil valley for a hike, where they provided us with a helpful, friendly and knowledgeable guide. We appreciated that. We experienced a lot and were very happy with the trip.
Super guide from Domaine-Malika hotel. An unpretentious, informative and thoughtful guide who spent a wonderful day with us in the Atlas mountains

Best Day of a 4 day break to Marrakech. We had 4 full days in Marrakech and decided to take a break from the chaos of Marrakech and go to the Atlas Mountains, and we picked the Amizamiz tour after emailing Mustapha several times to determine the best tour for us.Mustapha was extremely helpful and communication was extremely efficient.We were collected promptly from our Riad by another Mustapha and our driver was Rashid. The whole day was fabulous, and by far the best day of the 4 days we had in Marrakech. Firstly, we visited the area around the Dam, en route to Amizamiz and the scenery was breathtaking. We got some amazing photos. Next we headed to the mountains, stopping to take lots of photos and also enjoyed a walk where Mustapha pointed out several things of interest. We went on to eat at one of the Berber villages and had a fabulous tagine and bread made for us. Nothing was too much trouble and on the way back, we stopped to see Argan Oil being made at a co-operative. You may be able to book a tour once you arrive, at a cheaper cost (we paid £55 per person), however, I was more than happy with the tour, the content, and the knowledgeable guide and felt it was well worth the money and I would pay it again, and use this company.

Wonderful day tour but didnt show up for our airport transfar. We booked both parts of our airport transfer and an atlas mountains tour with this company.From the start Mustapha had been prompt with email replies so we didn't mind too much when our airport pickup was ten minutes late.We then went for our atlas mountains drive which we thoroughly enjoyed. Our guide (also called Mustapha) and driver (Brahim) were very friendly and knowledgeable and delivered a great tour. They knew the quieter areas to stop to get the best pictures and discouraged us from some of the tourist activities that they felt were just for profit and did not help the local people. The only downside of the trip was that we both became carsick due to the windy roads (despite not normally suffering from this). We recommend to take a sickness tablet just in case!Lunch was included on the trip which was delicious and we had a full day of the tour from 8am to 8pm. We would highly recommend this.We were then disappointed that the taxi to the airport did not show up. We spoke to Mustapha who said it was on its way but after 25 minutes we decided to give up and get in a cab on the street. Having spoken to Mustapha since we are trying to organise a refund. It was a shame that this happened but the quality of the tour made up for it.

Day in the Atlas mountains. Excellent day, individually tailored. Easy email communcation to organise and I believe that the proceeds go direct to the villages which helps to sustain their culture. Mohammed was an excellent guide and gave us a great insight to the lives of his people; he answered all of our many questions no matter how personal. The lunch in a local house included the best tagine of our trip. Thorughly recommended.

Best part of Marrakech weekend!. My friends and I did the day trip to the Atlas Mountains which included visiting a local village, riding camels, seeing a local market, having lunch, and hiking around one of the towns. We had an amazing and memorable experience! Everything was planned very well from the beginning and our itinerary was laid out clearly by Mustapha. In addition we were very pleased with our guide Rachid who was knowledgeable, helpful, and fun to talk to throughout the day. I would highly recommend to anyone who wants a day trip outside of Marrakech!

Skiing in the Atlas. Mustapha and his team run a terrific operation between Marrakech and the Atlas mountains. We decided to try out the skiing in Oukaimeden for 2 days and then went to Imlil to climb and ski down Mount Toubkal. Prior to getting out there Mustapha was very swift to reply to emails. He was helpful throughout suggesting what we would need to bring and recommending different itineraries. We decided on the above plan and everything went smoothly. We had good guides, suitable accommodation (although quite basic in Oukaimeden we stayed in a fantastic riad in Imlil) and a good food. A particular highlight was coming down the mountain to find a lunch of tagines, kebabs, tea, bread and tangerines at the bottom with an incredible view down the valley. All the stops were pulled out to make sure we had a fantastic trip. Things were done the 'Moroccan way' which means everything gets done but not necessarily when/what you expected. This was refreshing and meant that everything was flexible and relaxed. I can highly recommend putting your Moroccan experience in the hands of Atlas and Sahara Tours - they did not disappoint!

Highlight of the weekend!. My girlfriend and I had a day trip to the Atlas Mountains and a camel ride through a Berber village. Our guides made us feel really welcome throughout, always made us feel at ease and were happy to answer any questions. I was amazed at the Atlas Mountains and the village nested within them, I wish I had longer to do the Sahara tour. If you want to really see a bit of Morrocan culture, this is it, book it now!!!

Amizmiz Valley Day Trip . This is the first ever TripAdvisor review that we have written; it just shows what a great day we had! Mustapha was professional, knowledgeable and genuine. You can tell he's really passionate about his job plus he speaks fluent english. He arrived 30 minutes early with the driver, Rashid, and waited patiently while we had our breakfast at our Riad in Marrakech. They picked us up with a 4x4, which was driven really well by Rashid. You'll definitely feel safe. At the beginning of the journey, he told us about the history of Morocco and the Berber people. It was very comprehensive as both Mustapha and Rashid are Berber themselves. On the way to the valley, we stopped at the Argan oil cooperative and had the chance to witness the process of producing argan oil. After, we did a 2 hour hike through the Amizmiz valleys and Mustapha showed us how the Berber live their lives. The views were spectacular and the hike would be suitable for beginners. Just bring good hiking shoes as it can get slippery. Mustapha really took his time to show us all the different plants and fruits that grow there. We couldn't stop taking pictures and he was taking loads for us too. We then visited a Berber family at their village and had a very delicious home-cooked tagine lunch. We met their adorable children, too. We would recommend for you to bring some presents for the children. Our last stop was the dam and the views were amazing. We even got to dip our feet into the water. We highly recommend the Atlas and Sahara tour, especially Mustapha and Rashid. We'd definitely book a tour with them again.

Fantastic Day in the Atlas Mountains. From the very first inquiry e-mail to the end of our day with this operation, the experience was top notch! My wife wanted to ride a camel while in Morocco, what we got was so much more. This day was one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech. Mustapha promptly returned e-mails and organized our pick-up from our hotel in Marrakech. Our driver, Rachid, was friendly and knowledgable and gave us great insight to the many towns and villages we passed as we wound our way up the Asni valley.We met Mustapha and our guide Lahcen at Dar Amalou and took in the sights of the valley and Mount Toubkal over some mint tea. We then ascended a hill to Lahcen's home village of Aremd. As flatlanders from Florida, Lahcen recognized our difficulty with the altitude and tailored the pace perfectly with informative stops and photo opportunities. We wound our way through this delightful Berber village and back down the valley with few other tourists in sight all day. For lunch we returned to the roof of Dar Amalou and dined on a delightful tagine, couscous and salad while sitting on a bed of Berber rugs. The view from this private and quiet spot is breathtaking and you are left alone to enjoy your meal and recap the day so far.Afterwards we made our way down the valley to Imlil for our camel ride. I was expecting a 1/2 hour ride, similar to what one might get close to Marrakech. To my delight, we spent over two hours trekking down the valley through villages and orchards, the almond trees in full flower. Again, Lachen accompanied us to answer any questions during our ride. Rachid met us on the other end of our trek and delivered us to our hotel.If you are considering this operation for any of their tours, do not hesitate, book it and have an incredible experience! Thank you Mustapha, Rachid, and Lahcen.

Another world. We went to the Asni area and our guide took us to Mr Hassan's house for a tea ceremony and to see his house. It makes you appreciate the comforts we take for granted but appreciate the value of the simpler lives the Berber's lead. Casbah Tamadot was great for lunch

day in the high atlas mountains. wonderful day in the mountains in a 4x4 with a local guide. experienced from freezing ski slopes to a hot climb to a waterfall and a wonderful lunch from a local family on a rooftop terrace. a day not to be missed.
Atlas Mountains and waterfalls. Very impressive. Worth seeing. Do wear sensible shoes as there is a lot of climbing We only managed to get to the first waterfall as the going was rather hard

Memorable day. I contacted Mustapha a couple of days before leaving for Marrakech and got a quick reply to my email giving all options and costs available. We were collected from our hotel by an English-speaking driver, and met our guide on the way to Imlil. Mohammed spoke excellent English and gave us a fascinating insight into the history and life of the Berber people. His passion for the people and the country were quite inspiring. We had opted for a walking trip from Imlil, but stopped and had our photos taken on camels en route. We walked through the villages and had the most delicious lunch on the terrace of a house in Imlil as the Riad is being upgraded at present. In all we walked for about 3 hours, but it was not too demanding, and maybe we'll return to walk up the mountain sometime. Highly recommended!

Amazing!. We contacted this company a couple of days before leaving for Marrakech and they were brilliant. I thought I may have left it too late to organise a day in the mountains but Mustapha came back to me immediately with a range of different options. On the day, we were collected from our Riad and driven to the mountains collecting our guide, Mohammed, en route. The day was awesome and Mohammed really was amazing. Really easy going and knowledgable. Told us all about the area and traditions. Helped me up the snowy and icy patches of the walk, took loads of great photos, just great! Lovely lunch and then off for some camel riding. My only comment would be that the camel ride felt a little tacked on at the end as you basically ride around a field on your way home but we enjoyed it and all in all had a great day for what I felt was a reasonable price. I would definitely recommend this company and Mohammed as a guide. Fab!!

3 valleys and Atlas mountains. The scenery was fantastic and so varied. Take money with you though as it will cost more than just the trip. Went to the Argan oil co-operative and it was strange to have the contrast of the poverty and then they produce a card machine so you can use your credit card to buy produce!

Waterfall trip. We took waterfall trip, where trainers and take a camera.. Spectacular . The walk to the bottom can be a little precarious at times but we had a superb guide who found us canes as walking poles and helped us all the way

Fabulous experience in the mountains. We were referred to Atlas and Sahara Day Tours by a colleague of my partner's, and these kinds of personal recommendation always carry a lot of weight. We could immediately see why he had liked the company, as Mustapha responded to our e-mail with a variety of options very quickly. We had something specific in mind, and Mustapha was happy to tailor our day for us. We visited the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Ksar of Ait-Ben-Haddou and did a couple of hours' trekking nearby. Mohamed and our driver took such great care of us, and were really sweet and helpful when I got travel sick along the way. Mohamed is very knowledgeable on Moroccan history and culture, so we learned a fair bit during the day as well. They even gave us a gift of Moroccan coffee powder, with spices mixed into it, when we were bidding our farewells at the end of the day. All in all, a very positive experience!

Superb 3 valleys tour with Kasbah Tamadot for lunch - 16th February 2015. Strongly recommend this tour. Mustapha was professional and the guide Hassan was very informative. Both speak excellent English! We want to the Market which was interesting and although not a touristic one gave us a good insight into the farmers market (Ourika). Then went to Argan Oil Womens cooperative where you could see oil being made and there was no agressive selling. Next Lunch at Kasbah Tamadot was a dream - so beautiful and fabulous food! Then Imlil vallet and Mint Tea at Mustapha's hotel. Beautiful scenery; stops for pictures and amazing to be hot on the ground whilst there was snow on mountains! Very good value for money! Only downside the minivan was a little noisy!

Professional tour company. We booked 2 tours with Mustapha and he also arranged our transfers to and from the airport. They were very professional, timely and good transport was provided. The first a half day tour of Marrakech. Our guide Mustapha was very knowledgeable and saved us a lot of time and provided a lot of historical knowledge. It was great having him guide us through the medina and the museums.The day trip was also absolutely wonderful. We had a camel trek in the morning through the valley. The views of the landscape were amazing and the children really enjoyed themselves.We were then taken to a riad where there was a beautiful log fire and a delicious lunch awaiting us. We were taken to the terrace at the top of the riad from which there were amazing views of the atlas mountains. Mustapha then showed us some of the beautifully decorated rooms which we hope to stay in on our next visit.We then went for an afternoon walk through the berber village and had time to shop for some local pottery. Hassan our guide had excellent knowledge and history and was very polite and helpful.I would have no hesitation recommending this company. Made my trip to Marrakech very memorable.

Great day out. Booked via their website and we were really well looked after. We chose a day trek through the Ait Mizane valley and Ibrahim (our driver) and Mohammed (our guide) really looked after us. We were picked up on time from our riad in Marrakech and driven through local towns and villages to Imlil where we started our walk. Nicely bracing walk up to 2000 metres with great scenery throughout. The route itself was not too challenging, with the paths clearly well trodden by other and we really enjoyed it. The time flew by and after 3 hours we returned to Riad Jnane Imli. A cosy place for lunch, which was part of the package. The best food we ate in our week in Morocco, really tasty salads and tagines which topped off a great day for us before we were taken on a different route back to Marrakkech to take in some new scenery. Highly recommended.

Friendly, professional and reliable. Four of us booked this tour company for a trip to Ourika Valley. From the moment of enquiry, the company were very responsive, professional, friendly and helpful. Mustapha responded by email very quickly and everything was very clear. On the day, our guides, Hassan and Abdul, arrived at our Riad 10 minutes early and throughout the day they looked after us very well. Hassan speaks several languages and told us so much about Morocco - it's culture, history, etc. They were also great fun to be with. I recommend this company and would approach them for another trip when next in Marrakech.

Fantastic experience. Myself and 3 friends came across the business on Trip Advisor and were immediately impressed with Muphasa's speedy and informative responses to emails. The trip was well planned, the minibus even had wifi and a phone charger! The camels and horses were clearly well treated and respected and the staff were all absolutely wonderful. We had lunch at the family Riad which was simply fantastic, the views, the service and the food were all to die for. Our guide was informative, helpful and extremely friendly, making the whole trip very enjoyable. We had great fun walking up to the waterfalls (despite my silly walking boots - would advise wearing sensible footwear!) and then, based on our first experience, we decided to use the business again for our airport transfers and for a trip to Essaouira. The trips were extremely good value for money. Atlas and Sahara Tours really did make our whole holiday and I would highly recommend using them!

Breathtaking views of Atlas Mountains, exceptional hospitality; highlight of our stay in Marrakech. Went for one day camel ride/trek up Atlas Mountains. Driver met us promptly outside our Riad and drove us to Asni, where we started our camel ride. Ride was enjoyable and we passed by many Berber villages. Our guide, Muhamad, was polite, spoke good English, and very knowledgable of the area. After a feast of a lunch at the rooftop of a Riad in Imlil, we proceeded with our afternoon trek up the Atlas Mountains. Trek was tailored to our pace- we asked lots of questions and stopped to take many photos. Would emphasize the latter as the views were absolutely spectacular! Berber villages nestled on hilltops, snow-capped Atlas Mountains kissing the clouds, casting shadows on the Imlil valley below. Would recommend Atlas and Sahara day tours to travelers looking to escape hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Price point steeper than other alternatives, but you are paying for hospitality, exclusivity, and scenic views of the Atlas Mountains.

Perfect mountain trip. We had an excellent time on our day trip to the Asni Valley. Booking was easy with Mustapha, great communication there. We were picked up at our hotel and taken on a beautiful drive to meet our guide, Mohammad, who proved to be excellent in every way. We rode camels for a ways (not the most comfortable, but fun!) through a few villages and had plenty of chances to enjoy the great landscapes. Then it was time for lunch on the roof of a riad. Excellent tajines, amazing views. Then to the trek. The first 10 minutes seemed straight uphill, but afterward it was relatively easy going. Mohammad is from one of the villages we hiked through, and had many interesting stories about life there. We were really lucky in that, because of the Eid holiday, the Goat Man was out chasing children up and down the hills! And what do you know, on the drive out, there by the side of the road was the Goat Man himself. All in an incredible value, a great day away from the bustle of Marrakech, and some of the most incredible scenery I've seen. Highly, highly recommended.

Professional and personal service. We organised this day trip only two days before we left for Marrakesh not knowing how it was going to go, what with transport and language barrier, we didn't know what to expect.Mustapha replied to all our emails and queries very quickly. When the transport came we were very surprised, it was a very nice 4 whd drive vehicle with a very friendly driver, also like to add a very good driver too.When we arrived all the people were very welcoming, and we were then introduced to our guide for the day, Hassan. He adjust to our pace and standard very quickly and gave us information about the mountains and local villages in the surrounding areas, shame he didn't bring a football to play on the pitch 2000 metres up.The food that was put on for the 2 of us was outstanding, plenty to feed four, we did try to eat it all but failed miserably . This was a trip for our 30th wedding anniversary and we are so pleased that we are now contacting Mustapha to book in for the 8 day trip to the summit.

Reliable & Professional Service. Excellent run service - We used Atlas & Sahara Day Tours thrice whilst staying in Marrakech.  Firstly for the combined half day camel ride / Atlas Mountain trek and it was perfect. Pick up to lunch at the Riad in between was on point. Communication between Mustapha & our group couldn't have been better. Secondly we booked a driver to take us to and from Essaouira which was on point. Felt a lot safer being in an SUV around the manic roads of Morroco in comparison to hiring a car (Which would be testing for the best of drivers).Finally we arranged a drop off to the airport which made the beginning of the journey home a lot more comfortable. Would definitely recommend to all whilst staying in Marrakech / Morroco & would be happy to use their service again.

Fantastic experience on all counts!. Myself and three friends booked a day trip to ride camels and visit the Atlas Mountains. Mustapha answered all emails and queries within minutes and was so helpful.The day trip was excellent. The camels looked well treated and well fed (as opposed to some poor animals we saw elsewhere), and the guide and the driver were really friendly. The car was comfortable and even had Wifi! The whole day was really enjoyable, one I'll never forget.I would highly recommend using this company - also ask about transport or other needs you may have as Mustapha is very accommodating and willing to help in any way he can. The four of us booked our journey back to the airport with him to save getting two taxis (and it worked out cheaper too!).

Amazing, Incredible, trip of a lifetime. We took a short 4 day trip to Marrakech and this was our only excursion outside of Marrakech, so there was pressure on it to be a good trip, we took the day trip to Toubkal (the imlil and asni valleys) I am happy to say it more than delivered. The guides were incredible, so friendly and had excellent english. The whole day was well planned and the walk around the valley was very good too. All is all, this is the best money you will spend on any tour in any part of the world. 5 stars!
