Amazing trip to Imlil! Professionaly outstanding service!. We booked a trip with Atlas and Sahara tours last summer in August 2014... I've only just got around to writing my review as I have been meaning to but life gets busy!Anyway Mustapha organised our trip from here in the UK with professionalism and great efficiency! We were a family of 2 adults and a child we were picked up by our driver Mohammed a very pleasant polite young man from our riad in Marrakech and driven to the Atlas mountains. Mohammed stopped to allow us to take some gorgeous scenic photos enroute. We were then met by Rachid who was such a lovely guide nothing was too much for him he took many photographs for us.. went out of his way to make sure we were enjoying our Camel trek. He had vast knowledge of the area and was generally really pleasant and friendly as though we were his long lost relatives! He had a great rapport with our son made us all feel welcome! His hospitality was impeccable! We then had a lovely 3 course lunch fit for a king at Riad Jnane where we rested for a couple of hours and then continued our trek on foot to Mount Toubkal with Rachid... This guy was well known in his community a real people's person who looked after us extremley well. We arrived back to Imlil where we met Mohammed who drove us back to Marrakech... This trip was definitely the highlight of our trip to Morocco! Mustapha and his team from Mohammed, Rachid, to the camel and mule guide... the guys that looked after us for lunch were outstanding in their service hospitality and professionalism.We are travelling back to Morocco in April and very much looking forward to using Atlas and Sahara tours again!A big heartfelt thank you to Mustapha abd his fabulous team!

Just Great. We asked for a one day tour that would include walking in the Berber villages in the Atlas, having lunch in a riad, and riding camels. We got all of this, picked up and dropped off from our hotel in Marrakech. Rachid our walking guide was fantastic and the lunch was delicious. Well worth the money.

Very professional organisation. I contact Atlas & Sahara Tours at midnight, wanting to go on a tour the next morning - I didn't expect a reply, it was more wishful thinking. I was very pleasantly surprised when Mustapha responded very quickly with a range of options. I chose one and was collected on time the next day by Abdellah, a very interesting and honourable man. The drive there gave me plenty of time to ask about the scenery and about the city and country and we had a couple of stops en route for mint tea, which I quickly grew to like. The trip up the mountains was breathtaking. A local guide brought me up and was more than happy to take and pose for photos at various stops along the way. This is a fairly serious bit of trekking, so take clothes to keep you warm but prepare for being hot too - it's a few hours of serious walking. I idiotically only took Nike Air Max trainers with me, but managed OK.After the trek I went to the Riad operated by Atlas and Sahara Day tours - it is beautiful. I will stay there one day. I met Mustapha and was served a beautiful lunch (they were very accommodating of my vegetarianism). The village and mountain range have to be seen to be believed - very picturesque and interesting. Having lunch on the rooftop of the Riad gave some amazing views. A real highlight of the trip.From the moment you book to the moment you're dropped off, you're looked after by the impressive team that Mustapha has assembled. I will definitely be using this organisation again and have no difficulty in giving it five stars and recommending it to other people. People who've never been to Morocco before will find it particularly useful.

Professional and personal service. We booked a three day trek for five us to walk at the end of December. From the first email enquiry to our transfer back to our riad in Marrakech the service was professional and efficient. Mustapha and our guide Mohammad discussed an alternative route after snow closed our original path and we had a fantastic trek over beautiful mountain passes and through traditional Berber villages. Mohammad was a brilliant guide, full of interesting information and attentive to every need of our children. Said and the other Mohammad transported all our luggage and prepared delicious food. I would not hesitate to recommend Atlas and Sahara tours, they have managed to combine a professional service with a very personal touch.

What a fantastic day. We are so glad we chose to follow other reviewers' advice and book with this independent and highly professional tour company based in Imlil. The owner, Mustafa, was so patient and helpful in accommodating our changing needs. Our driver, Abdul went out of his way to be helpful, assisting in the purchase of our bus tickets for our onward journey to Essouria tomorrow. Best if all, was our guide Mohammed, who knew the Atlas mountains and its people and introduced us to both. A perfect host. We had morning tea and a delicious lunch on the roof terrace of Riad Jnane Imlil, from which we had a panoramic view of the valleys and the snow-covered peaks. We took a look at some of the rooms and they are very well appointed and beautifully decorated. We would definitely recommend the riad as a place to stay in Imlil. The whole day was a delight.

Well looked after, highly recommended.. We had an idea to celebrate a 50th birthday in the Atlas mountains and contacted this company to book a trek. In the end we let them arrange airport transfers and the hotel in Marrakech too. In spite of the flash floods and snow two weeks previously closing our intended route, the company offered us an alternative ininerary which was brilliant, including a stay at their gite in Imlil which is delightful. (at no extra cost) We were blown away by the food that was prepared for us (best picnics ever) and at how helpful and friendly the staff were. We were also very grateful for them organising our time in Marrakech. We will definitely use them again.

excellent organisation. We booked with Atlas and sahara Day tours totally on the back of the wonderful trip advisor reviews we read , as we had no idea where to start with a reliable company. I emailed the company and Mustafa replied immediately . In fact every email I sent he responded immediately , and was always polite and patient with our frequent questions and planning . He even arranged our pick up from the airport , and arrange for us to stay for the first night in the heart of the the old town in a lovely traditional riad 'Riad Zayane Atlas , which they own , and is just perfect for your introduction to marrakech. We were beautifully looked after , and had a wonderful breakfast on the sun terrace. We were then effortlessly taken on our booked tour of the atlas mountain , where again we stayed in the most perfect riad , also owned by them , and again had the best hospitality and wonderful food . We also did the sahara tour , and camel rides , and stay at the camp ...all excellently organised to a high standard. From start to finish we were dealt with professionally and without delay , and would have no hesitation in recommending Mustapha and his wonderful and capable team who made our trip to morocco truly memorable . If you have any doubts about this company, don't have , they are worth every penny.

What a great experience!. Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, we contacted Atlas and Sahara Tours online and Mustafa quickly got back to us.Having only a few days in Marrakech, we decided on the camel and Atlas Mountains day trek. We were so glad we did.Mustafa contacted us to make sure we and he had all the information needed to arrange the day. On the day before we were to go, he contacted us to suggest we delay a day as the weather was bad and it was snowing in the mountains. When we did go on the re-arranged day, the sun was out from dawn till dusk with barely a cloud in the sky.We were picked up promptly from our hotel and taken into the foothills where we met our English speaking guide, the camel driver and the camels. The next 2 hours was spent travelling 5 or 6 miles on the camels at a leisurely pace to enjoy the fantastic scenery and the clear, clear air.A short drive later and we arrived in Imlil, at the riad where we had spectacular views of the highest mountains in the Atlas as well as a spectacular lunch on the rooftop terrace - mint tea and pastries, Moroccan salad, lentils and olives, tagine of chicken with lemon and olives, flat bread, oranges and bananas to finish, all excellent!Following a short rest, we headed of with our guide up the network of paths to the village overlooking Imlil. Ninety minutes or so later and we arrived back at Imlil for our transport back to Marrakech and our hotel.The whole day was extremely well-organised and everyone we met from A&S Tours made us very welcome.I would definitely recommend the trip we did and would definitely recommend A&S Tours for trouble-free booking, great organisation and great food.

Heaps good, Highly recommend.. You can't go wrong with this tour agency. Highly recommend. Tour was the highlight of our trip to Morocco. We did the two day Mount Toubkal summit. We were unprepared for the weather during early November. It had been snowing on and off for the previous week and we were unprepared for the ice and snow on the peak. We were a little worried when we first saw the snowy peak and surrounding storm clouds, but Rasheed our guide put our fears at ease. We would attempt to summit but not do anything dangerous, if the weather turned bad we would turn back. We got to the Riad Jnane Imlil, where Mustapha (who runs the agency) decked us out with proper boots to walk through the snow (we had normal high top boots), snow jackets and gloves. They told us what the plan was for the next two days, where and how far we would walk. Unfortunately the weather turned bad when we reached our lunch stop and had to turn back. We could see it snowing on the peaks and people who had tried to summit that day were coming back saying that the conditions were terrible up top and had to turn back. Mustapha was really flexible and gave us a few options that we could do instead of trying to summit Toubkal. In the end we decide to return back to the riad and do a day hiking tour through the Berber Villages in the valley next door the following day. The stay in the Riad Jnane Imlil, was luxurious with floor heating. The dinner and breakfast which was provided was delicious. Mustapha our muleteer was very friendly and cooked amazing meals on both days of the hike, he organised all the carrying of our gear on the mule. Rasheed our guide was also very good, spoke English very well, friendly and knowledgeable.This agency is very well organised, communicating with Mustapha was quick and easy. We felt very safe through out and the people very hospitable.

Fantastic Experience. Brilliant experience from start to finish from the initial enquiry email to the end of the trip itself. Hussain was our guide and he was brilliant. Punctual and friendly drivers from the hotel to the start of the tour. relaxed, friendly and unhurried. Fantastic food in fantastic scenery. We could not do our original tour to Mt Toukbal summit because the weather was too bad, but the alternative route around the lower valleys was still incredible and the night in the Berber accomodation was great.

Amazing tour, wonderful guides, fabulous experience!. I can't say enough wonderful things about this experience! The people and places were lovely. I finished my day tour from Marrakech last week of the Asni Valley and Imlil, which consisted of a half day camel ride and half day hiking trip, as well as a visit to the berber villages. Our guide was Hassan, who was extremely kind and knowledgable, and our driver was Muhammad, who was very funny and easy going. They were an ideal combo to spend our day with and very pleasant from start to finish. We started with the mint tea in the berber village, followed by our camel trek through the valley and then the most amazing lunch at a private Riad in the mountains. It was easily the best meal and service I received during my week in Morocco. I also had the pleasure of meeting Mustapha at the Riad during lunch, who was so efficient and responsive in coordinating the tour before I arrived in Marrakech. He even offered to provide me with extra clothes/shoes as he was concerned I would be cold in the mountains, which was so very kind of him. After lunch we proceeded with our hike in the Atlast mountains where we saw so many amazing berber villages and the sweetest people I've ever met -- especially the children! We were met with smiling faces everywhere we went and it was clear Hassan had friendly relationships with many of the people we encountered. He gave us a detailed history on the people and places we were seeing and was very informative. He even stopped us to take photos in the best places and was quite the talented photographer! FOr those of you who like a good panorama shot, he is a pro -- and does it without you even asking. We found it quite amusing as we are 20-30 year girls who love photography. Muhammad and Hassan offered to stop at a copper mill for us to see how many of the moroccan lamps, etc. are made but we had to make it to an early dinner reservation so unfortunately we didn't have time to do so. While this tour was absolutely amazing, perhaps what I was most impressed with was what happened after we were dropped off in the square in Marrakech (we had requested to be dropped there instead of at our Riad). Five minutes after we got out of the car, I realized I had left my brand new iPhone 6 in the SUV when they had dropped us off. I ran back to the hostel and immediately phoned Mustapha, who contacted Hassan and Muhammad. They checked the vehicle right away and confirmed it was indeed there, and brought it back and hand delivered it to my Riad. As most of you know -- this would never happen 99.9% of the time, even in New York City, where I live. They could have easily denied finding the phone and kept it for a profit but instead were honest and responded immediately. Hassan even made sure he only gave the phone to me when he came back to my Riad that evening. Overall, this company exceeded my expectations on every level and I would highly recommend them and this specific tour to anyone looking to do a day-trip or excursion within Morocco. It was wonderful and I will definitely be recommending them to anyone who travels there in the future! :)

Excellent Trip!. We booked a 1 day trip to the from Marrakesh. It was a combination of the Ansi Valley and a camel ride. In both cases we were asked how long we wanted to take which was an excellent idea. Our taxi took us from our riad in Marrakesh to a riad in Imlil that we used as a base for the day. Upon arrival we were greeted by Omar and a nice glass of mint tea by the fire. Shortly afterwards our guide Mohammed , who was an absolute gentleman and a perfect guide, took us on a hike. We were given the choice of a 1 , 2 or 3 hour hike.We took a three hour hike through the valley which was absolutely gorgeous and set us up for our best meal of the trip on the roof terrasse of the riad. The view and the food were absolutely beautiful. After lunch we took a trip down the valley for a camel ride. Again the scenery was beautiful and a very enjoyable afternoon. The atlas hike was undoubtedly the highlight of our 4 days in Morocco and I would thoroughly recommend Atlas and Sahara Day tours.

An amazing experience beyond words!. I booked a short trip to Morocco as a surprise for my husband's 50th birthday and searched very many tour companies to find what I thought would be the perfect day trips for us. Because our time in Morocco was limited (we stayed in Marrakech) it was important to choose trips that did not include hours of driving. I decided on the 1/2 day trek in the Atlas Mountains (Asni Valley and Imlil) & 1/2 day camel ride, the evening Chez Ali dinner show and the Ourika Valley trips. Communication with Mustapha from the enquiry stage to the very end of our final day trip was outstanding, all emails and questions were answered promptly, the itinerary perfectly tailored, arrangements for pick ups from our Riad and drop offs excellent! We always knew the night before who our driver would be for the following day. The drivers spoke limited English but were extremely friendly and very helpful and tried hard to speak to us, as we did to them! The heavy rain previously had caused some roads to become tricky to negotiate but our drivers on each tour navigated them perfectly and we never once felt in any danger.Our guides for both Asni/Imlil and Ourika Valleys spoke very good English and were an absolute pleasure to be in the company of. Their knowledge of the local and surrounding area was impressive, they made the day trips enjoyable and unforgettable, by the end of each trip it truly felt as though you had made a new friend! The meals we stopped for which were included in the cost of the trips were tasty beyond belief, taken in perfect surroundings that looked like a picture postcard.Without a shadow of a doubt, Mustapha has given us the best tours we could ever have hoped for and I am immensely grateful to Atlas and Sahara Tours for that. The time we have spent with Hassan, Brahim and both Mohammed's has been amazing and has without doubt made my husbands birthday break memorable! Thank you Mustapha, we will definitely be back to Morocco, next time with the kids and will most definitely be booking with you! Please pass on our grateful thanks to Hassan for driving us to Asni/Imlil and to the camels, Mohammed for being a fantastic guide in the Atlas and for walking at my pace, and for staying by my side, reassuring me the whole time I was being hugely scared on the camel!!Thank you to Brahim for driving us to Chez Ali and staying there until it finished to drive us back to the Riad, and for driving us to the Ouirika Valley the day after. And to Mohammed for the unexpected stops at the Berber home and the artists gallery and the truly amazing walk, lunch (cooked by Brahim) and conversations we had!Not forgetting the gift of a jellaba and berber head scarf for my husband - he looked a treat, thank you!If you are looking for a tour company who can offer something different and at a very good price, do not look anywhere else!

Thoroughly recommended. We had an incredible 2-day trek through the Azzaden Valley. The mountains are stunning, the trekking was great - sometimes challenging, but very rewarding too. We were provided with a phenomenal lunch both days (fresh salad, tagine, cooked outdoors while we waited) and a superb dinner too in the beautiful little Berber village we stayed in. Best of all was our tour guide Mohammed, who as well as being interesting and helpful was just great company. It was clear his priority was our enjoyment and wellbeing, and teaching visitors about the Berber culture. I thoroughly recommend this trip - you won't regret it.

Great tour of Morocco. We booked a 4 day tour with Atlas & Sahara and although some of the days were quite long (due to distance of Sahara from Marrakech) we felt that we managed to see a good mix of what Morocco has to offer - with Kasbahs, culture, camel-trekking in the Sahara and a short day hike in the Atlas Mountains. From my initial inquiry Mustapha was attentive and helpful and everything ran like clockwork throughout our tour. Our 2 guides Hassan and Rachid were very friendly - with Hassan being very informative about all aspects of Morocco while Rachid was an excellent driver so we never felt any stress at any time, which I am sure we would have if we had tried to do all this on our own. We went to a few co-operatives but there was never any pressure to buy anything and it was interesting to see how things were made (eg argan oil, fossils, Rose Valley products). One of the best things on our tour was the Riad Jnane Imlil where we stayed in the Atlas Mountains - it was very comfortable and the staff were great. The food was a real highlight and they catered very well for us vegetarians. This is a family run company and almost all the staff and drivers seem to be related. Mustapha has a great understanding of sustainable tourism and seems to be doing a lot to help this particular area of the Atlas Mountains to look after its environment.

Valley was exciting, the tour not so much. We went on the walking tour of the Azmiz valley. ALthough not one of the top tour desitnations, we chose this one because it included lunch with a Berber family. Mustapha did a very nice job setting up the tour and helping us to understand what was included. Unfortunately, that understanding did not extend all the way to our tour guide, Jamal. We were picked up by the driver, Lasim, at the hotel, right on time. We then had to drive to another city to pick up our tour guide. Lasim did a very nice job trying to tell us about different areas as he drove, but his English was very poor and our French was only a little better. When we arrived at the other city, we picke dup Jamal and drove from there to Azmiz. It was nice that on the way we stopped and saw a lake, but we were not sure what we were looking at and Jamal was not very forward with information. When we stopped for water, i knew we were int rouble because jamal wante dus to pay for water -- I had specifically asked Mustapha about this prior to the trip and he said the tour picked up the price for water. Jamal looked surprised, but still bought the water and we drove on. We then stopped outside of the town, in a very industrial and farming area and Jamal began to dismount and only then did he tell us we were going to hike three and a half hours to the lunch. This was not the tour I had paid for, Jamal was very flexible and offered different options, only one of which was the tour I had planned. When we finally got started, we walked one hour to the lunch, then two hours after -- that was what we had contracted for. When we got to the Berber house for lunch, I had assumed we would eat with them and learn more of their culture and their backgrounds. Instead, there were three women in the house, none of whom at with us. They served us some wonderful mint tea on the roof and mad a remarkable tagine of chicken and potatoes -- wonderful food. They were also very hospitable and very open to letting us see their home. But we did not really get to talk with them. Jamal did a good job as interpreter, but I just feel there was a lot more we could have learned about the valley and the lives of the people. After lunch we walked on and it was nice day and nice hike. The valley was absolutely beautiful and I am glad we did this activity. I would only ask that we get more information about the tour while on the tour.

Ascend Assaoul Summit. We had a great time going up the summit of Assaoul Mountain. Our guide Mohamed had good command of English and most importantly the hike leadership. Mustapha from Atlas&Sahara tours was great to do business with. He helped us decide on a hike that was challenging but that lasted just one day. Due to limited amount of time we could not do Toubkal but going up Assaoul was fantastic because we got to climb a bit with our hands. It was somewhat a challenging hike in that there were steep sections where it was difficult to get a foothold. Apparently this was due to rain, also not many people go up Assaoul since Toubkal is the main attraction, therefore in a way it was a unique hike. The logistics and schedule of the hike were extremely flexible they made sure to ask what we preferred; whether it was when to eat or where to get picked up if we were tired or wanted to continued. We had an amazing lunch at the Riad Jnane Imlil. The driver Brahim picked us up in our Riad in Marrakech on time and drove us to Imlil safely and back to Marrakech. We thought the price for the service was more than fair, 63 pounds per person. We really recommend the this tours because they are very concern and take care that the traveler is satisfied plus they do not stop in any souks (markets) they just concentrate in the hike.

Camel riding and trekking. They are a great outfit, nothing too much trouble, lovely people, we loved the trip. Mustapha is a wonderful host, the camels were well behaved and in good condition, food at the Riad was brilliant!

Camel ride and hiking. We had a wonderful day trip; 1/2 day camel ride and 1/2 day hiking in beautiful Atlas Mountains, our guide - Mohamed, who perfect speaks English and who really looks after tourists is also a wonderful person. I can recommend this company and can not think about one single thing which was not right - everything was perfect.

Brilliant sahara and Atlas Moutain tour/trek!. Highly recommend this tour. We were picked up promptly from our Riad in Marrakech by our two really friendly guides, Hassan and Rashid for the long drive ( 7 and a half hours!) to the Sahara in a very comfortable 4x4. We had several stops on the way for sightseeing, plenty of photo opportunities, and a lovely lunch in the town where they filmed some of "Gladiator". We were met at the edge of the desert by Unis, our Berber guide and his camels.Once aboard, he whisked us off to our camp in the desert. A lovely meal awaited us and entertainment with the guides on the drums afterwards around the fire! Awoken at 6am for the sunrise breakfast, stunning views across the desert, and the ride back to our awaiting 4x4. Another long picturesque drive with plenty of stops again and lunch before reaching our charming Riad in the High Atlas mountains at Imlil. This is the nicest place we have stopped in Morocco. Wonderful rooftop views, plush room with underfloor heating, superb food and Mustafa and his team couldn't have made us more welcome. The next day Mohammed, our Mountain guide took us on an amazing trek through the mountains and villages, stopping for lunch at a Berber house. We had a fantastic three days. It was so well organised and everyone was so friendly and helpful. We can't recommend this tour enough! Thank you Mustapha!

Excellent tour!. We have booked this tour for a day out from Marrakesh for 3 people. Our option was "1/2 day camel trek in Asni valley & 1/2 day Hike in the Atlas Mountains", but they have plenty of options to select. Mustapha, the owner, was very helpful all the time and responded quick and nicely all my emails.The driver (Mohammed) was punctual in our hotel and drive us to Atlas Mountains where we collected our guide, Mohammed. We started in Asni Valley for a 2 hours camel trek and we were pick for our driver to Riad Jnane Imlil, where we had our lunch. The Riad Jnane is a wonderful place, rooms are beautiful and the setting is stunning. Our lunch (Salad and Tajin) was taste and delicious. After the lunch we continued our trip trekking Altas Mountain with Mohammed. The experience has been great, Mohammed has made our trip unforgettable and for sure we will repeat soon! It a pleasure have a local guide who transmit the essence of that part of Morroco with such professionalism. The trip was the best experience we can have, a gem in our travel to Morocco and for me, the best part of our all travel.

So much more than a trip to the Atlas Mountains. Our trip to the Atlas Mountains was an adventure for us 9 ladies who had travelled to Marrakech for a four day trip. We were collected by our driver from our Riad in the Medina and transported safely to our first stop where we were greeted with by our guide Hassan with mint tea and a train of camels! Although the tour offers a 2 and a 1/2 hour trek on the camels most of us opted for a gentle (for the most part) 40 minute trek on the camels. That was the beauty of the day. There was no problem adapting the programme to suit what we wanted to do on the day. We were then brought to a local market that services over 100 of the villages from the mountains. Then off to the village of Imlil for a fabulous leisurely lunch with Mustapha and his team. We were treated to a delicious lunch of salads and bread, scrumptious beef tagines and fresh fruit and coffee. Another leisurely walk and a quick look in some of the craft shops in the village instead of going on a trek in the mountains we headed back to Marrakech and agreed that this day trip was one of the highlights of our trip. Well done to Mustapha and his team!

Best part of our Morocco vacation. We did the 2 day hike through Azzaden Valley and loved it. Mustapha the owner was very helpful and quick to respond to emails, our driver who collected us from Marrakech and drove us to the mountains was very nice, and Muhammed our guide was simply amazing. The scenery was breathtaking, and we learned a lot about Berber life from Muhammed and by being surrounded by it as we passed through villages. It was nice to get away from the chaos of Marrakech as well. It is important to know that although this is advertised as an easy hike, it is not. It is more like moderate to strenuous. Both myself and my friend are in our 30s, experienced hikers and fit, and we both felt this hike was somewhat difficult (but absolutely worth it). What makes it difficult is the constant ascending and descending mountains with little flat ground, as well as some loose slippery rocks in parts. So although I thoroughly recommend this hike, make sure you have some decent fitness and your knees are in good condition. Thank you Mustapha and Muhammed for such a wonderful experience. It has been the highlight of our two-week Morocco vacation.

Amazing. We spent 2 days horse-riding in the Atlas mountains and it was amazing. We were picked up early on the first day and taken to near the stables for our breakfast. Our driver was hugely informative and helpful. It was a traditional Moroccan breakfast and the tour guides could not have been more accomodating. Then we went to the stables and were introduced to our horses who were immaculately cared for. Everyone was really friendly and welcoming. There were only 2 of us on the tour (one novice and one experienced rider) and we were accompanied by a guide on his horse and another guide on foot. The ride was very relaxed and we could set the pace, going for gallops if we wanted or just plodding along. Galloping in the Atlas mountains where no car can go and which is almost completely deserted is probably one of the most amazing things someone can do.We stayed overnight in a traditional house with the guides and a cook who travelled there on his friendly donkey. The accomodation is basic but worth it. It's better to take your own sleeping bag. There, we had a huge dinner with a massive tagine that was cooked on site. It was lovely.The house is in a small village so you see the locals and see a way of life that is so removed from your own. I still felt welcomed.We woke up and set off early the next morning after a nice breakfast and spent the rest of the day riding to the final destination. I couldn't recommend the experience more. I would love to go back. Coming from London this is a part of the world and a life you just won't see otherwise. The horses are very well looked after and great to ride. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and even the donkey was lovely! Couldn't have been better.

Best part of our trip. We booked a full-day trek with Atlas and Sahara Tours and it was easily the best part of our Marrakesh stay. Every detail was taken care of with care and attention by Mustapha, who was prompt in communications and also very accommodating in helping us with a last-minute schedule change. Our day started and ended with a charming and friendly driver, Abdul, who collected us from our riad to meet up with our guide.  The trek through the Berber hills was simply breathtaking.  Our mid-day meal at the Berber guest lodge was delicious and relaxing. But it was our guide Mohammad's warm and genuine demeanor which really made the hike extra special, as he shared his knowledge of the area, people and traditions. We spent the day trekking spectacular high mountains and walking trails through the valleys together and were simply touched by Mohammad's enthusiasm for his work and his eagerness to share his love of the Berber land and way of life with us.  We finished the day completely happy, with memories to last a lifetime, as well as looking forward to returning for a longer excursion someday soon.

Good Tour - Great Guide. We organized a day trip to the Atlas mountains and the experience from beginning to end was a very good one. I exchanged numerous emails with the owner/manager Mustapha prior to arriving in Marrakech and he did a great job of answering our questions working to select the best itinerary for us.On the day itself we were picked up at our hotel on schedule then taken to the town in the mountains from whence we would begin our walk. During the drive we picked up or guide for the day Mohammed. Mohammed is what made the tour the really positive experience that it was. I am not sure that we saw the best the Atlas mountains had to offer, but Mohammed made the walk extremely interesting and worthwhile. He was extremely proud of his home and that pride when combined with his knowledge made for a very enjoyable day.I would recommend this Atlas and Sahara Day Tours to anyone looking for some time in the mountains and I would encourage you to request Mohammed if he is available.

The best day we had on our trip.. We had an amazing day. Thank you so so much! We were treated so well and we honestly had the best day of our trip with these guys. Our only regret is not being able to stay longer!

Best day of our stay in Morocco. From the moment when our driver arrived to collect us in his clean, modern vehicle until the moment we were dropped back we were superbly looked after.Muhammed, our guide for the day was exceptional, he was informative and had a great pride in his culture and country.Lunch was perfect in a lovely setting and the afternoon trek provided stunning views and a good insight into the Berber way of life.I would advise anyone trekking to have suitable footwear as it's not a gentle stroll on the flat!I would happily recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours to anyone visiting Morocco and hope to return ourselves one day.

The right antidote to the city's crazy pace!. The best way to balance a vacation in Marrakech is to take a day trip to the breathtaking Atlas Mountains. The setting plus the activities in nature provided the right antidote to the frenetic pace of the city. We booked our tour with Atlas and Sahara tours and everything from the planning process to the actual execution was professionally orchestrated. We opted for the 1/2 day camel trek in Asni valley & 1/2 day Hike in the Atlas Mountains tour.The vehicles were modern and air conditioned; the drivers showed up in a timely fashion; the transitions between the drivers to the tour guide and back were seamless and uncomplicated. Our tour guide Mahmood was pleasant, knowledgeable; he had great command of the English language and was very passionate about the Berber culture. Our luncheon on the top of the terrace was exquisite and the views gorgeous. The camels were very well attended and much better behaved compared to similar treks in other countries. As a matter of fact, the camel trek was the easier of the two activities. I would classify the level of the hike as “active” and would advise to wearing comfortable shoes. But the payoff of this activity, reaching the waterfalls, was one of the greatest compensations in the trip.No matter what season you visit Marrakech, do yourself a favor, plan an escapade to the Atlas Mountains and book with Atlas and Sahara tours. The prices were reasonable, the lines of communication were always open and their service level was comparable to western standards with unique Moroccan flavors.

What a great day in the mountains with a terrific guide.. We wanted to have a day of hiking in the Atlas Mountains and were lucky enough to find Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. Our expectations were exceeded and the hike was just beautiful! I highly recommend them.

Camel Trek & Atlas Mountains. I stumbled across this company and contacted the lovely Mustapha, who was more than accommodating and very courteous and efficient. We choice the first option the Camel Trek at Ansi and then Atlas Mountain trek. Whilst not the cheapest of tours , its probably one of the best. Very easy to book with Mustapha and email communication was great. Having arrived in Marrakech , on the day of our tour our lovely A/C 4x4 arrived promptly at our hotel and our drive Abdul was friendly and polite it was a 45 min journey to Ansi where we stopped off to pick up our guide and camels . A quick toilet stop and we were taken by our guide Mohammed to meet our Camels and their owner. We were helped to hop onto our camels settled and a quick photo opportunity and off we went. What a Camel trek it was Mohammed was brilliant chatting to us as we rod along and always offering to take photo's for us whilst giving us really personable knowledge as we went from place to place. No question was too much trouble and was always answered with such knowledge , our trek by camel was nearly 2 hrs where we said our goodbyes to our lovely camels and Abdul our driver was waiting for us ready for the short drive up into the Atlas mountains to the Riad where we would be taking lunch and what a lunch it was 3 course of delight with mint tea we were left to eating with each other and the mountains and we were then ready for our trek into the Atlas with Mohammed . We chose a 2 hr Trek which was simply breathtaking , again with great guidance and knowledge and Mohammed was brilliant friendly and lovely could have accept for a nicer person to lead us. At the end of our trek through the mountains , stopping of a various points including the berber houses and waterfall and the little villages and mosques , it was back down where our car awaited to whisk us back to our hotel. If your visit Marrakech and can spare a day to explore the real Morocco this is definitely the trip and tour company to use !! Can't recommend them enough!!

A wonderful, unforgettable day trip. My friend and I had a wonderful day trip in the Atlas Mountains. From the moment we were picked up to being dropped off at the end of the day we couldn't have asked for more. Both our driver and guide were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We started with a two hour camel ride which was great fun and a beautiful way to see some of the country. Mohammed, our guide, took pictures on my camera for the whole of the journey which are wonderful and a great memory of our trip. We were then taken for lunch at Riad Jnane Imlil and were served a lovely meal - the tagine was definitely the best we had tried. The terrace that we had our meal on was lovely and peaceful with incredible views. It was also lovely to meet Mustapha who I had been in contact with when booking this trip. We were then taken on a three hour hike in the Atlas Mountains which was definitely the highlight of the day. Mohammed was incredibly fun (he even performed an Eminem rap for us!) and interesting to talk to. It was wonderful to hear all about the Berber culture and how they live. We were able to paddle in a waterfall as well as having tea in a typical Berber home. It was a day that we didn't want to end. I can highly recommend this day trip and Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. I will definitely be using them again in the future.

Fantastic and interesting day trip. My boyfriend and I enjoyed an excellent tour organised by Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. We made a last minute booking (day before the tour) and they were quick and professional and happy to accommodate us. We were picked up promptly from the hotel in a comfortable 4 wheel drive and our driver was very polite. Once in the Atlas mountains we were taken for a wonderful 3 hour hike with Mohammed who is a local from the village - we very much enjoyed our walk with him and our talks with him. He had a good sense of humour and very well read. Our lunch in Mustapha's place was excellent - we sat on a lovely terrace and were given a very generous amount of food. I had a tagine every day in Marrakech and I enjoyed this one the most. Our afternoon camel ride was also an interesting experience and allowed you to see the country from different perspective. All in all it was a memorable day. The tour was well worth the price - just remember to bring a bit extra for tips as everyone who helped out that day definitely deserves it!

THE BEST OF THE BEST. This is by far the highlight of our Moroccan holiday. From the beginning the lines of communication are kept clear by Mustapha and he was more than patient with us, so we were already comfortable going into the excursion. We were picked up from our riad in Marrakech by tour guide Hassan and driver by Mohammed. Both nice men, who we trusted and felt safe with from beginning to end. We did our 3 day excursion during Ramadan and immense heat, so it was a wonder just how much these guys went out of there way to accommodate us. As soon as we begun the excursion the days itinerary was explained and checked with us. We were taken to beautiful photo hotspots, and encouraged to have a look despite the long car journey ahead.Staying in the camp in the middle of the desert after a bumpy, but unforgettable, camel ride was just surreal. It's a beautiful and slightly luxurious experience and being able to meet other people of different nationalities there just made it that more special. We were watered and routinely fed, so the money paid is very worth it and the views !! Staying in the Atlas mountains of Imlil town is just a heart stopping must. The riad Imlil is a gorgeous boutique stay with the most stunning views of the valley and surrounding town. The food is superb, especially since we thought we'd had our fill of tagine - this was cooked to perfection. The staff are lovely - we felt at home and it wasn't long until i'd lost my brother to the staff and other guests, watching the World Cup semis. We met the infamous Mustapha - is this the nicest man in Morocco?! What a happy, welcoming man. He seemed genuinely concerned by our stay and trip.Our final excursion during the mountain hike was blissful and exciting. Hassan, for obvious reasons, couldn't exert too much of himself but he was wonderful in taking us all the way up and down a 2-hour mountain hike with time allowed for us to have fun in the waterfall and relax in the nearby cafe. I can't thank the team behind Atlas and Sahara tours enough for their attentiveness and welcome. Worth every penny and I'd do it all again.One small thing: if you want the full experience as is promised on the site itinerary - then don't book during the holy fast! Understandably you will have to make allowances otherwise.

Perfect hike. We took a 2 days hike on the high atlas with this organization.Mustapha, the owner, was very easy to talk to, and even agreed to change our dates at very short notice because we didn't feel comfortable with the weather forecast. Assad, our guide was truly knowledgeable and a great hiking companion. I would recommend this organisation without hesitation

Fantastic Experience!. My sister and I booked this tour from Marrakech, we booked the 3 day Desert and Mountain tour. It was absolutely one of the best experiences I've ever had traveling. Mustapha is easy to communicate with and very kind and hospitable; I booked the whole thing via email and he's wonderful in person. The night we spent in the mountains was at his riad, which at the time, had opened just a few months prior, and it was so beautiful. The Riad is extremely comfortable and feels like home and the view on the roof cannot be beat. All of our meals were served on the roof with a perfect view of mountains and stars. Our guide, Abdullah and our driver Mohammed were FANTASTIC!!! Mohammed drove so well on the curvy mountain roads that I did not get car sick once; and I have gotten car sick while driving in the mountains in India. Abdullah was an amazing guide, he was informative and fun to hang out with for the 3 days that we spent with him. He took us on a hike through the Atlas mountains that was unforgettable. He made us feel very safe and comfortable and we had a great time talking to him. This tour company works with another company to do the overnight stay in the desert and that was also wonderful. The camp at the desert was really comfortable with showers and toilets and the staff was very kind and so much fun. This is an amazing tour: well organized, comfortable and beautiful accommodations, knowledgeable staff and guides, delicious food, a one of a kind experience and the best way to see how diverse and spectacular the country is. It is well worth the price and you will not regret booking with them!

A great way to experience Morrocco. My wife and 3 children (aged 11-15) had a great trip. Pros:1) Mustapha was amazing - he went out of his way to make this a perfect stay. He was very flexible in changing our itinerary midway during the tour. We wanted to stay two extra nights in Imlil instead of Marakech - which he arranged without charge! He's also a genuinely really nice person as is his family.2) We were met at the airport and taken to our place in Marrakech (I would really advise people not to hire a car as not sure if I could have driven on the roads!). We were a bit nervous when we first arrived but the accommodation was great and we were met by Mustapha who was very reassuring. Marakech was crazy but also amazing - I think 1 day was enough for me and kids - visiting the markets and other sights. 3) Our private bus was spacious, comfortable and air conditioned and gave great views. Our driver Mohammed was also really friendly and helpful.4) Our guide Hassan was helpful because it meant that we never got hassled and knew where to go. 5) The sahara desert and camel ride was the highlight of the tour. It was a two hour ride over sand dunes to get to the camp which is the perfect amount of time. I would have preferred to miss out on visiting the gorge in the morning (as it was a bit of a detour) and spent more time at the camp - as there was a great climb to the top of a huge dune by the side of the camp but we didn't have enough time to get to the top of it before sunset. The stay at the camp was fabulous - with music played by the camel guides. I got to learn how to play the drums.6) The riad we stayed at by the Gorges enroute to Sahara was fabulous. The food and the accommodation was really authentic, location perfect and the families really friendly. We went for a great walk in the evening from the riad.7) Aït Benhaddou where they filmed Mummy and Gladiator was a great place to see Kasbahs. It wasn't packed with tourists so you got a real sense of the authenticity of the place;8) The Atlas Mountains were beautiful - and the Riad we stayed at in Imlil was perfect - very relaxing after the long drive.9) The guided treks around Imlil with mules were also amazing. We loved having lunch cooked for us on the mountains. We went so high we could eat the snow!Cons - very few:1) Travelling by road was the only way to get to the Sahara - however it meant that we spent a long time in our private bus getting there so not sure if suitable for really young children. However, the desert was spectacular and there was no other way of getting there - perhaps one day they'll fix the potholes!2) I never knew how much to tip guides as tipping is way of life in Morocco - it always made me feel a bit awkward. I would prefer it if the price of the tour was increased and they said that no tipping was expected. Tricky one!Thanks Mustapha for a great holiday - my boys will always treasure the experience!

Super all way through !. As a family with 2 girls aged 10 & 12 and not much time at hand, we wanted a private, organized and safe trip trough Morocco. We can only highly recommend Atlas and Sahara tours - we had a fabulous experience all way through. The only thing we would do different is take more time with us next time (we had a busy schedule). Good lodging, a very safe and secure driver, and our guide made our trip very memorable. We absolutely loved the hiking experience in the mountains, which was a unique experience thanks to the great organization. We will come back!

The best part of our Moroccan Adventure. Our family of four spent a week in Morocco -- 3 nights in Marrakech, 2 nights in Agadir, and 2 nights on a private tour with this company. There are many companies that can organize tours, but Mustapha's prompt and professional correspondence made Atlas and Sahara Day Tours a stand out from the start! Our first night was spent at a nomadic camp in the Sahara Desert outside of Zagora. True, the quintessential dunes of Merzouga would have been a more ideal choice, but we chose to camp closer due to the very long drives each day (especially since we had kids in the car). There was plenty of sand prior to and around the camp, so we were not disappointed. The camel ride, meals, tents, entertainment, and guides at the desert camp were great!! The next day was spent driving into the Atlas Mountains with several stops along the way. Mustapha's riad -- Jnane Imlil -- is stunning and the meals were incredible!! Hassan, our guide, was knowledgable and helpful, always answering the myriad of questions we asked. On our final day, he took us on a hike around Imlil and to the waterfalls -- just beautiful! Although the driving time in the Land Cruiser was long, our kind driver Mohammed did a perfect job and we were as comfortable as possible. Mustapha even made it a point to come to the riad and meet us -- we were very impressed with him and his entire staff! Overall: fantastic experience from start to finish!!

Fabulous Experience. We used this Company for our Airport Transfers and for a day in the Atlas Mountains. My queries beforehand were dealt with efficiently. I was a bit concerned when it took an hour & a half to get through passport control that our transfer would have left, but our driver was sitting there waiting patiently. The day out was one of the most memorable of my life. Beautiful views, excellent lunch and a very helpful guide Hassan who came from the village we visited and was very friendly & knowledgeable.The camel ride was fun & the even the camels were friendly which suggested to me they were well looked after. All in all, brilliant!

Fantastic day trip to Atlas Mountains. My husband and I visited Marrakech and wanted to spend a day in the Atlas Mountains. We booked with Atlas and Sahara Tours from the UK. Mustapha was extremely helpful in setting out the options we had for a day trip from camel rides to trekking. We decided that we wanted to trek the mountains and were not disappointed! We were collected from our Riad by a driver and taken to the Riad Juane to start our trek. Our guide, Rasheed, a local Berber was an excellent guide and so much fun! We trekked up the mountain whilst speaking to our guide about local life. We asked half way to see a mountain and our guide took us on a detour through the some rough track to see a local (and not so touristy) waterfall which was lovely! After lunch we did another walk up the mountain to see some more local villages which were humbling. Locals inviting you in for tea is testament to the nature of the friendless we experienced.The day went perfectly and the trip was the best part of our 4 day trip.

Private tours by Moha of Unique Morocco Adventures. This 2 week long tour of Marrakech, the Sahara and thre Atlas Mountains was remarkable. Our guide, in addition to being knowledgable and very well informed about his country, was also accomodating and generous, picking us up and dellivering us to the airport even though it was not a booked day, and taking us to the Majorelle garden as a special treat (on him). He knew the best places to stay and when we asked for "interesting hotels and places to stay", he found them. He even took us to his family's typical Berber house for lunch one day, a high point. We observed other driver guides on our week long sojourn and we are convinced we had the best guide in Morocco. We also covered an amazing lot of ground because Moha knew all sorts of places to show us, off the track. He is a good driver, with a good 4 wheel drive car, always clean and supplied with water. We learlned more about the culture than we expected, and we enjoyed every minute of our adventure, Moha seems to know everyone and can allways get a table in the shade for lunch, and a bottle of wine if you want one. We spent 3 days in Marrakech at the beginning and the end of our week of travel and it was perfect. We recommend this tour guide without reservation. We found Moha on Trip Advisor.

Camel ride and trek in Atlas Mountains. We had the most wonderful experience with Mohammed as our guide to the Atlas Mountains. Mohammed is very engaging and knowledgable about Berber culture, history and ecology. The trip is very smoothly run, the whole team could not have done more to make our day enjoyable. The camels were great fun to ride, and clearly much loved by their owner; the lunch was delicious and enormous- served on the roof of an intricately decorated guesthouse with amazing views. The hike was a strenuous enough climb to make you feel better about the 3 courses just consumed, with so much interest- waterfalls, villages at high altitude, snow capped mountains, the occasional Berber tea house. Highly recommended and an utter bargain with lunch included at £80 each!

Anyone wants to join this tour together?. I will be going Marrakesh on the 30th june to 5th july and would like to find someone to go on tours from this company together as i am just a single person and hard for me to get a tour to the Sahara. Please let me know if you are interested.
great day. great tour on camels, walking, Mohammad our guide was brilliant. lovely lunch in Mustapha`s Riad,fantastic value and to see rural villages

Truly amazing day!. On booking this trip for 3 of us for our own tour, Mustapha got back to our emails promptly and was extremely helpful at every stage. We were picked up from our Riad and we took the camel ride and trek through the Atlas Mountains and Berber villages having the most wonderful time. The animals were cared for, the food was delicious and the sights were stunning. Muhammad was our guide and he really is a lovely person, really informative of what we were experiencing but also very caring and friendly with his passion for the beautiful surroundings shining through.I cannot recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours enough, everything about it was fantastic including all the staff with the 3 of us feeling like we did not want our day to end.

Beyond our expectations!. We booked a private tour in mid May to the Atlas Mountains with a half day camel ride and half day hike through the Atlas Mountains. Mustapha very promptly responded to all of our emails, and was very patient in working with us as we changed dates and wavered on having a private versus group tour. We finally decided to book a private tour for the two of us as having a third person join would not have saved costs considerably. Our scepticism about booking tours online were dashed away as soon as we started our tour and met our driver, Mustafa (not the owner) and our tour guide, Muhammed. Although the roads were quite winding, we did feel safe with our driver and Muhammed was very friendly and made the effort to explain any sights along the way. The camel ride was approximately 2 hours, winding through a few villages and roads, and it was definitely a lot of fun. Next, we had lunch at Mustapha’s beautiful riad. This was hands down the best meal that we had during our 5 day stay in Morroco. We had more than enough food served to us, and everything tasted so fresh as it was grown in the gardens. This coupled with the views from the terrace made for a very memorable lunch. We then went on for a hike through Imlil Valley. The views through the walk were breath-taking and we learned a lot about the local culture from Muhammed. His love of the valley and the mountains was evident. All in all, we can’t highlight enough how wonderful a time we had. Muhammed went well above and beyond, and tailored the day for us, as he helped my other half arrange a very special proposal! We couldn’t have had a better person to share the moment with us. Overall we highly recommend this company, and we are looking forward to returning one day for a tour to the peak of the Atlas Mountain summit!

An amazing Atlas visit. We booked this trip before we left, speaking with Mustapha over the phone and by email to make arrangements. His English was excellent and he had no problem in organising our vegetarian requests. We discussed which of the itineraries on his website we were interested in and our preference for a 3-4 hour hike rather than mules, camels etc.The whole day went incredibly smoothly. We (my friend and I) were picked up on time (9 a.m.) in a lovely Mercedes jeep type thing (not a car person!) and driven into the mountains, stopping at a co-operative run by women selling argan oil. This was a brief stop and no pressure to buy. There was also the chance to use toilets. The journey was beautiful and our driver very good. When we reached the village we met our guide, Mohammed, who was assigned to just the two of us. I cannot praise him highly enough. We did find the first half of the walk extremely steep and hard going, although undoubtedly beautiful. Although we both walk, it is not usually in 30 degree heat, uphill at altitude - something we struggled with. However, because it was just us, we took plenty of breaks and did not feel worried about slowing down others. Mohammed was patience itself and also extremely informative about flora, fauna, the Berber way of life, Islam - whatever we asked him about! Once we made it to the plateau the walk was much easier and we picked up our pace a bit as we stopped going uphill!lunch (all included) on the roof terrace of the riad owned by Mustafa and his family, was delightful: lovely salads, vegetable tagine and bread and melon and cherries from the garden. Again, very nice toilets!All in all, a fabulous day out, full of wonderful memories that we will treasure. Yes it was hard work at times, but totally worth it and I have no hesitation in recommending them as every aspect was so well organised and the people were so lovely. Very reasonably priced. Enjoy!

What a surprise...a nice one though. Our day trip into the Atlas Mountains turned out to be one of the best days of our short stay in Marrakech. Joining up with several French tourists early one morning near the Hotel de Marrakech, we were seated next to the guide, Ahmed, in the lead vehicle (6 Land Cruisers),so that he translate his commentary separately to my wife and me. After a fast run along the highway, we swung off-road and swayed and bumped our way to a viewpoint overlooking an ancient casbah, citadel or fortress. After taking the obligatory photos, we were soon surrounded by local boys, who took a great interest in my wife's artistic sketches, as well as helping their selves to one or two of her crayons. Shortly afterwards, we were loaded back into the vehicles and set off again, stopping every so often to look at points of interest. At lunchtime we were invited to dine, Moorish style in a Berber village, and after some shuffling around of seating, we eventually sat down to an excellent tagine or tajine cooked chicken and vegetable dish, with freshly baked breads, and salads all washed down with their ubiquitous mint tea. Later we set off a climbed steeply upwards, glad of the surefootedness of our 4X4s as the ground fell away sharply on each side, until arriving at another Berber village. This was to be our last formal stop before arriving onto the Kik plateau, our destination for the day. Our party were invited to enter one of the spacious Berber family homes to drink more mint and eat some small, very sweet cakes made with their superb honey. I eschewed this visit preferring to walk around the village which clung to the precipitous hills, offering staggering views over the plains below. I was soon surrounded by half a dozen childen all asking for stilos (biros), bob-bons or l'argent (money). We had been expressly advised not to offer money, but I soon exhausted my remaining stock of pens. Finally, I sat down at one of the viewing points and took in the views, making sure that I was in full view of the local villagers who were toiling away in back-breaking fields. In spite of the fact that they were speaking either French of their own Arabic Berber dialect, the children and myself managed to communicate in some way or other. They continued to ask for money, assuming I wished to take their photographs, but were completed nonplussed when I handed my camera to them instead. After overcoming their surprise, they set about learning how to use the camera and took it in turns to take some group photos, and they soon started to exaggerate their features, trying to outdo each other in outlandish gestures, falling around with laughter as they did so, when they viewed their results. After some 20 minutes, they politely and solemnly returned the camera to me, with "merci, monsieur" and I re-joined the main party as it set off to continue climbing into the lower hills of the Atlas. To all of our astonishment, we finally arrived onto the plateau proper to be greeted by the most beautiful shades of green, light and dark, with crops growing in abundance as far as the eye could see. This was the highest point we were able to reach in the time available, and we soon started our descent into the valleys below, before eventually arriving back onto the highway and returned to the hustle and bustle of the Red City of Marrakech. What did we learn on this special day. We had had a very good lunch, met some of the nicest people and children on the planet, had great fun and been staggered (truly) by the achingly beautiful lower Atlas mountains. All in all, a very good day was had by all.

The Best Day Of Our Holiday!. We booked the Ait Mizane valley day trip (Atlas Mountains) via email. This is a walking day trip. But there are others to choose from. Right from the outset, Mustapha responded quickly and clearly. The driver arrived at our Riad on time, the 4x4 Landcruiser was pristine and the driver was very safe. We arrived at the Riad Jnane Imlil, where we met Mohammad our guide. We then had a lovely 2.5 hour walk - we could have made it as long or as short as we wanted, wandering up through a Berber village (great way to see village life up close and informally). Then we had what was probably our best tagine on our holiday - wonderful salad and bread too. We were supposed to go for another walk after lunch but were too full and tired from the morning so it was back to Marrakech for us. The views are amazing and the fresh air and vistas were definitely worth the drive. It was my husbands favourite day of the holiday. We paid 75 euros each and this included everything. I wore trainers but walking shoes and a pole would be ideal. This is not a stroll - it is a proper walk on uneven surfaces and requires some fitness. But just to give you some idea of the quality of this company, I left my shoes behind with the guide and they arranged for them to be delivered (1.5 hour drive!) to our Riad that evening - that is impressive service. Mustapha owns the Riad where we had lunch, and the driver and guide all live locally so its great to see some money going into these small villages. I thoroughly recommend this company. They couldn't have done anything better.

Fabulous!. Fantastic day in the Atlas Mountains around Ilmil. Lunch was the best meal I have had since I arrived in Marrakech, tagine, salad, lentils, mint tea etc. Our guide was great, very knowledgeable and happy to answer any questions. Will definately use these guys to go up Mount Toukbal one day. The riad they have in Ilmil is pretty amazing too!Wear plenty of sunscreen on a sunny day. I got toasted!

Great 3 day Trek in Atlas. After the bustle of Marrakesh what a relaxing and enjoyable trek we had in the Atlas mountains (apart from kids bickering over whose turn it was to ride the mule!). This was expertly organised by Mustapha and executed by his polite and knowledgeable staff. In fact according to the kids we dined on the best food in Morocco on this trek, despite the large plate of vegetables on offer.I would definitely recommend using this company and you will have nothing to worry about apart from your tired legs!Estelle

Toubkal ascent. Did a 2 day ascent of Jebel Toubkal with Atlas and Sahara and was very impressed by Mustapha's hospitality, probably the best hospitality that we received in Morocco. From the point of our taxi transfer from our Riad in Marrakech to sending us back to our Riad after our climb of Toubkal, Mustapha has it extremely well covered to ensure every part of the experience was with utmost comfort. We were also really well fed and taken care of in the course of the ascent. Being amateurs in mountain climbing, we took 3 hrs more to complete the climb. Even then, Mustapha and his team received us warmly in Imlil without the slightest bit of frustration at our pace, but instead emphasized that safety was most important and gave us tea, biscuits and hot showers to ease our pain from the muscle ache and exhaustion. Also had a long pleasant chat with Mustapha on soccer. Overall, the Toubkal ascent with atlas and Sahara was beyond our expectations and we were glad we did it.

What an amazing experience in Asni Valley. Last week my 2 daughters and I visited Marrakesh. Since its a close distance from the Atlas mountains we thought we would get off our sunloungers and do something active. I looked at Tripadvisor for ideas and found Atlas and Sahara tours. Mustapha, the owner, very promptly answered all my questions by email and helped with choosing the right trip. We chose a day trip to the Asni Valley. We were picked up by a comfortable people carrier car and the 3 of us set off. En route we picked up our guide for the day who was Mohammed. More about him later. There was no waiting, all worked like clockwork. On arrival to Imlil, our starting point, we had some tea and set off for a walk up to 2000m observing small villages and life of the locals and scenery which was breathtaking. Snow at the top in distance and air so pure. Mohammed (bless him) looked after us- we are not the fittest people on the planet, he helped, waited, explained, supported. His love and regard for his environment and us as clients was exemplary. he is genuinely a nice human being who values his work. At the top he treated us to tea in a local dwelling and we got our breath back! The way down took us past a waterfall, so many photo opportunities. Finally we got back to Mustaphas house on the edge of Imlil village, where we were treated to a fantastic lunch on a roof terrace- tagine so tasty and salad, all so clean and beautifully prepared. Fruit desert followed. We got back to the hotel at about 1700. I left my jumper at the house in Imlil and Mustapha emailed me about it and next day delivered it to the hotel, eventhough I told him not to waste his time making the 1.5 hour journey. Overall amazing day, amazing memories and a company that they all should be proud of. Next time( after some serious fitness prep we want to go for the overnighter up in the hills. There will be a next time as we will never forget how lovely it was.

Amazing 2 day adventure to Sahara!. We booked a private 2 day tour to the Zagora Sahara. From the start, Mustapha was extremely helpful. From my initial inquiries, through booking and to follow-up at the end of our trip. My husband and I had a fantastic time on this adventure and really enjoyed our overnight experience in the Sahara. The tour was very well organized and the guides were fantastic! Rashid was an amazing guide, he was very attentive to details and super nice! Mohammed was also great with the drive and we really trusted him and felt safe during the journey. The tour stops and restaurants along the journey were also very pleasant and everyone was very friendly. The overnight stay in the desert at the nomadic camp was a truly amazing experience and the tents with beds were very comfortable. Overall, we had an amazing time and we really appreciated the short trip away from Marrakech. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone! Thank you again Mustapha, Rashid & Mohammed!!! We will remember this for our lifetime.

Fantastic two day horse trek in Atlas Mountains!. We booked a private two day horse trek through the Atlas Mountains with Mustapha he was extremely helpful when booking and answered all of the emails we sent extremely promptly! The whole tour was excellently organised and we highly recommend booking through Mustapha! Our tour guide Mohammed was great and Hussain and his 3 horses were brilliant-it was a truly amazing experience passing through Berber villages, riding round mountains and up rivers-a must for a horse fans out there! We were taken to Mustapha's Riad at the end if the trek to freshen up and for mint tea-the Riad has only just been built and it is truly beautiful-we intend on returning so we can stay in one of the stylish rooms! Thanks to Mustapha and his team for a truly unforgettable experience

Trip to Telouet and Ait Benhadou. We had a trip over the Tizi n'Tichka to visit the Kasbahs at Telouet and Ait Benhadou with Abdul and Abdul - great guys! After the scary, noisy traffic in Marrakech this was delightful, and so informative. We loved the scenery through the mountains and the kasbahs were amazing - we will be back, but for a couple of days next time to get further south.

Better than we could have hoped for!. We booked a two night, three day tour of the Imlil valley through Mustapha, who was brilliant at helping us choose the right tour for us, go when we wanted and arrange dietry requirments and pickup and dropoff points. We assumed that we would be in a group with other tourists as we had not read at any point that it would be a private tour and so were blown away to find that it was just the two of us with our own Englsh speaking guide Mohamed, chef Lessan and mule to carry our things! Mohamed was so friendly and helpful throughout and Lessan made the best meals we had during our trip to Morocco on a camping stove on the side of a mountain (and loads of it!). The scenery was breath taking and weather perfect in March. Staying the the Berber house was a fun experience but we were really pleasantly surprised to find our second night's accomodation was in a beautiful Riad in the moutains, owned by Mustapha. Would highly recommend this trip to everyone!

An unforgettable adventure. My boyfriend and I did the half camel ride, half mountain trek day trip with lunch included, and it was worth every penny! The weather wasn't great for us in March, but even in the rain and cold we had a wonderful time. Riding the camels through the hills and villages, in particular, was an amazing experience and one of the best things I've ever done.For a really detailed, minute-by-minute review of the experience including photos, you can read my report here:http://jubbiz.wordpress.com/2014/05/01/a-wild-trek-on-camel-and-on-foot-moroccos-atlas-mountains/

Exceptional service - look no further. We spent three days on a truly unforgettable private tour in Sahara desert and Atlas mountains, which was a perfect combination of exciting experiences (riding camels, camping in the desert, stargazing) and breathtaking views (mountains, Ourika valley, Berber villages and many many more). We also went on a three-hour hike in the mountains - fairly challenging but much appreciated having eaten all those tajines!The experience wouldn't have been the same without the exceptional care and professionalism of all staff, during the booking and the tour itself. Rachid was our guide for the three days, and showed incredible patience in answering all our questions about the tour, Morrocan life and culture and more, and went above and beyond making sure we had everything we might have needed during the tour. Both Rachid and Mohammed (the driver) were genuinely nice people to be around.For the first night we stayed at a camp in the desert. While not fond of camping at all, I was relieved to find warm tents, showers with hot water, and bathrooms on site. We greatly enjoyed the meals cooked by the Berbers and the music played by the fire in the night.For the second night we were welcomed at Riad Jnane Imlil, which provides truly luxurious experience, with full range of amenities, mountain views (can be enjoyed from the roof terrace, private balcony, or even your own bed!). The most remarkable was the cooking by the chef Hassan - with plentiful three-course meals where the starter alone would be enough to feed you.Before the tour Mustapha, the owner, suggested we start with the desert night, followed by the mountains and hiking. We would recommend that as the driving time was out of the way and we could get back to Marrakech a bit earlier on the last day.

A great trip: exceeded our expectations. Our day trip to Imlil and walking in the Imlil valley was great. When booking this trip, Mustapha was great and prompt in his communications with us. Our driver Abdul picked us up from our Riad in Marrakech and drove us to meet our guide in Imlil. He took the time to tell us about the area, stopped at a scenic place so we could take pictures and had Berber music playing on the radio to get us in the mood! Our walking guide Mohammad was great. He kept up a good (reasonably slow and steady pace) for us to follow and he knew the area like the back of his hand. I kept thinking how hard it would have been for us to access the trails we were on if we hadn't been with him. When we reached the summit of our walk he pulled out fruit for us to snack on and both before and after our walk he brought us to get tea. I thought these were nice and unexpected touches. Lunch in the (beautiful) Riad in Imlil was huge and delicious. We were so full afterwards. On our drive home, Abdul kindly brought us to the train station in Marrakech and waited for us while we bought tickets for later in the week and then brought us back to our Riad. I would highly recommend a trip with Atlas and Sahara tours and I look forward to our next trip.

Very good personalised trek and lunch. We had already booked our stay at Imlil which is a village at the base camp of Atlas Mountains.We wanted to do some trekking with the help of a guide to take us around. The booking was done promptly through emails to Mustapha the owner. The guide Hassan came right on time and arranged for excellent path for our trek according to our preferences. It was a four our trek just for our family of four. He had excellent knowledge of terrain, history and lot of facts and information on geography,local fauna,flora and history.At the end of trek we were taken to the Riad for some excellent lunch on the terrace top. They catered for our vegetarian preference readily.I would highly recommend these people.

Our great adventure!!. Just got back from 3 days of Marrakech to Zagora and back!! Wow! Mustapha was superb and prompt with booking through emails!! Our guide, Rashid, was welcoming, took super care of all five of us, me, husband, three kids ages, 8, 10 and 14! Best of all spoke English well!! Our driver, Abdul was highly skilled and knew the winding mountain roads really well. The camel trek to the Zagora is a must! Could have done more days to really see the little towns in between Marrakech and the dessert! Full day drive to get to the camels in the dessert with a few stops in small villages...lunch awesome everywhere! Stay at nomadic tents a must!! Watched sunrise over the dunes!! Wow!! Stay at Riad Jnane Imlil...white glove, attentive service....newly built, authentic, beautifully Moroccan design...the riad only has five suites and the staff caters just to the five or less guests!! Tenemmirt Mustapha, Rashid and Abdul for a vacation we will never forget!!! Absolutely go with this company! Our hotel in Marrakech highly recommended them and now we do too!

Marrakech visit highlight!. This company are very well organized and Mustafa arranged our trip with only a few hours notice. My sister and I decided on the ½ day mountain trek, ½ day camel ride. The trek from Imlil through the villages by Hamid was interesting and fun. You really got a sense of the pride and nobility of the Berber people. Lunch was just fantastic (one of the best meals we had in Morocco) together with breathtaking views on the foothills of the Atlas. I remember saying to my sister “This is the life!”. The camel ride was good too. All-in-all a very worthwhile trip.

Very well looked after. We did a day trip, to the Atlas from Marrakech with the wife and two children (6&8). Excellent hospitality and organisation. We were picked up from our hotel by a friendly, English-speaking driver and taken to meet our lovely guide - Mohamed. He was brilliant, so kind and knowledgeable. All the staff are from the local villages, so there is a real sense of pride and as a tourist you feel you are supporting the local community. The kids loved the camel and mule trek - very safe. The food at lunchtime was freshly prepared and abundant!! Thoroughly enjoyable. RECOMMEND.

Brilliant Excursion. A superb excursion in the heart of the Atlas mountains. We chose to do half a day trekking in the Atlas Mountains followed by a camel ride. The day was chaperoned by our guide Mohammed. We was a lovely guy who was very well educated and told us a lot about the history and culture of the place. We then had a gorgeous lunch at Mustapha's Riad over looking the mountains. The food was absolutely delightful and the view was sensational. The camel ride was a great experience but the dried up river we went down resembled more of a dirt track which ruined the scenery slightly.But overall a great experience and a very well run company. I would recommend this to anyone, our favourite day in Marrakesh.

A Great Day in the High Atlas. We booked a half day trek with a half day camel ride in the High Atlas through Atlas and Sahara Tours. As has been mentioned in other reviews, Mustapha is extremely quick to answer queries and emails, and organisation was painless, with prices available in dirhams or Euros. The only problem we had with the day was that our excursion was put in the wrong page of their diary; we booked an early breakfast and were waiting for the driver, when no one arrived! Luckily, our riad manager raised them on the phone and they came as quickly as they could. Apologies were profuse and we didn't miss anything of our tour. We were picked up in a comfortable minivan, and the drive to Imlil was beautiful with plenty of opportunities to stop for photos, and a friendly driver. At Imlil, we met our guide Mohammad, who looked after us superbly. He made sure we had appropriate supplies, but brought along some extra water and fruit for us just in case. He was happy to adapt the difficulty and length of the trek based on our capability too. We trekked through some traditional Berber villages around Imlil, and Mohammad was extremely patient with our constant stops to take photographs of the views!
