He was friendly and knowledgable, but not intrusive; he was happy for us to walk and soak in the views without disturbing us, but also more than happy to talk at length about Berber history when we asked. We stopped for a break at a home in one of the higher villages, with time for some fruit and (naturally) mint tea while enjoying the views from a balcony. In the second half of our trek, we wound our way down the valley proper, following the river and seeing some beautiful waterfalls. Lunch was provided at Atlas and Sahara Tours' headquarters in Imlil. It was fantastic, with enormous portions, and very filling. We met Mustapha who was extremely apologetic about the earlier mix-up. Following lunch, we were driven further down through the mountains towards the river valley for our camel trek. Mohammad accompanied us to the camel trek as well, and acted as our personal photographer as we made our way along a dry riverbed! The camels were a fascinating experience even though neither of us were particularly good with heights....After just over an hour or so, we were met by our driver, said our goodbyes to Mohammad and the camels, and made our way back to Marrakech. We would highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours. Initial contact was excellent, and Mustapha was very patient in explaining numerous different tour options to us and letting us design a bespoke day if we wanted. Mohammad was perfect as a guide, and his photography was great; we were so glad he was there to capture our time on camelback for us!

One day camel trek and hike - Highlight of my holiday!. What an incredible day.Firstly, Mustapha has to be thanked profusely for letting me rearrange our planned excursion on the day (at the moment when our driver arrived at our Riad to collect us), due to me picking up a nasty bug from a restaurant the previous night. No extra charges, no hassle, which was fantastic considering how little notice I gave him.24 hours later, our driver arrived (again) to take us to our starting point, a roadside cafe in Reha, the absolute middle of nowhere, with nothing but 2 camels and a few horses around. After a pot of mint tea and some of our driver's breakfast which he very kindly shared with us (Moroccan style fried eggs, try then if you have time before your trek!) our guides for the day arrived.[A little word of warning about the roadside cafe: the "toilet" is a small cupboard upstairs with a hole in the floor. Nothing more. My advice - go before you leave.]We were helped onto our camels for the morning and set off. At the start of the journey you really need to place your trust in the camels. You'll be led over some very rocky terrain across a few streams to reach the paths that you'll spend the next few hours following - it's wobbly, but fret not, the grip that those animals have is astounding! The scenery along the way is stunning, totally other-worldly. Our guides were really friendly, answering any questions we had about the area. You will pass numerous Berber families in the mountains - give the children a wave, it looked as though we made their day. And contrary to popular belief, the camels were very well behaved, no spitting or kicking!We were picked up at the end of our trek (remember to tip the camel owner, 20dhms each is adequate) and driven to Riad Jnane, in Imlil, for lunch. It was getting a little cold outside, so the roaring fire which greeted us was welcomed. Once again, a pot of mint tea (this time with a plate of pastries) awaited us. Lunch was a massive salad to start, followed by beef tagine, then fruit. The dining room is really cosy, beautiful too. We were given a tour of the Riad by Mustapha (the whole thing has only recently been built, the guy is obviously really proud of his work!) before starting our tour of the Atlas mountains. Again, it feels as though you're on a different planet at times, it's unreal but stunning. It's not a particularly difficult walk, there is no climbing or anything treacherous involved. Watch for horses though, even on the narrowest passageways of the steepest slopes! Have your wits about you too, you will find yourself stopping at souvenir shops along the way where you'll be shown a selection of 'authentic Berber wares'. As with anywhere in Marrakech, don't feel pressured into buying anything that you don't want.The circular route took us back into Imlil, where we were picked up (the guide will stay, if you want to tip him (which you should), do so there). From there, we were driven back to our Riad.Pre-booking by email was really easy, everyone involved is extremely professional and friendly (and accommodating, as I discovered). Spending a day in the Atlas mountains is essential if you're coming to Marrakech for a few days. The best way to see them is by camel, and I would absolutely recommend booking to do so with these guys.

excellent tailor made tours. We just did a 3d Sahara and Atlas tour and were totally happy with it. Mustapha the organizer gives you great advise to find the right tour. The lodges /tents are of high end quality, you travel by 4x4 (it is worth as you travel 7h approx daily) and get close with locals. it is worth the money!!

A wonderful day in the Atlas mountains. My partner and I booked a 5 day holiday to Marrakech but were keen to visit the mountains. After spending hours pouring over the reviews on Trip advisor for day trips we went for Mustapha's outfit..Atlas and Sahara Tours. We booked a half day camel ride in Asni Valley, with lunch and hike in Ilmil. We were not disappointed. Mustapha and his guides and drivers are very professional. Hassan, our guide for the day, was lovely and made us feel very welcome. The trip to the mountains was in a very comfortable, very clean 4x4. The camel ride was entertaining, my camel being the mum of my partner's more playful son! This was followed by a drive u to Ilmil and a lovely lunch on the roof terrace of Mustapha's new Riad and then a hike which was definitely needed after such a feast. Then a comfortable journey home. A really wonderful trip. Thank you Mustapha and Hassan!

Book Without Fear And Know You'll Be Well Served. If you're the least bit concerned about booking with this company set aside any reservation you might have. This is the real deal and you'll have a great experience. Mustapha, who owns the firm and Riad Jnane Imlil, is a first class entrepreneur and puts customer service and experience as his first priority.Making reservations online was easy. Mustapha always followed up promptly, answered all questions, and personally worked to make sure our expectations were exceeded.Our guide and driver were at the hotel 15 minutes early for the pick up. Both were friendly, well versed in the area we toured, outgoing, and made sure we had a good time. Answering countless questions about the geography, community, way of life, and stopping to take pictures, were never a problem. There were three adults in our party. The SUV, owned by the driver who is from one of the villages we visited, was only a month old. One of us set up from with the driver, two in the middle row, and the guide in the back of the SUV. We had plenty of space and a comfortable ride.Our guide was excellent at pacing the hike based on the speed we wanted to hike. The two and a half hour hike through fields and villages, along well marked trails, was not difficult. We stopped frequently to rest and take pictures.After the hike we had lunch on the roof top patio of Riad Jnane Imlil, which was part of our day tour. Construction on the riad was completed about two months ago after two and a half years of building by local crafts people. The attention to quality and detail was impressive. The view of the villages and mountains was outstanding. The food, home cooked, was one of the more tasty meals we had in Morocco....lentil soup, traditional tagine (one vegetarian by request) and fresh fruit. Traveling back to Marrakech we took a different route than the one used on our way out. This gave us an opportunity to see more of the beautiful country, interesting villages, and sites in the area.The day we spent touring with this firm was one of the best days of our two week Moroccan journey. Having experienced the quality of their service I wouldn't hesitate to book more extensive travel with them through Morocco.

Fantastic hike in the Atlas Mountains. The one-day trip from Marrakech was great. Mustapha and his colleagues took care of every last detail, ensuring that we had a well-organised trip to the Ait Mizane valley, with a three-hour walk into the hills. The scenery was amazing and the lunch at the end of the walk was good too. We would use this company again.

Wonderful Sahara Tour. We had a fantastic tour with Abdul and Ibrahim to the Sahara. The two of them looked after us and ensured that we were comfortable on the long drive. They also were very good at making sure that we made it to each place by a certain time so we did not miss the Sahara sunset, and we were not disappointed - we got to see the sunset (on camels) and it was amazing.Abdul was extremely friendly, and very accommodating, speaking both in English to my partner and in French to me. He was also very patient with our questions and was more than happy to stop for photos and to give us local advice. Ibrahim was a fantastic driver and he expertly navigated the roads through the Atlas and the Sahara.I would definitely recommend thistour company, and we would definitely consider using them again when we come back to Morocco. I think we will definitely do a longer tour next time!

Walking tour. We decided at the very last moment to have a day in the Atlas mountains> Looked on TA and found this company. Mustafa was excellent responded quickly to my emails from hotel and trip was organised for the next day. Trip was excellent - nice walk with lovely local guide, excellent lunch ( the best we had in Morocco) and we were staying at so called 5* hotel in Marrakech. Most importantly the price was very competitive less than half of what the transit agent was attempting to charge - excellent value for money

Lovely People, Excellent Service. An amazing trip organised really really well by Mustafa and his team. We had a fantastic trip to the edge of the Sahara and into the Atlas Mountains with Abdullah and the very safe driver, Mohammed. Such lovely people and they were so sweet with Hamish our son of 10. Turns out wearing a Man City hat helps.....! I would recommend highly Atlas and Sahara Tours. We travelled February Uk Half term 2014.

3 Day to Zagora and Imlil Valley. These guys are great. Mustapha was super organised and efficient - we did it all by email - and the guide Abdullah and driver Mohammed was really friendly, knowledgeable and generous. The riad in Imlil is great - the food portions are enormous!One thing to be aware of (and this isn't a reflection of the guys) is that the trip we chose involves a lot of driving in order to be able to reach the desert from/to Marrakech in three days. Zagora is a day's drive with a stop & lunch at Ait Ben Haddou, and a days drive back to Imlil or Marrakech. We enjoyed it as you can see the geography and villages change as you're going but, if you have young children, it simply is a long time. We didn't have time to do more than three days and I really wanted to get to the Sahara but Abdullah and Mustapha both said it's better to do four or five days.
Day trip to the mountains. Excellent day trip. Well organised and lovely guide and staff. Would recommend. Scenery awesome and a clear day out after the busy madness of The Medina.

Fun on a camel. Five of us took a day tour including a 2 hour camel ride in the Asni valley and a trek in the Atlas Mountains. Our camels took us along and through a small partly dry river bed. Our camel herders who spoke limited English were still good at making us feel at ease and at no time were we worried considering beforehand how many people had said camels were awful. The valley was lovely and we had great views of the snow capped Atlas Mountains.A leisurely Lunch was served on the outdoor roof terrace of a Berber house and consisted of mixed salads, bread, beef tagine and fruit salad. After lunch we walked for two hours through small Berber settlements with great views of the valley and mountains.We organised the trip with Mustapha before we left England and he was very helpful, imformative and quick to respond to our queries. Our driver picked us up on time and our guide was confident and happy to answer any questions we had.Would certainly recommend Mustapha and his company for day treks or longer excursions.

One of our best experiences in Morocco!. As a couple we booked a trip with Adil. It was one of our best experiences in Morocco. I must admit we travelled a month ago, so I'm a bit rusty on the details.The tour started with us visiting a local berber market. The experience was very different compared to Marrakech, and it's definitely worth experiencing this if you're able to. I'd like to mention that there was no pressure to buy anything, not here, nor at any other point of the tour. We had some “Moroccan doughnuts” and resumed our journey towards an Argan Oil cooperative.The Argan Oil cooperative allowed us to see and learn how argan oil is produced. It was solely run by divorced and widowed women. There's also a store with many argan oil products. These are legitimate, as we learnt that many other argan oils are mixed with inferior oils. With a brief pause we resumed our trip to the Ourika Valley.The Ourika Valley was a beautiful sight, and gave us the chance to appreciate Morocco's nature, something we hadn't been able to experience in Marrakech. Throughout the drive we had the chance to talk to some local children, and we had brought some gifts (clothes) to give. Seeing children being so happy with our gifts was a great plus.We had lunch with a berber family. We had tea, couscous, chicken tagine, and fruit (we were too full by then). The food was amazing, I'd even go as far as saying it was the best couscous tagine we've had in Morocco. Also we were served bottled water, which is nice!Afterwards we drove through the Asney valley. Again, this was nice to see, as it differed greatly from the Ourika Valley. After this great journey we were brought back to our journey.This tour is an amazing value for money. It's a great experience, and we felt very comfortable throughout the process. I'd recommend it to anyone!

Great organised tour to the Ourika Valley. I booked a custom made day trip to the Ourika Valley in the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara tours. The booking process was easy and all the trips were carefully explained in an emails. We were met at our Riad by Abdellah who was our guide for the day. He was a fantastic guide who answered our many questions and looked after us for the day. The views were amazing and our 'hike' was amazing too, believe me, I'm not fit but I done it in my wedges! Lunch was in a great clean restaurant with good food, this was included in the price we paid which was 50 euros per person, well worth it. We stopped at a Berber house where they grind flour for a living which was interesting.Overall, a great day trip and Big credit to Abdellah who had to put with 5 women for the day!I would recommend this company to anyone who is interested in taking a day trip.

Best guides I have ever come across. I travel a lot and have been on numerous tours - this by far had the best guides I have ever come across.Mustapha is excellent with communication - very quick and answers all of your questions / queries / comments insanely quick! The day our tour was booked for was forecast to rain so Mustapha gave me a call and asked if I'd like to change the tour to the following day as it was forecast to be sunny...after juggling a few bits around, I agreed and am so glad I did!Hasan arrived at our riad half an hour ahead of schedule but was happy to wait for us whilst we ate breakfast. He then walked us to the car where Ali was waiting to drive us to the Asni valley for our camel ride. Ali and Hasan were great hosts, answering all of our questions along the hour long drive to the camels and telling us facts and anecdotes about Marrakech that we did not previously know.Camels were great - not a hugely scenic route taken on the camel ride, quite different to the desert (you ride them through a river) but was ok. Then drove to the Imlil village - Hasan and Ali's hometown and was amazing! Covered with snow, up to our ankles but the sun was beating down on us heavily. We watched children ski, had a go ourselves, hiked to the guesthouse and had an amazing lunch prepared for us by Omar and his wife - tea, starters, main course AND dessert. I mentioned to Mustapha before that it was my friends birthday and Hasan's mum made the most beautiful, ornate cake - she could put Patisserie Valerie out of business! And this at no extra charge!!!!!! We also all requested boneless chicken when we booked our excursion and this was done too.On the way back to the riad we asked to stop off somewhere to buy authentic argan oil and were taken to a women's argan manufacturers, given a tour, bought our oil - AND given free gifts! Then when back in Marrakech Ali waited for us to gather our swimwear and dropped us off to the Hammam for our treatments.It's the little things that matter to me that make up such great products and companies and the Atlas and Sahara tours team are honestly fantastic - I cannot recommend them highly enough.

Camel ride and Trek in Imlil Valley. Just back from Marrakech and this day trip was one of the highlights! Very well organised (Mustapha is very prompt with communication) company. Mohammed picked us up from our hotel & was a great driver - the roads were windy but I never felt car sick (which is normally the case) due to his good/safe driving. Abdil/Abdul was our guide for the camel ride and trek around Imlil and he was brilliant. So friendly, and so knowledgeable about his environment. The beef tagine for lunch on a roof terrace looking up at the snow-capped Atlas mountains was also lovely!Would highly recommend this company, and especially the 1/2 day camel ride and 1/2 day hike option! So great to escape the city for a day and feel so looked after!

Day Trip to Imlil and a hike in teh mountains. The driver parked and walked to our riad so he could show us the way to our mini van for the journey. He then drove us out of Marrakech and into the High Atlas to a village called Imlil where we met our walking gide Abdil.Abdil was a wonderful guide and after a mint tea we were off. The walk was very interesting and Abdil was very patient when we stopped to look at interesting rocks or photograph a view. He was also a fountain of knowledge about the Berber people and their customs. When we reached the highest point (about 2100m) Abdil suggested we have a rest and produced some wonderful oranges from his bag. We then followed Abdil along a ridge and then doan across a riverbed before returining to the village for a welcome lunch of the best Beef Tagine I have tasted.I thoroughly reccomend Atlas and Sahara tours trip to Imlil as a break from the city and souks - the air is so fresh and clean you can taste it.Gary

A Well Arranged Tour. The trip really began with our cold call to Mustapha and he was always quick to respond during the planning process. We were 2 familes, with children in the 7-12 year-old range. While we chose several of our own riads, Mustapha did a great job setting up guides, all of whom were wonderful, including the very knowledgeable and amicable Driss. Our driver, Mohamed, was excellent, and most important, very safe, as he carried 9 of us throughout Morocco. We really enjoyed our 2-day trek in the Atlas Mountains; I thoroughly recommend the excursion to all visitors, if possible. Leave the wonderful medinas for a couple of days as the mountains are a great escape/experience for children and adults alike. However, I would be specific with exactly how long and strenuous you would like the trek to be; our mules certainly helped of course, carrying children at times, not to mention yours truly. Overall, we arguably covered too much territory, visiting Marrakech, Essaouira, Atlas Mountains, Fes, Rabat, and Casablanca over 10 days. While Rabat may have its high points (love the seaside locale), it is probably better to spend more time in Fes. To conclude, I certainly endorse Atlas and Sahara, but one should give plenty of input (Mustapha will gladly offer many hotel options in each city) and ask for age appropriate (kids) activities if need be.

Private 8 day Sahara/Atlas Mountains tour. We booked an all inclusive week long tour with Atlas and Sahara tours for the first week in January. Mustapha was very easy to deal with via emails and always responded promptly. We received quotes from three different companies and his was well within our budget and also included going to both the Sahara and the Atlas Mountains which appealed to us. The itinerary included sleeping overnight in a hut on the mountains but as we were concerned about what the weather would be like we rang Mustapha to change this and it was not a problem.Our tour included airport transfers, all our accommodation and all the meals except lunches and dinners in Marrakech. It was wonderful arriving in Marrakech and being met by our driver who took us to the riad where we met Mustapha. We went over the itinerary for the next week and then were free until the next morning when we would be collected at 8am. We were fortunate enough to have Hassan for our five day tour of the Sahara and the Atlas Mountains as well as a wonderful driver who got us to all our destinations safely and on time. The van was in excellent condition and was well cared for. The distances are very long and some of the roads are quite bumpy. Our 8 year old daughter had a bad bout of car sickness so it is a good idea to take travel sick pills.Both Hassan and our driver were very thoughtful and protective of our children and we felt very safe in their care. Our eldest daughter has Down syndrome and they were very protective and kind towards her and were always looking out for her. One instance of this was when we arrived at Merzouga to begin our camel trek but as it was getting cold and dark Hassan recommended that we go to the desert camp by 4wd. Even though we were a bit dissappointed it was the right thing to do as it got very cold and dark quickly and it meant we were able to get to the camp much more quickly and have dinner and get settled. I do recommend bringing sleeping bags if you are sleeping in the desert camp in winter though as we were quite cold! Once the kids were asleep we all sat around the fire and were entertained by singing and dancing - with Hassan playing one of the drums. We were informed though that it is not a concert but instead a cultural exchange so everyone had to share a song from their own country. We had a large group of Italians in the camp so they entertained us with some Italian songs and being New Zealanders we had to oblige by doing the Haka. We still got to do our camel trek though as the next day we woke to see the sun rise and then trekked for an hour and a half through the Sahara - definitely a highlight of the trip.We were aware that today we were travelling 580 km from the Sahara to the Atlas Mountains but we hadn't really realised that with the road conditions this would take 11 hours. It was a very long day and in hindsight we should have taken two days to get back. Normally the trip to the Sahara is done as a four day trip and we did it in 3 days in order to fit in the Atlas Mountains as well. There is a lot to see along the way as we went back a different way and it would have been good to not feel so rushed and to stop and enjoy the amazing scenery.The advantage of having such a long travelling day was that it meant we had two full days in the Atlas Mountains. Hassan stayed on as our tour guide in the mountains but the driver returned to Marrakech after dropping us in Imlil. The next day our daughter was still recovering from her car sickness so it was just myself and my other two children who went for a walk. Once again the company was able to adapt to our needs as we decided to do a shorter 3 hour walk instead of the 5 hour walk as planned. My husband decided to go for a mountain bike ride and Hassan organised all that for him which was great. Mustapha came out to the guest house that evening to check up on us and it was great to be able to feed back to him as to how the trip had been.The next day we were all back to full health and we went for a walk through the valley. We had a mule with us and the children took turns riding her. Hassan was a great guide and as he is from the Imlil area knows everyone and would stop for a handshake and a chat with people we met on the way. We had a fantastic lunch in a Berber house and were overwhelmed by their generosity as well as the amazing food. We returned to Marrakech that afternoon and said our farewells to Hassan. Our tour included a guided tour of Marrakech the next day and once again the guide was great.Our trip to Morocco was amazing and I thank the Atlas and Sahara team for their organisation of our wonderful holiday. All our accommodation, food, excursions, guides and transports were perfect.

Day trip to Imlil Valley. We had a fantastic day out to Imlil with Hassan our guide. We were collected from Jemaa al Fna square at 9am and after a luxury minibus journey we were in the valley ready to hike for about 10:30am. Hassan will ask what you would like to see and where you would like to walk so you can choose and plan your trip with his maps.Hassan and his family his immediate family are originally from Imlil village and so he took us on a familiar 3 hour hike up and around the mountains in the valley. Although it was winter so we could not appreciate it fully, it was still breathtaking to be 2000ft and looking up at the highest peak in the Atlas range covered in snow with bright blue skies and hot sun on our faces.Hassan knows all about the physical geography of the area and will point out and explain about rock types, formation and it's relation to the plants, animals and locals way of life. Also as he comes from Berber ancestry he can talk for hours about the history of Morocco, the tribes and rulers and all about the Berber culture.We met some Berber guides along the way who were generously handing out sweet mint tea to walkers, and in the cold mountain air it tastes like nectar!We stopped for lunch at a guest house in the village and his family prepared a wonderful traditional feast for us to enjoy on the patio with views across the valley. As the Berbers will give everything they have to guests even if they have nothing for themselves, this was a very heartfelt gesture and very much appreciated. Everyone in the village knows 'crazy Hassan' and you can tell from the locals you encounter that he is well loved by his family and friends.I would thoroughly recommend an excursion with Atlas & Sahara Tours as they are very good value for money and if you are fortunate to have Hassan as your guide, you will be in for a very interesting trip in excellent company. Its a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and would be a perfect trip in the spring or summer when the valley is green and full of flowers.

Perfect treated. Had a day trip from Marrakech to the Atlas Mountain. Picked up by our guide Hassan and driver and a smooth ride up. We were very lucky with the weather. All clear skies. Had a very nice three hour hike with spectacular views of the Mountains followed by an excellent tagine lunch in the sun and a short walk back to the village and car. Then down to Marrakesh.Highly recommended and a prefect break from the hustle and noise of Marrakech. Niklas

Perfect organization for a 2 day hike. The hike with Hassam in the atlas mountains was definitely the highlight of our 10 days tour of morocco.We were picked up at the airport on perfect time, the driver was very corteous and polite.We met Mustapaha at Imlil, and were introduced to our guide Hassam, and our muleteers,The mountains are beautiful, but having Hassam with us to tell us about the history, culture and habits of the local people has made the two days memorable.Overall a perfect organization.

Don't Hesitate. A few weeks ago I was reading other peoples rave reviews about Atlas and Sahara Tours Imlil - Ait Mizane Valley day trip and I am delighted to say they are all true! I agree that booking is easy, you are well looked after and safe. Mohammed picked us up at our hotel at 8.30 and we had a cheery chat on the way to Imlil stopping to take photos of the terrific views and also at an all female co-operative to watch them making argan oil products (no hard sell but an opportunity to buy if you wanted). You could also use the toilets there. We arrived at Imlil where Mustapha met us on the roof of the Cafe Atlas Toubkal to make sure we were linked up with the correct guide, Jamal (a law student and nice local guy).We settled payment over a cup of tea and biscuits. We accidentally overpaid and he gave us back the difference - an honest man! Another opportunity to use the toilet before heading off. The walk with Jamal was a pleasant hike through villages with some steep parts as we headed higher up the mountain. You'll see some of village life and pass a few people with working donkeys. If you have mobility or breathing problems this is not for you but I reckon it is manageable for most people. Ankles and knees take a bit of a pounding when going back down some of the rocky steps but with the right footwear the overall experience is very good indeed. Lunch was on comfy cushions at low tables on Omars rooftop including a very tasty salad, tagine and fresh fruit from the local trees. Plenty of mint tea and water and loads of bread on offer. Terrific views and a warm welcome - all done well. Another opportunity to go to the loo and then off again to complete the circuit before going on the camel ride. That was an enjoyable short trip through villages and flatter, less remarkable countryside. Jamal stayed with us and walked along with the camel handler. It was easy getting on and off and Aisha my camel was gentle and the ride was slow and steady with other opportunities to take pictures. The order of the day is dependent on weather and light so your trip may differ. Some people told us they did the camel ride first. Mohammed was then waiting at the other end to take us back to our hotel before 4.30. All-in-all a great day out, just us with our guide and driver and a set of fantastic pictures and great memories. Wear walking shoes or good trainers and layers as the temperature can vary with altitude but honestly it wasnt that cold in the late December sunshine. Enjoy yourselves and don't hesitate to book with this company if you want a safe, enjoyable day out.

Perfect in every way. Right from the start the email responses were quick and very helpful making it easy for to decide which tour suited us best and we booked from the UK for a full day to the High Atlas mountains including Teoulet Casbah and Ait Benhadou.On the day of our trip the guide (Abdul) was there early and from the moment we met him was polite, cheerful, helpful and a real joy to be with for a the day.As this was a private tour, Abdul took us where we needed to go but also stopped when we wanted to take photos. We had a comfortable 4x4 and Abdul drove very well.Compared to the stories we heard from others I would recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours as they are a good, well run business and I would recommend them.

Horse riding with wild horses. We went riding for 2 days with Atlas in the mountains around Marrakech. Horses were good but a little too wild and didnt get along. Great views, good guides, good food incl vegetarian, but cold in December - bring all warm clothes!

excellent experience from booking through to day itself. Mustapha runs a well organised outfit - very organised from the outset. Straightforward operator and keeps a close eye on things during the day.Day trip with trek and camel ride worked very well for all the family. Hassan was a great guide on the trek and continued for the camel ride as well. Whilst I might not go on another trip when we return to Marrakech I would have no hesitation in recommending Mustapha and his crew to others.

Ait Ouazzaden valley TREK. atlas and sahara toursAit Ouazzaden valley TREK We left the cafe at Imi Oughlad about 1000m high - the drop off point for Mustapha the taxi driver from Marrakech. Following Jacquelene the mule who carried our load up the slope, the young guide Hassan told of the local vegetation and his background. Later Ibrahim the jolly smiling french speaking cook prepared a warm meal with fresh vegetables and fruit. "His nick name is the 'adjective'. He picked that up at school" explained Hassan.We ate in the autumn afternoon sun by Juniper trees on the steep slope looking down the valley. A herd of goats gathered in a clearing before us. Ibrahim had a job as a cook in a hotel in the flatlands related Hassan. He left it because he was happier in the mountains. When not working with tourists he looks after his herd of goats.Following trails lined by small shrubs and trees over a pass, we entered the valley to view in the distance Tinzerte, a sizable village of dark brown clay buildings.Tiny winding earthen paths separate the houses. No machinery of any type can enter. We passed friendly lively snotty nosed dirty faced children, and shy teenagers. The smells and sounds of the farmyard everywhere. At the lodgings a welcome with tea made from herbs which included sage. Almost as much ritual was involved here making and dring it as with yerba maté tea from S America. There was little sign that any of the friendly villagers spoke european languages.The sizable accomadation had electricity, running water, a flush toilet and shower. Wooden shutters, sometimes with plastic sheeting, on the deep set windows seal the rooms from the wind. Little use seems to be made of glass. Ibrahim spoiled us again later with a terrific evening meal.Although the rooms had no heating there was no shortage of blankets. Lying wrapped in blankets we heard distant dogs barking till they too fell asleep. Sunrise calls from mosques tried to awaken us. After an 08:00 breakfast I set off with Hassan. Beyond the village we passed animal folds which protect the herds from nocternal wild swine, jackals, foxes and even recently leopards and ...formerly lions. Hassan explained the irrigation system of the steep valleys, its managment and organization, of the collection of oak leaf fodder and of the medicinal oleanders plants women gather and carry to the village. He gave me a detailed north african view of Marrocco's history.On more than one occasion we came across two or more of european women making the journey together with a guide.Climbing now Hassan and I made our way further up the valley along barely visible paths between the low Juniper trees. Ibrahim followed some kilometers behind with the mule. His Berber songs travelled loudly and clearly through the valley and were answered by Hassan. There was more water in the streams in the valley now. At a larger village children play and laugh on their way home from school.We stop at a small berber village on slope. Hassan points towards the sun which lights up a ridge on which lies the village Id Issa - our destination for the evening. We enter a house with wooden door that covered only part of the height of the entrance. Inside are earth walls and an uneven earthen floor. In a corner lie potatoes and maize. No shelves. Storage is in plastic sacks. A welcoming middle aged housewife and her fiendly asthmatic friend share some marrocan tea with us, as we sit on the window ledge in the hot evening sun. Soon we travel further up winding paths to 1800 m and our guest house. A US lady on an aid project for a year was staying also. The evening was cold outside but despite any further form of heating warm inside due to earthen construction of the building. The hot shower here could be really hot. Plenty of blankets welcome again tonight. In the common room a television goes on. Satellite reception. More channels than you can hope to watch. An interesting discussion followed on the history of North Africa, Europe and the New World. Then bedtime. For the cold night I put the space blanket between the sleeping bag and the blankets - it worked a treat. Again the sunrise calls from mosques were ignored. Breakfast of bread, jam, and la vaux qui rie cheese. Then the luggage goes on Jacquelene's back. Up the slopes with us and higher up the valley we reach a pass above 2400m. Two swiss ladies and their guide having rest there had a photo shoot of Jacqueline before they moved on up to the crest. From our high perch we could hear mosque loudspeakers in a village below broadcasting the sound of prayers from CD player reminding that civilisation was not too far away. For us it was now a steady descent down the valley in the warm autumn sun to Imlil village, and Marrakech to be broken only by a final fantastic lunch from Ibrahim.

Fab day trip!. The count of excellent reviews here tells the story! Had a great day trip to Imlil with our guide Mohammed, really enjoyed our hour and a half's walk through the villages and lunch at Omar's little hidden restaurant was the best lamb tagine I had during my trip to Marrakech! The day started out quite rainy so we couldn't start the camel ride across the river as intended, so our driver, guide and owner Mustafa communicated and shuffle out plans around - so we had enjoyed a sunny spell in Imlil and then the afternoon panned out quite bright and sunny too! Really appreciated the fact that they switched this around and made sure an immensely enjoyable day out! Thanks guys.

Great day out. This is a great day out - we were collected from our hotel and driven to the Atlas Mountains - we stopped on the way at a massive Moroccan market ( not another tourist in sight) and then on to Camel riding for a couple of hours - our guide was wonderful happy to talk about the culture and social mix in Morocco which we found fascinating, we stopped for lunch at a Berbers home and had without doubt the best most authentic lunch of our entire trip - this was followed by a short trek through the mountains to view waterfalls and the stunning scenery.Excellent value for money and the highlight of our 4 day break. This company delivered more than we could have asked for. As two women our sense of safety was a priority and once again these guides delivered! Highly recommended .

Wonderful Day Trip!!. We were picked up at 8:30 by our guide, Abdellah, and our driver, and we drove out of Marrakech to the mountains. We stopped along the way to ride the camels, which as a great experience!! Then we continued for a while, and started hiking, seeing beautiful views of the valley, the mountains, the trees and villages. We had an amazing lunch and went to see the waterfalls.Abdellah was a wonderful guide, so so nice, explained everything to us in great spanish, taught us so much of the culture, history, and geography of Morocco, he's a really great guide, I recommend asking specifically for him!! He speaks spanish, italian, english and french!Also, I was sick that day and I wanted to state how great and patient both Abdellah and the driver were, always asking if I was ok, if I wanted to stop the car, if I needed something. The driver drove slowly and was always looking out for me, and Abdellah was very very nice about it. Also were we had lunch they made me a cup of something that would help me.It was definitely a great experience, the landscapes are amazing, and the opportunity to learn and talk to Abdellah was really great for us! I highly recommend it!!

The perfect day trip!. Three of my friends and myself went on the Atlas mountains hike and camel ride day excursion this past Wednesday and we had the greatest time. Mustapha was able to arrange for the fourth member of our party to join us last minute. We were treated with the utmost kindness and hospitality throughout the entire trip. Our guide Mohammed was very knowledgeable about the area since is from there and he was more than happy to answer all of our questions! We were given a delicious lunch in Omar's guest home which had a perfect view of the Atlas mountains and the valley below. It was absolutely stunning! Omar and his wife prepared us lunch and served us on their veranda. The food was amazing and he and his wife made a special vegetarian meal for me! I wasn't expecting it since I hadn't requested it, I had only mentioned to Mustapha through our emails what the eating preferences of the group were when he asked. He must have passed on the message that I was vegetarian to Omar and made me a special meal, it was so thoughtful and considerate of them. The food was absolutely supurb! After lunch we hiked through the mountains with Mohammed and had an overall perfect day. We were then driven back to our hotel in Marrakech by another man named Mustapha who was also very kind and sweet. Myself and my entire group highly recommend Atlas and Sahara Day Tours because they made us feel so welcome and we saw the most beautiful sights we could ever imagine! -Katherine

Brilliantly organised day trip. Every part of our day trip into the atlas mountains was brilliantly organised. Found it very easy to book with mustapha over email and ask any questions needed. The taxi transfer was prompt and the driver was not worked about us stopping to take photos all along the route. Interesting trip to the argan oil cooperative on the way as well. Once in imlil we met weigh our guide hassan and set off on our trek. The countryside is stunning for walking and hassan was full of facts and answered any questions we had. The lunch at the Berber house was very special. It was nice to taste traditional Moroccan food out of a restaurant and experience the hospitality of a better family. All in all a brilliant day which really added to our entire trip to Morocco

Peace and Tranquility in the Mountains. My daughter and I recently visited Marrakech and decided to do a one day outing in the Atlas Mountains. We read the outstanding reviews for this company and I contacted Mustapha to arrange the excursion. Mustapha answered promptly and we arranged the outing to include a 1/2 day camel excursion and then hiking in the mountains. This outing was the highlight of our entire trip to Morocco. I highly recommend it. Mustapha responds quickly to emails and delivers everything he promises. We decided to add two more people we met on the train onto our trip and Mustapha was able to accommodate all of us at the last minute. The driver and guide picked us up from our Riad and the guide, Abdulla, was with us the entire day. We then drove in a jeep type vehicle to the mountains, switched to camels and traveled several hours by camel into the mountains. This trip takes you off the beaten path where you can see the beauty of the landscape. It was quite, peaceful, and very relaxing. We saw village women riding by on donkeys and working in the fields. Young children were going by on their way to school, and various other villagers were passing by either on foot or on donkey. We met Mustapha in a small village after the camel ride and paid him before we went hiking into the mountains. Lunch was remarkable. It was up in the mountains next to a deserted waterfall. The food was delicious and the surroundings were breathtaking. Abdulla, our guide, was a very polite, charming, and knowledgeable young man. I highly recommend requesting him. What you will need. Do wear either tennis shoes or hiking boots - don't even think of doing this excursion in sandals. You will be climbing up rocks. You may also need a light sweater depending on the time of year. Eat a big breakfast because by the time you eat lunch you will be quite hungry!Thank you Mustapha and Abdulla!Tami

Great Day. The half day camel ride and Atlas Mountain hike was a great day out. Organisation was excellent, lunch delicious, and nothing too much trouble. Mustapha was friendly, engaging and full of useful information. Any tour with Mustapha comes Highly recommended.

A brilliant day out. We had a fantastic day in the Imlil Valley. Organised the trip via emails- Mustapha was very helpful.Picked up at our Riad by Abdul- excellent guide and driven out to the valley for our 2 hour camel trek- just about long enough as our thighs were begining to ache form gripping onto the camels. Then we were driven to Imlil and had lunch in a traditional Berber house- excellent food- the best tagine we had- really good to support the local people. Mustapha joined us for lunch-This was followed by our 2 hour trek to another Berber village with Abdul taking photos for us and even carried my daughters ruck sack for her.A brilliant day out- the highlight of our stay in Marrakech and highly recommended

Wonderful day Out to Ouzoude. My daughter and I booked a trip to the Ouzoude Falls from our Hotel in Marrakech. The driver arrived promptly at 8am, in a very nice car and drove us safely and courteously to the Falls (about 2 hours plus). We were met by Siad, our lovely guide, who had perfect English despite saying his strengths were Spanish and French!It is a wonderful day out and the mountains and waterfall are magical. Do go if you get chance on your trip to Morocco, it's worth it.

Amazing. This was the best part of our trip to Morocco. We had amazing local tour guides in Mohammed and Hassan our chef/mule driver. If you want to see the Atlas mountains there is no one else you should go with but these guys!! Our best regards to Mustapha, Mohammed, Hassan and the team! Michael and Dean.

A Moroccan Adventure. Josie and I admired our Tuareg turbans in the camel outfitter's mirror. The store clerk had wound our new headgear tightly around our heads, indigo for me, sky blue for Josie. Minutes later we stood on the shoulder of a desert highway in the growing darkness.Two saddled camels and a grizzled Berber tribesman caught the last rays of the sun. Hassan, our guide from Atlas and Sahara Tours, resplendent in his agave silk jellaba and boony hat, hung our backpacks over the handlebars, and told us to climb onto the hulking recumbent beasts.As soon as we sat in the saddle, each steed lurched and jolted upright and we were off into the Sahara. A half moon lit up the sands, and cast perfect silhouettes of our caravan across the dunes.Josie had booked this custom private tour months before, and it was unfolding even better than we'd hoped. Hassan our guide had already taken us to the the red adobe city of Ait Bennadou, and Glaoui Kasbah. He gave us the history of these fabulous monuments and fielded any and all questions that we posed. The thrilling drive through the breathtaking Atlas Mountains by our expert driver (Abdul?) was like a trip through geological and cultural history.Adii, our camel driver, led the string deeper into the dunes before we arrived at camp, a dozen black, goat hair Berber tents.We were greeted with sweet mint tea and cookies. We reclined on colorful carpet covering banquettes. The clean toilets, sinks, and showers were in a large tent off to the side. Adii served a delicious chicken tagine, and we listened to drums and Berber singing far into the night. We retired to our goat hair tent, where we slept on twin beds. Rousted out of bed before dawn, we mounted the camels. The sun came up behind us, casting long shadows ahead of us across the dunes.The long and spectacular drive back across the Atlas mountains to Marrakech was yet to come, but Hassan knew the best rest stops, and we enjoyed mint tea at each stop. I can recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours for anyone that wants an adventurous dose of Morocco.

What a great day out. My sister and I had a great one-day guided tour in the Imlil Valley. As promised, the driver picked us up from our Riad promptly, and drove us, to and from our adventure, with care. Mohammed, our guide, was priceless - competent, professional and kind. He made the day so interesting with information about the area and the people. We also shared laughs together and enjoyed his company, feeling safe at all times. Also, our lunch was excellent! Mustapha was well organised, in arranging everything, and there are no hidden costs whatever.

3 day tour - Imlil to Setti Fadma - Ju+Stu. We booked through Atlas and Sahara because of the good reviews - and were not disappointed. Everything was very well organised, from picking up from the hotel to return. The guide Hassan and muleteer/cook Abdul were excellent - Hassan explained along the way the geology, fauna/flora and also gave us a unique insight into everything Morrocan. The days were lengthy but the spectacular scenery and the fact that we were on our own apart from one other couple who we met up with in the evenings made this a trip to remember. Meal stops were a surprising treat - banquets laid before us - if anything could be criticised it was that there was too much food. This is a really great trip to do if you want to experience the Atlas, see village life and enjoy walking, and Atlas and Sahara organised it without a hitch - it is worth pointing out that the other couple we met in the evenings had gone through someone else, but their guide didn't speak any English and they had hidden extras - like having to buy water whenever they wanted it from the muleteer/guide. The only slight disappointment was the last day - walking primarily along a dirt road from Timichi to Setti Fadma as the route through the gorge had been closed due to rock falls. Also the route on day 2 varies from the publicised one in that we didn't cross into the Oukaimeden valley - though this did not spoil our trip in any way.

amazing trip. it is amazing private tours. guided trekking & walking holidays in Morocco, hiking, Mountain Bike, road cycling, camel ride, horseback riding, surfing, it start from ceramics shop,medicine shop, Ourika & climbing Atlas mountain it amazing trip & worth money you take amazing picture in the trip.

Brilliant. One thing that was obvious is that Mustapha really understands what tourists are looking for. There were no hidden costs and our experience of the tour was of paramount importance to the team, who did everything to make us feel comfortable, relaxed and safe. We were promptly picked up from our riad by Abdul who spoke good English, the car journey was smooth and he was happy for us to stop and take pictures. We arrived at the beginning of our hike in a beautiful village and met our guide Mohamed, who spoke very good English. His knowledge and passion for the mountains was clear and almost infectious, he led us across the stunning High Atlas telling us about the area and its culture, he was the perfect guide! We then arrived for lunch at a beautiful guest house and enjoyed some of the best food we ate in Morocco, the family were welcoming and left us to indulge while taking in breathtaking views of the mountains. After lunch we then embarked on a camel ride, which was tough going for a couple of non riders, but Mohamed made us feel at ease and took plenty of photos of us perched on these incredible animals. More breathtaking views and a lot of laughs were had.Absolutely shattered but uplifted and elated from or day, Abdul returned us to or riad around 5pm. We couldn't recommend this more highly and it is an experience we will never forget.

Fantastic!. Me and my partner booked half day camel ride and half day hike through the mountain villages. We booked a week in advance from the UK through Mustapha who was very helpful over email and even asked us what out culinary preference would be in the dayOur day started at 8.30 where we were picked up from our hotel on a 4x4. An hours drive by a very pleasant knowledgeable driver to the foot of the mountain range ensued, last an hour. We were met at the end of the drive by Hassan, a very friendly and helpful guide whom spoke very good English. Before setting off on a 2hr camel ride Hassan offered us tea, the toilet and even provided us with bottled water. The camel ride was led by a man, with Hassan maintaining communication with us aswell as leaving us to marvel the views ourselves. Hassan very kindly, without asking, took plenty of photos of us on the camel and the surroundings as we rode. The driver then met us at the end of the ride and drove us further up the Mountains, accompanied by Hassan. When we arrived to our destination Hassan took us to a local residence for a delicious 3 course lunch and tea with an amazing view. We stayed for 90 minutes, again with our privacy while we ate. After lunch was the hike to which Hassan gave us two options (very thoughtful of him as this was after he discovered my partner was pregnant). We chose to trek through the villages as oppose to the more unpredictable terrain of the heights of the mountains. The trek lasted around 2 hours, Hassan continuing to offer two options as we progressed, he was very considerate to my partner being pregnant, which was just one of many complimentary aspects of Hassan. We met the driver around 4:45 and he took us back to our hotelIt was the best thing about our trip to beautiful Morocco which Atlas and Sahara tours offered us incredible service, in particular Hassan, we would definitely is this company again and emplore future tourists to

Camel trek, lunch in the Atlas Mountains and hike through the Imlil village. We booked a day trip and were picked up just before 8.30am, seeing some amazing views on our way. The camel trek lasted a couple of hours in desert-like surroundings - my friend and I had a camel each with a baby camel following behind. We were led by Hassan, a friendly and very knowledgeable English speaking guide, and a man who guided the camels. It was great fun and both guides happily took lots of photos for us. Hassan then took us to the Saturday souk which was very busy with a real community spirit. We had a mint tea and tried some local honey.Our driver then took us to the Atlas Mountains where we had a delicious lunch of rice salad, chicken tagine and fruit in a guesthouse. We then opted for the slightly longer trek through the Imlil village rather than through the mountains, although we were glad we had brought our walking boots given the rough terrain. Hassan taught us a lot about the mountains and the Berber way of life, pointing out a Berber wedding as we passed and explaining how the water system served each Berber village. He showed us his house in the distance and invited us into his aunt's house for another mint tea. We arrived back at around 4.45pm and our driver took us back to Marrakech.All in all it was a brilliant experience and great value for money.

Everything efficient and as promised. A day trip to Imlil - Ait Mizane which we had organized in advance. Everything was on time and as planned. Guide and driver both spoke good English and were very helpful.The trip itself is a moderately taxing with a bit of a climb and gives wonderful views from various points on the route.

Ait Benhaddou. We booked a day trip with this company because of the great reviews we have seen.It was very professionally handled and Mustapha was easy to deal with.It turned out to be a very long day with lots of driving. We left at 8.45am and arrived home at 7.30pm. We visited two places and had quick stops for coffee, lunch and photo ops. The driver was very good but very fast and i had to ask him to slow down because of the twisty roads, which he did.The Guide at Ait Benhaddou was very poor and more interested in telling us of the old movies made there rather than the history of the village.I would use the company again but a different, shorter, trip

Atlas Mountain Tour - Excellent. I booked the 2 hour camel ride and 2 hour hike in the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours. It was booked one day beforehand but there were no problems at all sorting it out for us and Mustapha emailed to confirm the booking within a few hours The day was really well organised. We were picked up from our hotel by Omar at 8.30am and driven to the base of the mountains. During the drive to the mountains Omar provided lots of interesting facts about the Atlast Mountains which kept us entertained. He also offered to stop for us to take photos as the scenery was breathtaking. Omar is also a very good driver because those roads were not easy to navigate but we felt safe with his driving.Omar left us at the base of the mountains with our tour guide Hassan who was with us for the rest of the day. Before we went the camel ride, we were given mint tea and Hassan packed away a few bottles of water for us as it was really hot that day.The camel ride was amazing. It was really quiet and peaceful along our route as we went up the mountains and around the valley and villages but 2 hours is just about enough as we were getting a bit tired towards the end. We were then picked up by Omar again and taken to Imlil where we had a traditional Moroccan lunch and rested for a while.This was followed by a 2 hour hike around Imlil where we saw the waterfall and the way the local Berber people live followed by tea in one of their houses. I thought it would be tiring but it was was perfect but I would suggest you wear good walking shoes.The scenery was amazing and our guide Hassan was really knowledgeable and kept answering all my questions whilst also telling us about the interesting history and culture of the region.We were three females but felt safe and were looked after really well for the whole of the day. I cannot wait to return to Marrakech to book some of the other tours as we only saw a fraction of the Mountains and I would love to see more.All in all an amazing day and thanks to everyone for making it a wonderful experience for us.

Ait Mizane Valley day trip (Atlas Mountains). Last August we went to Marrakech and there decided to go on trip to the Atlas Mountains.We choose Atlas and Sahara Day Tours because of its good reviews.Gladly, our trip was no different than those we have been reading about.We agreed everything by mail with Mustapha and we made sure that all went well, always concerned in making a memorable trip for us.We were picked up on time at the Riad by Mohamed who speaks English very well and then he drove by car to Imlil. We made a stop at a co-operative where we could see the women that make the beauty products.At Imlil a guide, whose name was also Mohamed, was waiting for us. On foot, we started hiking and climbed from about 1700 m to 2100 m on the Atlas Mountains. We walked through 5 of the 8 Berber villages and had lunch in a Berber house on the balcony over a waterfall.At the end of the trip we were driven back to the Riad in Marrakech and everything went well.We won't forget the difficult bargain we had with Mustapha but we found a way so that we could make the trip.

Ourika Valley - 1 day trip. We liked the proffesionalism of this company a lot. First we had a very thorough correspondence exchange with Mustapha about different trips they offer. Finally we decided to go to Ourika valley as we were under short timeframe in Marrakech. If we were longer we'd certainly go for Merzouga desert trip. Trip to Atlas mountains was very nice. Mohammad, our driver and guide arrived in our riad even few minutes before in order to be sure that departure from puzzled medina will start as scheduled. His command of Englsh was very good. The car was quite new Kia SUV with air conditioning. Fluent and comfortable ride - nothing close to the city taxi drivers. His knowledge of the region was helpful. In the mountains, mountain guide was waiting for us. Very agile. The only downside was that it was not emphasized enough that getting to the waterfall requires some preparation for mountain trekking including non slippery shoes and some degree of fitness (it was tiring after 14 days of very intensive touring non stop). In any event the views were excellent and the tour is recommended.

One day camel and trek in the Atlas mountains. Totally professional and charming company. We were picked up by 4WD punctually at our out-of-the-way riad and driven up into the Atlas mountains, where camels were waiting for us. My wife, 7-year-old son and I were the only clients that day so we had the whole ride to ourselves, climbing up through Berber villages and through the Atlas foothills amid apple and cherry orchards. I can only imagine what it would be like in spring. After two hours we were picked up and driven to Imlil, a mountain town and trekking waystation for lunch, and the start of a two-hour trek up to 3000m in the shadow of Mount Toubkal, the second highest peak in Africa. Very thoughtfully, a mule was provided for our son, who might otherwise have found it a hard walk in the heat. The scenery was superb. it was how I imagine Nepal to look. After our descent into Imlil we were each presented with a gift pair of leather slippers which we chose ourselves. A really well organised and unforgettable trip. Abdul the driver was terrific character. Mohamed the guide was quieter but a complete local who knew everyone along the way and was bursting with knowledgeable about the area.

desert/mountain private tour c/o Atlas Sahara tours. We booked our 3 day trip to the mountains & desert through Atlas Sahara Tours, on the basis of excellent reviews, and were not disappointed. Communication with Mustapha , in advance of our arrival was very efficient and even though there was a little confusion re the length of our trip, it was quickly resolved. Our driver was highly professional , happy to offer stops at villages and a local agricultural souk, as well as organizing a tour of an original Jewish village c/o a friend and an extended visit to a veritable "Aladdin's cave" of Berber artifacts amassed by a passionate and well informed, private collector. The camel ride into the desert, albeit short, was enchanting and the generous hospitality of the nomads at the camp made our first night under the stars truly memorable.Our guide for the mountain trek was both friendly and knowledgeable, delighted and proud to impart information about the landscape and his Berber heritage. The "picnic" prepared by a local "chef" at the Coll, with food brought up by mule, was impressive ,beautifully presented and most welcome after clambering over boulders in temperatures exceeding 42 degrees!The mountain guest house with its stunning views, proved very comfortable and offered a lovely opportunity to meet and stay with a local family.On the basis of our experience and from talking to other people who had signed up for tours with other, cheaper, operators, I would highly recommend Atlas Sahara to anyone wishing to explore this part of the country within a short time frame.One small point: if you're undertaking a 3 day trip during the summer months without ascending Mt Toubkal, don't bother bringing sleeping bags or sleeping bag liners:everything is provided by the guest house and the Nomad camp!Now looking forward to arranging an extended trip into the desert with the same company....

Atlas and Sahara Tours, Marrakech, Morocco. We would very highly recommend using Atlas and Sahara Tours to trek and travel in Morocco - the trek, day tour to Essaouira and accommodation and all pick-ups and transport were all well organised by Mustapha and the three of us in our group had a great time! We did the four day/three night Atlas Mountain trek from Imlil to Setti Fadma (via Oukaimeden) with Mohammed the English-speaking Berber guide, Mohammed the muleteer and excellent cook and Aisha the well looked after and strong mule. We had clear information on what this would involve and what we needed to bring. Our vegetarian diet was superbly catered for. The accommodation was better than we had expected and we felt comfortable and welcomed. And the walking was wonderful too. Atlas and Sahara tours also organised our stay at the Riad Zayane Atlas in Marrakesh which we highly recommend too – it was small and comfortable and run by a welcoming family and staff.Just a note for Australian travellers – change your money before you go as Aussie dollars are not accepted or exchanged in Morocco.Alex, Iain and Robin

Fantastic time on a 5 day Desert/Mountain private tour. My husband and I have just returned from a 10 day stint in Morocco, 5 days being spent on the above trip. From the moment I first emailed Mustapha, I was confident that we had selected a great company to travel with. All emails were promptly responded too and arrangements easily made. On the first morning, we were collected by Abdul (our driver), and Mustapha, and taken to meet our local guide Hassan who would stay with us for the duration of the trip. Abdul and Hassan immediately made us feel at ease, safe, and secure. We could have been more looked after. The trip was more than we could have hoped for from the description on the website. All food was included, and was far and above what I would have expected on a trip of this sort - we rarely completely finished a meal! The only thing to bear in mind is that you pay for all drinks except water. Hassan and Abdul kept us well stocked with 1.5L water each per day and more as and when necessary/if it got warm .Highlight of the trip was definitely the moonlight camel ride/sunrise camel ride the following day, and climbing in the Atlas Mountains. The climb was amazing - I would say it is a moderate climb and you definitely require sturdy shoes/boots. The food presented at the top of the climb was fantastic considering the limited cooking equipment available to our muleteer!The 4 nights accommodation was good - the first night seemed to be a popular spot for travel groups and was comfortable. The second night was at the desert camp, which was great fun (although food was very late - about 10.30pm!), the third night was a delightful Riad/Guesthouse in Imlil valley which was beautiful (and we would definitely like to return here), and the last night is in a very basis guesthouse/gite in a traditional Berber village - it's a case of getting stuck in, but the mattresses are very comfortable and the views incredible!I would not hesitate to strongly recommend using this company for the above trip if you would like to experience many angles of Morocco. Day 3 is a long day spent travelling, but this is necessary to transport you from the Desert into the Atlas Mountains. We were grateful for the opportunity to catch up on sleep after the sunrise camel trek, but it is a long day. Great value for money, and we felt exceptionally safe and very well looked after by Abdul and Hassan.

Ourika Valley. We had a perfect excursion to the Ourika Valley from Marrakech. Our driver Mohammed picked us up at our riad. He was funny, informative and so patient with our endless questions. We stopped at an argon factory and then at a Berber village. Lunch in the valley with our feet in the water was heavenly. Our guide (another Mohammed) who took us up the waterfall seemed very attentive and made our safety and comfort a priority. It was extremely crowded and hot the day we went but our guides were very skilled at maneuvering us through the throngs of people and getting us to our destinations. It was really a perfect day. I would highly recommend this tour group to anyone visiting Marrakech. It was truly one of the highlights of our trip!

Atlas Mountains and Imlil Village. We had a fantastic day trekking around Imlil with our young guide Hassan. The day begun after being picked up in 4x4 from our Riad in Marrakech around 9am. Our driver Abdul was particularly friendly, he managed to give us a beginner class in speaking Berber while driving us to and from Imlil (about 1.5-2hr drive each way).When we arrived in Imlil we were introduced to Hassan who was a very friendly and knowledgeable guide. He took us on an unforgettable 3.5hr trek around Imlil that included a delicious lamb tagine lunch accompanied by cous cous & salad. There was a noticeably temperate climate in the higher altitude of the Atlas Mountains so you shouldn't be concerned about visiting during the height of summer.All-in-all, it was a highly rewarding day and a nice change of pace from busy Marrakech. The views were spectacular and experiencing part of the Moroccan Berber culture was highly enriching.

4X4/Camel Ride in the Atlas Mountains. Had a really great trip into the Atlas Mountains. We were met at a prearranged pick-up point by our driver in a very comfortable 4X4 and taken to the foothills of the mountains where we were met by some guides who took us for our camel trek. This wasn't some lame 5 minute ride around a sandy field as I saw elsewhere. Instead it was along a track which offered fantastic views of the valley and which took us through villages where we passed smiling Berber children. After the trek we were met by the 4X4 and taken up to the base of Mt. Toubkal (the highest mountain in Africa!) where we ate a traditional meal before trekking on foot along a donkey trail to the highest village and an idyllic waterfall some way above the treeline. It was a truly memorable trip and we felt that we got full value for our money as the trip lasted all day.

Good trip but a few minor niggles. Firstly excellent communication via email and phone when booking, although phone kept cutting off. They couldn't find our apartment so we had to walk to our nearest large hotel.Warm welcome from our driver. Met the owner half way along Mohammad VI to pay for the trip at the side of the road?Driver was informative on the way out but a tad on the way back. Used his phone continuously which made he journey feel a lot slower as he coasted most of the way.Excellent tour guide for the ourika valley, although on the website it states a short walk when it should state it's an hour long and you should wear trainers or walking boots, as flip flops and sandals really weren't appropriate so the walk up to the waterfall was mates by this. The tour guide however was attentive and friendly. Very intelligent with his knowledge of several languages etc.Food was ok, although be prepared to pay for your drinks. This is 3 courses.When booking we were told water was provided but this wasn't given until 2.5 hours later from leaving the hotel. Also, it was a 1.5l bottle to share between 4. As expected on the track this quickly disappeared to nothing so were especially thirsty b the time we ordered our food.All in all, a good value for money trip.

Family Day Trip to Ourika Valley. Just back from our day trip and we have the most wonderful day due to the organisation and friendliness of the people at Atlas. Trip organised efficiently through email after we arrived in Marrakech. Clear information and details and we modified what we had wanted to do as we have a young son. On the day we were picked up from our hotel by the wonderful Mohamed who was friendly, insightful and really an all round great guide. Full of information and stories! He stopped when ever we wanted to take photos as well as stopping at a Berber home and working mill, oil production coop ( great rest bite with a taster of the oils and tea) and a tasty traditional lunch all included in the cost. We could have continued to the waterfalls as well but chose to spend some time in the village at the 'roads end', walked across rope bridges to cafes and let my boys paddle with the locals in the river. Wonderful day filled with memories and hundreds of photos taken! Thank you to Mustapha and Mohamed!

one day camel ride / trek. We found Atlas very accommodating by picking us up with our luggage in Marrakech and delivering the luggage to the Riad in Imlill whilst we did our ride and walk. The camel ride took a couple of hours, but in the baking sun I would say it was enough. we were then collected and taken to Imlill for a trek and lunch. Again, this took a couple of hours. It worked really well, though my only negative comment is that it was over by 2pm - a lot earlier than I was expecting. The lunch by a waterfall was very good.

2 day valley trek and 2 day Toubkal ascent. This was a great trip. Communication pre-arrival was great, Mohammed arranged everything. Was picked up from my hostel in Marrackech, and driven to Imlil. Wonderful 2 day valley hike and a tough, snowy hike up Toubkal. The food was absolutely fantastic, our guide Mohammed was great and very knowledgeable about the area and it was a wonderful experience. I'd happily use Atlas and Sahara tours again.

4x4 Trip to the Atlas Mountains with Adil - Great Experience. What a great excursion. A real eye opener and a great opportunity to see what Marrakech has to offer other than it's monuments, palaces, gardens and busy markets. I went to Morocco with my girlfriend at the end of May and prior to that we had plenty of contact with Adil (via email) who made sure that he catered for our needs. Adil was a real gent - punctual, polite, informative and spoke very good English and added some nice touches when he greeted us which went down well. He happily arranged for us to have a private tour (which we recommend).Our trip consisted firstly with a 20 min Camel ride which was good fun. We then savoured the unique experience of a Berber market which was very interesting. Adil then took us to see the local women making Argan Oil in it's traditional form and my girlfriend had fun interacting with the women and having a go at making it herself.We then proceeded to the highlight of the trip, a drive through the stunning landscape before ascending the Atlas Mountains. Not only did we consume the amazing scenery, we also had the humbling experience of meeting the Berber Villagers, being greeted by the droves of children as we drew near (We brought them gifts of colouring and activity books, games and a football which went down a treat - We wish we brought more as the delight on their faces was heart warming). We were also shown great hospitality and we were fed a beautiful traditional 3 course meal.We highly recommend this trip if you fancy getting out of the hustle and bustle of the Medina.

Brilliant Views. Is good to see how the Berbers live and is great to visit there home, the meal at the end at the bottom of the mountains is great and the view is amazing. - ( Atlas Mountain Tour - First Choice )

Highlight of Our Trip to Morocco. My boyfriend and I just got back from an amazing 4 day trek from Imlil to Setti Fadma through the Atlas Mountains! I would highly recommend the experience to anyone traveling to Marrakesh. We were picked up right on time from our Riad and smoothly transported to Imlil for the start of our trek. In Imlil we met our guide and muleteer. Our guide, Mohammed, spoke English well and was very familiar with the area, having grown up near Imlil and having guided here for the past six years. During the trek we stayed in gites and Berber inns along the way that were rudimentary but quite sufficient - and which only helped to put us out of our element a bit, in the best sort of way, as we had hoped and expected the trip to. Everywhere we went we felt safe and we met nothing but friendly faces throughout the hike. The valleys were beautiful, the villages fascinating, and the people inspiring! It was an experience of a lifetime that I will not soon forget!

A very memorable day trip. We booked a day trip to the Atlas Mountain with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours and it all went very smoothly. It was booked before we went to Marrakech, the driver picked us up on time and took us to meet our guide. We walked for a couple of hours through lovely scenery, climbing quite steeply, crossing some quite challenging terrain at one point to avoid a long walk round to get to the guides village. Here the guide was very attentive, taking us across one at a time and guiding where to put our feet. We then had a fabulous lunch in his house, cooked by his wife. The meat and vegetables in the tagine were glorious, accompanied by chicken on skewers, a massive salad with pasta and lots of unleavened bread, there was no way we could eat it all!!! We then walked back via the waterfall to the large village where our driver picked us up to return us to the hotel. It was the highlight of our trip to Marrakech and very well organised and safe.

Wonderful experience through the Atlas mountains. My husband, daughter and I had a wonderful trip through the Atlas mountains out to the desert. The scenery and nature was amazing and our driver was quite unbelievable. He really looked after us and could not do enough to make us happy.We should have been a group of 8 but five of the group had to cut short the journey because of sickness. Mohammed and his colleagues at Atlas & Sahara tours organized the return to Marrakech and really took responsibility for our friends and made sure that they were well looked after. The one negative element that marred our trip was that we spent New Years Eve in the desert where a large German group had organized music turning the camp into a very noisy disco.Otherwise a wonderful experience.

5 Day Atlas and Sahara Trip. I undertook this trip with my boyfriend on the 26th April. Overall, very good. I would say that Atlas and Sahara are far more ahead of their time then similar companies operating in the same market.The correspondence and organisation from Mohamad and Mustapha before we went was excellent. They stayed in regular contact and were reasonable about payment terms and prices. They helped reduce the price by putting me in contact with others who were interested in doing the trip, thus reducing our cost.Our driver spoke limited English, but was very aminable and friendly. He was able to portray the basics of where we were travelling to and what we were seeing and joined us for dinner on occassion. The two riads provided were more than adequate. The stay in the dessert and beber house was not particularly comfortable, but that is what you are signing up for. Our atlas trek guide was quite quiet, I suspect due to limited english - but when spoken to, he made a good effort to talk back. The trek and views were spectuctualar and highly recommended.The dessert stay was a little weird. We turned up and were whisked into a room with bored looking local 'musicians' who played a few songs and then asked us to buy their cds, we didnt. The jeep ride was fun and the views amazing of the dessert. The hospitiality when we got to the camp was pretty poor, we were not told anything about dinner times or offered a drink, we had to track people down and ask them. The camel ride back across the dunes was a highlight. There was a stop at a 'carpet factory' which was supposed to be imformative, but turned into quite the hardsell. But I think that comes with the territory in morocco and expected it at some point,We did a day drip enroute to the dessert around local farming land and visited a mosque which was all unexpected and actually very good.I think I also need to mention our cook on our Atlas Trek was excellent, taking pride in his work and generally being very happy and friendly and were our hosts in the berber home stay.I think they offer excellent value for money and would certainly recommend you book i

Best Part of Visit to Marrakech. Two of us booked the 1/2 day camel, 1/2 day hiking trip. Our trip was arranged for us with great ease after emailing the general booking website, we were greeted by a private driver for the day at our hotel.
