The driver spoke English and was very knowledgable and able to answer any and all questions we had. Upon arrival at the camel riding we were greeted by 2 guide. The camel ride was a bit boring and slow but made for great pictures. We then drove with one of the guides to the town of Imlil. Our driver dropped us off and the guide took us on a 2 hour hike plus an hour lunch in a local home. The guide also spoke decent English and we felt completely safe.The hike was quite hard as it was straight up a side of a mountain but wonderful views and really interesting. Make sure you bring enough money to tip everyone- driver, guides, lunch, etc. It was a wonderful day and I would highly recommend this trip to anyone!

An amazing trip.. I feel very sorry for Jabula, (7th April 2013). He missed out terribly. Our experience of this company was completely the opposite of his. We booked a day walking tour to Imlil and seperately a five day trip to Erg Chegaga through "Atlas and Sahara Tours", now apparently 'Exotic Morocco Travel-Day Tours' at the end of March 2013, Both were excellent. Our driver thoughout was Abdul, we could not have asked for better. At Imlil we were guided by a fully qualified local man, Joel, a fluent English speaker whose knowledge and courtesy in showing us his country made our day extremely satisfying.A couple of days later we started our five day trip to the desert journeying on the first day to Zagora via theTiz n'Tichka pass, Ait Ben haddouu Kasbah and the Draa valley. Abdul was an experienced guide and steady driver who spoke good English. He was very considerate and took care to ensure our trip throughout was great fun as well as extremely interesting and stimulating. He repeatedly went beyond the planned itinerary, exploring oases off the main road or or taking us on less visited tracks through fantastic landscapes, en route our daily destinations. The Hotel Zagor, where we spent our first night, was acceptable but not brilliant. The next day we continued on to the Sahara stopping off at Kasbah villages and a pottery at Tagounite en route. At Ouled Driss a local guide took us through the labyrinthian "undergrouund" streets of the village and then to his house for lunch, a memorable experience.Once through M'hamid and off road, Abdul's driving changed as he demonstrated his prowess with his 4 by 4, charging across the dunes in an exhilerting dash to our camp for the night. We arrived in time to enjoy the sunset and an excellent meal. The camp, (managed by Alkouch Lohsen), was low profile, with friendly staff, small but very clean and comfortable with carpets, electric light and sprung beds in the tents! We were not roughing it. It suited us perfectly. The dunes were magnificent particularly in the evening and early morning light. We didn't bother with camels but enjoyed a guided stroll the following morning spotting wildlife and finding herds of camels but, unfortunately not their owners,the object of the walk. On returning to the camp Abdul set off to fix the issue and returned having arranged for us to meet a nomadic farmer in his nearby camp. The people of the desert have an extraordinary reputation but we were discovering just how threatened their legendary nomadic lifestyle is. The impact of climate change, inability to cross militarised borders and accelerating movement of educated children to more comfortable parts means that those we met were probably of the last generation. There were many highlights on our short trip and our visit to this farmer, a dignified 75 year old, was definitely one of them.We had another exciting drive back across the desert to M'hamid and Ouled Driss. We stayed the night at "Dar Tahaya", a small hotel, in the centre of the kasbah in the care of Hassan's family. From its flat roof we could see over the mud-built town to the palmery beyond, a sight just thousands of years old. By now the trip had taken on a near magical quality as we enjoyed even more Moroccon hospitality in, what was for us, exotic but nevertheless always comfortable suroundings. The following morning Housin, another local guide, booked by Abdul, took us on a fascinating tour of a nearby palmery village, the subject of inter-family rivalryand battles between nomads and farmers, in which his family had participated, just a few generations back.Our final night was spent at the Enakhile kasbah, N'kob, after tracking across a stupendous black and pitiless stoney desert enclosed by distant mountainous cliffs, an incredible landscape to the north of Zagora and missed completly by the guide books. Beyond the desert and on cliffs looking back over the town and out across palms to more distant mountains the hotel at N'kob was another find by Abdul which we really appreciated. (It helped that he seemed to know everyone wherever we were.) On the final day, driving back to Marrakesh through the Atlas, our driver still managed to cut away from the main road to find villages and valleys off the beaten track.In 50 years travel around the Mediterranean and its margins we have been lucky enough on occasion to find places that whilst equipped for tourism were yet to crushed and destroyed by the mass market. These trips beyond Marrakesh certainly fell into that category. Further, it was clear that Atlas and Sahara Tours were consciously endeavouring to put money directly into country communities by supporting individuals and start up enterprises there; we were told as much by people we met along the way. The pay-off for us tourists was immediate in the places we were taken to and the good will extended to the company everywhere we went. This sort of treatment, which we benefited from, is far beyond the reach of the average national or international company. We are very grateful to Mohamed for arranging the trips and being so flexible at short notice. I am sure he has other great drivers to call upon but we personally owe a debt of gratitude to Abdul for his work in making or holiday a complete success. We would unhestatingly recommend him. And oh, we were offered as much water as we required and it was free everytime !Be sensible don't try and do the desert trip in a day or two. Cut your time in Marrakesh which CAN definitely be done, without loss, in two days. Spend your time in the south where you will be amazed. Visited March 2013

Atlas & Sahara Day Tour. Our day trip to the Atlas Mountains was one of the highlights of our Mroccan holiday. We traveled to Marrakech in April and wanted to do a day trip into the Atlas Mountains. I had read many favourable reviews for Atlas and Sahara tours so I sent them an email. Mustapha responded within the day and was so easy to deal with. I was traveling with 3 children and my parents in law. My mother in law has had hip surgery limiting the types of day tours on offer on the website. Mustapha was fantastic and tailored a tour to suit our needs and did so at a fantastic rate. Our driver on the day was Mohammed. He grew up in the mountains and was an endless source of information and lovely stories throughout the day. His English was very good making it very easy to communicate. Mustapha had advised that Tuesday is a good day to travel into the mountains as there is a weekly Berber market. We took his advice and were so glad that we did. Overall we had a truly memorable day and thoroughly enjoyed Mohammed's company and stories. Mustapha was a pleasure to deal with and always prompt with email replies. We recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours highly.

Comfortable camel trek!!. We undertook a day trip with Atlas and Sahara day tours in March 2013. Communications with the company before we left were easy and efficient and we were duly picked up at 8.30am at our Riad. Our driver was courteous and informative and very friendly. He drove us smoothly on the Moroccan roads to the mountains where we met our camels with their guide. I was pleasantly surprised as the camels seemed to be in excellent condition and were actually comfortable to ride! We were led at a comfortable relaxing pace through some stunning scenery for the next 2 hours. It really was an amazing experience. We had lunch at a Berber house where our vegetarian needs were well met and the food was of excellent quality. The views from the rooftop were stunning and the meal was very relaxing.A 2 hour walking trek followed with our private guide, and once again the scenery was amazing. We were met at the end by our driver who took us smoothly back to our Riad.Overall it was an excellent day tour and definitely left us wanting to go back and do more, and we would readily use Atlas and Sahara tours again.

Mixed experience. We've just returned from Morocco where we spent four days with Atlas and Sahara tours. I hate to pour cold water on all the excellent reviews, but our experience wasn't entirely perfect.We booked Atlas and Sahara to take us from Marrakech to Zagora for an overnight camel trek to a Berber camp, then to Imlil in the Atlas mountains for a two day trek up Mt. Toubkal with an overnight at the Toubkal refuge.The good: Pre-trip communication with Mohammed was excellent. Accommodations in Imlil at Dar Amalou guesthouse were great and our mountain guide (also named Mohammed) was superb. The experience of hiking in the Atlas was great, even though we did not summit Toubkal because of bad weather. Seeing so much of Morocco's diverse landscape was wonderful.The bad:(1) Our driver from Marrakech to Zagora and on to Imlil did not keep his end of the contract. We did not stop at the film studio on Ouazzarete nor at the village of Ait Benhaddou on the way to Zagora because we "didn't have enough time." We picked up plants in one town and delivered them in another. We stopped at his sister's house for tea and made several other unscheduled and unexplained stops at ATMs, coffee shops, gas stations and government offices. On the way back form Zagora to Imlil we insisted on stopping at the film studio and at Ait Benhaddou but the promised 1 hour tour of the village did not materialize. The driver did not speak English. Finally, water and drinks which were part of the contract were not included and we were told to pay for them ourselves.(2) Despite repeated queries about the likelihood of summiting Toubkal in early April, we were assured that it was a "great time to climb the mountain." Maybe we were unusually unlucky with the weather, but we had six inches of fresh snow, the temps dipped to -13F with the windchill and the winds blew 40 mph. We have hiked all over the world and understand mountain weather conditions. It just would have been great to have a little more honesty up front.(3) When we discussed our grievances with Mohammed at the end of the trip, he blamed the driving company. He explained that drivers never speak English as they do not have the same level of education as tour guides. He also argued that drinks are never considered part of a meal. There were no apologies.What the traveller should know:(1) An English speaking driver does not mean a driver who speaks English. Ignore that promise in the contract. Take your best schoolboy French.(2) Meals apparently do not include drinks, even juice and water.(3) The packing list for Toubkal is a joke. Luckily we knew this. Do not attempt to summit in early spring unless you have plastic boots, gaiters, winter mountaineering parkas, and experience with crampons and ice axes.(4) Do not expect the overnight with the Berbers to be a cultural experience. The Berbers do not speak English, there was no opportunity to learn about their lives in the desert, with camels, the role of women, anything. To be fair, none of this was promised in the contract, but it is an opportunity missed. It is a 1 hour camel ride, mint tea, tangine dinner, overnight in a tent, camel ride out. No more and no less.Hope this helps.

The highlight and an unforgettable experience in Marrakesh. If there is one thing i can recommend you do in Marrakesh is take a tour with Atlas and Sahara Tours. We went on the one day hike up to the mountains, and it was simply one of the best trips i have ever had the pleasure of going on. We had our own private guide who was absolutely brillant. He told us about the history of the region, the Berber Village and about the country in general. The views are breathtaking, and my only regret is that we weren't there longer to take a 3 day trek up to mountains. When we first arrived, I was feeling very dodgy, and as we started our trek, i got quite ill and nauseous. I blamed it on the breakfast! But having said that, my mate who had the same thing wasn't sick. Our guide was a real gentleman and left me alone to expel everything! I was fine after 15 minutes, and we went on the trek. If you're worried about your fitness levels, don't be, because it's not all uphill and it's worth it just to see to the views. We had lunch at the house of our guide's brother, and it was my favourite meal on our trip (and we ate at a 5 star resturant). The meal was exquisite. We were picked up at our hotel promptly and we were dropped off after. It's all catered for and this is where i have to sing Mohammed's praises. He is your guy if you want to undertake tours in Marrakesh. He sorted us a guide to the Medina the following day and i have to say i was thankful for it. Our guide was english speaking and took us around for half a day. If we had been there longer, I would definitely have taken a few more of the tours - but we just didn't have the time. For me, this trip will always stand out. I can't recommend this company enough for your time there - all i can is that you won't be disappointed if you take one of their tours.

Fifteen Day Trekking Trip To The Atlas Mountains & More. Last autumn (2011) I undertook along with my brother a fifteen day trekking trip to the Atlas Mountains. This was followed by a couple of days stay in Marrakech as well as day excursion to the 'Ait Benhadot Fortress' which is a UNESCO World Heritage Centre all organised by Atlas Sahara Tours. The whole trip was well coordinated and organised and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I strongly recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours to anyone who wish to do a similar trip themselves

Three days with Atlas and Sahara Tours. We wanted a tailor-made tour to accommodate our interests (mainly photography) and to see the Atlas mountains and Berber community. Thank you tripadvisor forum members for your recommendations - you were dead right. This company is amazing - so organised and attentive to detail. The personalised itinerary had our approval and all the arrangements agreed upon and our emails promptly attended to. Thank you, Mustapha.We had a wonderful guide and excellent driver and a well-maintained Toyota landcruiser for the off-road part. We felt safe and excellently informed. We enjoyed the local cuisine and staying in a Berber guest house. Everywhere people were friendly and we highly recommend this company.

Trip of a Lifetime!!. Had an amazing experience trekking recently in the Atlas mountains. We cannot recommend highly enough Mohammed and his team at Atlas and Sahara Tours. We went on our own private trip with a great guide called Abdul who was very friendly and informative about the region. Everything ran smoothly and we were provided with excellent food and breathtaking views. When we got to various resting places along the way, the food was already there prepared by our own chef who had gone on ahead with a mule carrying provisions and our belongings. On one such stop we were greeted by a herd of inquisitive mountain goats. The trek was over 2 days and we stayed at a Berber village one night. The sun was shining down on the red hillside while we passed almond trees, walnut groves, desert plants, river beds and snow capped mountains. Great value for money, especially compared to other tour organisers. I have recommended Atlas and Sahara Tours to friends & colleagues and will definitely use this company when we visit Morocco again to explore the Sahara desert.

Company is excellent in every way.. You have many choices of tour guides for exploring the Atlas mountains; pick Atlas and Sahara and you will be very happy. The tour coordinator, Mustapha, is an excellent communicator. As a first time visitor to Morocco and Africa the cultural differences were a little scary and I was afraid some of our requests would get lost in translation (e.g. Vegetarian lunch, longer hike, English speaking driver and guide). But Mustapha understood everything, he responded to our questions very quickly and stayed in touch with us until the end, ensuring our satisfaction. Mohammad, our driver, spoke excellent English, gave a very informative explanation of the sights and who've safely. Hassan, our guide, was a good companion and interesting. He was very well informed and able to answer all of our questions. He even gave us some instruction on safe hiking technique. Hassan prepared a 7 vegetable tagine and fresh salad for us for lunch at a Berber house, and the meal was delicious. If you want to hike in the Atlas, this is a great company to use and is well worth the cost.

Amazing Experience!!. My partner and I have just returned from Marrakech and decided to do a 1 day 1/2 camel - 1/2 hike through the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara Day Tours, and we couldnt have asked for more! From the first contact, through to the end, was great. Having come across this company a few days before our departure, Mustapha was happy to help orgainze something for us at our convenience. Both our driver and guides were friendly, extremely polite and knowledgeable. Definitely a must if you would like a private guided tour - which is well worth it!!

Amazing Trek in the Atlas Mountains. We have just got back home from an amazing 5 day honeymoon in Morrocco. We spent two days trekking in the Atlas Mountains, organised by Mustapha. The scenery was breath-taking (they filmed 7 years in Tibet here apparently - according to Wiki!) - Cherry blossom, walnut trees and juniper adorn the hillsides. Our guides were friendly and knowledgable, even treating us to a performance on the Berber drum! We covered about 30 km, ascending 700m (we think) to 2500m - and arrived back at Imlil tired, but happy. The food was tasty, healthy and plentiful and we couldn't have asked for more. We just need an excuse to come back! Thankyou.

Most memorable New Year's Eve. The highlight of my trip to Morocco was spending New Year's Eve in the Sahara desert in a Berber tent. This was after a scenic drive and overnight in the Atlas mountains. Wished we had gotten to Merzouga sooner so we would have had time to climb the dunes and get pictures of the sunset. The morning was a little rushed getting back to the van, but the camel ride was a fun experience. Anwar was a terrific driver negotiating all those winding mountain roads and getting us safely to our destination.

Horse Riding, Toubkal climbing, dessert, sight seeing... best tour ever!. hello!We were 8 persons and did 12 intensive days in Morocco, with many attractions including 6 days of horse riding in Atlas, sudden decision to split the grup and climb Toubkal, than camer riding and than with one more unplanned gruop split. Additionalyy half of the gruop was vegan, so we were really difficult to take care of. What I loved about the people from Atlas and Sahara that there were open for our ideas and needs, always ready to act and adapt, with a smile and positive attitude. Really worth recommending!Violetta

Day trip from Marrakesh. From first contact by email, everything about the company gave confidence. The whole day was superb - apart from the guide going to the wrong hotel but they made every possible effort to find us. The driver, the walking guide and Mustapha himself were all really committed to give us a great day and that is what we got. Out to the mountains and then a 3 hour trek with the pace set perfectly and with a generous spirit of help too when it got a bit tricky. Lunch in a Berber house was delicious and well done all round. The driving was safe and comfortable, even in the back, the 4x4 was modern and in excellent condition. I strongly recommend this company on the basis of their administration and output.

Atlas & Sahara in October 2012 - Family with 2 Children. We had a 2 weeks trip in Marocco. We had a 4 days trekking tour in the Atlas, a 3,5 days trekking tour in the desert and we visited Fes as well. Our trip was excellent organised from Mohamed and Mustaphas. The've absolutly understood our needs.Driss was our guide for the 2 weeks and he's the best guide you can imagine! We had 2 very beautiful and very interesting weeks. A big thank you to Mohamed, Mustapha, Driss, Mohamed (cook & responsable for the mule), Brahim (Desert)
Stunning!. We had a day trip up the Atlas Mountains with a local guide (recommended) the views are outstanding. It's hard work on the legs but well worth the effort.

Well-planned holiday experience for 13 days of extreme adventure in Morocco. Finally my desire to see the Sahara desert came true along with other activities e.g. surfing, kiteboarding, driving by the Atlantic coast, trekking in Atlas Mountains, camel trek in Merzouga desert) for 13 days starting by Casablanca, Essaouira, Sidi Kaouki, Agadir, Marrakech, Atlas Mountains & Sahara. Mohamed planned the entire trip from A to Z (accommodation, transfers, tours, etc.) and everything went very smoothly! I am extremely satisifed by his professionalism during my entire stay since the whole holiday became an unforgettable experience. Also many thanks to the rest of the very friendly team whom were our guide Mostapha & our friendly driver Rachid!

Very efficient organisation and friendly guide. A wonderful day walking in the mountains. Well guided, timed and very informative. A brilliant way to experience something completely different and escape the chaos of Marrakech for a few hours.

Atlas mountain tour. We are a couple from Bristol and had booked a trip with Adil after reading fantastic reviews through tripadvisor. Adil was great from the word go. His English was very good, he was very pleasant and answered all of our questions.First of all we visited a berber village where they made Argan oil followed by a berber home which we enjoyed a traditional moroccan dish and got to meet a berber family. Adil then accommodated for our additional request of visiting a berber school.We couldn't thank Adil enough for our unforgettable experience! We can't wait to go back again next year! I would highly recommend this trip.

Days hiking in the Atlas Mountains. We contacted Mohamed to book this via email during our trip to Marrakech. He arranged pick from our hotel in a nice 4x4 and transport to the Atlas mountains. We trekked for around 4-5 hours with a fantastic guide named Abdil. The walk was challenging and very interesting. Despite walking in shorts and T shirt in +20degsC there was snow on the ground as we went up the mountain.The visit and eating in the Berber villages was amazing and a great experience. This was definitely one of my highlights of the visit to Marrakech.

The highlight of my Morocco trip. This is my first time mountain trekking and I really love it! Mustapha the guide is very helpful, especially for a newbie like me. If I had more time, I'd go for more than two days trip. This experience definitely the best thing of my Morocco trip (and in my life so far)!

Fantastic excursion to the Atlas. Unforgettable excursion to Imlil. We (party of 7 women!) started the day by a 2-hour camel (or horse for some of us) ride in an amazing valley. We appreciated having a guide each to help us walk the animal. Really beautiful sceneries, fantastic pictures taken....Our main guide (who could speak English very well) was really attentive and experienced, explained a lot about local lifestyle. We then drove to Imlil where we had a simple but tasty lunch. The weather did not allow the walk we had planned but we were quite happy to wander in the village and enjoy the shops (with very friendly owners). The drive back to Marrakech was a bit an adventure as a huge storm started when we left, but our experienced driver (Hassan) made us feel very safe.Will definitely go back with husbands and kids!Also used Atlas and Sahara Tours for pick-up from and drop-off to the airport. Great service.I do highly recommend them!!!

Atlas and Sahara Tours and Mount Toubkal. This is the 2nd time we have used Atlas and Sahara - last year a one day walking trek, this year a 2 day including climb to the summit of Mount Toubkal and an overnight stay in the refuge. As last year excellent from start to finish - picked up at hotel and taken to Imlil met Mohammed our guide from last year , who intoduced us to Mohammed who was to be our guide this year, cook and mule arrived. One reviewer said they felt sorry for the mules, admittedly it only carried one backpack and 2 sleeping bags along with food for us but I thought the mules looked well cared for and needed little cajoling to make the journey up and down. hey seemed both healthy and happy if you can tell if a mule looks happy!The ascent to the refuge took us about 4.5 hours, it is a steady incline, along a stony and clearly marked pathway Mohammed set a steady pace and was happy to stop if you needed a breather/ catch the views. We stopped en route and had a fantastic lunch - there is no way you starve on these trips and the standard of food was better than in our hotel!We arrived at the refuge - it is reasonably basic but has running water showers, bunk rooms a sitting area with a fire and dining rooms. Extra blankets were available if needed. Each group had their own cook who provided food - again excellent. Following day had a 6am start - it is a continual ascent - not tecnical, but there were some reviews that says no guide needed - obviously that does depend on experience and navigation skills, but in places particularly when there has been snowfall the path is not distinct. For those who have little experience and think its an easy peasy stroll please be warned , it is not common but someone did die ,falling from near the summit the night we were there- part of a group but no guide and I believe no grampons. The ascent and descent takes 5-6 hours, we did it in November and grampons were essential , snow was thick and icy in places. Mohammed was excellent - he had a great sense of humour , assisted when necessary but also gave you space to enjoy the environment. We arrived at the top - a great sense of achievement and fabulous views - and then started a steep descent - having not used grampons before I was happy on occasions for Mohammed to offer assistance. We arrived back at the refuge in nearly 6 hours having been a little slower descending as I suffered from some altitude sickness( just sickness no headaches) I believe there were others that day who didnt get to the top because of altitude sickness. Having got back to the refuge we had a further 4 hours back to Imlil , a lovely lunch was prepared but I couldnt do it justice - and Mohammed was more than happy for me to take my time and feel better before the journey - but I knew his mum was making couscous for his return and i was keen throughout our two days as part of my challenge to keep within time frames we soon set off - but with a clear path ahead we had a head start and left Mohammed, the mule and cook to cartch up ! it took us 3.5 hours to get back - and on reaching the road we were met by Brian our taxi driver. So to conclude brill 2 days, great organisation ,excellent guide , would I use again most definitely in fact Morrocco November 2013 is already on the cards - just need to read some of your reviews to find another trek - 2011 1 day , 12 2 days so its got to be longer next year. Thanks Mustapha at Atlas yopu have a great time and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend you or any of your team - WELL DONE !!

Brilliant day trip to the Atlas Mountains. Having read excellent reviews, myself and my friend Lucy booked onto the half day camel ride & half day hike with Atlas & Sahara Tours in April this year. We had a fantastic day with the limited time we had available to explore the Atlas Mountains. Mohamed & Mustapha who we booked the trip through online were extremely helpful & prompt in getting back to us with pre-trip queries and as promised we were picked up in Marrakech at 9.00am by our wonderful driver Assan. On arrival in Asni we met our guide Abdul who was full of knowledge of the local area and looked after us for the day. We then did a 2 hour camel trek to the other side of the valley through berber villages, Assan was there to meet us at the end of the trek to drive us to Imlil for lunch which was excellent. We then started our 2 hour hike through the Atlas Mountain villages facing Toubkal which was beautiful. We finished the hike late afternoon and were then driven back to our Riad in Marrakech. The service we received throughout was very professional and I would highly recommend Atlas & Sahara tours for exploring the Atlas Mountains. I would love to go back with more time in the future and climb to the summit of Toubkal and I would definitely book through Atlas & Sahara tours again. Thank you Abdul for a wonderful trip and to Assan and the rest of team for looking after us, we had a wonderful time!Sophie - UK

Great trekking experience with children. We booked an overnight trek with mules with Mustapha a couple of days before leaving for Marrakech. Everything was very straightforward from booking to execution. We were picked up as promised from our Ryad and taken to Imlil in the Atlas mountains to begin the trek. There we were met by Mustapha himself and introduced to our guide, Mohammed, muleteer Ibrahim and our mules. The walk itself was billed as an "easy and interesting" two day walk. It was certainly interesting, not so much easy but perhaps that just shows how unfit I am! We spent the first day climbing up to the Tizi Mzik pass and then dropping down to a Berber village to spend the night in a very rustic Berber guest house. I had been worried this would be a bland affair but it was actually full of local colour. We were very fortunate as our trip coincided with a village festival. Mohammad took us along to watch and helped us made sense of it all. The next day we crossed over a slightly less intimidating pass to drop back into the Imlil valley and return to Marrakech. The girls, six and nine, loved having the mules to ride on and we would never have been able to walk so far without the support. We had great food all the way. We usually hate having guides, but Mohammad was very discreet and helpful, ready to make suggestions but always listening to what we wanted to do. Extra top service from Mustapha: we discovered on the morning of the trek that my elder daughter's boots didn't fit any more. He rang round his friends and found us a pair of boots for her to borrow. All round very impressive.

Just too many incidentals!. 4x4 picked up at hotel but back seat was raised so views very limited. No need to have stopped at pottery but the worse stop was the Women's co-operative which inflated the price of merchandise! Best to buy anything in the Square where it was 700%!!! cheaper

Brilliant - very professional. We took a day long mountain biking tour to the Atlas Mountains. All the staff were excellent, from our careful driver, to the guides. They took us for an amazing lunch in Asni - a real highlight. The mountains were spectacular - thanks to Atlas and Sahara Tours for making our day so special!

Amazing Trek. Myself and my boyfriend did a two day trek up Mount Toubkal in September which I booked in advance. The whole experience was Amazing. We found the company to be very reliable. We were picked up from our hotel in Marrakech and driven to Imlil where we were met by a company representative who spoke perfect English, he waited with us until our guide arrived and then we set off. We stopped for lunch in a beautiful spot and then arrived at the refuge at around 4, where we had mint tea and hot showers(!) before being served a lovely dinner. The next day was an early start and pretty tough going as the mountain was snow capped but well worth it when we reached the top. Our guide was helpful and cheerful the whole time and waited with us when we returned to Imlil for our taxi to arrive to take us back to Marrakech. We would definitley us Atlas and Sahara Tours again.

A trip not to be missed. We took a 2 day trip to the Atlas and Sahara and it was the highlight of the holiday. Our guide Yosef and driver Allah spent 2 days with us driving over 500 miles through the Atlas Mountains, anti Atlas Mountains. The first day we visited the Kasbah at AitBenhaddou through Zagora where we camped in a Bivouac in the Tinfou Dunes. On the second day we had a camel ride in Zagora, visited a Berber town (Kasbah) where we saw the locals making pots out of clay.This was the highlight of the trip to Morocco and if you want to experience the real Morocco then this is the trip to take.

1 Day Imlil Trip. An excellent all round experience, we took the 1 day trip to Imlil in August and thoroughly enjoyed it all. This company's positive reviews are very well deserved as the initial contact with Mohamed was very quick and dealt with well, he rang me at the hotel to confirm details and all the arrangements were spot on.The transfer was prompt and quick and the driver was informative and friendly both there and back, although I must apologise for us falling asleep on the way back - so tired!The trek itself was a real experience, our guide Mohammed was excellent, really informative and very mindful of our need for info and rest and water breaks. The scenery was spectacular and the break for food was fabulous and very welcome. Seeing the village and the people who live there was a genuine experience I will not forget.The walk was initially tough but overall I would say it was suitable for all. A thoroughly recommended experience.

1 day trek of the Imlal Valley. As we were only staying in Marrakech for 4 nights a 1 day trek in the Atlas Mountain range was as much time as my wife and I could afford.We investigated other excursion companies but found Atlas and Sahara to be the one that attracted us most due to their excellent reviews and prompt response to our enquiries.We were collected from our Riad at 9:00am in the heart of the Medina by our driver Abdul and transferred the 90 minutes journey to the Imlal Valley and met by our guide Mohammed. The trek through the mountain range and many villages was excellent and our guide was fantastic. He knew when to provide information and when to leave us to enjoy the splendours of the mountain range. This is a very important part of a guides role and one that Mohammed has obviously mastered.The trek was split up only for a lunch, prepared to our vegetarian request accompanied with some wonderfully refreshing mint tea.It should also be noted that I had made a small error in as much as I had arrived at the trek having brought an insufficient amount of euros in error. However, when I explained this on the telephone to Mohammed in the tour office he was very understanding and accepted my request to make my payment in part euros and part dirham without complaint. Excellent customer service.On completion of our trek we were again met by our driver Abdul at c.3:30pm and returned safely to Marrakech. Again, Abdul was an excellent driver who took care to drive at a reasonable speed and with courtesy. Whilst our trip at the start of the day was full of conversation and local information which we welcomed and enjoyed, Abdul was mindful that on our return journey we were tired and just wanted to rest.It should also be noted that there was no attempts by either driver or guide to take us to shops only willing to sell us there wares. This was very important to us as we wanted only to experience the mountain range and not to buy any goods which we didn't require.I would recommend Atlas and Sahara for any trek requirements in the Atlas range; Mohammed and Mustafa (office) arranged our excursion as they said they would and Mohammed and Abdul looked after us very well.

Transfer from Airport to Hotel (and back). Having arranged the transfer from Airport to our hotel, we weren't sure how it would work (as we have never done it before). However we were delighted with the result.Whilst our taxi driver wasn't displaying our name on arrival (which we were looking forward to)we were approached by another taxi driver speaking perfect english, guiding us to where (and who) we need to see. Our taxi driver was polite, a careful driver and delivered us comfortably to our destination.It is the return journey that prompted me to give a review.As we waited in the foyer of our hotel wondering if the taxi driver would turn up (or should we have phoned to make sure) he arrived at 14.25 Prompt as per our itineary! He was polite, delighted to hear all abour our stay in Marrakesch and was driving a 4x4 air conditioned vehicle as a bonus.We were more than delighted with the service (our first with Sahara) we received.

Toubkal 2 day ascecnt. Recently returned from Atlas and Sahara Tours 2 day tour- for only 120 euros, we were picked up from out Hotel in Marrakech, transferred to the base of the mountain, and given a wonderful tour up the Atlas ranges highest mountain. The food included two lunches, two dinners and breakfast, and all the meals were outstanding. The guide was extremely friendly, and a mule was provided to carry kit up the mountain. An absolutely cracking deal with a very reliable company. This is the second time i have used Atlas and Sahara tours after my sahara tour last summer- i couldnt recommend Mohammed and Atlas and Sahara more highly. Excellent service

Excellent day - excellent guides. Was in Marrakesh for only 3 days, so opted for the one day [horse ride in the morning and 4WD in the afternoon]. We were picked up from our hotel at 08.30 by Abrahim our guide, splendid in blue! and driven to the foot of the mountains for mint tea before being given our horses. A lovely relaxing 2 hour ride before being driven [with Mustafa another guide also] to the waterfall for the most amazing food. The 4WD afternoon was superb - hairpin bends like Ive never experienced - having to pause halfway round a corner to reverse, tight doesnt even cover it - Id raise a drink to Abrahims driving!! Dropped back at our Riad at 8pm, it was a full day which really extended our knowledge of the area and gave us all an unforgetable experience!! Big thanks

Combined day trip to the Atlas Mountains. If you only have time for one tour this is the one to do. We were picked up from our hotel in a comfortable 4 x 4 and driven to the edge of the Atlas mountains to meet our guide Hassan and the camels. A leisurely camel ride through the lovely countryside took us up into the foothills where we had lunch. Amazing amounts of food and the most delicious fresh walnuts. After lunch Hassan guided us on a lovely walk round the waterfalls and even provided me with a jacket (it was much colder up in the mountains). We asked if we could stop at the women's co-operative to buy some Argan oil which we duly did. Taken back to our hotel in same vehicle at the end of the day. Definitely the highlight of our holiday which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Highly recommended. We had a fantastic 4 day tour including the Sahara and High Atlas Mountains. We had a very helpful guide who was very informative but also gave us plenty of space. He was a good driver and drove smoothly and carefully. This was very important when we were covering so many miles each day. All the accommodation and food provided was good. Would definitely recommend for a more personalised tour experience.

Excellent experience. I arranged this with Mohammed by email. Although it is slightly more expensive than other treks, Mohammed pointed out that this included everything (food, transfers etc) so there were no hidden charges. I was reassured that he didn't slash the prices immediately, like other companies, as he was confident that his trip would deliver, which it certainly did. My partner and I only had a week in Morocco, so arranged a one day trip. It was one of the best parts of the holiday and an excellent, full day. The guide was a local, friendly, polite, non-intrusive, but very informative. The walk was at just the right pace for us and the length of the walk was just right. The scenery was beautiful and everchanging. The meal was lovely, but more of a hostel type house than a typical local's house. Mohammed called us at the end of the trip to ensure that everything had been to our satisfaction. An excellent serivice and real Moroccan experience.

Couldn't even try their services. I asked them for a quotation and they replied demanding from me all my contact details or they wouldn't send a proposal. I told them we could do it by email and they said I could be someone trying to make a fraud ¿?As far as I understand, no Internet user is obliged to share his/her personal details; I also understand they can reject a quotation request based on logical policies, but if they answer potential clients on that way, How will they treat their final customers?On the other hand... I immediately got 3 other proposals from different companies (one of which I tried in a previous trip to Morocco) with very good manners and customer oriented approach to the sale.Sad story... I write this because I think the experience of a customer does not start only when you already hired a company, it involves all the process since the moment you become a lead, through negotiation and final hiring of the services.

Great experience in Morocco 5 days trip. Dream to come back.. This excellent trip and excellent experience. It was 2 days Toubkal trekking and 3 days 4-wheel tour over best sightseeing places in Morocco. I had very tight schedule but Mohamed made it perfect, what I admitted when I read other descriptions and reviews. I liked the manner in which Mohamed and all staff handled negotiation and later organised and guided tour: respectful, precise, professional, client oriented.It was interesting to talk to my guide Mohamed during Toubkal trekking, I knew a lot from him about Morocco, his life and berbers people. I ow totally the success of my 3-days trip around Morocco to my driver Abdul. He is excellent driver, knows a lot about all places we visited, you can ask him almost everything and get right answer. He loves his country and his people and this makes him excellent guide.I would highly recommend to book your tour with Atlas & Sahara Tours, if you want custom tailored program, professional attitude, knowledge of country, and not the last, competitive prices.Thanks to these people, I loved their country and dream to come back.

Ideal - even for the none walker!. Booked it with Mohammed, he even rang me on the house phone!Wanted a sightseeing trip with some walking.Met at the Riad by Hassan who was an excellent driver.Went to a lake and then started climbing, in the car! Stopped at a family house for tea, honey, which we bought a pot of, and bread and oil.Then we basically left the road for a track up the mountains, snow on the ground, and climbed up to a Berber house for a meal. My husband then walked part way down but I didn't!!This company, although not cheap, will accomodate what you want. Best money we paid out for views -unforgetable

Highly Recommended! Great Tour. My partner and I were only in Marrakech for a few nights, but we decided we definitely wanted to do some sort of tour to the Atlas Mountains. After researching online, we came across Atlas and Sahara Tours on Trip Advisor which had received some great reviews. We emailed regarding the Imlil Valley Tour and received a prompt response from Mohamed that evening. As first time trekkers, Mohamed responded to all our queries quickly. We then booked online the day before flying out and we’re able to take part on the tour just two days later. We were picked up from our Riad and driven to the bottom of the mountains where we were met by our guide who spoke great English, (also named Mohamed). Mohamed was friendly and able to answer any questions we had whilst on the trek. He even got us some bottles of water, (as we had forgotten ours), and lent my partner his hat to protect him from the sun. Included in the Tour price was lunch cooked in a Berber home. My partner and I were able to sit back in the sunshine, relax and enjoy the mountain views whilst we ate our wonderful home cooked Moroccan lunch and drank tea. Throughout the entire trek no one was pushy or trying to sell you anything and it was far from touristy.It was a truly wonderful experience which we would highly recommend. Not only do you see some incredible views, but you walk away with some fantastic photographs and a great sense of achievement. Everyone, from our guide, to our taxi drivers, and the local Berber people were professional, warm and welcoming.

First rate service and great value.. My husband and I booked a last minute trip and Mohammed was very accommodating. He was always quick to answer our questions and supply various options. Our guides were very professional and informative. We would definitely book with this company again!!!!

Excellent day tour. Mohammed was a very imformative and excellent guide. He was very engaging yet not too 'in your face'.Restaurant we were taken to for lunch was brilliant.Our driver, Ali, was safe and dependable.Highly recommended for excursions.

A great day, great guide and exceeded expectations !. We had a short break to Morrocco in Nov/dec and wanted to do a days walking in the Atlas Mountains- we booked with Atlas and Sahara Tours - but when we got to the hotel we were told how expensive the tour was ( 70 euro pp) compared with others - naturally we were a bit worried but I contacted Mohammed who was very reassuring informed us that we really would be trekiing - not visiting , looking and wandering and how true that was ! We were rtaken to Imil valley where we met Mohammed who spoke great English, friendly but not in your face and humourous and of we went - a steady and gradual clim for about 3 hrs, a 15 min snack break , another hour then a suburb lunch made by Mohammeds wife ( couldnt get the recipe out of her tho) and sat on the veranda in beautiful sunshine in view of the mountains then off again through the villages and getting a glimse of life in the Atlas mountains. Then back to pick up vehicle- yes a brilliant day , no berber tourist shops , carpets, or anything touristy in fact we only saw 3 other non locals the whole time. But yes it was a trek sio if you want to wander , look and get back on the bus maybe not for you ! Was it expensive ,,,, no Mohammed it was worth every penny sorry to doubt you ! Would we do it again yes definitely and hoping to with maybe an overnight stop thrown in !! Thanks M and M !

Toubkal climbing. In December. 2011, my wife and I visited our friends in Morocco. I very like mountains and mountaineering, so I decided to climb to Toubkal while my wife with friends took one day tour around Imlil. My guide Abdul was very professional, informative, with good English and decent sense of humor. Actually by the end of our trek he became for me as a good and reliable partner. Near the summit (4000m) we met a very strong wind ( level of hurricane) and he advised to returned back , because such situation was getting dangerous – I can hardly stay even with support of ice ax. I really enjoyed these two days looking at magnificent views and meeting challenges – what else need a man in the mountains. Thank you very much atlasandsaharatours for such trip. My wife and her friends also were very enjoyed by one day trek around Imlil. I would highly recommend anybody their service. Igor

Highly Recommended. If you do one thing in Morocco during your visit, you MUST take the time to contact Mohammed and his group for the half day camel and Atlas mountain trek. We had one of the best experiences in recent memory. They took extra care to make sure we arrived safely, with a pick-up right at our hotel. Constantly considerate of our comfort throughout the whole tour. Not to mention, there was no nickle and diming, nor were we forced to stop and shop. And most important, we were not rushed, we went at our own pace and chose where we went. This trip was all about the beautiful country and us experiencing it. We had a home made meal on the rooftop of their accommodations. We, unfortunately, did not stay there for the night, which I am sure would be top notch as well. I could go on and on, but I will not. Point blank, best tour company I have ever dealt with!

Excellent, customized experience.. I wanted to explore Marrakech and climb Jebel Toubkal. When I contacted Mohamed, he worked with me to create just the customized experience I was looking for. I spent just the right mix of time on my own in Marrakech and hiking in the mountains. Abdul, my guide, was terrific: he was able to tailor our journey to my pace (faster than normal, I'm an ultrarunner). From the time I was picked up at the airport, through many guesthouses and miles covered, to my final drop-off, I always felt like Mohamed and his team (including Abdul, Ibrahim, and even our mule guy) were on top of the situation and ready to accommodate--but not smother, because my independence is important to me when traveling. I would recommend Atlas to any level of traveler, whether seeking a very guided trip or a somewhat hands-off one.

An authentic, adventurous, safe way to see Morocco by camel, foot, or 4x4!. Some friends and I were going to Marrakech for just a few days and wanted to ride some camels through the desert or see the mountains. If you want to go to the desert, you need a few more days, but we did an awesome one day trip (from 9am-6pm). When I first emailed the company, they just sent a vague itinerary with suggestions for a longer trip. But upon emailing them again, they sent a good itinerary for a day trip. They had someone get us at our hotel and walk us to the car. I was a bit skeptical because this person that walked us wanted a tip, and I read that a lot of these camel trek/hiking/desert/mountain tour groups make their money by charging you extra for everything. But I was pleasantly surprised because we were not charged for water they provided and a few other extras (i.e., fruit). The roads don't really have lane markings and can be a bit dangerous, but our driver was a professional. I felt really safe, but I did get carsick (typical for me). We met our guide, Muhammed, and we rode camels to Imlil. The camels were great and a lot of fun. For the most part they seemed well taken care of, but there was a male camel that was in questionable health. The camel had some sort of big yellow thing coming out of its mouth (possible infection?) and flies all over its face. It also had a mesh muzzle and kept making lots of grunts and they kept it in the back of the line. It's always a concern when animals are used, but maybe this camel was just fine. I'm not an expert. It was amazing to ride the camels through the berber villages, but I would prefer if the male camel we had was in better health.Mohammed took some great pics of us with the camels - he offered to take pictures whenever we wanted. He could have made suggestions for pictures ("stand here" or some directions), but he's a guide, not a photographer. He was not just an informative, polite, fun guide, but he was also patient. We could tell that he was a local and he interacted with many people on our tour, which was really great and made for an authentic trip. We had the BEST food for lunch; it was served in a local berber's home. It was amazing! The lamb tajine was incredible - the best thing we had eaten the entire trip. And they brought us some fruit for dessert - the lemons and pomegranate tasted like nothing I have had before. They said that if you take a longer trip this is a place you can stay overnight. It would probably be worth it for the food alone!The hiking was fun but definitely a little challenging (some steep, narrow paths and such). It was true hiking - not just walking. I'm sure if you ask they can set up an easier route. Seeing the berber villages was incredible! It was amazing to see how other people live, and they were very welcoming. We saw so many incredible things on this journey - it was unforgettable! Doing a trek like this is a must if you are going to Morocco. It's an absolutely incredible experience, and is off the tourist track. Everything is really local and authentic. We took longer than expected but there was no extra charge and no one rushed us. Overall, an amazing experience. You have to do a camel ride/hike/trek when you go to Morocco!Recommendations if you go: a coat and scarf with long pants was necessary as it was pretty cold. Use a backpack if you must (not a purse). Bring toilet paper and hand sanitizer, just in case. Bring water as well.

Wonderful excursion from Marakesh to Imlil. The experience went above and beyond our expectations. We much enjoyedour guide, Mohammed, who was friendly, informative, and a true localof Imlil.Fortunately, there were none of the unexpected, and unwanted, detoursinto tourist traps that we had seen reported about other excursionproviders. All of us agree that the excursion company lived up to itsend of the bargain and gave us an amazing experience.Our excursion included lunch, which turned out to be the best meal weate during our trip. It was delicious!The vehicle was a nice, new SUV, and the driver seemed verysafe. These factors made the trips between Marakesh and Imlil quitecomfortable, even though the drive went through some rugged mountainterrain.

Amazing experience - not to be missed. My friend and I booked a day trip with Atlas and Sarah Tours via email from our hotel in Marrakesh, and were very happy to find that they could accommodate us on such short notice. We had lots of questions and Mohamed (who i think is the owner) was very patient in answering all of them which was great. the trip itself was very well organized - we were picked up at our hotel and driven to Imlil where we were met by our guide also called Mohamed. We hiked up to Tizi Mzig (2584m) and we are not experienced hikers, so Mohamed was great at taking his time with us and making sure we were ok and made it to the top in one piece. (it took around 3 hours to get to the top). the views from there are amazing!! we took a slight different route on the way down and ended up in a Berber village were we had some lunch - I still think it was the best Tagine we had anywhere in Morocco. I can definitely recommend using Atlas and Sahara Tours, they can tailor the trip to your needs and what you want to see, and its very good value for money.

An Energetic and Cultural Slice of Escapism. I did a three day trek loop starting from Imlil. It was approximately 55km, with altitude ranging from 1700m to 2450m.The views were so dramatic my legs went wobbly on many occasion!We trekked up and down three main valleys, from mountain pass to the rivers below. We passed through countless Berber villages, on many occasion being invited in for mint tea. Abdul my guide was friendly and enthusiastic, volunteering historical, geographical and cultural information throughout.The 2 nights were spent in modest Berber guest houses, one night being treated to a fabulous homemade chicken tagine. On the trek we saw hawks, quails, squirrels, lizards and lots of goats! Not only was this a serious work out on the legs it was also an authentic way of seeing the Berber way of life.A nice touch from the company was to arrange transfers to and from the airport. They also recommended a reasonable and charming riad for €55 per night in the Marrakech medina. Ticked all the boxes for me! Bravo.

A mixed bag - rather unexciting scenery. We trekked for 2 days with Atlas and Sahara Tours, originally intending to do the toubkal ascent but opting for waterfalls and Berber villages instead.Guide didn't offer much by way of information beyond our altitude. The Berber village gite (hostel) was very basic.Prices seem to vary so make sure you haggle.They are very flexible and willing to adjust plans to suit customers. You're likely to get the best experience if you know exactly what you want up front.

exactly what i was looking for. perfectly planned.. i did a 2 day trek to mount toubkal summit and it was great. pick up from marrakech by mustafa & then abdul was my guide with hassan mule guide/cook. we were able to trek at my favoured pace (pretty quickly) and was able to learn alot about the local area and morocco in general during our time on the mountain. food was superb and even received a special gift at the end. would highly recommend atlas & sahara tours. thanks. joey maclean

Mohamed guided our family through Marrakesh, Imlil, and Essouria and created a vacation of fun, adventure, learning, and relaxat. Mohamed met us at the airport,and from that moment on was the most gracious, generous, attentive, and charming travel guide and organizer we could have hoped for. He created a perfect blend of structured time, free time, and shopping time for our family of four adults, including arranging for docents to provide city tours in Marakesh and Essauria, and touring us himself through the magnificent High Atlas villages of Imlil. No request was a problem, and he was always just a quick phone call away if we were on our own and needed to connect with him. Mohamed is multilingual and was well able to communicate wherever our adventures took us. And he seems to be known, and respected, by many throughout the area. Mohamed always anticipated our needs, kept safety at the forefront, and found many ways for us to explore, enjoy, and feel at home in his beautiful country. I would highly recommend Atlas and Sahara and the services of Mohamed and his driver, Mustafa.

Desert and atlas mountain trips. We spent a week in Morocco and did the 3 day desert trip and 1 day trek in the Atlas mountains. I booked the trips by email before arriving in Marrakech. Mohamed at Atlas and Sahara tours was really helpful and answered all my questions really quickly. The trips were really good value for money and the drivers and guides on both were excellent. We did the shared tour to the desert, rather than the private tour. I would recommend the shared tour - better value for money and good to meet other people to share the experience with.
Great trip out. We did the camel ride and half day trek, great fun, Mohammed was a lovely guide really knowledgeable and interesting thoroughly enjoyed it, would definitely use their services again

Outstanding Moroccan experience for children. Through Mohamed, we arranged a 2-day Atlas trek as part of 5-day trip to Marrakesh; family includes 3 boys (9, 7, 7). Half-day camel trek, followed by overnight stay at local guesthouse in the Atlas, and then a full day of mule trekking around the foothills of Toubkal. A fantastic exposure to Morocco, with friendly, well-informed and chatty guides who went out of thir way to look after our kids. Delicious locally-cooked food throughout, basic but very comfortable guesthouse, beautiful scenery. Organisation was excellent by internet from UK and in-country. Fast, efficient transfers; good advice on local shopping etc; never a shortage of mint tea! Good value for money. Kids loved it. We would recommend Atlas and Sahara Tours without hesitation

Wonderful Experience. We were in morocco for 10 days traveling from Casablanca to fez to merzouga to marakesh and to imlil (along with a few other quick stops in other cities along the way like Rabat and meknes). I will tell you this...your driver and guide will make or break your trip, and for us Mohamed 100% made our trip. He is an excellent guide and totally committed to making your experience perfect. I loved the itinerary Atlas tours put together for me but i strongly recommend going with Mohamed if you can because he was such a great guide. Also of all the cities I listed, Imlil is probably the one you never heard of. Not too many people go there but I STRONGLY recommend it as it was my favorite day. That is where Mohamed is from - high up in the atlas mountains near mount tubkal. It's a beautiful escape from the cities and provides some spectacular views and insight into the mountain life. Kasba Toubkal, was one of the best "hotels" you can stay at. Look them up online and see for yourself. That place is a hidden gem!Lastly, you spend a lot of time in the car traveling from city to city. I was worried we were going to get a tiny car that we wouldn't be comfortable in or that wouldn't have air conditioning. Do not worry because they give you a nice big 4x4, comfortable, and in excellent condition.

Good services, nice trip!. We travelled through Morocco from Marrakech to Fès, visiting Merzouga, Ait Benhadou, Dades and Todra gorges (February/2010). We also spent an overnight in a tent in the Sahara desert. We are a couple of friends, and everything was well organized. We enjoyed the trip a lot. Our driver (Mr. Abidou) and guide (Mr. Mustapha) were very helpful and nice people, always concerned about our well-being. We highly recommend this agency to plan your trip in Morocco.

Brilliant Company, superb for families. e found Atlas and Sahara Tours by searching on the internet. We had already read the Lonely Planet guide and had decided on the trek we wanted to take. I emailed several companies but Atlas and Sahara Tours were very quick to respond and very professional in their approach. In Imlil Mohammed came to visit us the night before the trek and went through all the details of our 3 day/2night adventure. The next morning we were greeted with our wonderful guide Ibrahim and two assistants who looked after both the mules and cooked wonderful meals for us. Our children aged 10 and 12 rode the mules (uphill) when they needed, and I grabbed a ride on the last day which was fantastic. We had a great adventure and were looked after extremely well. I would highly recommend this tour company. We are looking forward to going back for some more Atlas trekking. Thank you Ibrahim x

Lovely people and amazing scenery!!. Merhabba,We visited Morocco this August: we booked the trekking tour in advance.. and we were really looking forward to it! In Marrakesh we were picked up early by a taxi they arranged for us, so that was the start of our tour!!! We met our guide in Imlil, he was very friendly and told a lot about the berber culture. First we walked to the highest point of the trek, it was heavy but really beautiful!! We received a large luch overlooking the green valley. After that we went to see a waterfall, it was very refreshing and this gave us a boost to continue our trek. We walked through berber villages and finished our day at a guesthouse. We got a wonderful meal and went to sleep quickly! We heard it could be very cold in the mountains at night so we received three blankets a person but this was not necessary because it wasnt that cold! The next day we walked only a few ours through different valleys to end our tour with another big lunch. Overall it was a very nice trek with very lovely people and amazing scenery!! We would recommend it to anyone:)

Very professional and well organised trek - geared to family with children. We picked Atlas and Sahara Tours as they had good reviews on trip advisor, including reviews by other families with children, and we were equally impressed. We have twin 12 year olds plus a 6 year old who has never done anything like this, so it was really important to have a company that genuinely understood families and could tailor accordingly. They picked an excellent route for us - not too ambitious, though still challenging - and the mule provided for my daughter to ride on worked out out great - and was great fun for her and her two brothers - though she did walk too! She didn't much like the steep narrow descents on a mule, preferring to walk those - can't say I blame her! Our guide, Abdul, was very helpful and came from the local area. Considering it was Ramadam and very hot when we were there he did an amazing job. The guest house we satyed in was very basic but was clean, and the company arranged for us to have sheets & blankets provided as we couldn't bring sleeping bags without busting our Ryan Air baggage allowance. I thought the price was very reasonable - we paid £350 for two days including one nights accommodation and all food with guide, cook & 3 mules plus efficient and comfortable transport in a 4x4 to and from Marakech.The communications were excellent both beforehand with Mohammed by email, and when we arrived with Mustafa who also met us at the end. Everythign was as discussed and promised.Handy tip - if you go in August pack some light breathable waterproofs as summer storms crop up. Mustafa was very helpful ran around on our behalf arranging hire of waterproofs while we set off, and then drove them up to us en route but this is obviously not the ideal (or cheapest) solution!Also in August be aware it is is still very hot , though fresher than down in Marrakech.I would love to go back and do one of the more challenging treks and would highly recommend the company!! will try to post some pics if my teccie skills can cope - the landscapes were amazing, and loved the Berber villages perched on the hlilsides.

Great organisation - great trip. In May I was in Morocco with my boyfriend and we did a 2-day summit of Mount Toubkal with Atlas and Sahara tours. Even though I have already done several of these trips, it is always a little bit nerve racking to reserve with a company you don't know but I did not have to worry. Mohammed was great: he answered my emails quickly and answered all of my concerns and made it very easy to organise the meeting place etc...Our guide was also good and right away we were very comfortable, with Mohammed meeting us at the start of the hike (which I really appreciated as it made me feel more secure). The hike itself was tough and I was really happy that we had a mule to carry our backpacks!! Whenever we stopped, the guide and muleteer would make us tea and the most wonderful food - my only real complain is that there was often too much and we could not finish it all!!! (Not a real problem!).All in all, I would definitively recommend this company as it met our expectations and really took care of us during our trip. And they took the time to answer all my questions by emails which is also very important... not everyone does so and knowing that you can get in touch with your tour company is super important!!!

A really well coordinated trip.. I had a wonderful two weeks in Morocco on a program developed just for me by Atlas and Sahara Tours. I, at 79, did not want to go on their Toubkal summit trip but did want to visit Marrakech and hike in the Atlas Mountains. I stayed in Marrakech before and after the hiking, in two very nice and very different riads. In the mountains the guide Mohamed adjusted the route to accommodate a leg I sprained on the trail. Ibram, the muleteer/cook provided wonderful meals on the trail and in Berber village houses using a stove and food carried in the mule Iji's baskets. The side trip to Essaouria was the icing on the cake as I am a wooden boat fan. A really great trip!

Nuhs Nuhs in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco. Fantastic newly opened campsite and Café in the beautiful Atlas mountains of Morocco.British owner with vast knowledge of the local area, very friendly.This campsite is family friendly and has everything you need for a comfortable pleasant stay. Stunning location with breathtaking views very close to the waterfalls.They also have hot showers and flushing toilets! The ti-pees are huge and lots of fun for the children.Follow the link for their website for booking details: www.nuhsnuhs.webs.com or email them at contactnuhsnuhs@gmail.com Would defiantly recommend

Visiting the Atlas Mtns was awesome - great scenery, great local guides.. I went on a 2 day trip to the Atlas Mtns last month. As I was on my own, I stayed in a guesthouse at Imlil and did two great day excursionsaccompanied by local guides - firstly up to one of the mountain passes, scrambling up hillside paths and passing Berber villages on the way. It was tough going at times but well worth the huffing and puffing. The next day was easier - a pleasant hike along one side of the valley, across the river and back along the river itself with rock-hopping most of the way and views to die for. My guides spoke good English, were very professional but friendly and made it all fun. I can recommend this kind of trip to anyone who wants to explore the mountains and at the same time experience part of Moroccan culture. Nola McCann.

fantastic trek, superb guides, for Atlas mountain treks these are the ones. Toudaoui Brahim & Mohamed Atlas mountain tours nailed it for us. We were two women and two 10 yr old children. We went on a three day 2 night trek. Next time we would do 3 nights 4 days (as they actually recommended). The guide was Dris, the cook was Hassim and the muleteer Brahmin (sorry guys if I've spelt your names wrong). They made the experience from start to finish; they were professional, informative and totally committed to making our time work. This meant brilliant food, great local knowledge and insights, humour, patience. They were fantastic with the kids, funny and kind. It was tough the first day as unusually for the time of year it hailed, rained and snowed for the first day. We were walking for many hours (our choice) and it could have been pretty grim but they kept our spirits and speed up and we made it to the gite. They organised huge numbers of blankets, cooked great food and were flexible about the plans for the next days. The mountains were beautiful, the villages were fascinatinmg, the people were very friendly, but what made the trek were Dris, Hassim and Brahmin. I would totally recommend them and this amazing area
To The Summit & Beyond. Thank you Atlas and Sahara for a well planned operation I will be seeing you again for our camel expedition through the Sahara! Dominic Short Clear River Group

Great Trip. Thank you Abdul and Muhammed.. We booked a three night four day trek in the Atlas Mountains with Atlas and Sahara. Our children are 14, 11, and 6. They provided an extra mule for the 6 year old, and a muleteer (Hassan) who took great care of her. Our primary guide, Abdul, was just wonderful. He had a great knowledge of the mountains, was extremely friendly, and did everything possible to make our trip good. It snowed on our third day, making it impossible for the mule carrying our 6-year old to climb to the pass planned for that day. So our trip had to be completely reorganized in the middle, and Abdul did a great job. Be sure to take your own sheets. Some of the "guesthouses" at which we stayed were not just primitive, but also quite dirty. All in all a wonderful trip. Thank you Abdul!

Brilliant organisation and guides. Will use again.. I have just returned from a week in Morocco and spent three days walking in the Toubkal area. This was organised for us by Atlas and Sahara Tours and it was first class. I stayed with our two teenage boys in the Dar Imlil hotel and we then walked to the refuge and stayed two nights there in fantastic snowy conditions - such a contrast to Imlil and Marrakech! Our guide, Abdul, couldn't have been more helpful and he took the boys up Toubkal while I pottered around in nearby valleys. A mule and another guide were also provided and some extremely good food was provided during our trek - the only problem was there was too much of it and we felt guilty leaving it. Abdul also sorted out crampons and ice axes for the boys. Booking anything by email can be worrying, but this company wouldn't even take a deposit from me which I thought was pretty amazing in this day and age. We're hoping to go back next year and possibly do a desert trek with them, so they must be good for us to be planning a return already!

Toudaoui Brahim & Mohamed - Excellent Trek!. We opted for a four day trek around the High Atlas through the valleys and it was excellent. Like one of the other reviewers, the cost was less than other trekking companies and as far as I know, did not leave out anything. In fact, for €200 per person we had a guide, a mule, a chef, 3 nights in guest accommodation with hot showers each night (even a hammam for 20 Dirham pp was available on the last night) - in comparison to other treks that I've done (showers?!!) this felt like luxury. (We were quoted £295 pp from a UK based company for I think pretty much the same thing)The food was fantastic, thanks to Mohammed our fabulous chef, Jacqueline the mule carried all our stuff and Idriss our guide was polite, friendly, informative - we had a lot of fun. On average we walked 5-6 hours per day (although longest was 7.5 - we opted to go further to see a waterfall). Generally I would describe the route as moderate (although, of course, that all depends on fitness etc).Anyway - I would thoroughly recommend Toudaoui Brahim & Mohamed, a local Imlil based company, for your trek in the Atlas.

Thorough, detailed and flexible planning and advice.. We took our time selecting our travel company for our long-thought about trek in the Atlas Mountains. Once we had narrowed down our choices, we found that the advice and itineraries Atlas and Sahara Tours offered were excellent. Mohamed gave us clear routes and details of walking, and was supremely patient and flexible in making the changes and additions - days in Essaouira - we requested as our understanding of the trip developed. Unfortunately domestic events have meant we have to postpone our visit, but we will put Atlas and Sahara Tours at the top of our list if we are able to re-instate our visit in the future. (It's free at the planning stage...)oin the future.

I really enjoyed our guides kindness, particularly because he was fasting during Ramadan!. Atlas and Sahara Tours are a very professional and kind company. I've gone on two trips with them, and have friends who have gone with them many times as well. Living in Casablanca, I really appreciate their honesty!

A pleasant afternoon in the Atlas Mountains. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience walking in the Atlas Mountains with the Atlas and Sahara Tours company. The transport to and from the location went smoothly. Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and we took a scenic route across some scree slopes and through some Berber villages. The views were beautiful, the level of walking was just right (not too difficult, but still some good hills) and we were welcomed back to the centre with a very tasty tagine. A ll in all a very pleasant afternoon.

Wonderful vacation with Atlas and Sahara Tours. Our family of 5 recently vacationed in Morocco and here is our advice: go with Atlas and Sahara Tours. We were treated both as treasured guests and as family for the entire experience. We planned it ahead of time with Mohamed by email who always responded the same day or the next morning. He understood that we wanted a vigorous trip with nice accommodations and planned it perfectly. The airlines lost two of our bags. No problem. We made a detour to the Moroccan equivalent of Walmart and replaced what we needed. On the way to our hotel in the mountains, we passed a bazaar in progress. With great cheer, we made the unexpected stop and enjoyed the food, crafts, color and personalities and then returned to the comfortable van and moved forward. The Inn at Dar Imlil was not full and our accommodations were upgraded at no cost. The rooms were palatial and the views of the valley and mountains gorgeous. The stars at night were themselves worth the price of the trip. We hiked for two days on wonderful trails through terrific scenery and mountain villages with curious children who loved their instant pictures on the iPhone camera. The guide, lunch and lunch spots were excellent. But the unanticipated problems brought out the best in Mohamed. On one day, my wife developed blisters and Mohamed arranged for a respite donkey ride to allow her to continue. Atlas and Sahara tour with www.dunesline.com. I did a lot of research to organise this trip and communicated with many tour operators before choosing Dunesline. They (Siad, in the office) were able to completely tailormake the trip we wanted and offer suggestions and options. My wife and I wanted a fairly authentic experience and Dunesline were able to offer a night with a Berber family. We were not sure how this would pan out, or if it would really be authentic,but it was a fantastic experience, however, to do this one has to be happy to step well out of their comfort zone and it may not be everyone's cup of tea :-)I found many trips that were twice the price of our trip with Dunesline. Most of these operators seemed to be European based. Dunesline is a local business and therefore there are no foreigners clipping the ticket. The hotel accommodation that we were put up in was superb, and we couldn't really see how a more expensive trip could be justified.Hmad, our driver and guide, picked us up from our riad in Marrakech and took us over the Atlas Mountains and into the Sahara. He was (is) a fantastic guy and we still keep in touch. His English was very good and he was an excellent guide. We leaned much about the country and people from him and he certainly added an extra dimension to our trip. The vehicle was good, the accommodation superb, and as pretty seasoned travellers, we have to say this has been one of the best trips we have done.All this said, this kind of trip needs to be undertaken only by those with an open mind that wish to learn about a poor, dry, country. You spend quite a lot of every day driving in hot, remote countryside - but it is very beautiful and the Berbers are really nice, friendly people. Of course you are in a comfortable landcruiser with air con. A lot of these people are very poor and while I don't like being ripped off, I was very happy to let go of some dirhams as I saw fit. In Marrakech you can give some poor old beggar something without being swamped by lots more of them. You need to do a bit of reseach and take basic and obvious security and hygiene precautions, but there is basically no alcohol in Morroco so you feel very safe, even late at night.We originally planned to just visit Marrakech. The trip over to the Sahara was just an add-on which turned out to be one of the greats.
